Sense.DEF: the first letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第一个字母

Sense.DEF:
the sixth note in the musical
scale
of C
major
or the musical
key
based on this note
Sense.TRAN: A音〔C大调音阶的第六音〕﹔A调

Sense.DEF: the highest mark that a student can get in an examination or for a piece of work
Sense.TRAN: A级﹐甲级﹐甲等〔表示学业成绩优秀〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got an A in French.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的法语得了个A。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Julia got straight A’s
all A’s
in high school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅读中学时成绩全部是A。

Sense.DEF: someone who regularly gets the best marks possible for their work in school or college
used to refer in a short way to one of two different things or people. You can call the second one B
Sense.TRAN: 甲﹐A〔两个不同事物或人中的一个﹐另一个称乙（B）〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A demands £500, B offers £100.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甲方索要500英镑﹐乙方愿出100英镑。

Sense.DEF: from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hiring a car was the best way to get from A to B.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 租车是从一地到另一地的最好方法。

Sense.DEF: describing, including, or knowing everything about a subject
Sense.TRAN: 从头到尾〔表示描述﹑涵盖或了解一个科目的全部内容〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the history of art from A to Z
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术通史

Sense.DEF:
the name of a road in Britain that is smaller than a
motorway
, but larger than a
B-road
Sense.TRAN: A34（主干）公路﹐A40（主干）公路等〔英国公路名称﹐介于高速公路和B级公路之间〕

Sense.DEF: a common type of blood

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= amp or 或 amps 安培

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are talking about someone or something that has not been mentioned before, or that your listener does not know about
Sense.TRAN: 一﹐一个〔用于未曾提及或对方不知道的人或物的名称前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们遇到了一个麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a hole in the fence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 篱笆上有一个洞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly they heard a loud bang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们突然听到砰的一声巨响。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are referring to a general type of person or thing and not a specific person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于泛指一类人或一类事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a sandwich?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来块三明治好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to train to be an engineer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想经过培训成为一名工程师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a really nice man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真是个好人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a look at this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瞧瞧这个。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It needs a good clean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这得好好清洗一下。

Sense.DEF: used before someone’s family name to show that they belong to that family
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某人的姓氏前表明其属于这个家庭〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of his daughters had married a Rothschild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有个女儿嫁给了罗斯柴尔德家的人。

Sense.DEF: one
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thousand pounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一千英镑
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dozen eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一打鸡蛋
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to wait an hour or two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得等一两个小时。

Sense.DEF: used in some phrases that say how much of something there is
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a lot of people at the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人参加了聚会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few weeks from now I’ll be in Venice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再过几个礼拜我就在威尼斯了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have caused a great deal of trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你惹出了很多麻烦。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘each’ when stating prices, rates, or speeds
Sense.TRAN: 每一（个）〔用于表明价格﹑费用或速度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I get paid once a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工资一个月发一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eggs cost $2 a dozen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡蛋两美元一打。

Sense.DEF: used before singular nouns to mean all things of a particular type
Sense.TRAN: 任一﹐每一〔用于单数名词前表示某一类的全部〕
Sense.EXAMPLE:
A square has four sides
all squares have four sides
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正方形有四条边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A child needs love and affection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子需要爱和关怀。

Sense.DEF: used once before two nouns that are mentioned together very often
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于两个经常同时提及的名词前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll fetch you a cup and saucer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去给你拿一副杯碟来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does everyone have a knife and fork?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都有刀叉了吗？

Sense.DEF: used before the -ing forms of verbs when they are used as nouns referring to an action, event, or sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示动作﹑事件或声音的动词-ing形式之前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a beating of wings overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头顶上传来翅膀的拍打声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bernice became aware of a humming that seemed to come from all around her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯尼斯意识到似乎从四方八面传来嗡嗡声。

Sense.DEF:
used before nouns that are usually
uncountable
when other information about the quality, feeling etc is added by an adjective, phrase, or
clause
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于有形容词﹑短语或从句修饰的不可数名词前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candidates must have a good knowledge of chemistry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 求职者必须精通化学。

Sense.DEF: used before the name of a substance, food etc to refer to a particular type of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于物质﹑食品等名称前表示某一类〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a good cheese to make the sauce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要用优质的奶酪来做调味酱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants that grow well in a moist soil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在湿润的土壤中生长良好的植物

Sense.DEF: used before the name of a drink to refer to a cup or glass of that drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I get you a coffee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你倒杯咖啡好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Renwick went to the bar and ordered a beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦威克走到吧台前点了杯啤酒。

Sense.DEF: used before the name of a famous artist to refer to a painting by that artist
Sense.TRAN: 一幅…的作品〔用于著名画家的姓名前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an early Rembrandt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦勃朗的一幅早期作品

Sense.DEF: used before a name to mean someone or something that has the same qualities as that person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某人或某物的名字前指与其具有同样特性的人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was hailed as a new Marilyn Monroe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被誉为玛丽莲·梦露再世。

Sense.DEF: used before someone’s name when you do not know who they are
Sense.TRAN: 某一﹐一位〔用于陌生人的姓名前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a Mr Tom Wilkins on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有位汤姆·威尔金斯先生打电话来。

Sense.DEF: used before the names of days, months, seasons, and events in the year to refer to a particular one
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某一年的日﹑月﹑季节和事件前﹐指具体的日子或事件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We arrived in England on a cold wet Sunday in 1963.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1963年一个寒冷﹑下着雨的星期天﹐我们来到了英格兰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember a Christmas like it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的记忆中不曾有过像这样的圣诞节。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法:a, an
F2NBox.EXPL: Before a word beginning with a vowel sound, use an
F2NBox.TRAN: 读音以元音开头的单词前用an
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: an elephant
an umbrella
an obvious mistake
F2NBox.EXPL: Use an before an 'h' that is not pronounced
F2NBox.TRAN: 不发音的h前用an
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: an hour later
an honest explanation
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a before a 'u' that is pronounced like 'you'
F2NBox.TRAN: u发you音时前面用a
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a university
a unique opportunity
F2NBox.EXPL: Use an before an abbreviation that is pronounced with a vowel sound at the start
F2NBox.TRAN: 读音以元音开头的缩写前用 an
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: an SOS call
an MP3 file

Sense.DEF: in a particular condition or way
Sense.TRAN: 处于某种状况﹔以某种方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: aloud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大声地
Sense.EXAMPLE:
alive
living
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活（着）的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
with nerves all atingle
tingling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全身神经刺痛

Sense.DEF: in, to, at, or on something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
abed
in bed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在床上
Sense.EXAMPLE:
afar
far away
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在远处

Sense.DEF: not or without
Sense.EXAMPLE:
amoral
not moral
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不道德的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
atypically
not typically
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非典型地

Sense.DEF:
the highest mark that a student can get in a
GCSE
examination
Sense.TRAN: A星级〔普通中等教育证书考试的最高得分等级〕

Sense.DEF: the room or department in a hospital where people go if they are injured or suddenly become ill
very good or completely healthy
Sense.TRAN: 一流的﹐极好的﹔完全健康的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything about the resort was A-1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个度假胜地各方面都是一流的。

Sense.DEF:
a standard size of paper, used in Europe and Japan. A3 paper measures 297 x 420
millimetre s
.

a standard size of paper, used in Europe and Japan. A4 paper measures 210 x 297
millimetre s
.

a standard size of paper, used in Europe and Japan. A5 paper measures 148 x 210
millimetre s
.

an organization for
alcoholic s
who want to stop drinking alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 戒酒协会，嗜酒者互诫协会

Sense.DEF: a British organization which provides services for people who own cars
Sense.TRAN: 汽车协会〔英国一个为车主提供服务的组织〕

Sense.DEF: a two-year college degree in the US
Sense.TRAN: 准文学士〔美国大学的一种两年制学位〕

Sense.DEF: a large animal from southern Africa that has a very long nose and eats small insects
Sense.TRAN: 土豚〔非洲南部的一种大型动物﹐鼻长﹐食小昆虫〕

Sense.DEF: used to show you are disappointed, hurt, or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 唉﹔哎哟﹔呸〔表示失望﹑受伤或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aargh, the lid won’t close.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唉﹐盖子盖不上。

Sense.DEF: a common type of blood
to be very surprised or shocked by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a moment, I was completely taken aback by her request.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一时间她的要求把我吓了一大跳。

Sense.DEF: a frame with small balls that can be slid along on thick wires, used for counting and calculating

a kind of
shellfish
which is used as food and whose shell contains
mother-of-pearl
to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could she abandon her own child?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子？

Sense.DEF: to go away from a place, vehicle etc permanently, especially because the situation makes it impossible for you to stay
Sense.TRAN: 离弃﹐逃离〔某地方﹑交通工具等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to abandon the car and walk the rest of the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只好弃车﹐步行走完剩下的路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fearing further attacks, most of the population had abandoned the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为害怕还要受到袭击﹐大多数市民已逃离该市。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something because there are too many problems and it is impossible to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game had to be abandoned due to bad weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气不好﹐比赛不得不中止。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They abandoned their attempt to recapture the castle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们放弃了夺回城堡的努力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Because of the fog they abandoned their idea of driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为有雾﹐他们打消了开车去的念头。

Sense.DEF: to stop having a particular idea, belief, or attitude
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were accused of abandoning their socialist principles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被指责放弃了社会主义原则。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rescuers had abandoned all hope of finding any more survivors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营救人员对找到更多生还者已不抱任何希望。

Sense.DEF: to feel an emotion so strongly that you let it control you completely
Sense.TRAN: 沉湎于某事﹔陷入〔某种感情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She abandoned herself to grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她陷入悲痛之中，无法自拔。

Sense.DEF: to leave a ship because it is sinking
if someone does something with abandon, they behave in a careless or uncontrolled way, without thinking or caring about what they are doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They drank and smoked with reckless abandon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们纵情地喝酒抽烟﹐毫无顾忌。

Sense.DEF: an abandoned building, car, boat etc has been left by the people who owned or used it
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑﹑汽车﹑船等〕废弃的﹐被丢弃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was found abandoned in Bristol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车被人发现丢弃在布里斯托尔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the demolition of abandoned buildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 废弃建筑物的拆除

Sense.DEF: an abandoned person or animal has been left completely alone by the person that was looking after them
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或动物〕被抛弃的﹐被遗弃的

Sense.DEF: behaving in a wild and uncontrolled way
Sense.TRAN: 无约束的﹐无度的﹐放荡的

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that shows you accept that someone has complete power over you
embarrassed or ashamed because you have done something wrong or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked rather abashed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看起来很羞愧。

Sense.DEF: to become less strong or decrease
Sense.EXAMPLE: We waited for the storm to abate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等风暴减弱。

Sense.DEF: a place where animals are killed for their meat
a long black piece of clothing worn by Muslim women in some countries, which covers the body and is usually worn with a separate head covering
Sense.TRAN: 阿拉伯长袍〔一些国家女性穆斯林穿的黑长袍〕

Sense.DEF:
a woman who is in charge of a
convent
a place where a group of
nun s
live

a large church with buildings next to it where
monk s
and
nun s
live or used to live

a man who is in charge of a
monastery
a place where a group of
monk s
live
Sense.TRAN: 男修道院院长﹔大寺院男住持
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= abbreviation 缩略语﹐缩写

Sense.DEF: to make a word or expression shorter by not including letters or using only the first letter of each word

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Information technology’ is usually abbreviated to ‘IT’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: information technology（信息技术）常被缩略为IT。

Sense.DEF: made shorter
Sense.EXAMPLE: Orders were passed to the commander at the front in an abbreviated form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 命令以缩略的形式传达给前线指挥官。

Sense.DEF: a short form of a word or expression

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Dr’ is the written abbreviation of ‘Doctor’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: Dr是Doctor的书面缩写形式。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say be short for instead of be the abbreviation of/for
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说be short for﹐而不说be the abbreviation of/for
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: W.H.O. is short for ‘World Health Organization’.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: W.H.O.是世界卫生组织的缩写形式。

Sense.DEF: the act of abbreviating something
the letters of the English alphabet as taught to children
the basic facts about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ABCs of your computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你所掌握的计算机入门知识

Sense.DEF: one of the national television companies in the US
the national public television company of Australia
to give up the position of being king or queen
Sense.EXAMPLE: King Alfonso XIII abdicated in favour of his eldest son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王阿方索十三世把王位让给了长子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king was forced to abdicate the throne .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王被迫退位。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to be responsible for something, when you should be or were before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has largely abdicated its responsibility in dealing with housing needs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在很大程度上推卸了解决住房需求的责任。

Sense.TRAN: 退位（危机）〔指1936年英国国王爱德华八世为娶离婚女子沃丽丝·辛普森而退位的这段时期〕

Sense.DEF:
the part of your body between your chest and legs which contains your stomach,
bowel s
etc

the end part of an insect’s body, joined to the
thorax
to take someone away by force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The diplomat was abducted on his way to the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交官在去机场途中遭绑架。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Abduct is mostly used in journalism. In everyday English, people usually say kidnap
F2NBox.TRAN: abduct主要是新闻用语。 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说kidnap
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He was kidnapped on his way to the airport.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在去机场的路上被人绑架。

Sense.DEF: in bed
not usual or normal
Sense.TRAN: 异常的﹐反常的﹔脱离常规的
Sense.EXAMPLE: aberrant behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异常行为

Sense.DEF: an action or event that is very different from what usually happens or what someone usually does
Sense.EXAMPLE: a temporary aberration in US foreign policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国外交政策的短暂异常
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mental aberration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神失常

Sense.DEF: to help someone do something wrong or illegal
something such as a custom, rule, or system that is in abeyance is not being used at the present time

GramExa.GLOSS: no longer be used

Sense.DEF: to hate a kind of behaviour or way of thinking, especially because you think it is morally wrong
Sense.TRAN: 厌恶﹐憎恶〔某种行为或思想方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I abhor discrimination of any kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我厌恶任何一种歧视。

Sense.DEF: a deep feeling of hatred towards something
something that is abhorrent is completely unacceptable because it seems morally wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The practice of killing animals for food is utterly abhorrent to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常痛恨杀死动物制成盘中餐的做法。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone dislikes someone or something very much
Sense.TRAN: 某人不能容忍某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t abide that man – he’s so self-satisfied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受不了那个人﹐他太自满了。

Sense.DEF: to live somewhere
to accept and obey a decision, rule, agreement etc, even though you may not agree with it
Sense.TRAN: 遵从〔决定〕﹔遵守〔法规〕﹔信守〔协议等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to abide by the referee’s decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须服从裁判的决定。

Sense.DEF: an abiding feeling or belief continues for a long time and is not likely to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil has a deep and abiding love for his family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔对家人怀有深厚不渝的爱。

Sense.DEF: the state of being able to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ability to walk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行走的能力
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The health center serves all patients, regardless of their ability to pay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗中心为所有病人服务﹐不管他们的支付能力如何。

Sense.DEF: someone’s level of skill at doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The test measures your mathematical ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种测试考查的是数学能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: mixed ability classes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生能力参差不齐的班级

GramExa.EXAMPLE: students of average ability
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中等能力的学生
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are musicians of all abilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种演奏水平的乐师都有。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He showed his abilities as a leader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显示出了领导才能。

Sense.LEXUNIT: to the best of your ability
Sense.DEF: as well as you can
Sense.EXAMPLE: He completed the job to the best of his ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽全力完成了工作。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a group of low ability pupils
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组能力较差的小学生

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was a young man of great ability.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很有才华的年轻人。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 非凡的/突出的/特殊的才能
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a writer of remarkable ability
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位才华横溢的作家

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at different levels
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a mixed ability class
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生能力参差不齐的班级

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an unusual ability that is difficult to explain
an ability that you are born with
language skills
that you have proved through your achievements

Collocate.COLLOC: have the ability to do sth

Variant.LEXVAR: possess the ability to do sth

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has the ability to make people feel relaxed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能让人感到轻松。

Collocate.COLLOC: show/demonstrate the ability to do sth
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 表现/展示做某事的能力
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a chance for candidates to demonstrate their abilities
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 候选人表现能力的一个机会

Collocate.COLLOC: lack the ability to do sth

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children were of the same age and ability level.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子的年龄和能力水平相同。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a wide range of ability within the class.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 班里的学生能力差距悬殊。

Collocate.COLLOC: a test of ability/an ability test

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a group that students are taught in, based on their level of ability
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 能力小组〔按学生能力施教的一个小组〕

Sense.DEF:
makes nouns from adjectives ending in
-able
and
-ible
Sense.TRAN: 〔将以-able和-ible结尾的形容词转化为名词的词尾〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: manageability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可处理（性）

Sense.DEF: the state of being extremely poor, unhappy, unsuccessful etc
an abject action or expression shows that you feel very ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: an abject apology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低声下气的道歉

Sense.DEF: to state publicly that you will give up a particular belief or way of behaving
Sense.TRAN: 公开宣布放弃〔某种信念或做法〕

Sense.DEF: a particular form of noun in some languages, such as Latin or Finnish, which shows movement away or separation
Sense.TRAN: 离格﹐夺格〔拉丁语﹑芬兰语等语言中名词的一格﹐表示离开某物的运动﹑距离等〕

Sense.DEF: burning strongly with a lot of flames
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within minutes the whole house was ablaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几分钟内﹐整座房子就成了一片火海。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The factory had been set ablaze
made to burn
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家工厂被纵火焚烧。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Ablaze is mostly used in journalism or in literature. In everyday English, people usually say on fire
F2NBox.TRAN: ablaze主要是新闻和文学用语。 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说on fire
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The whole house was on fire .

Sense.DEF: very bright or colourful
Sense.TRAN: 明亮的﹐灯火辉煌的﹔色彩缤纷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a passing pleasure-boat, with all its lights ablaze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘驶过的游船﹐船上灯火辉煌

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her yard was ablaze with summer flowers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的院子里夏花绚烂。

Sense.DEF: feeling or showing strong emotion, especially anger
Sense.TRAN: 情绪激动的﹔怒气冲冲的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His eyes were ablaze with fury.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼里燃烧着怒火。

Subsense.DEF: to have the skill, strength, knowledge etc needed to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 有能力做某事﹐会做某事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always wanted to be able to speak Japanese.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直想学会讲日语。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a situation in which it is possible for you to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to do more gardening, but I never seem able to find the time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想多干点园艺活﹐可似乎总是抽不出时间。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been able to read that report yet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没能看那份报告。

Sense.DEF: clever or good at doing something
Sense.TRAN: 聪明能干的，能力出众的
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of my more able students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我班上能力比较强的学生之一

Sense.DEF: that you can do something to
Sense.EXAMPLE:
washable
it can be washed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可洗的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
unbreakable
it cannot be broken
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会破的﹐不碎的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
loveable
easy to love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可爱的

Sense.DEF: having a particular quality or condition
Sense.TRAN: 具有…性质的﹔处于…状态的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
knowledgeable
knowing a lot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博学的
Sense.EXAMPLE: comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舒适的

Sense.DEF:
physically strong and healthy, especially when compared with someone who is
disabled
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every able-bodied man had to fight for his country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一个体格健全的男人都必须为祖国而战斗。

Sense.DEF: people who are able-bodied
a low rank in the navy, or someone who has this rank
if you perform your ablutions, you wash yourself – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 沐浴﹔漱洗〔有时为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: cleverly, skilfully, or well
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was ably assisted by her team of researchers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到自己研究小组成员的大力帮助。

Sense.DEF: when you do not allow yourself to have or do something that you want
very different from usual in a way that seems strange, worrying, wrong, or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 不正常的﹐反常的﹔变态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: abnormal behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反常行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: an abnormal level of cholesterol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胆固醇水平异常
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents thought it was abnormal for a boy to be interested in ballet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母认为一个男孩子对芭蕾舞感兴趣并不正常。

Sense.DEF: an abnormal feature, especially something that is wrong with part of someone’s body
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指身体的〕不正常﹐变异﹔变态
Sense.EXAMPLE: tests that can detect genetic abnormalities in the foetus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以查出胎儿遗传变异的化验

Sense.DEF:
a very offensive word for an Australian
aborigine
. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 土佬〔对澳大利亚土著的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF: on or onto a ship, plane, or train
Sense.TRAN: 在[船﹐飞机﹐火车]上﹔上[船﹐飞机﹐火车]
Sense.EXAMPLE: They finally went aboard the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们终于登上了飞机。

Sense.DEF: on or onto a ship, plane, or train
Sense.TRAN: 在船[飞机﹐火车]上﹔上船[飞机﹐火车]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane crashed, killing all 200 people aboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机失事﹐机上200人全部遇难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boat swayed as he stepped aboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上船时﹐船晃了起来。

Sense.DEF: used to tell passengers of a ship, bus, or train that they must get on because it will leave soon
Sense.TRAN: 请大家上船[上公共汽车﹐上火车]！

Sense.DEF: someone’s home – sometimes used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Welcome to my humble abode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎光临寒舍。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a homeless person with no fixed abode
no permanent home
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居无定所的无家可归者

Sense.DEF: the right to live in a country

the past tense of
abide
to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 废除﹐废止〔尤指已存在很久的法律﹑制度等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

Sense.DEF: when a law or a system is officially ended

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the abolition of the death penalty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 死刑的废除

Sense.DEF: someone who wants to end a system or law

an
atomic bomb

PronCodes.PRON: əˈbɒmɪnəb ə l, -m ə n ə -

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant or of very bad quality
Sense.TRAN: 极令人讨厌的﹐可恶的﹔极差的
Sense.EXAMPLE: abominable cruelty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人发指的暴行

Sense.DEF:
a
yeti
Sense.TRAN: 〔据传生活在喜马拉雅山一带的〕雪人

Sense.DEF: to hate something very much
someone or something that is extremely offensive or unacceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slavery was an abomination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奴隶制令人深恶痛绝。

Sense.DEF: relating to the Australian aborigines
relating to the people or animals that have existed in a place or country from the earliest times
an aborigine
someone who belongs to the race of people who have lived in Australia from the earliest times
to stop an activity because it would be difficult or dangerous to continue it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rescue mission had to be aborted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援任务不得不停止。

Sense.DEF:
to deliberately end a
pregnancy
when the baby is still too young to live

if a
pregnant
woman or animal aborts, the baby is born too early and is dead when it is born
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease causes pregnant animals to abort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病会导致怀孕的动物流产。

Sense.DEF:
a medical operation to end a
pregnancy
so that the baby is not born alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided to have an abortion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定做人工流产。
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-abortion campaigners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参与反堕胎运动的人

Sense.DEF: someone who performs abortions, especially illegally
an abortive action is not successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: an abortive military coup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场未遂的军事政变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an abortive attempt to reform local government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革地方政府的失败尝试

Sense.DEF: to exist in very large numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rumours abound as to the reasons for his resignation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关他辞职的原因有各种各样的谣传。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Examples of this abound in her book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的例子在她书中比比皆是。

Sense.DEF: if a place, situation etc abounds with things of a particular type, it contains a very large number of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The forests abound with deer, birds, and squirrels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林里有许许多多的鹿﹑鸟和松鼠。

Sense.DEF: concerning or relating to a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book about politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本有关政治的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said something about leaving town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说了些要离开镇子的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lied about his age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他谎报年龄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: About that car of yours. How much are you selling it for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到你的那辆车﹐你打算卖什么价钱？
Sense.EXAMPLE:
What’s he on about
talking about
?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在说什么呀？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s about Tommy, doctor. He’s been sick again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生﹐是汤米﹐他又病了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Naturally, my mother wanted to know all about it
all the details relating to it
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很自然，我母亲想知道事情的全部。

Sense.DEF: used to show why someone is angry, happy, upset etc
Sense.TRAN: 因为〔用以表明生气﹑开心﹑烦恼等的原因〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really worried about Jack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很担心杰克。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s upset about missing the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为错过聚会而不开心。

Sense.DEF: in many different directions within a particular place, or in different parts of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent the whole afternoon walking about town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们整个下午都在城里四处走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Books were scattered about the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里到处摊着书。

Sense.DEF: in the nature or character of a person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s something really strange about Liza.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莎真有点怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What I like about the job is that it’s never boring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作我喜欢的是它从不枯燥。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask a question that directs attention to another person or thing
Subsense.TRAN: 某人/某事物怎么样[怎么办]〔用以将注意力转向另一人或另一物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What about Jack? We can’t just leave him here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克怎么办？ 我们不能把他丢在这里不管。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling hungry. How about you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我饿了﹐你呢？

Subsense.DEF: used to make a suggestion
Subsense.TRAN: 某人/某事物怎么样[好吗]〔用以提建议〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How about a salad for lunch?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午饭吃沙拉怎么样？

Sense.DEF: to do something to solve a problem or stop a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 想办法解决某个问题﹐处理某坏情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we don’t do something about it, the problem is going to get worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们不想办法解决﹐问题会变得更糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What can be done about the rising levels of pollution?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染越来越严重﹐可以采取什么办法呢？

Sense.DEF: if an organization, a job, an activity etc is about something, that is its basic purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leadership is all about getting your team to co-operate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当领导的职责就是让你的团队同心合力。

Sense.DEF: used to say who or what is important in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 重要的（问题）是某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s all about money, and who’s got the most.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就是钱的问题﹐是谁拿到最多的问题。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to do something while they are doing something else because it would be easier to do both things at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go and see what’s the matter, and while you’re about it you can fetch me my sweater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去看看怎么回事﹐顺便把我的毛衣拿来。

Sense.DEF: used to ask the reason for something that has just happened, especially someone’s angry behaviour
surrounding a person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo sensed fear and jealousy all about her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔感觉她周围充满恐惧和嫉妒。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying what the subject of something is
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s always talking about you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是谈论你。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In her novels she writes about life in South Africa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的小说描写南非生活。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s something I wanted to ask you about.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有件事我想问问你。

Exponent.DEF: about a particular subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a book on English grammar
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于英语语法的书
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a report on poverty in rural areas
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份关于农村贫困状况的报告

Exponent.DEF: about
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Prince Saiid answered questions concerning Kuwait’s future.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛义德亲王回答了关于科威特前途的问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report raises a number of questions regarding food safety.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告提出了一些有关食品安全的问题。

Exponent.DEF: about – used especially when you want to start talking or writing about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dear Sir, I’m writing with regard to your advertisement in The Times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 敬启者﹐关于贵方在《泰晤士报》所刊之广告﹐特致此函求教。

Exponent.DEF: used in business letters and in emails to introduce the subject that you are going to write about
Exponent.TRAN: 关于〔用于商业信函和电子邮件中﹐以说明事由〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Re: Friday’s meeting
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于星期五的会议

Sense.DEF: a little more or less than a particular number, amount, or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: I live about 10 miles away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我住的地方离这里十英里左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiny computer about as big as a postcard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约明信片大小的微型电脑
Sense.EXAMPLE: We left the restaurant at round about 10.30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们10点半左右离开了餐厅。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually prefer to use approximately , as it sounds more technical
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们一般更喜欢用approximately﹐因为此词听上去更专业
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The cost to taxpayers is approximately $200 billion.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税人要支付大约2,000亿美元。

Sense.DEF: in many different directions within a place or in different parts of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were rushing about, trying to find the driver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们四处奔走着寻找司机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cushions were scattered about on the chairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垫子散放在椅子上。

Sense.DEF: near to you or in the same place as you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is Derek about? There’s a phone call for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德里克在吗？ 有电话找他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quick! Let’s go while there’s no-one about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点儿! 趁没有人在我们赶紧走。

Sense.DEF: existing or available now
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope she hasn’t caught flu. There’s a lot of it about .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望她没得流感﹐最近得流感的人很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She might get temporary work, but there’s not much about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她也许可以找个临时的工作﹐但这种机会不是很多。

Sense.DEF: almost or probably
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was about ready to leave when somebody rang the doorbell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正准备离开﹐这时有人按响了门铃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you finished?’ ‘ Just about .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “做完了吗？”“差不多了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just about the worst mistake anyone could make.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这差不多是一个人可能犯的最大错误了。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you have told them everything you know
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was a quiet chap, married with kids. That’s about it, really.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这个人话不多﹐已婚﹐有孩子。 大概就是这样。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that there is nothing else available
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s some cheese in the fridge and that’s about it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱里有些干酪﹐就这些。

Sense.DEF: so as to face in the opposite direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quickly turned about and walked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一个转身就走了。

Sense.DEF: if someone is about to do something, or if something is about to happen, they will do it or it will happen very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were just about to leave when Jerry arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正要离开的时候﹐杰里来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work was about to start on a new factory building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新厂房即将动工。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not be about to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you have no intention of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 不打算做某事〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never smoked in my life and I’m not about to start now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这辈子从未抽过烟﹐现在也不打算开始抽。

Sense.DEF: a complete change in the way someone thinks or behaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: The administration seems to have done a complete about-face on gun-control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对枪支管制的态度似乎来了个180度大转变。

Sense.DEF: in a higher position than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our office is above the hairdresser’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的办公室在理发店上面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a bruise just above his left eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在他左眼上方有块瘀伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard a strange noise coming from the room above.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见楼上房间传来奇怪的响声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The great bird hovered high above our heads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只大鸟在我们头顶上方的高处盘旋。

Sense.DEF: more than a particular number, amount, or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: 50 metres above sea level
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海拔50米

GramExa.GLOSS: higher than the temperature at which water freezes
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tonight, temperatures should be just above freezing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的温度应该稍稍高于零度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: free medical care for pensioners aged 65 and above
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为65岁及以上的退休金领取者提供的免费医疗
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prize winners must have gained marks of 80% or above.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖者肯定得到了80分或80分以上。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
The salaries we offer are well above
much higher than
average.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提供的薪资远高于平均水平。

Sense.DEF: to a greater degree than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many employers value personality above experience or qualifications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多雇主重视个性甚于经验或资历。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something is more important than anything else
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Max is hard-working, cheerful, and above all honest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯工作努力﹑性格开朗﹐最重要的是为人诚实。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
medals awarded for bravery above and beyond the call of duty
greater than it is your duty to show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为超越职责要求的勇敢精神而颁发的奖章

Sense.DEF: louder or clearer than other sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can always hear her voice above everybody else’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你总会听到她的嗓门压过其他所有的人。

Sense.DEF: higher in rank, power, or importance
Sense.TRAN: 〔级别﹑权力或地位〕大于﹐高于﹔在上﹐以上
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never rose above the rank of corporal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的军衔一直没有超过下士。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: officers of the rank of Major and above
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少校及少校以上的军官

GramExa.GLOSS: from people in higher authority
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We just obey orders from above.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是遵守上级的命令。

Sense.DEF: before, in the same piece of writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: As mentioned above, there is a service charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如上所述﹐须收取服务费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Write to the address above for further information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 详情请致函上述地址查询。

Sense.DEF: to not be too good or honest to do something
Sense.TRAN: 没有好[诚实]到不做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eileen’s not above flirting with the boss when it suits her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾琳在适当的时候还是会和老板调调情的。

Sense.DEF: to be so good that no one can doubt or criticize you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even the king’s closest advisers were not above suspicion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使国王的心腹顾问也不能排除嫌疑。

Sense.DEF: to think you are better or more important than you really are

Subsense.DEF: used in a piece of writing to refer to something mentioned in an earlier part of the same piece of writing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For the above reasons, the management has no choice but to close the factory.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基于上述原因﹐资方别无选择﹐只好关闭工厂。

Subsense.DEF: something mentioned before in the same piece of writing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If none of the above applies to you, you may be able to reclaim tax.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你的情况不在上述之列﹐可以要求退税。

Sense.DEF: honest and legal
Sense.EXAMPLE: His plans for opening a coffee shop are completely above board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开咖啡馆的计划完全是光明正大的。

Sense.DEF: mentioned on a previous page or higher up on the same page
a word you say when you do a magic trick, which is supposed to make it successful
Sense.TRAN: 阿布拉卡达布拉〔施魔法时所念的咒语〕

Sense.DEF: to rub something so hard that the surface becomes damaged
an area on the surface of your skin that has been injured by being rubbed against something hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was treated for cuts and abrasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因划伤和擦伤而接受治疗。

Sense.DEF: the process of rubbing a surface very hard so that it becomes damaged or disappears
Sense.EXAMPLE: extra protection against abrasion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防止磨损的额外保护

Sense.DEF: rude or unkind
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a tough girl with rather an abrasive manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个举止相当粗鲁的泼辣女孩。

Sense.DEF: having a rough surface, especially one that can be used to clean something or make it smooth
Sense.TRAN: 粗糙的﹐有研磨作用的〔尤指可用于擦洗或打磨某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smooth down with a fine abrasive paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用一张细砂纸来打磨光滑。

Sense.DEF: a rough powder or substance that you use for cleaning something or making it smooth
to make sure that you know all the most recent facts or information about a particular subject or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to keep abreast of the latest developments in computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 了解计算机的最新发展很重要。

Sense.DEF: to walk, ride etc next to each other, all facing the same way

GramExa.GLOSS: with two, three, four etc people or vehicles next to each other
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The planes were flying four abreast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机分成四架一排飞行。

Sense.DEF: level with someone or something or in line with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the car drew abreast of him, Jack suddenly recognised the driver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆车追上来与杰克并行时﹐他一下子就认出了驾车的人。

Sense.DEF: an abridged book, play etc has been made shorter but keeps its basic structure and meaning
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑剧本等〕删节的﹐节略的﹐压缩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The abridged edition was published in 1988.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 删节本于1988年出版。

Sense.DEF: in or to a foreign country
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never lived abroad before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未在国外生活过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She often goes abroad on business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经常出国公干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We never travelled abroad when we were kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们小时候从来没有去国外旅行过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: goods imported from abroad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从国外进口的商品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The books about Harry Potter have been very popular, both at home and abroad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关哈利·波特的书在国内外一直都很流行。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling, piece of news etc is abroad, a lot of people feel it or know about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: commercial secrets which we did not want to be spread abroad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想传出去的商业秘密

Sense.DEF: to officially end a legal agreement, practice etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both governments voted to abrogate the treaty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国政府均投票通过废除这项条约。

Sense.DEF: sudden and unexpected
Sense.EXAMPLE: an abrupt change of plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划的突然改变

GramExa.PROPFORM: come to an abrupt end/halt etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus came to an abrupt halt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车突然停了下来。

Sense.DEF: seeming rude and unfriendly, especially because you do not waste time in friendly conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I didn’t mean to be so abrupt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不是故意这样无礼的。

Sense.DEF:
the muscles on your
abdomen
stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: exercises that improve your legs and abs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼腿部和腹肌的运动

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle easier to control when you have to stop very suddenly
Sense.TRAN: 防抱死制动装置，防抱死剎车装置

Sense.DEF: a painful swollen part of your skin or inside your body that has become infected and is full of a yellowish liquid
to escape from a place where you are being kept

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy absconded from a children’s home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男孩从儿童收养所逃走了。

Sense.DEF: to secretly leave somewhere, taking with you something that does not belong to you
Sense.TRAN: 〔带着不属于自己的东西〕潜逃

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has to convince a judge that he wasn’t going to abscond with the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他必须说服法官自己并非要携款潜逃。

Sense.DEF: to go down a cliff or a rock by sliding down a rope and pushing against the rock with your feet
when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Ms Leighton will be in charge during my absence
while I am away
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不在时﹐由莱顿女士负责。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her work involved repeated absences from home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作使她经常不在家。

Sense.DEF: the lack of something or the fact that it does not exist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a complete absence of any kind of planning
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无计划

Sense.EXAMPLE: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察没有证据﹐只好把迈尔斯放了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: absence makes the heart grow fonder
Sense.DEF: used to say that being away from someone makes you like them more
Sense.TRAN: 人不见﹐心更念﹔久别情更深

Sense.DEF: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to go

GramExa.EXAMPLE: students who are regularly absent from school
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常缺课的学生

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, if someone is on holiday or on a business trip, people usually say that he/she is away
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐如果某人在休假或出差﹐人们一般说he/she is away
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He's away at the moment. He’s gone to Hawaii.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在不在﹐他到夏威夷去了。
F2NBox.EXPL: If you want to say that someone is not in a particular place, say not there
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果想表示某人不在某处﹐要说not there
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I called in to see her but she wasn't there.
F2NBox.EXPL: If you want to say that someone is not with you, say not here
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果想表示某人和你不在一起﹐要说not here
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I'm afraid he's not here at the moment. Can I take a message?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐他这会儿不在。 要我记下留言吗？

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is absent, they are missing or not in the place where they are expected to be

GramExa.EXAMPLE: plans to force absent fathers to pay child maintenance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强制不和小孩生活在一起的父亲支付抚养费的计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Local women were conspicuously absent
obviously not there
from the meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地妇女缺席会议﹐众目昭彰。

Sense.DEF: a look etc that is absent shows you are not paying attention to or thinking about what is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dull, absent look on her face implied boredom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上呆滞﹑茫然的神情说明她觉得无聊了。

Sense.DEF: to not go to a place or take part in an event where people expect you to be
someone who should be in a place or at an event but is not there
a process by which people can vote before an election because they will be away during the election
Sense.TRAN: 缺席投票〔因投票人在选举期间不在而可提前投票的程序〕

Sense.DEF: regular absence from work or school without a good reason
someone who lives a long way away from a house or apartment which they rent to other people, and who rarely or never visits it
Sense.TRAN: 〔住在很远处﹑很少或从不到访出租房产的〕在外房东﹐在外地主

Sense.DEF: a vote which you send by post in an election because you cannot be in the place where you usually vote
Sense.TRAN: 缺席选票〔投票人在选举期间不能到场而通过邮寄方式投的票〕

Sense.DEF: when you are not at a court or an official meeting where a decision is made about you
in a way that shows that you are not paying attention to or thinking about what is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura gazed absently out of the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉出神地看着窗外。

Sense.DEF: likely to forget things, especially because you are thinking about something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grandad’s been getting rather absent-minded lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爷爷最近变得越发健忘了。

Sense.DEF: a bitter green very strong alcoholic drink
Sense.TRAN: 苦艾酒〔一种绿色的烈性酒〕

Sense.DEF: complete or total
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have absolute confidence in her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对她充满信心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t know with absolute certainty that the project will succeed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有绝对的把握这个项目一定会成功。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize your opinion about something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 十足的﹔绝对的〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: definite and not likely to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need absolute proof that he took the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要确凿的证据﹐证明他拿了钱。

Sense.DEF: not restricted or limited
Sense.EXAMPLE: an absolute monarch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专制君主
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents used to have absolute power over their children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去父母对孩子有绝对权力。

Sense.DEF: true, correct, and not changing in any situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have an absolute right to refuse medical treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有绝对权利﹐可以拒绝接受治疗。

Sense.DEF: measured by itself, not in comparison with other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: In absolute terms wages have risen, but not in comparison with the cost of living.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从绝对意义上说﹐工资是提高了﹐但同生活费用相比较的话﹐其实没有提高。

Sense.DEF: something that is considered to be true or right in all situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: She believed in the importance of moral absolutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为道德上的绝对准则十分重要。

Sense.DEF: completely and in every way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made his reasons for resigning absolutely clear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把辞职的理由讲得一清二楚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you absolutely sure?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你绝对肯定吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: This cake is absolutely delicious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这蛋糕好吃极了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize something
Sense.TRAN: 确确实实地﹐绝对〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The burglars took absolutely everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盗贼偷走了所有的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim knew absolutely nothing about the business when he joined the firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆加入公司时对这个行业一窍不通。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has absolutely no experience of marketing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毫无营销经验。

Sense.DEF: used when you strongly disagree with someone or when you do not want someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you let your kids travel alone at night?’ ‘Absolutely not!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你会让孩子们晚上单独外出吗？”“当然不行！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you completely agree with someone

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the adverb absolutely in spoken and written English. 副词absolutely在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the adverb absolutely is much more common in spoken English than in written English. This is because it is used to emphasize adjectives like brilliant, stupid, fantastic etc in spoken English. 本图表显示﹐副词absolutely在英语口语中的使用频率远远高于书面语﹐这是因为它在口语中被用来强调brilliant, stupid, fantastic等一类的形容词。

Sense.DEF: when a party or person wins more than half of the total votes in an election
Sense.TRAN: 绝对多数〔指选举中某一党派或个人获得超过半数的得票〕

Sense.DEF: the lowest temperature that is believed to be possible
when someone is formally forgiven by the Christian Church or a priest for the things they have done wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pope Leo gave him absolution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教皇列奥赦免了他的罪孽。

Sense.DEF: a political system in which a ruler has complete power and authority
Sense.TRAN: 专制主义（制度）﹐独裁政治

Sense.DEF: to say publicly that someone is not guilty or responsible for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He cannot be absolved of all responsibility for the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能完全免去他对这场事故的责任。

Sense.DEF: if someone is absolved by the Christian Church or a priest for something they have done wrong, they are formally forgiven
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教或神职人员〕赦免…的罪

Sense.DEF: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something
Sense.TRAN: 吸收〔液体﹑气体或其他物质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water and salts are absorbed into our blood stream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水分和盐被吸收进我们的血液中。

Sense.DEF: to read or hear a large amount of new information and understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her capacity to absorb information is amazing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吸收信息的能力令人称奇。

Sense.DEF: to interest someone so much that they do not pay attention to other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Judith lay on the settee, absorbed in her book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪思躺在沙发椅上专心致志地看书。

Sense.DEF: to become part of something larger
Sense.EXAMPLE: California absorbs many of the legal immigrants to the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚州吸纳了许多前往美国的合法移民。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were soon absorbed into local village life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很快就融入了当地的乡村生活。

Sense.DEF: if something absorbs light, heat, energy, or noise, it takes it in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darker surfaces absorb heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深色的表面吸热。

Sense.DEF: if something absorbs changes or costs, it accepts them and deals with them successfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beer industry had absorbed a doubling of federal tax in 1991.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1991年﹐啤酒行业经受住了联邦税加倍的考验。

Sense.DEF: if something absorbs money, time etc, it uses a lot of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Defence spending absorbs almost 20% of the country’s wealth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国防开支消耗了这个国家将近20%的财富。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the effect of a sudden violent movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: A well-designed sports shoe should absorb the impact on your feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计优良的运动鞋应当能够减轻脚上受到的冲击力。

Sense.DEF: material that is absorbent is able to take in liquids easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: absorbent kitchen paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸水性强的厨房用纸

Sense.DEF: enjoyable and interesting, and keeping your attention for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 十分吸引人的﹐引人入胜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an absorbing hobby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项有趣的爱好

Sense.DEF: a process in which something takes in liquid, gas, or heat

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the body’s absorption of iron
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体对铁质的吸收

Sense.DEF: a process in which people or things become part of something larger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the absorption of Soviet immigrants into Israel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏联移民在以色列的融入

Sense.DEF: when you are very interested in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t understand James’ absorption with military history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白詹姆斯为何对军事史那么着迷。

Sense.DEF: to choose not to vote for or against something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Six countries voted for the change, five voted against, and two abstained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六个国家投票赞成变革﹐五个国家反对﹐两个国家弃权。

Sense.DEF: to not do or have something you enjoy, especially alcohol or sex, usually for reasons of religion or health
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常出于宗教或健康原因〕戒除

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pilots must abstain from alcohol for 24 hours before flying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员在飞行前的24小时里必须禁酒。

Sense.DEF: careful not to have too much food, drink etc
an act of not voting for or against something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The draft law was passed by 134 votes to 19, with 5 abstentions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该法律草案以134票对19票获得通过﹐另有5票弃权。

Sense.DEF: when you do not do something you enjoy doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fasting and abstention from intoxicating drinks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁食和戒含酒精的饮品

Sense.DEF: the practice of not having something you enjoy, especially alcohol or sex, usually for reasons of religion or health
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤出于宗教或健康原因的〕节制﹔〔尤指〕戒酒，禁欲

Sense.DEF: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events
Sense.TRAN: 纯理论的﹐纯概念的﹐抽象的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ability to translate abstract ideas into words
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将抽象概念转换成文字的能力

Sense.EXAMPLE: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought
thinking about ideas
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

Sense.DEF: existing only as an idea or quality rather than as something real that you can see or touch
Sense.EXAMPLE: the abstract nature of beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美的抽象本质

Sense.DEF: abstract paintings, designs etc consist of shapes and patterns that do not look like real people or things
a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people
a short written statement containing only the most important ideas in a speech, article etc
considered in a general way rather than being based on specific details and examples
Sense.TRAN: 抽象地﹐概括地﹐从理论上说
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talking about crime in the abstract just isn’t enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽象地谈论犯罪根本不足以说明问题。

Sense.DEF: to write a document containing the most important ideas or points from a speech, article etc
to remove something from somewhere
not noticing anything around you because you are thinking carefully about something else
a general idea about a type of situation, thing, or person rather than a specific example from real life
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always talking in abstractions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是谈抽象的东西。

Sense.DEF: when you do not notice what is happening around you because you are thinking carefully about something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rocked the baby gently, gazing in abstraction at the flickering fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地摇晃着宝宝﹐出神地望着摇曳的火光。

Sense.DEF: the use of shapes and patterns that do not look like real things
a noun that names a feeling, quality, or state rather than an object, animal, or person. For example, ‘hunger’ and ‘beauty’ are abstract nouns.
unnecessarily complicated and difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maths is a mix of abstruse theory and detailed calculations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学既有深奥的理论﹐又有精密的计算。

Sense.DEF: completely stupid or unreasonable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seems quite absurd to expect anyone to drive for 3 hours just for a 20 minute meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人开3小时的车只为了去参加一个20分钟的会议﹐这好像很荒唐吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems an absurd idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

Sense.DEF: something that is completely stupid and unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the stories he tells verge on the absurd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲的有些故事近乎荒诞。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Duncan laughed at the absurdity of the situation.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 邓肯嘲笑那荒唐的局面。

Sense.DEF: surprisingly or unreasonably

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prices seem absurdly low to Western tourists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对西方游客来说﹐价格似乎低得出奇。

Sense.TRAN: 英国旅行社协会〔该机构成员许诺公平对待顾客并在出游未成行时退还钱款〕

Sense.DEF: a large quantity of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an abundance of wavy red hair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓密的红色鬈发

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One quality the team possessed in abundance was fighting spirit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队的一大特点是斗志昂扬。

Sense.DEF: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: an abundant supply of fresh water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充足的淡水供应
Sense.EXAMPLE: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

Sense.DEF: very easy to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d made her feelings towards him abundantly clear .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常清楚地表明了对他的感情。

Sense.DEF: in large quantities
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melons grow abundantly in this region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区盛产甜瓜。

Sense.DEF: cruel or violent treatment of someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: several cases of child abuse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数宗虐待儿童案

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many children suffer racial abuse at school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多孩子在学校遭受种族虐待。

Sense.EXAMPLE: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

Sense.DEF: the use of something in a way that it should not be used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: government officials’ abuse of power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府官员的滥用职权

Sense.EXAMPLE:
A self-monitoring tax system is clearly open to abuse
able to be used wrongly
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自我监督的税收制度明显会被滥用。

GramExa.GLOSS: the practice of drinking too much or taking illegal drugs

Sense.DEF: rude or offensive things that someone says when they are angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: vandalism and verbal abuse directed at old people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏公共财物和辱骂老人

GramExa.GLOSS: a series of rude or angry words

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other driver started hurling abuse at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另外一个司机朝我破口大骂起来。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone in a cruel and violent way, often sexually

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was sexually abused as a child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小时候遭到过性虐待。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Williams abused his position as Mayor to give jobs to his friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯滥用市长权力﹐给不少朋友安排了工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morris abused the trust the firm had shown in him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯辜负了公司对他的信任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who abuse the system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滥用这一制度的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proportion of drinkers who abuse alcohol is actually quite small.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮酒者中酗酒的人所占的比例实际上很小。

Sense.DEF: to say rude or offensive things to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many soldiers in Belfast are verbally abused .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多驻扎在贝尔法斯特的士兵遭到辱骂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came to the help of another driver who was being racially abused by three white passengers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他前去帮助另一个遭三名白人乘客用种族歧视言语谩骂的司机。

Sense.DEF: to treat something so badly that you start to destroy it
Sense.EXAMPLE: James abused his body for years with heroin and cocaine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯吸食海洛因和可卡因多年﹐糟蹋了自己的身体。

Sense.DEF: using cruel words or physical violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith denies using abusive language to the referee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯否认辱骂裁判。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became abusive and his wife was injured in the struggle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他动了粗﹐妻子在扭打中受伤。

Sense.DEF: if one piece of land or a building abuts another, it is next to it or touches one side of it
very bad or of bad quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reunion was an abysmal failure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重逢聚会弄得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: a very dangerous or frightening situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The country might plunge into the abyss of economic ruin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家也许会陷入经济崩溃的危险境地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At that time Bosnia was standing on the edge of an abyss .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候的波斯尼亚如临深渊。

Sense.DEF: a deep empty hole in the ground
a very big difference that separates two people or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gaping abyss between these grand buildings and my own miserable home
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些高楼大厦和自家陋室的天壤之别

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= alternating current 交流电
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= air conditioning 空（气）调（节）系统

the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=
account 1 2
账户

Sense.DEF: a tree with small yellow or white flowers that grows in warm countries
the work that university teachers and students do – often used humorously
the activities and work done at universities and colleges, or the teachers and students involved in it
relating to education, especially at college or university level
Sense.TRAN: 学术的〔尤指与学院或大学教育有关〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He possessed no academic qualifications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有学历。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a program to raise academic standards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

Sense.DEF: concerned with studying from books, as opposed to practical work
Sense.TRAN: 纯理论的﹐学术的〔与实践相对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the study of art as an academic discipline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把艺术作为一门理论科目的研究

Sense.DEF: good at studying
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not very academic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他学习不怎么样。

Sense.DEF: if a discussion about something is academic, it is a waste of time because the speakers cannot change the existing situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question of where we go on holiday is purely academic since we don’t have any money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去哪里度假完全就是空谈﹐因为我们根本没有钱。

Sense.DEF: a teacher in a college or university
a member of an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc
the period of the year during which there are school or university classes
an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国艺术和文学学会

Sense.DEF: a college where students are taught a particular subject or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: a military academy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事学院
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Royal Academy of Music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家音乐学院

Sense.DEF: a school in Scotland for children between 11 and 16
Sense.TRAN: 〔苏格兰11到16岁孩子上的〕中等学校

Sense.DEF: a private school in the US
in England, a state secondary school that is run with help and money from private organizations or people
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国由私人团体或个人捐助的〕公立中学

Sense.DEF: a small purple fruit that grows in South America and is used especially for its juice
Sense.TRAN: 紫莓﹐巴西莓﹐阿萨伊果〔产于南美洲﹐尤用于榨汁〕

Sense.DEF: sung without any musical instruments
Sense.TRAN: 清唱的[地]﹐无乐器伴奏的[地]

Sense.DEF: a British organization that tries to end disagreements about pay, conditions at work etc between the management of a business and its workers
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕咨询调解仲裁处〔负责协助解决劳资纠纷〕

Sense.DEF: to agree to a demand, proposal etc, especially after first disagreeing with it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指最初不同意后〕同意﹐答应
Sense.EXAMPLE: the doctor’s refusal to accede to his patient’s request
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生对病人要求的拒绝

Sense.DEF:
if someone accedes to the
throne
, they become king or queen
getting gradually faster
a substance such as petrol that makes a fire spread or burn more strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police suspect that an accelerant was used in the arson attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方怀疑这宗纵火袭击事件中使用了助燃剂。

Sense.DEF: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加快经济增长速度的措施

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle or someone who is driving it accelerates, it starts to go faster
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car accelerated smoothly away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车平稳地加速离去。

Sense.DEF: a process in which something happens more and more quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an acceleration in the rate of inflation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率的加快

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rapid acceleration of economic progress in South East Asia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 东南亚经济的快速增长

Sense.DEF: the rate at which a car or other vehicle can go faster
Sense.EXAMPLE: The latest model has excellent acceleration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款最新型号加速性能优异。

Sense.DEF: the rate at which the speed of an object increases
the part of a car or other vehicle that you press with your foot to make it go faster

a large machine used to make extremely small pieces of
matter 1 3
move at extremely high speeds
the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a strong Irish accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

Sense.DEF: if the accent is on a particular quality, feeling etc, special importance is given to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: accommodation with the accent on comfort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注重舒适的住处

Sense.DEF: the part of a word that you should emphasize when you say it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the word ‘dinner’ the accent is on the first syllable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: dinner一词的重音在第一音节上。

Sense.DEF: a written mark used above or below particular letters in some languages to show how to pronounce that letter

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The man had a Spanish accent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个男人有西班牙口音。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She spoke with an accent that I couldn’t understand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话有口音﹐我听不懂。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: During his stay in England, he had picked up an English accent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他旅居英格兰期间学会了英格兰口音。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: no longer speak with an accent
Collocate.EXAMPLE: After five years in Europe, Ricky had lost his American accent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 里基在欧洲生活了五年后﹐说话不再有美国口音。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: deliberately speak with a different accent from your usual one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: When mum’s on the phone, she puts on a funny accent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈打电话时说话腔调很好笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very noticeable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She spoke with a strong Scottish accent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讲话带有浓重的苏格兰口音。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has a very slight accent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他略微有些口音。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from a particular area of a country

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 上层阶级/中产阶级/工人阶级（说话）的腔调

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an upper-class accent

Sense.DEF: to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use make-up to accent your cheekbones and eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用化妆来突出颧骨和眼部。

Sense.DEF: to emphasize a part of a word in speech
spoken with a foreign accent
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke heavily accented English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说英语带有浓重的外国口音。

Sense.DEF: emphasized or given special importance
Sense.EXAMPLE: accented lighting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突出的照明

Sense.DEF: to make something more noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photograph seemed to accentuate his large nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片似乎突出了他的大鼻子。

Sense.DEF: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她请里克喝咖啡﹐他接受了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge
agree to do something difficult
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please accept this small gift.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请收下这份小小的礼物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They offered me a job and I accepted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给我一份工作﹐我接受了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He accepted a glass of water from Helen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接过海伦递来的一杯水。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
He readily accepted her invitation
accepted it quickly
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, when talking about accepting a job, accepting responsibility or blame, or accepting a method of payment, people usually use take
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示接受工作﹑承担责任或接受某种付款方式时﹐人们一般用take
F2NBox.BADEXA: They offered me the job and I accepted .
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ They offered me the job and I took it .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给我这份工作﹐我接受了。
F2NBox.EXPL: When talking about accepting an offer, people often say take someone up on their offer
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示接受提议时﹐人们常说take someone up on their offer
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He decided to take her up on her offer .

Sense.DEF: to decide that there is nothing you can do to change a difficult and unpleasant situation or fact and continue with your normal life
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not going to change, and you just have to accept it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不会改变的﹐你只能忍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have to accept that this is not an ideal world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须接受现实﹐这不是个理想的世界。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to accept the fact that most of your problems are caused by jealousy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要承认这个事实 — 你的问题多数是由嫉妒引起的。

Sense.DEF: to decide that someone has the necessary skill or intelligence for a particular job, course etc or that a piece of work is good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students accepted by Stanford Law School had very high scores on the LSAT.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦福法学院录取的学生LSAT（法学院入学考试）的成绩非常高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have accepted him as the representative of the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们接受他为公司代表。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Random House accepted the book for publication.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝登书屋同意出版这本书。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to become part of a group, society, or organization, and to treat them in the same way as the other members

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children gradually began to accept her as one of the family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们逐渐接纳她为家庭中的一员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It often takes years for immigrants to be accepted into the host community.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民经常需要几年的时间才会被当地社区所接纳。

Sense.DEF: to agree to take or deal with something that someone gives you, or to say that it is suitable or good enough
Sense.TRAN: 同意﹔〔认为合适或足够好而〕接受
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has accepted the resignation of a senior army commander.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已批准一位陆军高级指挥官的辞呈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please accept my sincere apologies .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请接受我诚挚的歉意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, we don’t accept traveller’s cheques.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我们不收旅行支票。

Sense.DEF: to decide to do what someone suggests or advises you should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be prepared to accept the advice of members of staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要愿意采纳员工的建议。

Sense.DEF: to agree that what someone says is right or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has accepted your explanation as to why you didn’t attend the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她相信了你没有出席会议的解释。

Sense.DEF: to admit that you were responsible for something bad that happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The University will not accept responsibility for items lost or stolen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物品遗失或被窃﹐本大学概不负责。

Sense.DEF: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an agreement which is acceptable to all sides
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各方均可接受的协议

Sense.EXAMPLE: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

Sense.DEF: acceptable behaviour is considered to be morally or socially good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alcohol is not an acceptable way out of your problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 借酒消愁并不可取。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here, the students set the standards for acceptable behaviour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里由学生自己制定可接受行为的标准。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is not socially acceptable for parents to leave children unattended at that age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母不照管那么小的孩子是社会大众所不能接受的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is perfectly acceptable to sample the food before you buy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品先尝后买是完全可以的。

Sense.DEF: when you officially agree to take something that you have been offered

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the formal acceptance of an invitation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式接受邀请

Sense.EXAMPLE:
He wrote a letter of acceptance
a letter in which you agree to accept a job, university place etc
to the university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给那所大学写了一封接受函。

Sense.DEF: when people agree that an idea, statement, explanation etc is right or true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the acceptance of Einstein’s theory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对爱因斯坦理论的认同

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is still not widespread acceptance that fathers can care for children as well as mothers do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲和母亲一样能照顾好孩子的观点尚未得到普遍接受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This management style gained acceptance in the 1980s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种管理模式在20世纪80年代得到了认可。

Sense.DEF: the ability to accept an unpleasant situation which cannot be changed, without getting angry or upset about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By the end of the trial, Nicolas moved towards acceptance of his fate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 审判结束时﹐尼古拉斯慢慢接受了自己的命运。

Sense.DEF: the process of allowing someone to become part of a group or a society and of treating them in the same way as the other members
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acceptance by their peer group is important to most youngsters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大多数年轻人来说﹐为同辈所接纳是很重要的。

Sense.DEF: considered right or suitable by most people
Sense.TRAN: 公认可接受的﹐被认可的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having more than one wife is a normal and accepted practice in some countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一些国家﹐一夫多妻是正常的﹑被认可的做法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: generally accepted principles of fairness and justice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍接受的关于公平﹑公正的观念

Sense.DEF: the right to enter a place, use something, see someone etc
Sense.TRAN: 进入权﹔使用权﹔接触的机会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Access to the papers is restricted to senior management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有高级管理层才有权查阅这些文件。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cats should always have access to fresh, clean water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该让猫总能喝到新鲜﹑干净的水。

Sense.DEF: how easy or difficult it is for people to enter a public building, to reach a place, or talk to someone
Sense.TRAN: 进入﹔到达﹔面见〔的难易度〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to improve access for disabled visitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在设法给残障访客的出入提供便利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a villa with easy access to the sea
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢离大海很近的别墅

Sense.DEF: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Access to the restrooms is through the foyer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去洗手间要穿过门厅。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have access to a car/a computer etc
Sense.DEF: to have a car, a computer etc that you can use
Sense.TRAN: 有汽车/计算机等可以使用

Sense.DEF: the legal right to see and spend time with your children, a prisoner, an official etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: My ex-husband has access to the children once a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的前夫有权每周探望孩子一次。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in entering a place or in seeing someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 进入〔某地〕﹔见到〔某人或某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police managed to gain access through an upstairs window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察设法从楼上的一扇窗户进入了屋子。

Sense.DEF: to find information, especially on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 存取﹐获取〔尤指计算机数据〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Users can access their voice mail remotely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用户可以远程获取语音邮件。

Sense.DEF: an educational course for adults which prepares them for study at a university or college
a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into
Sense.EXAMPLE: The island is only accessible by boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有座教堂离我家很近。

Sense.DEF: easy to obtain or use

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the need for a health service that is accessible to all
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 建立全民共享的医疗服务体系的需求

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Computers should be made readily accessible to teachers and pupils.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应当让老师和学生可以随时使用电脑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is accessible is easy to meet and talk to, even if they are very important or powerful
Sense.TRAN: 易接近的﹐随和的﹐平易近人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think that you’ll find she’s very accessible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你会发现她十分平易近人。

Sense.DEF: a book, poem, painting etc that is accessible is easy to understand and enjoy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wants his music to be accessible to everyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望自己的音乐人人都能欣赏。

Sense.DEF: an official process in which someone becomes king, queen, president etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the accession of James I
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯一世即位

GramExa.GLOSS: the act of becoming king, queen, president etc

Sense.DEF: the act of agreeing to a demand
an object or work of art that is added to a collection of objects or paintings
to add accessories to clothes, a room etc
something such as a piece of equipment or a decoration that is not necessary, but that makes a machine, car, room etc more useful or more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: bathroom accessories such as mirrors and towel-rails
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镜子和毛巾架等浴室配件

Sense.DEF: something such as a bag, belt, or jewellery that you wear or carry because it is attractive
Sense.TRAN: 装饰物﹐小配件〔如手袋﹑皮带﹑珠宝等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: fashion accessories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时尚饰品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a set of fully matching clothes and accessories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套完全相配的衣服和饰物

Sense.DEF: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
Sense.TRAN: 同谋﹐帮凶﹐〔尤指帮助藏匿的〕从犯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an accessory to murder
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋杀案的帮凶

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who helps a criminal before or after the crime

Sense.DEF: a special piece of equipment on a computer system, which is designed to manage and control information, requests etc received from other computers that are connected to the system without wires
a company that provides the technical services that allow people to use the Internet, usually in exchange for a monthly payment
Sense.TRAN: 因特网接入服务供应商

Sense.DEF: a road which allows traffic to reach a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the access road to the farm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进入农场的行车通道

Sense.DEF: the time taken by a computer to find and use a piece of information in its memory
in a way that is not planned or intended
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I met her quite by accident
completely by accident
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遇见她完全是偶然。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discovery was made almost by accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项发现几乎纯属意外。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The pilot, whether by accident or design
whether it was planned or not planned
, made the plane do a sharp turn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知是有意还是无意﹐那名飞行员让飞机来了个急转弯。

Sense.DEF: an event in which a car, train, plane etc is damaged and often someone is hurt
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 70,000 people are seriously injured every year in road accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年在道路事故中受重伤的有七万多人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident happened at the junction of Forest Road and Pine Walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故发生在森林路与松树路的交叉口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a train accident
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车事故

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone is injured or something is damaged without anyone intending them to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken had an accident at work and had to go to hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯在工作中出了事故﹐不得不去医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I’m sorry about breaking the vase – it was an accident
I did not intend to do it
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我把花瓶打碎了—这是个意外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He died in a climbing accident in the Himalayas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在攀登喜马拉雅山时遇难。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
She was injured in a freak accident
an unusual accident
when a wall suddenly collapsed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一场墙壁突然倒塌的诡异事故中受了伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a slight accident with your coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了个小小的意外﹐我把你的咖啡弄洒了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They lost their lives in a tragic accident .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在一次悲惨的事故中丧生。

Sense.DEF: something that happens without anyone planning or intending it
Sense.EXAMPLE: My third baby was an accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第三个孩子是意外怀上的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is no accident that men fill most of the top jobs in nursing, while women remain on the lower grades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性在护理行业中占据大多数重要职位﹐而女性仍处于较低级别﹐这绝非偶然。

GramExa.GLOSS: an event or situation caused by chance
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 出生/地理/历史等的偶然

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone who has broken something that they should not worry that it has happened
Sense.TRAN: 意外事情在所难免﹐不小心总是有的

Sense.DEF: used about a situation in which an accident is likely to happen because no one is trying to prevent it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boats are being left to drift; it’s an accident waiting to happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任由这些船漂流﹐肯定会出事的。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meaning 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s been a bad accident on the freeway.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路上发生了一宗严重事故。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: News is coming in of a major rail accident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚收到的消息说发生了一宗重大铁路事故。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 可怕的/严重的/骇人听闻的事故
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We narrowly avoided a nasty accident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们险些遭遇严重事故。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which someone is killed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a fatal accident involving a bus and a cyclist
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及一辆公共汽车和一名骑车人的致命交通事故

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is not serious
when someone is hit by a driver who does not stop

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had an accident on my way to work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上班途中出了事故。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Your son has been involved in a car accident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你儿子遭遇了车祸。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Steps have been taken to prevent a similar accident happening again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 已采取措施﹐预防类似事故再次发生。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: One of the accident victims is still trapped in his vehicle.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一名事故受害者仍然被困在车里。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the place where it happened
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police were at the scene of the accident within minutes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察几分钟之内就赶到了事故现场。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a small accident’. Say 而要说 a minor accident .

Exponent.DEF: an event in which a vehicle is damaged and often someone is hurt
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her father died in a car accident.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲死于车祸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hugh had an accident on his way to work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 休上班途中出了交通事故。
