Exponent.DEF: a serious accident in which a vehicle hits something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Rees-Jones was the only person to survive the crash.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 里斯——琼斯是这起撞车事故唯一的幸存者。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a car/plane/train crash
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 撞车事故/飞机失事/火车撞车事故

Exponent.DEF: an accident in which two or more cars, trains etc hit each other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His car was involved in a collision with a train.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的车与一辆火车相撞。
Exponent.THESPROPFORM:
a head-on collision
between vehicles that are driving towards each other

Exponent.DEF: a serious accident involving a train, plane, or boat, in which a lot of people are killed or injured
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was Britain’s worst air disaster.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是英国最严重的空难。

Exponent.DEF: an accident in which a car or train is badly damaged
Exponent.TRAN: 〔汽车或火车遭严重损毁的〕交通事故
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ben nearly died in a car wreck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本险些死于车祸。

Exponent.DEF: an accident that involves several cars or trucks
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pile-up happened in thick fog.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起连环撞车事故发生于大雾天。

Sense.DEF: happening without being planned or intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: an accidental discharge of toxic waste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒废料的意外排放
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buy an insurance policy that covers accidental damage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买一份意外损害保单。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I accidentally locked myself out of the house.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不小心把自己锁在了门外。

Sense.DEF: an expression used by a court when it has decided that someone’s death was caused by an accident
the room or department in a hospital where people go if they are injured or suddenly become ill
more likely to have accidents than other people
Sense.TRAN: 易遭遇意外的﹐易惹事故的

Sense.DEF: to praise someone or something publicly
Sense.EXAMPLE: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

Sense.DEF: praise for a person or their achievements
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The young singer is enjoying critical acclaim
praise by people who are paid to give their opinion on art, music etc
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位年轻歌手得到评论家的赞赏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their recordings have won great acclaim .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的唱片获得高度评价。

Sense.DEF: publicly praised by a lot of people
Sense.TRAN: 备受推崇的﹐广受欢迎的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book has been widely acclaimed by teachers and pupils.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书在师生中广受欢迎。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
His work was critically acclaimed
praised by people who are paid to give their opinion on art, music etc
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品备受评论家推崇。

Sense.DEF: a loud expression of approval or welcome
the act of electing someone, using a spoken rather than written vote
to become used to a new place, situation, or type of weather, or to make someone become used to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Runners had to acclimatize to the humid tropical conditions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛跑选手必须适应潮湿的热带环境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found it hard to acclimatize myself to working at weekends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现自己很难适应周末上班。

Sense.DEF: praise for someone who is greatly admired, or a prize given to them for their work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She received a Grammy Award, the highest accolade in the music business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得了音乐界的最高奖项 — 格莱美奖。

Sense.DEF: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with a place to stay, live, or work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The island was used to accommodate child refugees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该岛用于收容儿童难民。

Sense.DEF: to accept someone’s opinions and try to do what they want, especially when their opinions or needs are different from yours
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve made every effort to accommodate your point of view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经尽力采纳你的观点。

Sense.DEF: to get used to a new situation or to make yourself do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her eyes took a while to accommodate to the darkness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛过了一会儿才适应黑暗。

Sense.DEF: helpful and willing to do what someone else wants
Sense.TRAN: 肯通融的﹔随和的﹔温顺的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an accommodating child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个性格温顺的小孩

Sense.DEF: a place for someone to stay, live, or work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price for the holiday includes flights and accommodation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 度假的价格包括机票和住宿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: living accommodations for the crews
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船员的起居舱
Sense.EXAMPLE: travel and hotel accommodations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行及酒店住宿
租用的住处
Sense.EXAMPLE: secure accommodation for young offenders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严密看管的少年犯囚室
Sense.EXAMPLE: Universities have to provide student accommodation for first-year students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学必须为一年级生提供学生宿舍。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say somewhere to live/stay rather than accommodation
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说somewhere to live/stay﹐而不说accommodation
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She’s trying to find somewhere to live.
Have you found anywhere to stay yet?

Sense.DEF: an agreement between people or groups who have different views or opinions, that satisfies everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We reached an accommodation between both parties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们双方达成和解。

Sense.DEF: music that is played in the background at the same time as another instrument or singer that plays or sings the main tune

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He plays folk music with guitar accompaniment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在吉他伴奏下演唱民乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A group of children danced around to the accompaniment of drums and piano.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群孩子在鼓和钢琴的伴奏下跳舞。

Sense.DEF: something that is provided or used with something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: White wine makes an excellent accompaniment to fish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白葡萄酒是吃鱼时绝佳的佐餐酒。

Sense.DEF: while something else is happening or while another sound can be heard
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were exercising to the accompaniment of cheerful music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在欢快的乐曲声中锻炼。

Sense.DEF: something that happens at the same time as another thing
someone who plays a musical instrument while another person sings or plays the main tune
to go somewhere with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不论丈夫去哪里﹐她都陪伴左右。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say go with or come with someone rather than accompany someone
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说go with或come with someone﹐而不说accompany someone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Do you want me to go with you to the station?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想不想让我陪你去车站？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She came with me to church.

Sense.DEF: to play a musical instrument while someone sings a song or plays the main tune
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daniel wanted Liz to accompany him on violin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔想让丽兹用小提琴为他伴奏。

Sense.DEF: to happen or exist at the same time as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease is accompanied by sneezing and fever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病伴有打喷嚏和发烧症状。

Sense.DEF: if a book, document etc accompanies something, it comes with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please see accompanying booklet for instructions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说明请参阅所附的小册子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your passport application form should be accompanied by two recent photographs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护照申请表应附近照两张。

Sense.DEF: a person who helps someone such as a criminal to do something wrong
to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有计划要做的事情﹐我们都已完成。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Mission accomplished
we have done what we intended to do
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大功告成。

Sense.DEF: an accomplished writer, painter, singer etc is very skilful
Sense.TRAN: 〔作家﹑画家﹑歌手等〕有才华的﹐造诣高的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a highly accomplished designer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位才华横溢的设计师

Sense.DEF: something that is known to be true and cannot be doubted
something successful or impressive that is achieved after a lot of effort and hard work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cutting the budget was an impressive accomplishment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 削减预算是一项了不起的成就。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a major accomplishment for a player who had been injured so recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于一个刚受过伤的选手来说﹐这是很好的成绩。

Sense.DEF: the act of finishing or achieving something good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the accomplishment of policy goals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策目标的实现

Sense.DEF: an ability to do something well, or the skill involved in doing something well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Playing the piano is one of her many accomplishments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹钢琴是她的多项才艺之一。

Sense.DEF: without being asked or forced to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He decided to go of his own accord.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是自己决定要去的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door seemed to move of its own accord.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那扇门似乎自己在动。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These results are in accord with earlier research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些结果和先前的研究一致。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is important to the success of any firm that its partners should be in complete accord.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 合伙人步调一致对于公司的成功至关重要。

Sense.DEF: a formal agreement between countries or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Helsinki accord on human rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫尔辛基人权协定

Sense.DEF: if two or more people do something with one accord, they do it together or at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a silence as the women turned with one accord to stare at Doreen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些女人一齐转身盯着多琳看﹐全场鸦雀无声。

Sense.DEF: to give someone or something special attention or a particular type of treatment
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will not be accorded any special treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会得到任何特殊待遇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Every school accords high priority to the quality of teaching.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每所学校都高度重视教学质量。

Sense.DEF: to match or agree with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The punishments accorded with the current code of discipline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处罚与现行的纪律规则一致。

Sense.DEF: according to a rule, system etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Article 47 may only be used in accordance with international law .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第47条只能按照国际法来施行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use this product only in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须依照厂商说明书使用本产品。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is suitable for a particular situation or that is based on what someone has done or said
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katherine still considered him a child and treated him accordingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳仍旧把他当作小孩子﹐像对待小孩子一样对他。

Sense.DEF: as a result of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些法律相互矛盾﹐因此﹐采取了措施将其阐明。

Sense.DEF: as shown by something or stated by someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to the police, his attackers beat him with a blunt instrument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照警方的说法﹐袭击者用钝器击打他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is now widespread support for these proposals, according to a recent public opinion poll.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据最近的民意调查﹐目前人们普遍支持这些提议。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘according to me’ or 或 ‘according to my opinion/point of view’. Say 而要说 in my opinion : In my opinion his first book is much better. 依我看﹐他的第一本书好多了。

Sense.DEF: in a way that depends on differences in situations or amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will be paid according to the amount of work you do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的酬劳将按工作量来定。

Sense.DEF: in a way that agrees with a system or plan, or obeys a set of rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game will be played according to rules laid down for the 1992 Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛将按1992年杯赛所制定的规则进行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything went according to plan , and we arrived on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切按计划进行﹐我们准时到达。

Sense.DEF:
a musical instrument like a large box that you hold in both hands. You play it by pressing the sides together and pulling them out again, while you push buttons and
key s
.
to go towards someone you do not know and speak to them in an unpleasant or threatening way
Sense.TRAN: 〔以不怀好意的态度〕上前和〔陌生人〕说话
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accosted by four youths and forced to give them all his money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四个少年走上前来和他搭讪，逼迫他交出身上所有的钱。

Sense.DEF: a written or spoken description that says what happens in an event or process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was too shocked to give an account of what had happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因受惊过度而无法描述所发生的事情。

GramExa.GLOSS: a description of all the details of an event in the order that they happened
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a blow-by-blow account of how England lost to Portugal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队如何负于葡萄牙队的详细报道

Sense.EXAMPLE: Chomsky’s account of how children learn their first language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔姆斯基关于儿童如何学习第一语言的描述

GramExa.GLOSS: a description of events by someone who saw them
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 目击者的/第一手的描述
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eye-witness accounts told of the unprovoked shooting of civilians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目击者讲到平民无故被枪击。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This gives a first-hand account of the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是关于这场战争的第一手报道。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out
Sense.EXAMPLE: My salary is paid into my bank account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
My husband and I have a joint account
one that is shared between two people
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

Sense.DEF: to consider or include particular facts or details when making a decision or judgment about something
Sense.TRAN: 考虑到某事﹐把某事考虑进去
Sense.EXAMPLE: These figures do not take account of changes in the rate of inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数字没有把通货膨胀率的变化考虑进去。

Sense.DEF: because of something else, especially a problem or difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was told to wear flat shoes, on account of her back problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为背部有问题﹐她被建议穿平底鞋。

Subsense.DEF: an exact record of the money that a company has received and the money it has spent
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The accounts for last year showed a profit of $2 million.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年的账目显示利润为200万美元。

Subsense.DEF: a department in a company that is responsible for keeping records of the amount of money spent and received
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Eileen works in accounts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾琳在财务部工作。

Sense.DEF: if you buy goods on account, you take them away with you and pay for them later
an arrangement that you have with a shop or company, which allows you to buy goods or use a service now and pay for them later
Sense.TRAN: 〔可先使用后付款的〕赊欠账户
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you charge this to my account please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把这记在我的（赊欠）账上吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unlimited-use Internet account
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个能无限使用的因特网后付费账户

Sense.DEF: a statement that shows how much money you owe for things you have bought from a shop

GramExa.GLOSS: pay what you owe
GramExa.EXAMPLE: James left the restaurant, settling his account by credit card.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯用信用卡结完账离开餐厅。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement to sell goods and services to another company over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our sales manager has secured several big accounts recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的销售部经理最近拉到了好几笔大生意。

Sense.DEF: according to what a lot of people say
Sense.EXAMPLE: It has, from all accounts, been a successful marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁都说这是一桩美满的婚姻。

Sense.DEF: if you do something on someone’s account, you do it because you think they want you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please don’t change your plans on my account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请不要为了我而改变你的计划。

Sense.DEF: by yourself or for yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carrie decided to do a little research on her own account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽决定自己做点研究。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on no account/not on any account
Sense.DEF: used when saying that someone must not, for any reason, do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: On no account must you disturb me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你千万不要打扰我。

Sense.DEF: according to what you have said, especially when you have admitted doing something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bentley was, by his own account, over-sensitive to criticism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据本特利自己说﹐他对批评过于敏感。

Sense.DEF: concerning a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: There needn’t be any more worries on that account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要再为那事担心了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give a good/poor account of yourself
Sense.DEF: to do something or perform very well or very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kevin gave a good account of himself in today’s game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文在今天的比赛中表现出色。

Sense.DEF: to force someone who is responsible for a mistake or a crime to explain publicly why they did it and punish them for it if necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people responsible for the accident have never been brought to account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起事故的责任人一直没有被追究责任。

Sense.DEF: to use something for a good purpose
Sense.TRAN: 善用某物﹐充分利用某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps she could put some of her talents to good account by helping us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过帮助我们﹐也许她可以把自己的某些才能充分发挥出来。

Sense.DEF: not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she grew up, her father was of no account to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她渐渐长大﹐父亲对她也不重要了。

Sense.DEF: to form a particular amount or part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Afro-Americans account for 12% of the US population.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非裔美国人占美国人口的12%。

Sense.DEF: to be the reason why something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent pressure at work may account for his behavior.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为也许是最近的工作压力导致的。

Sense.DEF: to give a satisfactory explanation of why something has happened or why you did something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you account for your movements on that night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能说明一下你那天晚上的行踪吗？

Sense.DEF: to say where all the members of a group of people or things are, especially because you are worried that some of them may be lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three days after the earthquake, more than 150 people had still to be accounted for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震发生3天后﹐仍有150多人下落不明。

Sense.DEF: responsible for the effects of your actions and willing to explain or be criticized for them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government should be accountable to all the people of the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府应当对全体国民负责。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Managers must be accountable for their decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理人员必须对自己作出的决定负责。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital should be held accountable for the quality of care it gives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院应当对医护质量负责。

Sense.DEF: the profession or work of keeping or checking financial accounts, calculating taxes etc
someone whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes etc
accountancy
the equipment needed for a particular activity or way of life
Sense.TRAN: 〔某项活动或某种生活所需的〕装备﹐配备
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stylish accoutrements of an English country gentleman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名英国乡绅的时髦装备

Sense.DEF: having official approval to do something, especially because of having reached an acceptable standard
Sense.TRAN: 鉴定合格的﹐达到标准的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an accredited counsellor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位合格的辅导员
Sense.EXAMPLE: an accredited language school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一所鉴定合格的语言学校

Sense.DEF: if a government official is accredited to another country, they are sent to that country to officially represent their government there
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为本国政府代表〕被派驻国外的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UK accredited representative
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的官方驻外代表

Sense.DEF: a layer of a substance which slowly forms on something
a gradual process by which new things are added and something gradually changes or gets bigger
if advantages accrue to you, you get those advantages over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔利益﹑好处等〕逐渐产生﹐逐渐形成

GramExa.EXAMPLE: benefits that accrue to students
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生逐渐得到的好处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: advantages accruing from the introduction of new technology
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 引进新技术逐渐显现出的好处

Sense.DEF: if money accrues or is accrued, it gradually increases over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest will accrue until payment is made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利息将会累计增加﹐直至付清款项。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= account 账户

Sense.DEF: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富﹐这是不公平的。

Sense.DEF: to gradually increase in numbers or amount until there is a large quantity in one place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fat tends to accumulate around the hips and thighs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脂肪常常积聚在臀部和大腿部位。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say build up rather than accumulate
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说build up﹐而不说accumulate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: These chemicals tend to build up in the soil.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些化学物质常常会在土壤中积聚。

Sense.DEF: gradually increasing in amount or degree over a period of time
a part of a computer that stores numbers

a kind of
betting
on the results of a series of horse races, by which any money you win from a race is bet on the next race
the ability to do something in an exact way without making a mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他传球准确无误。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being correct or true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: worries about the accuracy of government statistics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府统计数据准确性的担心

Sense.DEF: correct and true in every detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该手册尽量公正﹑准确地介绍每一家酒店。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police believe Derek gave a reasonably accurate account of what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方相信德里克对事情的叙述是比较准确的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
The evidence she gave to the court was not strictly accurate
not exactly accurate
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向法庭提供的证词并不完全准确。

Sense.DEF: measured or calculated correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to get accurate figures on population numbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难取得精确的人口统计数字。

Sense.DEF: a machine that is accurate is able to do something in an exact way without making a mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cutter is accurate to within ½ a millimetre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个切割器精确到 1 / 2 毫米以内。

Sense.DEF: an accurate shot, throw etc succeeds in hitting or reaching the thing that it is intended to hit
Sense.EXAMPLE: an accurate shot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准确命中
Sense.EXAMPLE: accurate bowling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准确的投球

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible to predict the weather accurately.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报不可能很准确。

Sense.DEF: used to show that something makes you very angry

someone who is accursed has had a
curse
put on them
a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A number of serious accusations have been made against her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受到了多项严重指控。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His administration now faces accusations of corruption.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的政府正面临贪污腐败的指控。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The organizers of the march strongly denied government accusations that they intended to cause trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行的组织者极力否认政府对他们企图闹事的指控。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她过去对我妄加指责﹐说了种种不是。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中﹐他们逃离了该国。

Sense.DEF:
a form of a noun in languages such as Latin or German, which shows that the noun is the
direct object
of a verb or a
preposition
an accusatory remark or look from someone shows that they think you have done something wrong
to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was accused of murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控谋杀。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smith accused her of lying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯指责她说谎。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
The professor stands accused of
has been accused of
stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

Exponent.DEF: to say that you believe that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two women have been accused of kidnapping a newborn baby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名女子被控绑架一名新生婴儿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you accusing me of lying?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是指责我撒谎吗？

Exponent.DEF: to accuse someone of doing something, although this has not been proved
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在未证实的情况下〕断言﹐声称
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He alleged that the other man had attacked him first.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称是另一名男子首先袭击他的。

Exponent.DEF: if the police charge someone, they officially tell that person that they are believed to be guilty of a crime and that they must go to court
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was charged with murder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被指控犯有谋杀罪。

Exponent.DEF: to officially accuse someone of a crime so that they will be judged in court under the American legal system
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was indicted on charges of fraud.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因涉嫌诈骗被起诉。

Sense.DEF: the person or group of people who have been officially accused of a crime or offence in a court of law
an accusing look from someone shows that they think you have done something wrong
to make yourself or another person become used to a situation or place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took a while for me to accustom myself to all the new rules and regulations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过了一段时间才适应所有的新规章制度。

Sense.DEF: to be familiar with something and accept it as normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were accustomed to working together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们习惯了一起工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her eyes quickly became accustomed to the dark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛很快就适应了黑暗。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say be used to instead of be accustomed to, and get used to instead of get/become accustomed to
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说be used to﹐而不说be accustomed to﹔一般说get used to﹐不说get/become accustomed to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She 's used to working with children.
It’s hard at first, but you’ll get used to it.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 一开始不容易﹐但你会习惯的。

Sense.DEF: usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pans were in their accustomed places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些锅在老地方。

Sense.DEF: sexually attracted to both men and women
a playing card with a single spot on it, which usually has the highest value in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ace of hearts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红心A
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a pair of aces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一对A。

Sense.DEF: someone who is extremely skilful at doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soccer ace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球高手
Sense.EXAMPLE: cycling ace Chris Boardman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶尖自行车选手克里斯·博德曼

Sense.DEF:
a first shot in tennis or
volleyball
which is hit so well that your opponent cannot reach the ball and you win the point
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球或排球中的〕发球得分﹐爱司球

Sense.DEF: to have the advantages in a situation so that you are sure to win
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Americans hold most of the aces in this technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一技术领域美国人占绝对优势。

Sense.DEF: very close to doing or achieving something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team came within an ace of winning the championship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队与冠军擦肩而过。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have an ace up your sleeve
Sense.DEF: to have a secret advantage which could help you to win or be successful
Sense.TRAN: 手中有王牌﹐有获胜的绝招

Sense.DEF: something that you keep secretly to use when you need it
Sense.EXAMPLE: That fifty dollars is my ace in the hole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那50美元是我应急备用的钱。

Sense.DEF: someone who is a very skilful pilot, player etc
Sense.TRAN: 王牌飞行员/顶尖运动员/滑雪高手等
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ace marksman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位神枪手

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was ace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会棒极了。

Sense.DEF: to do very well in an examination, a piece of written work etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I aced the History test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我历史考得很好。

Sense.DEF:
to hit your first shot in tennis or
volleyball
so well that your opponent cannot reach the ball
Sense.TRAN: 〔在网球或排球比赛中〕对…发球得分﹐对…发爱司球

Sense.DEF: criticizing someone or something in a clever but cruel way
Sense.EXAMPLE: acerbic wit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖刻的俏皮话

Sense.DEF: a chemical made from acetic acid
a smooth artificial cloth used to make clothes

a transparent sheet that you write or print something on, and that is used with an
overhead projector

the acid in
vinegar
a clear liquid with a strong smell, used for cleaning surfaces, making paint more liquid, or for making other chemical substances
a gas which burns with a bright flame and is used in equipment for cutting and joining pieces of metal
if part of your body aches, you feel a continuous, but not very sharp pain there
Sense.EXAMPLE: His feet were aching from standing so long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站了那么久﹐双脚隐隐作痛。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say they have a headache , have (a) backache , have (a) stomach ache , or have (a) toothache rather than saying that their head, back, etc aches
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说have a headache﹐have (a) backache﹐have (a) stomach ache或者have (a) toothache﹐而不说head﹐back等aches

Sense.DEF: to want to do or have something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m aching for sleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很想睡觉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He ached to reach out and hold her close.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很想伸出双手紧紧抱住她。

Sense.DEF: to have a strong unhappy feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sarah ached with sadness that her brother was so ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弟弟病得很重﹐莎拉忧心忡忡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim’s heart was aching for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆为她心痛难过。

Sense.DEF: a continuous pain that is not sharp or very strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stomach ache
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胃痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: A dull ache throbbed at the back of David’s head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维的后脑隐隐抽痛。

GramExa.GLOSS: slight feelings of pain that are not considered to be serious
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Apart from the usual aches and pains, she felt all right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了几处经常性的疼痛以外﹐她感到身体尚可。

Sense.DEF: a strong, mostly unhappy, feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ache of his loneliness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的孤寂之苦

Sense.DEF: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard
Sense.TRAN: 实现﹔〔尤指经过努力〕取得﹐达到
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frances achieved very good exam results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于实现目标﹐当上了教授。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say someone gets a result rather than achieves it
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get a result﹐而不说achieve a result
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He got good grades in his final exams.

Sense.DEF: to be successful in a particular kind of job or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want all our students to achieve within their chosen profession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望所有的学生在自己选择的专业领域内都能有所成就。

Sense.DEF: something important that you succeed in doing by your own efforts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We try to celebrate the achievements of our students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想要庆祝学生取得的成就。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His great achievement is to make all the players into a united team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The test measures children’s achievements in reading, spelling, and maths.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项测验评估儿童在阅读﹑拼写和数学方面的成绩。

Sense.DEF: when you achieve something or when people achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roberts is researching the effect of social class on educational achievement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯茨在研究社会等级对于学业成就的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As we climbed the final few metres, we felt a sense of achievement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们攀登最后几米的时候﹐有一种成就感。

Sense.DEF: someone who is successful because they are determined and work hard
Sense.TRAN: 〔意志坚定﹑工作勤奋的〕成功人士

Sense.DEF: a weak part of someone’s character, which could cause them to fail at something
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人性格中的〕致命弱点﹐致命伤
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think Frank’s vanity is his Achilles' heel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为﹐虚荣心是弗兰克的致命弱点。

Sense.DEF: the part of your body that connects the muscles in the back of your foot with the muscles of your lower leg

used to represent the sound you make when you
sneeze

a chemical substance that has a
pH
of less than 7. Strong acids can burn holes in material or damage your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: sulphuric acid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硫酸

Sense.DEF:
the drug
LSD
having a sharp sour taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: a juicy apple with a slightly acid flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个多汁﹑略带酸味的苹果

Sense.DEF: an acid remark uses humour in an unkind way to criticize someone
Sense.TRAN: 尖酸刻薄的话/评论/口吻等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was expecting another of his acid remarks, but he remained silent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我等着他再说一句刻薄的话﹐但他不吭声了。

Sense.DEF: a way of finding out whether something is as good as people say it is, whether it works, or whether it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: People ask if the team is good enough. This match will be the acid test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们问这支球队是不是够好﹐经过这场比赛的考验就可见分晓。

Sense.DEF:
an acid soil does not contain much
lime 1 3
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blueberry bushes need a very acid soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝莓的生长需要强酸性土壤。

Sense.DEF: a kind of dance music that is played loudly using electronic instruments
Sense.TRAN: 迷幻豪斯音乐〔一种用电子乐器演奏的高音量舞曲〕

Sense.DEF: very sour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some fruit juices taste a bit acidic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些果汁味道略酸。

Sense.DEF: containing acid
to become an acid or make something become an acid

a type of popular music that combines features of many other kinds of music, especially
jazz
,
hip-hop
, and
soul
Sense.TRAN: 迷幻爵士乐〔结合爵士乐﹑嘻哈乐﹑灵乐等特点的流行音乐〕

Sense.DEF: if you say something acidly, you say it in a cruel or unkind way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sure you’re right,’ he said acidly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你肯定是对的。”他挖苦道。

Sense.DEF: rain that contains harmful acid which can damage the environment and is caused by chemicals in the air, for example from cars or factories
to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists
Sense.TRAN: 承认〔某事属实或某情况存在〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family acknowledge the need for change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He acknowledges that when he’s tired he gets bad-tempered.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认自己累了就会发脾气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Claire acknowledged that she was guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔承认有罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government must acknowledge what is happening and do something about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于目前的情况﹐政府必须承认其存在并对此采取措施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Maybe you are right,’ she acknowledged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “也许你是对的。”她承认道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a fact that most smokers readily acknowledge .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是大多数烟民都愿意承认的事实。

Sense.DEF: if people acknowledge something, they recognize how good or important it is
Sense.TRAN: 承认〔某事物优秀或重要〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film festival is acknowledged as an event of international importance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个电影节被认为是国际盛事。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be widely/generally acknowledged to be sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mill produces what is widely acknowledged to be the finest wool in the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家工厂生产的毛料被公认是全世界最好的。

Sense.DEF: to accept that someone or something has authority over people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both defendants refused to acknowledge the authority of the court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名被告都拒绝承认法庭的权威性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of the poor acknowledged him as their spiritual leader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多穷苦人都把他视为他们的精神领袖。

Sense.DEF: to publicly announce that you are grateful for the help that someone has given you
Sense.EXAMPLE: We wish to acknowledge the support of the university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想要感谢大学给予的支持。

Sense.DEF: to show someone that you have noticed them or heard what they have said
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom acknowledged her presence by a brief glance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆瞥了她一眼﹐表示知道她在。

Sense.DEF: to let someone know that you have received something from them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收到此信后请告知﹐不胜感谢。

Sense.DEF: the act of admitting or accepting that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We want an acknowledgement of the existence of the problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望这问题的存在能够得到承认。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The reduction in their grant is an acknowledgement that they have been paid too much.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少对他们的拨款就是承认他们拿得太多了。

Sense.DEF: a movement of your body that shows that you have noticed someone or heard what they have said
Sense.EXAMPLE: Basil nodded an acknowledgement as he entered the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴兹尔走进房间时点头打招呼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a faint smile of acknowledgement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她微微一笑打招呼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Larsen looked over and nodded in acknowledgement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉森望过去﹐点点头打招呼。

Sense.DEF: the act of publicly thanking someone for something they have done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She received a special award in acknowledgement of all her hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得一个特别奖﹐表彰她的辛劳工作。

Sense.DEF: a letter written to tell someone that you have received their letter, message etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want a written acknowledgement?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要我书面确认收到吗？

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing at the beginning or end of a book in which the writer thanks all the people who have helped him or her
Sense.TRAN: 〔作者在卷首或卷末的〕致谢﹐鸣谢

Sense.DEF: the best and highest level of something
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的顶峰﹐某事物的顶点
Sense.EXAMPLE: the acme of perfection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽善尽美

Sense.DEF: a medical problem which causes a lot of red spots on your face and neck and mainly affects young people
someone who serves a leader or believes in their ideas
someone who helps a priest at a religious ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 侍僧﹐辅祭﹐助祭〔教士的助手〕

Sense.DEF:
the nut of the
oak
tree
relating to sound and the way people hear things

an acoustic
guitar
or other musical instrument does not have its sound made louder electronically

PIC.HEADING: ACOUSTIC 原声的
PIC.PICCONTENT: acoustic guitar 原声吉他；amplifier 扩音器；electric guitar 电吉他

Sense.DEF: the shape and size of a room, which affect the way sound is heard in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hall has excellent acoustics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 礼堂的音响效果极佳。

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of sound
to deliberately find out about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to acquaint myself with the new regulations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得熟悉一下新的规章制度。

Sense.DEF: to give someone information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to acquaint the police with the facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得把事实真相告诉警方。

Sense.DEF: someone you know, but who is not a close friend
Sense.TRAN: 相识的人﹐泛泛之交﹐熟人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He heard about the job through a mutual acquaintance
someone you and another person both know
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是通过一个双方都认识的人知道有这份工作的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say someone I know rather than an acquaintance
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说someone I know﹐而不说an acquaintance
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I got the job through someone I know .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是通过一个熟人得到这份工作的。

Sense.DEF: a relationship with someone you know, but who is not a close friend
Sense.EXAMPLE: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在因特网上相识。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
You can’t judge her on such short acquaintance
when you have not known her long
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认识这么短时间﹐你无法对她作出评价。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
My uncle did not improve on further acquaintance
when you knew him better
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深交之后我叔叔依然如故。

Sense.DEF: to meet someone for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should be delighted to make Mrs McGough’s acquaintance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴能认识麦高夫太太。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the hotel, I made the acquaintance of a young American actor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在酒店里﹐我结识了一位年轻的美国演员。

Sense.DEF: knowledge or experience of a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have a passing/nodding acquaintance with sth
GramExa.GLOSS: have only slight knowledge or experience of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has a passing acquaintance with a lot of different subjects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对许多学科都知道个一鳞半爪。

Sense.DEF: a person of your acquaintance is someone that you know
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poems were written by various women of her acquaintance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些诗是她认识的形形色色的女性写的。

Sense.DEF: when you meet someone for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people are nicer than you think on first acquaintance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都比你初次见面时所认为的要好。

Sense.DEF: a crime in which a person forces someone they know to have sex with them
your experience or knowledge of a subject
a slight friendship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Sheridan had struck up an acquaintanceship with Giles
had met him and became friendly with him
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢里登与贾尔斯交上了朋友。

Sense.DEF: if you are acquainted with someone, you have met them a few times but do not know them very well

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Were you acquainted with a friend of mine, Daniel Green?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认识我的一个朋友丹尼尔·格林吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: We would like to get better acquainted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望加深对彼此的了解。

Sense.DEF: to know about something, because you have seen it, read it, used it etc
Sense.TRAN: 熟悉某事物﹐了解某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was well acquainted with classical literature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对古典文学很熟悉。

Sense.DEF: to do what someone else wants, or allow something to happen, even though you do not really agree with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oil companies have been accused of acquiescing in the pollution of the ocean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油公司被指控对污染海洋的做法暗中默许。

Sense.DEF: too ready to agree with someone or do what they want, without complaining or saying what you want to do
to obtain something by buying it or being given it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

Sense.DEF: to get or gain something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college acquired a reputation for very high standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所学院以学术水平高而闻名。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get rather than acquire
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get﹐而不说acquire
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Where did you get that tie?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在哪儿买的那条领带？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He soon got a reputation for being unfriendly.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的不友善很快便尽人皆知。

Sense.DEF: to gain knowledge or learn a skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent years acquiring his skills as a surgeon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他花了许多年时间学习外科医生的技能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elsie acquired a good knowledge of Chinese.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔茜汉语学得很好。

Sense.DEF: to begin to like something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had acquired a taste for European beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢上了欧洲啤酒。

Sense.DEF: something that people only begin to like after they have tried it a few times
the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: the acquisition of language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言的习得

Sense.DEF: the act of getting land, power, money etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔土地﹑权力﹑金钱等的〕获得﹐得到

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the acquisition of new sites for development
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得新的开发用地

Sense.DEF: something that you have obtained by buying it or being given it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Art Society is holding an exhibition of recent acquisitions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术协会在为新近购得的艺术品举办展览。

Sense.DEF: wanting to have and keep a lot of possessions
to give a decision in a court of law that someone is not guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the defendants were acquitted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有被告都被判无罪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge directed the jury to acquit Phillips of the murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官指示陪审团裁决菲利普斯谋杀罪名不成立。

Sense.DEF: to do something well, especially something difficult that you do for the first time in front of other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指首次在别人面前做困难的事时〕表现好/得体

Sense.DEF: an official statement in a court of law that someone is not guilty
a unit for measuring area, equal to 4,840 square yards or 4,047 square metres
Sense.EXAMPLE: They own 200 acres of farmland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拥有200英亩农田。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 200-acre wood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片200英亩的林地

Sense.DEF: a large amount of space
the area of a piece of land measured in acres
Sense.TRAN: 英亩数﹐以英亩计算的面积

Sense.DEF: an acrid smell or taste is strong and unpleasant and stings your nose or throat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cloud of acrid smoke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团刺鼻的烟雾

Sense.DEF: an acrid remark expresses anger and criticizes someone strongly
an acrimonious meeting or discussion is one in which people argue a lot and get very angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议﹑讨论〕激烈的﹐唇枪舌剑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting ended in an acrimonious dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议在激烈的辩论中结束。

Sense.DEF: feelings of anger between people who disagree strongly and do not like each other

someone who entertains people by doing difficult physical actions such as walking on their hands or balancing on a high rope, especially at a
circus
acrobatic movements involve moving your body in a very skilful way, for example by jumping through the air or balancing on a rope
Sense.EXAMPLE: They performed some amazing acrobatic feats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们表演了一些令人惊叹的杂技动作。

Sense.DEF: skilful movements of your body, for example jumping through the air or balancing on a rope
a word made up from the first letters of the name of something such as an organization. For example, NATO is an acronym for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
Sense.TRAN: 首字母缩略词〔如NATO（北约）由North Atlantic Treaty Organization的首字母缩略而成〕

Sense.DEF: from one side of something to the other
Sense.TRAN: 从一边到另一边；穿过，越过
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first flight across the Atlantic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨越大西洋的首次飞行
Sense.EXAMPLE:
They ran straight across the road
without stopping
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们径直跑过了马路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to swim across.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得游过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d got halfway across before Philip realized he’d left his money at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走到半路﹐菲利普才意识到他把钱忘在家里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We gazed across the valley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向山谷另一边凝望。

Sense.DEF: towards someone or something on the other side of an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s Brendan. Why don’t you go across and say hello?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是布伦丹﹐你为什么不去打个招呼呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The referee looked across at his linesman before awarding the penalty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判先朝巡边员看了一眼﹐然后判罚点球。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He walked across to where I was sitting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝我坐的地方走过来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something exists or reaches from one side of an area to the other
Sense.TRAN: 从一边延伸到另一边；横贯﹐跨越
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep crack across the ceiling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 横贯天花板的一道深深的裂缝
Sense.EXAMPLE: the only bridge across the river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河上唯一的一座桥
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think this shirt is too tight across the shoulders?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得这衬衫的肩部是不是太紧了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s parked right across the entrance to the driveway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把车就那么停在车道入口处。

Sense.DEF: on the opposite side of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: My best friend lives across the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最好的朋友住在马路对面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew that just across the border lay freedom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道﹐越过边境就自由了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Across the street from where we’re standing, you can see the old churchyard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们所站之处的街对面﹐你可以看到古老的教堂墓地。
GramExa.EXAMPLE:
the woman sitting across from me
opposite me
on the train
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车上坐在我对面的女士

Sense.DEF: in every part of a country, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a TV series that became popular across five continents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在五大洲广受欢迎的电视系列片
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers are expected to teach a range of subjects right across the curriculum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求教师能教授课程里的很多科目。

Sense.DEF: used to show how wide something is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The river is 2 kilometres across.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河宽两公里。

Sense.DEF: affecting everyone or everything in a situation or organization
Sense.TRAN: 全面的[地]﹐包括一切的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: an across-the-board pay increase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 集体加薪
Sense.EXAMPLE: In July everything we sell is reduced right across the board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7月﹐我们出售的所有货品将全面降价。

Sense.DEF: a poem or piece of writing in which the first or last letter of each line spells a word
Sense.TRAN: 离合诗﹔离合文〔各行第一个词的首字母或最后一个词的尾字母能组合成词的一种文体〕

Sense.DEF: acrylic paints or cloth are made from chemical substances, not natural substances
acrylic paints
one thing that you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thoughtless act
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻率的举动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an act of violence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力行为
GramExa.EXAMPLE: her many acts of kindness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的许多善行
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The act of writing a list can help to calm you down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 列清单可以帮助你冷静下来。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the act of doing sth
GramExa.GLOSS: at the moment that you are doing something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lindsay paused in the act of putting down the phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 林赛放下电话时停顿了一下。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say a thoughtless/kind/stupid etc thing to do rather than a thoughtless/kind/stupid etc act .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说a thoughtless/kind/stupid etc thing to do﹐而不说a thoughtless/kind/stupid etc act。

Sense.DEF: a law that has been officially accepted by Parliament or Congress
Sense.TRAN: 〔由议会或国会正式通过的〕法令﹐法案
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Housing and Community Development Act of 1977
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1977年《住房和社区发展法》
Sense.EXAMPLE: an act of Parliament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会法令

Sense.DEF: insincere behaviour in which you pretend to have a particular kind of feeling or to be a particular kind of person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike played the loving husband in front of the children but it was all an act.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克在孩子面前表现得像个体贴的丈夫﹐但那都是假装的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be natural. Don’t feel you have to put on an act .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然点﹐不必装模作样。

Sense.DEF: to become more organized and behave in a more effective way, especially in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to get your act together if you’re going to find the right house to buy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想买到合适的房子﹐你得加把劲。

Sense.DEF:
one of the main parts into which a stage play,
opera
etc is divided
Sense.EXAMPLE: I arrived at the theatre late and missed the first act.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到剧场时晚了﹐错过了第一幕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the beginning of Act 3
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第三幕开场

Sense.DEF: a short performance on stage or television by someone who plays music or tells jokes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The argument was just part of their act.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争吵只是他们表演的一部分。

Sense.DEF: a performer or a group of performers who perform together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band is one of many acts that have been booked for the concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会已邀约多方参演﹐这个乐队是其中之一。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a hard/tough etc act to follow
Sense.DEF: someone who does such an excellent job that it would be difficult for someone doing the same job after them to be as good
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has been a very successful captain and will be a hard act to follow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是位非常出色的队长﹐后来者将很难与之比肩。

Sense.DEF: to take part in an activity that someone else has started, especially in order to get a share of the advantages for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为得到好处而〕插手﹐参与〔他人发起的活动〕

Sense.DEF: an event that is caused by natural forces, such as a storm, flood, or fire, which you cannot prevent or control
Sense.TRAN: 天灾﹐自然灾害﹐不可抗力

Sense.DEF: an occasion when people pray together and show their respect for God
a situation in which you are trying to do several different types of work at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 同时兼顾好几个方面的工作﹐力图面面俱到

Sense.DEF: to be impossible to find when you are needed
to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司解雇他做得对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UN must act now to restore democracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国现在必须采取行动来重建民主体制。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有足够多的民众起来要求﹐政客们才会采取行动。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often use expressions like do the right thing or do a brave thing rather than use act with an adverb such as correctly or bravely
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常常用do the right thing﹐do a brave thing等说法﹐而不用act和correctly﹐bravely等副词连用的说法
F2NBox.BADEXA: They acted correctly in telling her.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ They did the right thing in telling her.
F2NBox.EXPL: When act is used alone to mean ‘take action’, in everyday English people usually just say do something
F2NBox.TRAN: act单独使用﹐表示“采取行动”之意时﹐在日常英语中人们通常只说do something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We have to do something now.

Sense.DEF: to behave in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: They acted unreasonably when they turned down Jill’s application.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拒绝了吉尔的申请﹐这样做没道理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been acting strangely ever since his Mom died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从母亲死后﹐他的行为一直很怪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pip acted as if he was better than everyone else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮普表现得好像他比任何人都强似的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop acting like a baby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别像小孩子那样胡闹了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She acted with dignity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表现得很有尊严。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone to behave in a more adult way, suitable for someone of their age

Sense.DEF: to pretend to have feelings, qualities etc that are different from your true ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he’s angry, he acts the fool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一生气就装傻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That guy is acting crazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个家伙在装疯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stella felt unnatural in their company, as if she was acting a part.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉和他们在一起感到不自在﹐好像在演戏一样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why does he act as if he was stupid?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为什么装傻？

Sense.DEF: to perform in a play or film
Sense.EXAMPLE: I first started acting when I was 12 years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我12岁开始演戏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is acting the role of Lady Macbeth six evenings a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一星期六个晚上演麦克白夫人这个角色。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie is very well acted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片演得非常好。

Sense.DEF: to have an effect or use

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中﹐衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Disinfectants act on bacteria in two main ways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消毒剂杀灭细菌有两种主要途径。

Sense.LEXUNIT: act for sb/act on sb’s behalf
Sense.DEF: to represent someone, especially in a court of law or by doing business for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Makin, a solicitor, is acting for the young people in their case against the county council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅金律师在本案中代表年轻人起诉郡议会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am acting on behalf of the bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我代表银行方面。

Sense.DEF: to do a particular job for a short time, for example while the usual person is absent
Sense.EXAMPLE: My brother speaks French – he can act as interpreter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弟弟会说法语﹐他可以充当翻译。

Sense.DEF: to do something because of another person’s advice or order, or because you have received information or had an idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is acting on the advice of her lawyers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她按照律师的建议行事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police say they acted on information received.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称﹐他们根据接到的情报采取了行动。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people act out an event, they show how it happened by pretending to be the people who were involved in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were acting out the story of the birth of Jesus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们正在表演耶稣诞生的故事。

Sense.DEF: to express your feelings about something through your behaviour or actions, especially when you have been feeling angry or nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: These teenagers are likely to act out their distress by running away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些青少年可能会用离家出走的方式来表达自己的郁闷情绪。

Sense.DEF: if children act up, they behave badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a tough kid and he acts up a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很倔的孩子﹐还常常调皮捣蛋。

Sense.DEF: if a machine or part of your body acts up, it does not work properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器〕运转不正常﹐〔身体〕出毛病
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer is acting up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑又出问题了。

Sense.DEF: someone who does an important job while the usual person is not there, or until a new person is chosen for the job
the job or skill of performing in plays and films
the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The government must take action
do something
now to stop the rise in violent crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府现在必须采取行动遏止暴力犯罪的上升。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmental groups want tougher action on pollution from cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护团体希望对汽车污染采取更严厉的措施。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
She was looking forward to putting her ideas into action
doing the things she had planned
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她盼望着将自己的想法付诸实施。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Ambulance crews are ready to spring into action
suddenly start doing something
if anything goes wrong during the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护车急救人员随时准备出动﹐以应对比赛期间发生的意外。

Sense.DEF: something that someone does

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her prompt actions probably saved my life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她敏捷的行动很可能救了我一命。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
The child could not be held responsible for his actions
he was too young to be blamed for them
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能要求这个小孩对自己的行为负责。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chief of police tried to justify his actions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察局长试图为自己的行为辩解。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is in action is doing the job or activity they are trained or designed to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: photos of ski jumpers in action
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跳台滑雪者跳下时的照片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to see the new computer system in action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望看到新的计算机系统运行起来。

Subsense.DEF: broken and not working
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The photocopier is out of action again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复印机又出故障了。

Subsense.DEF: injured and unable to do anything

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The injury will keep him out of action for a month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次受伤将使他一个月无法做事。

Sense.DEF: fighting during a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been reports of widespread enemy action in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据报敌军在该地区开展大规模行动。

GramExa.GLOSS: killed or wounded while fighting
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His father was killed in action in Vietnam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父亲在越战中阵亡。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
530 servicemen were reported missing in action
they were never seen again after a battle
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据报有530名军人在战斗中失踪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men were sent into action with little or no training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些男子被送上战场时几乎没有或根本未经训练。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He had seen action
been involved in fighting
in France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在法国打过仗。

Sense.DEF: a legal or formal process to decide whether someone has done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE:
They are threatening to take legal action against the hospital
start a court case against them
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们扬言要起诉这家医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The director faces disciplinary action
official action to punish him
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位董事面临纪律处分。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The matter is now the subject of a court action
a court case
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事现在成了一桩诉讼的争议事项。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The students agreed to drop their action
decided not to continue with a court case or an official complaint
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们同意撤诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The sisters brought a libel action against the newspaper
started a court case
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家姐妹起诉报社诽谤。

Subsense.DEF: exciting things that are happening
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There hasn’t been much action around here for months.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个月来这里没有发生多少有意思的事。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: New York is where all the action is .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约是最繁华喧闹的地方。

Subsense.DEF: an action film has a lot of exciting scenes in it, in which people fight, chase, and kill each other
Subsense.TRAN: 〔电影〕有许多打斗刺激镜头的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Gibson became famous in action movies.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉布森演动作片出了名。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a TV action hero
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个电视动作片男主角

Sense.SIGNPOST: the events in a story/film etc
Sense.DEF: the events in a story, film, play etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the action takes place in San Francisco.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分情节发生在旧金山。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The action opens
starts
in a barbershop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 故事在一家理发店拉开序幕。

Sense.DEF: the way something moves or works

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the action of the heart
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏功能

Sense.EXAMPLE: a smooth braking action
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平稳的制动过程

Sense.DEF: the effect that a substance, especially a chemical, has on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drug blocks the action of the cancer gene.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药能遏制癌症基因的作用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the action of alcohol on the liver
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精对肝脏的影响

Sense.DEF: a group formed to change a social or political situation – often used in names
Sense.TRAN: 行动小组/委员会等〔常用于名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Child Poverty Action Group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童贫困行动小组

Sense.DEF: an opportunity to be involved in an event or activity, especially one that will be enjoyable or will make money
Sense.TRAN: 参与﹐插手〔尤指为了玩乐﹑赚钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want a slice of the action, tickets may still be available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你们想一起去﹐可能还有票。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are judged by what you do, and not by what you say

used by film
director s
to give the instruction to begin filming
Sense.TRAN: 开拍！〔电影导演下令开始拍摄时用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lights, camera, action!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯光﹐摄影﹐开拍！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something to deal with a problem
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government must take action to control inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须采取行动控制通货膨胀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask forcefully
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Voters are demanding tougher action on gun crime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民强烈要求对涉枪犯罪采取更严厉的措施。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: suddenly start doing something
start doing something you have planned to do

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The public wants immediate action to stop the terrorists.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众希望立即采取措施阻止恐怖分子的活动。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that needs to be done immediately
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Opposition called for urgent action to reduce unemployment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党要求采取紧急措施降低失业率。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We need firm action to deal with the problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要采取坚决措施来解决这个问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that has a big effect on the way something develops
that has a very severe effect
that is aimed at making a government or company do something
that workers take in order to protest about pay, working conditions etc
that two or more countries, organizations etc take together

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you decided on a course of action?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 行动方案你决定了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The General outlined his plan of action for the campaign.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军概述了他的作战计划。

Sense.DEF: to do a specific thing that needs to be done, especially after discussing it
Sense.TRAN: 就…进行处理﹐对…采取行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are we actually going to action these objectives?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们究竟如何实现这些目标呢？

Sense.DEF: if something you say or do is actionable, it is so bad or damaging that a claim could be made against you in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: His remarks are actionable in my view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看﹐他的话可招致诉讼。

Sense.DEF: an action-packed film, book etc contains a lot of exciting events
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑书等〕情节起伏跌宕的﹔刺激的

Sense.DEF: something that must be done, as a result of a meeting
Sense.TRAN: 〔经会议商讨后决定的〕具体行动方案

Sense.DEF: an important or exciting moment in a sports game that is shown again on television immediately after it happens, sometimes at a slower speed
Sense.TRAN: 即时重播﹐精彩回放〔电视中回放体育比赛的精彩瞬间〕

Sense.DEF: an event in your life that is very similar to one that you have experienced before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an action replay of the week we spent in Jamaica
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在牙买加度过的那个星期的再现

Sense.DEF: the positions that people such as soldiers or the police take when they are getting ready to fight or deal with a difficult situation – often used to tell people to go to these positions
Sense.TRAN: 〔士兵﹑警察等的〕岗位〔常用于下命令〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crew, return to action stations!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全体人员﹐各就各位！

Sense.DEF: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use set off rather than activate when talking about electrical systems
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中表示触动电器﹐人们一般用set off﹐而不用activate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Someone has set off the smoke alarm again.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人再次触响了烟雾警报器。

Sense.DEF: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: games for active youngsters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她80多岁了﹐但仍旧很活跃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father always led a very active life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲一直过着忙忙碌碌的生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a child with a very active imagination
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个想象力很丰富的孩子

Sense.DEF: involved in an organization or activity and doing lots of practical things to achieve your aims
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became politically active at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Bureau is active in promoting overseas investment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该局积极促进海外投资。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take/play an active part/role in sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Encourage students to take an active part in discussions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要鼓励学生积极参与讨论。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She took an active interest in local charities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对当地慈善事业非常热衷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the importance of active participation by elderly people in the life of the community
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人积极参与社区生活的重要性

Sense.EXAMPLE:
We’re taking active steps
doing practical things
to deal with the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在采取积极措施解决这个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We maintain active links with other European universities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们与欧洲其他大学保持积极联系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is an active member of the Labour Party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是工党的积极分子。

Sense.DEF: operating in a way that is normal or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: The virus is active even at low temperatures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病毒即使在低温下也有活性。

Sense.DEF: doing something regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: sexually active teenagers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常有性行为的青少年

Sense.DEF:
an active
volcano
is likely to explode at any time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The volcano became active last year with a series of eruptions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座火山去年活跃起来﹐喷发了好几次。

Sense.DEF:
an active verb or sentence has the person or thing doing the action as its
subject
. In ‘The boy kicked the ball’, the verb ‘kick’ is active
producing a chemical reaction
Sense.EXAMPLE: nicotine, the active ingredient in tobacco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟草中的活性成分尼古丁

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Carol was actively involved in the local sports club.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗尔积极参加当地体育俱乐部的活动。

Sense.DEF: the active form of a verb, for example ‘destroyed’ in the sentence ‘Enemy planes destroyed the village.’
the work that soldiers do in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: Powell was declared unfit for active service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍威尔被宣布不适合服役。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More than 20,000 women are on active duty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两万多名女性在服现役。

Sense.DEF: someone who works hard doing practical things to achieve social or political change

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 政治活动家/积极支持同性恋的人/动物权利支持者等

Sense.DEF: things that people do, especially in order to achieve a particular aim
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为达到一定目的而进行的〕活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone is free to engage in peaceful political activity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都可以自由参加和平的政治活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fund-raising activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 筹款活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular physical activity helps to control your weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定期参加体育活动有助于控制体重。

Sense.DEF: something that you do because you enjoy it
Sense.EXAMPLE: leisure activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休闲活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: outdoor activities such as hiking or climbing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如远足、爬山等户外活动

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of things are happening or a lot of things are being done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office was suddenly full of frantic activity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里一下子紧张忙碌起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The farm was always a hive of activity at this time of year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年这个时候农场里都是一派繁忙景象。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meanings 义项 1, 2 & 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children were encouraged to take part in several different activities.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们被鼓励参加几种不同的活动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The men were involved in terrorist activities.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些男子参与了恐怖活动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He doesn't do a lot of physical activity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不常进行体力活动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Political activity is closely controlled by the government.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治活动受到政府的严密控制。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The current level of economic activity will influence business confidence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当前经济活动的水平将会影响企业信心。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Internet shopping is a rapidly developing area of business activity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 网上购物是商业活动中一个迅速发展的领域。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The level of economic activity has increased.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济活动水平有所提高。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘make an activity’. Say 而要说 take part in an activity or 或 be involved in an activity .
Do not say 不要说 ‘sport activity’. Say 而要说 sports activity .

Sense.DEF: someone who performs in a play or film

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has starred with many leading actors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她曾与许多大牌演员一起担任主角。

GramExa.GLOSS: an actor who takes unusual or interesting roles

Exponent.DEF: someone who performs in a play or film
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her son wants to be an actor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她儿子想当演员。

Exponent.DEF: a woman who performs in a play or film. Many women prefer to be called actors rather than actresses
Exponent.TRAN: 女演员〔许多女性更喜欢被称作actor﹐而不是actress〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Who was the actress who played Jane Eyre?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 扮演简·爱的女演员是谁？

Exponent.DEF: a famous actor
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Julia Roberts is a famous Hollywood star.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 茱莉娅·罗伯茨是著名的好莱坞明星。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel is popular with movie stars.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店很受电影明星的喜爱。

Exponent.DEF: someone who plays the most important part in a play or film
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Daniel Radcliffe is the star of the ‘Harry Potter’ films.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔·拉德克利夫是《哈利·波特》系列电影的主角。

Exponent.DEF: one of two or more famous actors who have important parts in a play or film
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her co-star Jodie Foster won the Best Actress Award.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 与她联袂主演的影星朱迪·福斯特获得了最佳女演员奖。

Exponent.DEF: the main acting part in a play or film
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He will play the lead in a new version of ‘Dracula’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将扮演新版《吸血僵尸》的主角。

Exponent.DEF: an actor in a film who does not say anything but is part of a crowd
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She started her career as an extra in TV soap operas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她初出道时在电视肥皂剧里当群众演员。

Exponent.DEF: an actor who learns a part in a play so that they can act the part if the usual actor is ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Vanessa had flu, and her place was taken by her understudy, Miss Lisa Fennell.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦妮莎得了流感﹐她的角色由替补演员莉萨·芬内尔小姐担任。

Exponent.DEF: all the actors in a play or film
Exponent.TRAN: 〔一出戏或一部电影的〕全体演员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Other members of the cast include Johnny Depp and Danny DeVito.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧组的其他成员包括约翰尼·德普和丹尼·德维托。
Exponent.EXAMPLE:
She will head the cast
she will have the most important part
.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将领衔主演。

Exponent.DEF: a group of actors who perform plays together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 2006, he joined the Royal Shakespeare Company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 2006年﹐他加入了皇家莎士比亚剧团。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The play will be performed by an all-female company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧将由一个女子剧团表演。

Sense.DEF: a woman who performs in a play or film
used to emphasize that something is real or exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not joking. Those were his actual words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没开玩笑﹐那都是他的原话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know Germany won, but I can’t tell you the actual score.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道德国队胜了﹐但我不知道确切的比分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest is only charged on the actual amount borrowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利息只按实际借款额收取。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
In actual fact
really
, there is little evidence to support the allegations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实上﹐这些指控几乎没有证据支持。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use actual to mean ‘at the present time’. Use current or present . 表示“现在”的意思不要用actual﹐而要用current或present: the current (NOT 不说 actual) economic policy 当前的经济政策

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the most important part of an event or activity
Sense.TRAN: 真正的某事物﹐某事物本身
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme starts at 8.00 but the actual film doesn’t start until 8.30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节目8点开始﹐但电影本身要到8点半才放映。

Sense.DEF: facts, rather than things that people believe or imagine
Sense.TRAN: 事实﹐真实情况﹐实际情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grim actualities of prison life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱生活的严酷现实

Sense.DEF: the state of being real or really existing
Sense.EXAMPLE:
In actuality , it’s much more complex than that
used when talking about what a situation is really like
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际情况比那要复杂得多。

Sense.DEF: to make a plan or wish become true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mistakes are a necessary part of actualizing your vision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯错是实现梦想的必经之路。

Sense.DEF: used to add new information to what you have just said, to give your opinion, or to start a new conversation
Sense.TRAN: 实际上﹐其实﹔说实在的〔用于补充新的信息﹑说明个人观点或开始新的对话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve known Barbara for years. Since we were babies, actually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认识芭芭拉很多年了﹐实际上我们从小就认识。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Actually, on second thoughts, I don’t think I want to go out tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其实再想想﹐我今晚不打算出去了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the real or exact truth of a situation, rather than what people may think
Sense.TRAN: 实际上﹐事实上〔用于强调真实的情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time are you actually leaving?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到底几点走？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labor costs have actually fallen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人工成本实际上降低了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Disappointed?’ ‘No, actually I’m rather glad.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “失望了？”“不﹐实际上我挺高兴的。”

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the adverb actually in spoken and written English. 副词actually在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。
This graph shows that the adverb actually is much more common in spoken English than in written English. 本图表显示﹐副词actually在英语口语中的使用频率远远高于书面语。

Sense.DEF: numbers that relate to something that has actually happened, rather than what was expected to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mobile phone operators had expected monthly usage of up to 250 minutes. Actuals are very different, at 100 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 移动电话运营商原本预期每月用量可达250分钟﹐但实际数据大相径庭﹐只有100分钟。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to advise insurance companies on how much to charge for insurance, after calculating the risks
to behave in a particular way because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was actuated by violent jealousy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的忌妒心驱使着他。

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of machinery start to operate
the ability to think, see, or hear clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A motorist needs good visual acuity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾车者需要良好的视敏度。

Sense.DEF: the ability to think quickly and make good judgments

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm’s success is largely due to Brannon’s commercial acumen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的成功主要归功于布兰农的商业头脑。

Sense.DEF: a treatment for pain and disease that involves pressing your hands on particular parts of the body
a treatment for pain and disease that involves pushing special needles into parts of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: the four main acupuncture points
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四大穴位

Sense.DEF: an acute problem is very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: The housing shortage is more acute than first thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住房短缺情况比一开始想的要严重。

Sense.DEF: an acute feeling is very strong
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: acute embarrassment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万分的尴尬
Sense.EXAMPLE: acute anxiety
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极度的忧虑

Sense.DEF: an acute illness or disease quickly becomes very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: acute arthritis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 急性关节炎

Sense.DEF: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

Sense.DEF: quick to notice and understand things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon’s vague manner concealed an acute mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙貌似蒙昧，其实头脑灵活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an acute analysis of Middle Eastern politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对中东政治的敏锐分析

Sense.DEF: an acute angle is less than 90°

an acute
accent
a mark used to show pronunciation
is a small mark written above a vowel. In ‘café’, the letter ‘e’ has an acute accent
Sense.TRAN: 发锐音的﹐标有尖音符号的

Sense.DEF: feeling or noticing something very strongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students are becoming acutely aware that they need more than just paper qualifications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生越来越强烈地意识到他们需要的不仅是一纸文凭。

Sense.EXAMPLE: acutely embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异常尴尬的

Sense.DEF: an advertisement
used to show that a date is a particular number of years after the birth of Christ
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first century AD
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公元1世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: 54 AD
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公元54年

Sense.DEF: a well-known phrase that says something wise about human experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: the old adage that a picture is worth a thousand words
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一图胜千言”这句古老格言

Sense.DEF: a piece of music that should be played or sung slowly

in the Old Testament of the Bible, the first man created by God. God put him in the Garden of Eden, and created Eve, the first woman, from one of Adam's
rib s
. He was the father of Cain, Abel, and Seth.
Sense.TRAN: 亚当〔《圣经·旧约全书》中的人物﹐人类的始祖〕

Sense.DEF: to not know someone at all
determined not to change your opinion or a decision that you have made
Sense.EXAMPLE: She begged me to change my mind, but I remained adamant .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她求我改变主意﹐但我坚决不肯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Madonna is adamant that she will not tour this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦当娜坚持今年不作巡回演出。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Britain is adamantly opposed to the new directive.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国坚决反对那项新指令。

Sense.DEF: the lump at the front of your neck that moves when you talk or swallow
to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children are finding it hard to adapt to the new school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们觉得很难适应新学校。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: flowers which are well adapted to harsh winters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常适应严冬的花

Sense.EXAMPLE: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do these insects adapt themselves to new environments?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些昆虫是如何适应新环境的？

Sense.DEF: to change something to make it suitable for a different purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car has been adapted to take unleaded gas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车经改装可以使用无铅汽油。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These teaching materials can be adapted for older children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些教材可以修改一下供大龄孩子使用。

Sense.DEF: if a book or play is adapted for film, television etc, it is changed so that it can be made into a film, television programme etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She lives in a specially adapted flat.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她住在一间专门改造过的公寓里。

Sense.DEF: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The catfish is adaptable to a wide range of water conditions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲶鱼能适应很多种水环境。

Sense.DEF: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the BBC adaptation of the best-selling book
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本畅销书的英国广播公司改编版
