GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s working on a screen adaptation of his latest novel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在把自己的最新小说改编成电影。

Sense.DEF: the process of changing something to make it suitable for a new situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: adaptation to the environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 适应环境

Sense.DEF: an object that you use to connect two different pieces of electrical equipment, or to connect two pieces of equipment to the same power supply
Sense.TRAN: 转接器﹐适配器﹔多头插头

Sense.DEF: to put something with something else or with a group of other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the mixture seems dry, add water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果混合物看上去干﹐加点水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you want to add your name to the list?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想把你的名字加到名单里吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Suzuki has added extra doors to its sports off-roader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铃木公司为其运动越野车增加了车门。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Material about recent research has been added to this new edition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新版本增加了最近的研究材料。

Sense.DEF: if you add numbers or amounts together, you calculate their total

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add 7 and 5 to make 12.
For tax purposes, your pension and earnings are added together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算税款时﹐养老金和收入加在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add £2.20 to the cost for postage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在该费用基础上加2.20英镑的邮费。

Sense.DEF: to increase the amount or cost of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spell-checking your document adds time to the process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给文件作拼写检查会延长这一过程的时间。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sales tax adds to the price.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售税提高了价格。

Sense.DEF: to say more about something that has just been said
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘And I don’t care what you think,’ she added defiantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “而且我不在乎你怎么想。”她挑衅地加了一句。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there anything you’d like to add, David?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维﹐你还有什么要补充的吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone will be invited to vote, he said, adding that voting is likely to be via the Web.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说所有人都会被邀请来投票﹐并且补充说投票可能通过网络进行。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
I was refused accommodation – not, I hasten to add , on account of my appearance
used to explain more about what you have just said
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的住宿要求被拒——我要赶紧说明一下﹐不是因为我的外表。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She was trying to entertain us – unsuccessfully, I might add
used to comment on what you have just said
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想逗我们开心——但我说是白费力气了。

Sense.DEF: to give a particular quality to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve added value to the information by organizing it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把信息进行了整理﹐使它变得更有价值了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: add a touch of glamour/class (to sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Champagne always adds a touch of glamour to the occasion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香槟酒总能为特别的场合增添情调。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Coloured glass can be added for effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以加装彩色玻璃以突出效果。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce another fact that supports your opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our hospitals are short of cash. Add to that the long hours doctors work, and you have a recipe for disaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的医院资金短缺﹐再加上医生工作时间长﹐这些早晚都是祸根。

Sense.DEF: if something adds weight to an argument, idea etc, it makes it stronger
Sense.TRAN: 为某事物增加影响力[说服力]

GramExa.PROPFORM: add weight to the suggestion/idea etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Recent research adds weight to the theory that the climate is changing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的研究进一步证明了气候正在变化这个理论。

Sense.DEF: to make a bad situation worse for someone who has already been treated badly
Sense.TRAN: 既伤害又侮辱﹔雪上加霜
Sense.EXAMPLE: She not only deceived him but, to add insult to injury, allowed him to pay for her meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不仅骗了他﹐更恶劣的是还让他付了饭钱。

Sense.DEF: to make an argument or disagreement worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rather than providing a solution, their statements merely added fuel to the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的声明不但没有解决问题﹐反而火上浇油。

Sense.DEF: to include something with something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to add in the cost of your time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘记把你的时间成本也算进去。

Sense.DEF: to include or put on something extra
Sense.EXAMPLE: proposals to add a penny on income tax
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所得税增加一便士的提议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The private chapel was added on to the church much later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个私用小圣堂是这座教堂很久以后加建的。

Sense.DEF: to make a feeling or quality stronger and more noticeable
Sense.TRAN: 增加﹐增添〔某种情绪或品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This show will no doubt add to his growing reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场演出无疑将使他正在扩大的名声更加响亮。

Sense.DEF: to calculate the total of several numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can add up in my head quite easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做心算加法很轻松。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Specialized software adds up the statistics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专用软件合计统计数据。

Subsense.DEF: if a set of facts does not add up, it does not provide a reasonable explanation for a situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was troubled by a feeling that things just didn’t add up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很苦恼﹐觉得事情不对劲。

Subsense.DEF: if sums, numbers etc do not add up, there is a mistake in them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These figures don’t add up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数字错了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that lots of small amounts gradually make a large total
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are five of us using the phone so it all adds up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们五个人用电话﹐所以就打得很多了。

Sense.DEF: to produce a particular total or result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rising prison population and overcrowding add up to a real crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱里的犯人越来越多﹐人满为患﹐造成实实在在的危机。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= attention-deficit disorder 注意障碍

Sense.DEF:
an imaginary family from a US
cartoon strip
, which was later made into a humorous television programme and films. They wear black clothes and are very interested in death and frightening things. If you describe a family as being like the Addams Family, you mean that they are very strange.
Sense.TRAN: 亚当斯一家﹐爱登士家庭﹐阿达一族〔美国连环漫画中的虚构家庭﹐曾改编为电视节目和电影。 形容某家人像亚当斯一家﹐即表示他们非常奇怪〕

Sense.DEF: in addition to what is usual or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: cereal with added vitamins
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维生素强化麦片
Sense.EXAMPLE: no added sugar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无添加糖

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The system has the added advantage of recordable DVD drives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该系统还有一个优点是它带DVD刻录光驱。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Include people in your picture for added interest .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将人物摄入画面以增添情趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our yard is only small, and has the added disadvantage of facing north.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的院子很小﹐还有个缺点是朝北。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It may not be necessary to go to the added expense of updating your anti-virus software.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另外花钱升级杀病毒软件也许没有必要。

Sense.DEF: something you add to the end of a speech or book to change it or give more information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an addendum to section 4
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第四节补遗

Sense.DEF: a type of poisonous snake
someone who is unable to stop taking drugs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recovering heroin addict
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个正在康复的海洛因吸食者

Sense.DEF: someone who is very interested in something and spends a lot of time doing it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My nephew is a complete video game addict.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我侄子绝对是个电子游戏迷。

Sense.DEF: unable to stop taking a harmful substance, especially a drug

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 50 million Americans are addicted to nicotine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五千万美国人有烟瘾。

Sense.DEF: liking something so much that you do not want to stop doing it or having it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: kids addicted to surfing the Net
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉迷于上网的孩子们

Sense.DEF: the need to take a harmful drug regularly, without being able to stop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: addiction to alcohol
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒瘾

Sense.DEF: a strong desire to do or have something regularly
if a substance, especially a drug, is addictive, your body starts to need it regularly and you are unable to stop taking it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tobacco is highly addictive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟草很容易使人上瘾。

Sense.DEF: an activity that is addictive is so enjoyable that you do not want to stop
Sense.TRAN: 使人入迷的﹐使人沉溺其中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It started as a hobby, but it got so addictive I had to keep on doing it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始时只是爱好﹐但它让人如此着迷﹐我只得继续下去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: addictive arcade games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使人入迷的游戏厅游戏

Sense.DEF: used to add another piece of information to what you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company provides cheap Internet access. In addition, it makes shareware freely available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司提供廉价的因特网接入服务。 此外﹐它还推出免费的共享软件。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In addition to his movie work, Redford is known as a champion of environmental causes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了电影事业外﹐雷德福还是位公认的环保斗士。

Sense.DEF: the act of adding something to something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The addition of networking facilities will greatly enhance the system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 增加网络设备将会大大增强系统的性能。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turn sparkling wine into Buck’s Fizz with the addition of chilled orange juice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在发泡葡萄酒里加冰冻橙汁﹐做成巴克菲士鸡尾酒。

Sense.DEF: something that is added to something else, often in order to improve it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This excellent book will be a welcome addition to the library of any student.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本好书会成为受所有学生喜爱的新藏书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the latest addition to our designer range
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们名师设计系列的最新款式

Sense.DEF: the process of adding numbers or amounts to make a total
an extra room that is added to a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: They built a big addition onto the back of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在房子后面加盖了一间大屋子。

Sense.DEF: more than what was agreed or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Additional information can be obtained from the centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以从中心获取更多信息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An additional charge is made on baggage exceeding the weight allowance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行李超重要额外收费。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say extra rather than additional
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说extra﹐而不说additional
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He gets extra money from his parents.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在父母那儿另有钱拿。

Sense.DEF: in addition
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new contract is in place. Additionally, staff will be offered a bonus scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新合同已经准备就绪。 除此之外﹐还将给员工设立一个奖金计划。

Sense.DEF: a substance that is added to food to improve its taste, appearance etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: permitted food additives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 允许使用的食品添加剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our products are free from artificial additives .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的产品不含人工添加剂。

Sense.DEF: to confuse someone so they cannot think properly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All that drink has addled his brains!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么多酒喝下去他都糊涂了！

Sense.DEF: something extra that is added to an existing plan, agreement, law etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔现存计划﹑协议﹑法律等的〕补充

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We bought legal protection as an add-on to our home insurance policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们购买了法律保障﹐以作为家庭财产保单的补充。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that you connect to a computer to improve its performance
Sense.EXAMPLE: an add-on circuit board
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块附加电路板

Sense.DEF: a product that is designed to be used with another product

Subsense.DEF: the details of the place where someone lives or works, which you use to send them letters etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What’s your new address?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的新地址是什么？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can give you the address of a good attorney.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以给你一个好律师的地址。

Subsense.DEF: the series of letters and other symbols that you put when sending email to a particular person, or that is the name of a website
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They have changed the address of their website.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们变更了网址。

Sense.DEF: a formal speech that someone makes to a group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an address to the European Parliament
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 致欧洲议会的演讲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new President delivered his inaugural address in Creole.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新总统用克里奥尔语发表就职演说。

Sense.DEF: the correct title or name that you should use when speaking or writing to someone

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s your home address?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的住址是什么？

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的工作/办公/学校地址
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I sent the letter to her work address.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把信寄到了她的工作地址。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can’t find his email address.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到他的电子邮件地址。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Just type in the web address.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要键入网址就行了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They need the full address, including the postcode.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要详细地址﹐包括邮政编码。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a new address for sending mail to when you move from your old address

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She refused to give me her address.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不肯把自己的地址给我。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you know Helen’s address?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道海伦的地址吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I wanted to write to him, but I’ve lost his address.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给他写信﹐可我把他的地址弄丢了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ll need your full name and address.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要你的全名和地址。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a new address when you move to a different place
having no permanent home – used especially in news reports
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 没有固定地址〔尤用于新闻报道〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a book or a file on your computer, where you keep people’s addresses

Sense.DEF: if you address an envelope, package etc, you write on it the name and address of the person you are sending it to
Sense.TRAN: 在〔信封﹑包裹等〕上写姓名和地址

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That letter was addressed to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那封信是寄给我的。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Send a stamped, self-addressed envelope
with your address on it so it can be sent back to you
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寄上一个贴好邮票的﹑写有回邮地址的信封。

Sense.DEF: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our products address the needs of real users.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的产品满足真正用户的需要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marlowe now addressed himself to the task of searching the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马洛现在开始搜查房间。

Sense.DEF: to speak to someone directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned to address the man on her left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过头对左边的男士说话。

Sense.DEF: if you address remarks, complaints etc to someone, you say or write them directly to that person
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will have to address your comments to our Head Office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得把意见向我们总部反映。

Sense.DEF: to make a formal speech to a large group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He addressed an audience of 10,000 supporters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对一万名支持者发表了演说。

Sense.DEF: to use a particular title or name when speaking or writing to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president should be addressed as ‘Mr. President’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对总统应该称“总统先生”。

Sense.DEF: the person a letter, package etc is addressed to
to give facts or reasons in order to prove that something is true
an adenoidal voice is unpleasant and sounds as if it comes mainly through someone’s nose
Sense.EXAMPLE: her adenoidal singing voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那带鼻音的难听歌声

Sense.DEF: the small soft pieces of flesh at the top of your throat, behind your nose, that sometimes become swollen
good at something that needs care and skill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Melissa quickly became adept at predicting his moods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快梅莉莎就学会了预测他的情绪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Silas proved adept in the art of avoiding potholes in the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛拉斯看来很善于避开路上的坑坑洼洼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid she’s also an adept liar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕她还是一个撒谎专家。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a form of kung fu practiced by only a handful of adepts
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有少数几个行家才会的一种武功

Sense.DEF: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 足够的﹐充分的﹔合乎需要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作水准勉强合格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are the parking facilities adequate for 50 cars?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车设施是否够50辆车停放？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lunchtime menu is more than adequate to satisfy the biggest appetite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中午的菜给胃口最大的人吃都绰绰有余。

Sense.DEF: fairly good but not excellent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her performance was adequate but lacked originality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的表演还过得去﹐但缺乏独创性。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder 注意缺陷障碍（伴多动）

Sense.DEF: to stick firmly to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The eggs of these fish adhere to plant leaves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鱼产下的卵附着在植物叶片上。

Sense.DEF: to continue to behave according to a particular rule, agreement, or belief
Sense.EXAMPLE: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have adhered strictly to the rules .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我严格遵守了规章制度。

Sense.DEF: when someone behaves according to a particular rule, belief, principle etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: adherence to democratic principles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚守民主的理念

GramExa.EXAMPLE: strict adherence to Judaic law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格遵守犹太教教规

Sense.DEF: someone who supports a particular belief, plan, political party etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: adherents of the Greek Orthodox Church
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊正教会的信徒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The anti-globalization movement is attracting new adherents to its principles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反全球化运动正吸引着新的拥护者支持其理念。

Sense.DEF: when something sticks to something else

a piece of
tissue
skin
that grows around a cut or diseased area
a substance such as glue that you use to stick two things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: waterproof adhesive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防水黏合剂

Sense.DEF: not planned, but arranged or done only when necessary
Sense.TRAN: 临时安排的[地]﹔特别的[地]﹔专门的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: decisions made on an ad hoc basis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临时作出的决定

Sense.DEF: goodbye
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bid her adieu .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她道别。

Sense.DEF: continuing without ever ending – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 无限地﹐无止境地〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to explain A, then B, and C, and so on ad infinitum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得解释A﹐再B﹐再C﹐一直没完没了地解释下去。

Sense.DEF: goodbye

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= adjective 形容词

Sense.DEF: a room, building, piece of land etc that is adjacent to something is next to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stayed in adjacent rooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the building adjacent to the library
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

Sense.DEF:
a word that describes a noun or
pronoun
. In the phrase ‘black hat’, ‘black’ is an adjective and in the sentence ‘It makes her happy’, ‘happy’ is an adjective.
a room, building, or piece of land that adjoins something is next to it and connected to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A vacant plot of land adjoins his house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一块空地紧挨着他家。

Sense.DEF: if a meeting, parliament, law court etc adjourns, or if the person in charge adjourns it, it stops for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was almost noon when the meeting adjourned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休会时差不多已经是中午了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress has adjourned for the November elections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会因11月的大选而暂时休会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His trial was adjourned until May.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的审讯延期至5月份。

Sense.DEF: to finish an activity and go somewhere – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 转移到别处﹔换地方〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rest of us adjourned to a nearby pub for some refreshments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们其他人转移阵地﹐去了附近酒吧吃点心。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We sought an adjournment of the proceedings.

Sense.DEF: to make a judgment about something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reforms of 1979 were generally adjudged to have failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1979年的改革被普遍认为是失败的。

Sense.DEF: to officially decide who is right in a disagreement and decide what should be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Dean adjudicates any faculty disputes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系主任裁决教师间的纠纷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The owner can appeal to the court to adjudicate on the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 物主可请求法院裁定此事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge adjudicated that he should be released.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官裁定应当将他释放。

Sense.DEF: to be the judge in a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: He adjudicated at all the regional music competitions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在所有地区音乐比赛中担任评判。

Sense.DEF: something that is added or joined to something that is bigger or more important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Online instruction is a useful adjunct to the real thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 线上教学是对真人面对面教学的有用辅助。

Sense.DEF:
an
adverbial
word or phrase that adds information to another part of a sentence. In ‘They arrived on Sunday’, ‘on Sunday’ is an adjunct.
to order or try to persuade someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gwen adjured him to be truthful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格温要求他讲真话。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took a few seconds for her eyes to adjust to the darkness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了几秒钟她的眼睛才适应了黑暗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents had trouble adjusting to living in an apartment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母不习惯住公寓。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took time to adjust myself to motherhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过了一段时间才适应做母亲的角色。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get used to rather than adjust (to)
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get used to﹐而不说adjust (to)
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ You’ll soon get used to it .

Sense.DEF: to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check and adjust the brakes regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常检查并调节刹车装置。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尝尝汤的味道﹐然后调整佐料用量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If your employment status changes, your tax code will be adjusted accordingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果就业状况改变﹐你的免税代码也会作相应调整。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say turn up or turn down the temperature, volume etc rather than adjust it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示调节温度﹑音量等人们一般说turn up（调高）﹐或turn down（调低）﹐而不说adjust。

Sense.DEF: if you adjust something you are wearing, you move it slightly so that it is neater, more comfortable etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He paused to adjust his spectacles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停下来整整眼镜。

Sense.DEF: something that is adjustable can be changed or moved slightly to make it suitable for different purposes
Sense.EXAMPLE: an adjustable spanner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把活动扳手

Sense.DEF: a small change made to a machine, system, or calculation
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑系统或计算的〕调整﹐调节

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Once we make the adjustments for inflation, the fall in interest rates is quite small.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们按通货膨胀调整﹐利率降幅其实很小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slight adjustment to the mechanism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对机械装置的微调

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It just needs a few minor adjustments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需要作一些小小的调整。

Sense.DEF: a change in the way that someone behaves or thinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a period of adjustment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段调整期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her adjustment to her new role
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对新角色的适应

Sense.DEF: an army officer responsible for office work
the activity or business of advertising, considered as a whole
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anything that grabs your attention is good in adland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是能吸引注意力的就是好广告。

Sense.DEF: to say things that you have not prepared or planned when you are performing or giving a speech
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never use a script; I just ad lib the whole programme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都不用节目稿﹐整个节目我都是即兴发挥。

Sense.DEF: someone who works in advertising

Sense.EXAMPLE: an admin assistant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位行政助理
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works in admin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她做行政工作。

Sense.DEF: to manage the work or money of a company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money will be administered by local charities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔资金将由当地慈善机构管理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our office administers the affairs of the Society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们办公室管理协会的事务。

Sense.DEF: to provide or organize something officially as part of your job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is not the job of the police to administer justice; that falls to the courts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 司法不是警方的职责﹐而是法院的职责。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pillai had responsibility for administering to the needs of half a million people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮莱负责解决50万民众的需求问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The test was administered to all 11-year-olds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个考试针对所有11岁的孩子进行。

GramExa.GLOSS: be the official person who listens to it

Sense.DEF: to give someone a medicine or medical treatment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Painkillers were administered to the boy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已给那个男孩服了止痛药。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This unit teaches students how to administer first aid .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本单元教学生如何进行急救。

Sense.DEF: the activities that are involved in managing the work of a company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re looking for someone with experience in administration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在寻找一个有管理经验的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The health service spends too much on administration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗服务部门在行政方面花费太多。

GramExa.GLOSS: the people who do this work
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the college administration
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院行政部门

Sense.DEF: the government of a country at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Kennedy Administration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem has been ignored by successive administrations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题一直被历届政府所忽视。

Sense.DEF: the act of administering something, especially a law, test, or medicine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the administration of justice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 司法
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the administration of sedatives
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇静剂的施用

Sense.DEF: relating to the work of managing a company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job is mainly administrative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the administrative costs of health care systems
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健体系的管理成本
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an administrative assistant
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行政助理
GramExa.EXAMPLE: staff who provide technical and administrative support to the college
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院的技术及行政支持人员

Sense.DEF: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或机构的〕管理人员﹐行政人员﹐主管

Sense.DEF: having many good qualities that you respect and admire
Sense.TRAN: 令人钦佩的﹔极其出色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an admirable achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人钦佩的成就

Sense.DEF: a high rank in the British or US navy, or someone with this rank
the government department that controls the British navy
a feeling of great respect and liking for something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daniel gazed at her in admiration .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔用爱慕的眼神注视着她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wanted to express my admiration for the way the crew handled the crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想对机组人员处理此次危机的方式表达敬佩之情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her riding soon drew the admiration of the older girls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的骑术很快引来了年长女孩的羡慕。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that you feel strongly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s a man for whom I have the greatest admiration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他敬佩不已。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘Where did you learn to do that?’ she asked with genuine admiration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “你在哪儿学会做那个的？”她怀着发自内心的敬佩问道。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that you secretly feel, but do not show
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have always had a sneaking admiration for his music.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直暗暗欣赏他的音乐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that you do not try to hide
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her father looked at her in open admiration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲赞赏地看着她﹐目光不加掩饰。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: unwilling admiration
that two or more people feel for each other

Collocate.COLLOC: be full of admiration/be filled with admiration
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m full of admiration for what you’ve done.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对你所做的一切满怀敬佩之情。

Collocate.COLLOC: have great/deep/a lot of etc admiration
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She always had great admiration for people who could speak so many languages.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向来对会说这么多种语言的人敬佩不已。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His films have won the admiration of the critics.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的电影赢得了评论家的赞赏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: talk or write about your admiration
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wrote to him expressing her admiration for his work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她写信给他﹐对他的作品表示赞赏。

Sense.DEF: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lewis was much admired for his work on medieval literature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯因其对中世纪文学的研究而备受赞誉。

Sense.DEF: to look at something and think how beautiful or impressive it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped halfway to admire the view .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中途停下来观赏风景。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sal stood back to admire her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨尔退后几步欣赏她的作品。

Sense.DEF: to be attracted to someone, without letting them know
Sense.TRAN: 暗恋某人﹔暗自仰慕某人

Exponent.DEF: to like someone because they have achieved something special, or they have skills or qualities that you would like to have
Exponent.TRAN: 钦佩﹐羡慕〔某人的技能或品质〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I admire your courage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我佩服你的勇气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She admired him for the way he dealt with the situation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她佩服他处理这个局面的办法。

Exponent.DEF: to have a good opinion of someone, even if you do not agree with them, for example because they have achieved a lot or have high standards
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is respected by all her colleagues at the university.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受到大学所有同事的尊敬。

Exponent.DEF: to greatly admire someone because of their achievements and personal qualities, especially someone famous
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mandela is revered as one of the great leaders of our time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼德拉被尊为我们这个时代伟大的领导人之一。

Exponent.DEF: to admire someone who is older or who has more experience than you
Exponent.TRAN: 钦佩某人〔指年长或更有经验的人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the young comedians look up to him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的年轻喜剧演员都敬佩他。

Exponent.DEF: to think that someone is good at what they do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His teachers seem to think very highly of him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师们似乎都对他评价很高。

Exponent.DEF: to admire someone so much that you think they are perfect – used especially about famous people or people in your family
Exponent.TRAN: 崇拜﹔极度喜爱〔尤指名人或家人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He idolized his brother.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他崇拜他的哥哥。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jane grew up idolizing Princess Diana.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 简从小到大一直都崇拜黛安娜王妃。

Sense.DEF: someone who likes a person and thinks that they are attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful woman with many admirers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个有许多爱慕者的美丽女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a secret admirer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个暗恋者

Sense.DEF: someone who respects a famous person, especially because they like their work
Sense.EXAMPLE: a crowd of fervent admirers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群热情的崇拜者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m a great admirer of yours,’ she managed to stammer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我非常崇拜您。”她终于结结巴巴地说道。

Sense.DEF: showing that you think someone or something is very impressive or attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: admiring glances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞赏的眼光

Sense.DEF: admissible reasons, facts etc are acceptable or allowed, especially in a court of law
Sense.TRAN: 可采纳的﹐可接受的〔尤指在法庭上提出的理由﹑事实等〕
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可采信的证据

Sense.DEF: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Senator’s admission that he had lied to Congress shocked many Americans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员承认他对国会说谎﹐这令许多美国人感到震惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Silence is often interpreted as an admission of guilt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉默常被解读为承认有罪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

Sense.DEF: permission given to someone to enter a building or place, or to become a member of a school, club etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: No admission after 10 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上10点以后免进。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The young men tried to enter a nightclub but were refused admission .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些年轻人试图进入夜总会﹐但是被拒之门外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women gained admission to the club only recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到最近女性才获准加入这家俱乐部。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: those applying for admission to university
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学入学申请者

Sense.DEF: the process of allowing people to enter a university, institution etc, or the number of people who can enter
Sense.TRAN: 录取﹐录用﹔录取人数﹐录用人数

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 大学/学院/学校的招生人数

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The college has a very selective admissions policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所学院的招生政策很严格。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the admissions officer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 招生部主任

Sense.DEF: the process of taking someone into a hospital for treatment, tests, or care
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are 13,000 hospital admissions annually due to playground accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有13,000人因为游乐场上的意外而入院治疗。

Sense.DEF: the cost of entrance to a concert, sports event, cinema etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Admission: $10 for adults, $5 for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门票: 成人10美元﹐儿童5美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost includes free admission to the casinos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用中包括免费进入赌场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Museum has no admission charge .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家博物馆不收门票。

Sense.DEF: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “行了﹐也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You may not like her, but you have to admit that she’s good at her job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许不喜欢她﹐但你不得不承认她很能干。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul admitted to me that he sometimes feels jealous of my friendship with Stanley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗向我承认﹐说他有时候妒忌我与斯坦利的友谊。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须承认﹐实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 承认吧！我对了﹐是不是？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dana admitted feeling hurt by what I had said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达娜承认我说的话伤了她的感情。

GramExa.GLOSS: admit without being ashamed
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 直率地/公开/坦白承认等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Phillips openly admits to having an alcohol problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普斯公开承认有酗酒问题。

Sense.DEF: to say that you have done something wrong, especially something criminal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greene admitted causing death by reckless driving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林承认自己鲁莽驾驶﹐致人死亡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A quarter of all workers admit to taking time off when they are not ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四分之一的工人承认他们没病也请过病假。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: After questioning, he admitted to the murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过盘问﹐他承认自己是凶手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: No organization has admitted responsibility for the bombing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有组织承认对这宗爆炸案负责。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to enter a public place to watch a game, performance etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only ticket-holders will be admitted into the stadium.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有持票者才可进入体育场。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say let someone in rather than admit someone
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说let someone in﹐而不说admit someone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They won’t let you in without a ticket.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有票他们不会让你进的。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to join an organization, club etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drake was admitted into the club in 1997.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1997年德雷克被那家俱乐部接纳为会员。

Sense.DEF: if people at a hospital admit someone, that person is taken in to be given treatment, tests, or care
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time was she admitted?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她什么时候入院的？

Sense.DEF: to stop trying to do something because you realize you cannot succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: For Haskill, selling the restaurant would be admitting defeat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对哈斯基尔来说﹐卖掉餐厅就是承认失败。

Sense.DEF:
to allow a particular piece of
evidence
to be used in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Courts can refuse to admit evidence obtained illegally by police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭可以拒绝接纳警方非法获取的证据。

Exponent.DEF: to agree unwillingly that something is true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He admitted that the company was having financial difficulties.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认公司遇到了财务困难。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I must admit I was disappointed by their reaction.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须承认我对他们的反应感到失望。

Exponent.DEF: to admit something in a discussion or argument
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘You may be right,’ Bridget conceded.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你也许是对的。”布里奇特承认道。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a decision which he now concedes was incorrect.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个决定他现在承认是错误的。

Exponent.DEF: to say that something is true or that a situation exists
Exponent.TRAN: 承认〔某事属实或某情况存在〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report acknowledges that research on animals is not always a reliable guide when it comes to humans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告承认﹐根据在动物身上进行的研究来判断人类并不一定可靠。

Exponent.DEF: to admit something that you feel embarrassed or ashamed about
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bradley confessed that he struggled to finish the race.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德利承认他是挣扎着完成比赛的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I must confess I don’t like his wife at all.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须承认我一点都不喜欢他的妻子。

Exponent.DEF: used when admitting that something is true, although you do not think it makes much difference to the main point. Granted is usually used at the beginning of a sentence, or on its own
Exponent.TRAN: 不错/我承认〔granted常用于句首﹐或单独使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has a lot of experience, I grant you, but she’s not good at managing people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不错﹐她经验丰富﹐但管人不行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Granted he did play well in the last game, but generally his form hasn't had been very good recently.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不错﹐他上一场比赛确实打得很好﹐但总的来说他最近的状态不太好。

Section.SECHEADING: admit you have done something wrong

Exponent.DEF: to say that you have done something wrong, especially something criminal
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He admitted charges of theft and false accounting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认了盗窃和做假账的指控。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bennett admitted killing his wife.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝内特承认杀了妻子。

Exponent.DEF: to tell the police or someone in authority that you have done something bad, especially when they have persuaded you to do this
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He finally confessed that he had stolen the money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最后承认他偷了钱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They told him that if he confessed he would get a lighter sentence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们告诉他﹐如果他招供会被从轻量刑。

Exponent.DEF: to admit that you have done something wrong, usually something that is not very serious. Own up is more informal than admit or confess
Exponent.TRAN: 承认〔犯错﹐常指小错。own up没有admit和confess正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He owned up to the mistake straight away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他马上承认了错误。

Exponent.DEF: to admit that you have done something wrong that is not very serious
Exponent.TRAN: 承认〔犯了不太严重的错〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Come on, fess up! Where were you last night?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐老实交代﹐你昨晚在哪儿？

Exponent.DEF: to finally admit something bad that you have been trying to hide
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They want the government to come clean on where all the money has gone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要求政府说明白钱都到哪儿去了。

Sense.DEF: if a situation admits of a particular explanation, that explanation can be accepted as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The facts admit of no other explanation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事实不容有其他解释。

Sense.DEF: permission to enter a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gaining admittance to the club was no easy matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获准进入那家俱乐部并非易事。

Sense.DEF: used when you are admitting that something is true
Sense.TRAN: 诚然﹐确实地﹔不可否认地
Sense.EXAMPLE: This has led to financial losses, though admittedly on a fairly small scale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这已造成了经济损失﹐尽管这个损失其实还比较小。

Sense.DEF: a substance that is added to another substance in a mixture
to tell someone severely that they have done something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The witness was admonished for failing to answer the question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 证人因没有回答问题而受到警告。

Sense.DEF: a warning or expression of disapproval about someone’s behaviour
if you say or do something ad nauseam, you say or do it so often that it becomes annoying for other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, we’ve been over this ad nauseam. I think we should move on to the next item.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瞧﹐这个问题我们都已经说腻了。 我看我们还是进入下一项吧。

Sense.DEF: without delaying or wasting any time
Sense.EXAMPLE: So without further ado, I’ll now ask Mr Davis to open the debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不再多说了﹐现在我请戴维斯先生开始辩论。

Sense.DEF:
earth and
straw
that are made into bricks for building houses
the time, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, when a young person is developing into an adult
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult
an extremely attractive young man
to take someone else’s child into your home and legally become its parent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sally was adopted when she was four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎莉四岁时被人收养。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple are unable to have children of their own, but hope to adopt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那对夫妇自己无法生育﹐但希望领养孩子。

Sense.DEF: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 采用某种方法/政策/态度等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。
Sense.EXAMPLE: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

Sense.DEF: to use a particular style of speaking, writing, or behaving, especially one that you do not usually use
Sense.TRAN: 采取﹐采用〔不常用的说话﹑写作或行为方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kim adopts a southern accent when speaking to family back home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基姆和老家的亲人讲话就操南方口音。

Sense.DEF:
to formally approve a proposal,
amendment
etc, especially by voting
Sense.TRAN: 正式通过﹐批准〔尤以投票方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress finally adopted the law after a two-year debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过两年辩论﹐国会最终通过了这项法律。

Sense.DEF: to choose a new name, country, custom etc, especially to replace a previous one
Sense.TRAN: 选定〔名字〕﹔移居〔国家〕﹔采纳〔习俗〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stevens became a Muslim and adopted the name Yusuf Islam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文斯成为穆斯林后取名优素福·伊斯兰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Becoming a member of a society means adopting its values.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为某个社会的一员意味着要接纳这个社会的价值观。

Sense.DEF: to officially choose someone to represent a political party in an election
an adopted child has been legally made part of a family that he or she was not born into
Sense.EXAMPLE: his adopted son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的养子

Sense.DEF: your adopted country is one that you have chosen to live in permanently
the act or process of adopting a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided to put the baby up for adoption .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定让人收养那个婴儿。

Sense.DEF: the act of starting to use a particular plan, method, way of speaking etc
the choice of a particular person to represent a political party in an election
an adoptive parent is one who has adopted a child
someone or something that is adorable is so attractive that they fill you with feelings of love
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh what an adorable little baby!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐多么可爱的小宝宝！

Sense.DEF: great love and admiration
Sense.EXAMPLE: the look of adoration in his eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爱慕的眼神

Sense.DEF: the showing of great love and respect for God
to love someone very much and feel very proud of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Betty adores her grandchildren.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂非常宠爱孙辈。

Sense.DEF: to like something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: I simply adore chocolate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我简直太喜欢巧克力了。

Sense.DEF: liking and admiring someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: his adoring fans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的狂热追随者

Sense.DEF: to decorate something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: church walls adorned with religious paintings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饰有宗教绘画作品的教堂墙壁

Sense.DEF: something that you use to decorate something
the act of decorating something
a chemical produced by your body when you are afraid, angry, or excited, which makes your heart beat faster
Sense.EXAMPLE:
There’s nothing like a good horror film to get the adrenalin going
make you feel nervously excited
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的恐怖片最能让人看得血脉偾张。

Sense.DEF: a boat that is adrift is not fastened to anything or controlled by anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several of the lifeboats were still afloat a month after being cast adrift .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放漂一个月后﹐有几艘救生艇还在漂流。

Sense.DEF: someone who is adrift is confused about what to do in their life
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young woman adrift in London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个在伦敦漂泊的年轻女子

Sense.DEF: if something comes adrift, it is no longer fastened or attached to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was forever coming adrift from the pins she used to keep it in place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发总是从固定头发的发夹中散开来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: two points/five seconds etc adrift (of sb)
Sense.DEF: two points, five seconds etc behind someone in a competition, race etc
clever and skilful, especially in the way you use words and arguments
Sense.TRAN: 机敏的﹐灵巧的﹔〔尤指〕口齿伶俐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an adroit negotiator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个谈判高手

Sense.DEF: a system that makes it possible for information such as video images to be sent to computers through telephone wires at a very high speed
Sense.TRAN: 不对称数字用户线〔用于宽频网络的一种系统〕

Sense.DEF: praise and admiration for someone that is more than they really deserve

PronCodes.PRON: ˌædʒʊˈleɪt ə ri, ˈædʒəleɪt ə ri

Sense.DEF: a fully-grown person, or one who is considered to be legally responsible for their actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some children find it difficult to talk to adults.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些孩子觉得与大人很难谈得来。

Sense.DEF: a fully-grown animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The adults have white bodies and grey backs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些成年动物的身体为白色﹐背部为灰色。

Sense.DEF: fully grown or developed
Sense.EXAMPLE: an adult lion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一头成年的狮子
Sense.EXAMPLE: the adult population
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成年人口
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lived most of his adult life in Scotland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成年后大部分时间住在苏格兰。

Sense.DEF: typical of an adult’s behaviour or of the things adults do
Sense.EXAMPLE: dealing with problems in an adult way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以成人的方式处理问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: That wasn’t very adult of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那样就不是很成熟了。

Sense.DEF: adult films, magazines etc are about sex or related to sex
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑杂志等〕仅限于成人的〔因涉及性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is rated R for language and adult themes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片因为语言和成人题材被定为限制级。

Sense.DEF: education provided for adults outside schools and universities, usually by means of classes that are held in the evening
a substance that is secretly added to food or drink, making it less pure
to make food or drink less pure by adding another substance of lower quality to it
Sense.TRAN: 在〔饮食〕中掺入低劣杂质﹐给…掺假

Sense.DEF: someone who is married and has sex with someone who is not their wife or husband
a married woman who has sex with a man who is not her husband
sex between someone who is married and someone who is not their wife or husband
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had committed adultery on several occasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她数次与人私通。

Sense.DEF: the time when you are an adult
to suggest or describe something in an incomplete way

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= adverb 副词

Sense.DEF: before something happens or is expected to happen
Sense.TRAN: 预先﹐提前﹔（在某事）发生之前
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要先提醒你﹐我跳舞不是很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

GramExa.PROPFORM: six months/a year etc in advance
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Book tickets 21 days in advance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请提前21天订票。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: to be more developed or modern than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 超前于某人/某物﹔比某事物先进
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their aircraft were in advance of those used by the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的飞机比美国人用的要先进。

Sense.DEF:
a change, discovery, or
invention
that brings progress

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the great technological advances of the 20th century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪伟大的科技进步之一

Sense.EXAMPLE: a major advance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项重大进展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Recent advances in genetics have raised moral questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗传学的最新进展引起了道德上的争议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an advance on previous treatments
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对以往治疗方法的改进

Sense.EXAMPLE: the advances made in the understanding of mental handicap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在了解智障方面取得的进步

Sense.DEF: forward movement or progress of a group of people – used especially to talk about soldiers

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the enemy’s advance on St. Petersburg
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌军向圣彼得堡推进

Sense.DEF: money paid to someone before the usual time, especially someone’s salary
Sense.EXAMPLE: a $500 advance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 500美元预付款

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Krebs decided to ask for an advance on his salary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克雷布斯决定要求预支薪水。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to start a sexual relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She accused her boss of making advances to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指控老板勾引她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The witness said that he ‘went berserk’ when she rejected his sexual advances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证人称﹐她拒绝他的挑逗﹐他便“勃然大怒”。

Sense.DEF:
an increase in the price or value of something – used especially when talking about the
stock exchange
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格或价值的〕上涨﹐攀升〔尤用于证券交易〕

Sense.DEF: to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers
Sense.EXAMPLE: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Troops advanced on the rebel stronghold
moved towards it in order to attack it
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队向叛乱分子的据点推进。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The army advanced across the plain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队前进穿过平原。

Sense.DEF: if scientific or technical knowledge advances, or if something advances it, it develops and improves
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our understanding of human genetics has advanced considerably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对人类遗传学的了解有了很大进展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group’s research has done much to advance our knowledge of the HIV virus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小组的研究大大增进了我们对艾滋病病毒的了解。

Sense.DEF: to give someone money before they have earned it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will they advance you some money until you get your first paycheck?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你拿到第一笔薪水前﹐他们是否会预支你一些钱？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I advanced $1,500 to Kramer last Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上星期四﹐我预支给克雷默1,500美元。

Sense.LEXUNIT: advance your career/a cause/your interests etc
Sense.DEF: to do something that will help you achieve an advantage or success for yourself or someone else
Sense.TRAN: 促进职业/事业/兴趣等的发展
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jameson agreed to the deal in an effort to advance his political career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆森为了他政治生涯的发展﹐同意了这笔交易。

Sense.DEF:
if the price or value of something advances, it increases – used especially when talking about the
stock exchange
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑价值〕上涨〔尤用于证券交易〕

Sense.DEF: to change the time or date when an event should happen to an earlier time or date
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting has been advanced to ten o'clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议提前到10点钟。

Sense.DEF: if you advance a film, clock, musical recording etc, or if it advances, it goes forward
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔电影﹑钟表﹑唱片等〕向前移动﹔把〔钟表〕拨快

Sense.DEF: planning etc that is done before an event
Sense.EXAMPLE: We received no advance warning of the storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有收到风暴预警。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who go first to a place where something will happen to prepare for it
Sense.TRAN: 〔提前到某地为活动做准备的〕先遣队﹐先遣人员

Sense.DEF: a copy of a book, record etc that has not yet been made available to the public
very modern
Sense.EXAMPLE: advanced weapon systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先进的武器系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: advanced technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先进的技术
Sense.EXAMPLE: high levels of unemployment in the advanced industrial societies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发达工业社会中的高失业率

Sense.DEF: studying or dealing with a school subject at a difficult level
Sense.EXAMPLE: advanced learners of English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级程度的英语学习者
Sense.EXAMPLE: advanced physics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高等物理（学）

Sense.DEF: having reached a late point in time or development
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease was too far advanced to be treated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病情已经发展到晚期﹐没法治疗了。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the age of someone who is old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite his advanced age, he often travelled abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管上了年纪﹐他还是常常出国旅行。

Exponent.DEF: using very modern technology and ideas
Exponent.EXAMPLE: technologically advanced nations
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技发达国家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their equipment isn’t as advanced as ours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的设备不如我们的先进。

Exponent.DEF: very advanced, and working in a better but often more complicated way than other things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: highly sophisticated weapons
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级精密的武器
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As machines become more sophisticated, they become more likely to break down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器越来越先进﹐也越来越容易出故障。

Exponent.DEF: using very advanced technology, especially electronic equipment and computers
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指电子设备和计算机〕高科技的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: high-tech industries in Silicon Valley
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 硅谷的高科技产业
Exponent.EXAMPLE: High-tech listening equipment was used to find survivors in the rubble.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高科技探听设备被用来搜寻瓦砾中的幸存者。

Exponent.DEF: using the newest and most advanced features, ideas, and materials that are available
Exponent.TRAN: 使用最先进技术的﹐最先进的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The football club has invested £40 million in state-of-the-art training facilities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该足球俱乐部投资了4,000万英镑购置最先进的训练设备。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sound system is state-of-the-art.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套音响系统是最先进的。

Exponent.DEF: cutting-edge technology or research is the most advanced that there is at this time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The system uses cutting-edge technology to identify and eliminate viruses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统使用最尖端的技术来查杀病毒。

Sense.DEF:
another name for
419 scam
progress or development in your job, level of knowledge etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: career advancement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业发展
Sense.EXAMPLE: advancements in science
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学进步

Sense.DEF: the fact of growing older
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blake had grown much quieter – another sign of his advancing years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布莱克话比过去少多了——这是年事渐高的又一个迹象。

Sense.DEF: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her experience meant that she had a big advantage over her opponent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的经验意味着她比对手有很大优势。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Younger workers tend to be at an advantage
have an advantage
when applying for jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
It might be to your advantage
it might help you
to take a computer course of some kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上一门计算机课程可能对你有利。

Sense.DEF: a good or useful feature that something has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This printer has several advantages over conventional printers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与传统打印机相比﹐这种打印机具有多项优点。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone unfairly in order to get what you want, especially someone who is generous or easily persuaded
Sense.TRAN: 〔不公正地〕利用某人﹐占某人的便宜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t lend them the car – they’re taking advantage of you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要把车借给他们——他们在利用你！

Sense.LEXUNIT: take advantage of sth (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: to use a particular situation to do or get what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: I took advantage of the good weather to paint the shed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我趁天气好给棚屋刷上油漆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll want to take full advantage of the beach-front clubs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会想在海滨俱乐部里充分享受一番。

Sense.DEF: to use something that you have or that happens in order to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 利用某事物/将某事物转化为有利条件
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could he turn the situation to his advantage?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是如何将形势转化为对自己有利的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Burns used his family connections to good advantage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯恩斯很好地利用了家族的人脉。

Sense.DEF: to make the best features of someone or something very noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dress showed her tanned skin to great advantage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的连衣裙很好地衬托出她晒黑的肤色。

Sense.DEF: used in tennis to show that the person named has won the next point after the score was 40–40
Sense.TRAN: 某人占先〔表示网球比赛局末平分后某人先得分〕

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our parents didn’t have all the advantages that we have.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的父母过去并没有我们现在享有的那么多有利条件。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Both teams tried to get an advantage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两队都试图占得优势。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His height gives him a big advantage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的身高使他具有很大优势。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make you have an advantage – often used when this is unexpected
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sometimes a lack of experience can work to your advantage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候经验不足也会对你有利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: understand the advantage

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a great advantage to be able to speak some Spanish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 能说一点西班牙语是很大的优势。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a small one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Karpov enjoyed a slight advantage over his opponent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔波夫比对手稍具优势。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Companies that receive government subsidies have an unfair advantage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 享有政府补贴的公司具有不公平的有利条件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you can clearly notice
a definite advantage
an extra advantage

Collocate.COLLOC: the advantages and disadvantages of sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the advantages and disadvantages of living in a big city
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在大城市的好处和坏处

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the advantages are more valuable

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a good advantage’. Say 而要说 a big advantage or 或 a real advantage .

ThesBox.HEADING: THESAURUS 词语辨析 - Meaning 义项 2

Exponent.DEF: a good feature that something has, which makes it better, more useful etc than other things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The great advantage of digital cameras is that there is no film to process.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 数码相机的一大优点就是无需冲洗胶卷。

Exponent.DEF: a feature of something that has a good effect on people’s lives
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Regular exercise has many benefits, including reducing the risk of heart disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼有许多好处﹐其中包括降低患心脏病的风险。

Exponent.DEF: a good feature that something has, which you consider when you are deciding whether it is the best choice
Exponent.TRAN: 〔相对于其他事物的〕长处﹐优点
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The committee will consider the merits of the proposals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会将考虑这些提议的优点。

Exponent.DEF: an advantage that makes you believe that something is a good thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They believed in the virtues of culture, civilization, and reason.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坚信文化﹑文明和理性的好处。

Exponent.DEF: used when mentioning a good feature of something. This phrase is rather informal and you should not use it in formal essays
Exponent.TRAN: 某事物的一个优点/一大优点/最大优点〔此短语相当不正式﹐不应在正式的文章中使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The good thing about cycling is that you don’t have to worry about getting stuck in a traffic jam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑自行车的好处就是不必担心遇到堵车。

Exponent.EXP: the beauty of sth is that
Exponent.DEF: used when you want to emphasize that something has a very good or useful feature
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The beauty of the plan is that it is so simple.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划妙就妙在非常简单。

Sense.DEF: having more money, a higher social position etc than someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔经济﹑社会地位等〕处于优势的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the boys come from less advantaged backgrounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些男孩中有些家境较差。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 社会地位/地理位置/经济等处于优势的

Sense.DEF: helpful and likely to make you successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was now in a more advantageous position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在的位置更有利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: terms advantageous to foreign companies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对外国公司有利的条款

Sense.DEF: the time when something first begins to be widely used
Sense.EXAMPLE: the advent of the computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机的问世

Sense.DEF: the period of four weeks before Christmas in the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 降临节〔基督教中圣诞节前的四个星期〕

Sense.DEF: a picture on thick paper which has parts like doors with smaller pictures behind them. You open one door each day in December until Christmas.
happening by chance
an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a great adventure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大奇遇
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ahab’s adventures at sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚哈的海上历险
Sense.EXAMPLE: an adventure story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个历险故事

Sense.DEF: willingness to try new things, take risks etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on – where’s your sense of adventure?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧——你的冒险精神哪里去了？

Sense.DEF: an area of ground for children to play on, with equipment and structures for climbing on
Sense.TRAN: 冒险乐园〔提供设施供儿童攀爬玩乐的场所〕

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys adventure
Sense.EXAMPLE: an adventurer travelling the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周游世界的冒险家

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to become rich or socially important by using dishonest or immoral methods – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 投机分子﹔为求名利不择手段的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: when someone who is in charge of a government, business, army etc takes dangerous risks
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治﹑商业﹑军事等方面的〕冒险主义

Sense.DEF: not afraid of taking risks or trying new things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andy isn’t a very adventurous cook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪不是一个敢于大胆创新的厨师。

Sense.DEF: eager to go to new places and do exciting or dangerous things
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢冒险的﹐有冒险精神的

Sense.DEF: a word that adds to the meaning of a verb, an adjective, another adverb, or a whole sentence, such as ‘slowly’ in ‘He ran slowly’, ‘very’ in ‘It’s very hot’, or ‘naturally’ in ‘Naturally, we want you to come.’
used as an adverb
Sense.EXAMPLE: an adverbial phrase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 副词短语

Sense.DEF: an adversarial system, especially in politics and the law, is one in which two sides oppose and attack each other
Sense.TRAN: 对抗性的〔尤指政治和法律制度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the adversarial nature of two-party politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两党政治的对抗性

Sense.DEF: a country or person you are fighting or competing against
Sense.EXAMPLE: his old adversary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的老对手

Sense.DEF: not good or favourable
Sense.EXAMPLE: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

Sense.DEF: conditions that make it difficult for something to happen or exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: The expedition was abandoned because of adverse weather conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气恶劣﹐探险活动中止了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: developments which had adversely affected their business
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他们的生意产生不利影响的事态发展

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: his courage in the face of adversity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面对逆境的勇气

Sense.DEF: an advertisement
to mention something
to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: advertise (sth) on television/in a newspaper etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many companies will only advertise in the Sunday paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司只会在周日报纸上刊登广告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The inn is advertised as being from the early 16th century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据宣传﹐这家小旅馆建成于16世纪早期。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise
advertising brings good results
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

Sense.DEF:
to make an announcement, for example in a newspaper or on a
poster
, that a job is available, an event is going to happen etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poster advertising the concert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张音乐会宣传海报

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I see they’re advertising for a new Sales Director.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他们在登广告招聘新的销售主管。

Sense.DEF: to let people know something about yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t advertise the fact that you’re looking for another job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要对外宣扬你正在另找工作。

Sense.DEF: a picture, set of words, or a short film, which is intended to persuade people to buy a product or use a service, or that gives information about a job that is available, an event that is going to happen etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Sunday papers are full of advertisements for cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周日报纸上全是汽车广告。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She saw an advertisement for a ski vacation in Vermont.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到一则去佛蒙特州滑雪度假的广告。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They put an advertisement in ‘The Morning News’, offering a high salary for the right person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在《晨报》上刊登了一则启事﹐出高薪寻找合适的人选。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organizers of the concert had taken out a full page advertisement in ‘The New York Times’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会筹办者在《纽约时报》上刊登了整版广告。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only a handful of people answered the advertisement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有寥寥数人对该广告作出了回应。

Sense.DEF: to be a good example of something or show how effective it can be
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a very good advertisement for the benefits of regular exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要证明经常锻炼的好处﹐他便是很好的样板。

Exponent.EXAMPLE: an advertisement for shampoo
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一则洗发水广告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They placed an advertisement in the newspaper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在报纸上刊登了一则广告。

Exponent.DEF: an advertisement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s been in several TV ads .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拍过好几个电视广告。

Exponent.DEF: an advertisement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a job advert
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 招聘广告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He took out a front-page advert for his shop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给他的店做了个头版广告。

Exponent.DEF: an advertisement on television or radio
Exponent.EXAMPLE: television commercials
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视广告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was in some commercials for beer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍过一些啤酒广告。

Exponent.DEF: an advertisement in the cinema, on television, or online for a film or programme which will be shown soon
Exponent.TRAN: 〔电影院﹑电视或网上的〕新片预告﹐节目预告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A second trailer for Richard Friedman’s film has just been added to the website.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 网站上刚刚加进理查德·弗里德曼电影的第二个预告片。

Exponent.DEF: a series of advertisements for a company’s products
Exponent.TRAN: 〔公司产品的〕广告宣传﹐推广活动
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company has spent more than $300 million on promotions for the brand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司已投入三亿多美元用于品牌推广。

Exponent.DEF: an advertisement on a wall
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They selected a famous artist to do the poster for the upcoming performance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们选了一位著名画家为即将举行的演出制作海报。

Exponent.DEF: a large sign next to a road, with an advertisement on it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: billboard advertisements
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大型户外广告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A huge hoarding shows two contrasting images.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个巨大的广告牌显示了两幅对比鲜明的画面。

Exponent.DEF: a piece of paper with an advertisement on it, often given to you in the street
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone was handing out flyers for a new nightclub.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在分发一家新开夜总会的广告传单。

Exponent.DEF: an advertisement across the top of a page on the Internet
Exponent.TRAN: 〔网页上的〕横幅广告﹐标题广告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Banner ads are becoming more sophisticated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 网页的标题广告愈发精美。

Exponent.DEF: unwanted advertisements that you get in the post
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I never read junk mail.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来不看垃圾广告邮件。

Exponent.DEF: unwanted emails advertising things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to delete all the spam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在设法删除所有的垃圾邮件。

Exponent.DEF: a short advertisement that you put in a newspaper if you want to buy or sell something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bike was advertised for sale in the small ads section.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆自行车在分类广告栏上登了广告要出售。

Sense.DEF: a person or company that advertises something
used in the names of newspapers
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Stockport Advertiser
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《斯托克波特广告报》

Sense.DEF: the activity or business of advertising things on television, in newspapers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: advertising aimed at 18–25 year olds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对18到25岁人群的广告
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career in advertising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告业生涯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both candidates are spending millions on television advertising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位候选人都花费数百万元在电视上做广告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a major advertising campaign
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场重要的广告宣传活动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the advertising slogan ‘Come alive with Pepsi’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “百事可乐﹐活出真精彩”的广告标语

Sense.DEF: a company that designs advertisements for other companies
an advertisement in a newspaper or magazine that is made to look like a normal article
Sense.TRAN: 社论式广告﹐软广告〔报刊上像普通文章的广告〕

Sense.DEF: an opinion you give someone about what they should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should have followed my advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真该听我的建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: advice on saving energy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关节约能源的建议
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need some advice about my computer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要一点有关我的电脑的意见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
On her doctor’s advice
because her doctor advised her
Smith decided to take early retirement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯听从她医生的建议﹐决定提前退休。

Sense.HINTTRAN:
Do not confuse the noun advice
ədˈvaɪs ədˋvaɪs
with the verb advise
ədˈvaɪz ədˋvaɪz
. 不要混淆名词advice和动词advise: He gave me some useful advice. 他给我提了些有用的建议。 | Can you advise me on college courses? 你能就大学课程给我提些建议吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Advice is an uncountable noun. Do not say 'advices’ or 'an advice'.
F2NBox.TRAN: advice是不可数名词﹐不要说advices或an advice。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My father once gave me some useful advice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲曾给我提过一些有用的建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I decided to get some advice from a specialist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定向专家咨询意见。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can I ask your advice about something?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有事想问问你的意见﹐行吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If in doubt, always ask for advice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有疑问﹐一定要向人请教。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what someone advises you to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He followed his doctor’s advice and went on a low-fat diet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听从医生的建议﹐采取了低脂饮食。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay attention to someone’s advice
not do what someone tells you
try to get some advice
give someone advice that you have learned or been given

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 好的/很好的/有用的/有益的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book is full of good advice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书中好建议甚多。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sensible
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I thought that this was sound advice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这是合理的建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately all the advice they gave me was wrong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐他们给我的建议都是错误的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Financial advisors can be fined if they give bad advice to a client.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 理财顾问如向客户提供不良建议会被罚款。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 法律/医生的/财务等意见

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from someone who is not involved and will not get an advantage
very different opinions about what you should do

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let me give you a piece of advice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我来给你一点忠告吧。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when advising someone what to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A word of advice: look at the small print in the contract very carefully.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一句忠告: 仔细阅读合同中的小字印刷条款。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 咨询中心/咨询服务/问讯台/咨询处

Sense.DEF: part of a newspaper or magazine in which someone gives advice to readers who have written to them about their personal problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔报刊上解答读者个人问题的〕咨询栏

Sense.DEF: something that is advisable should be done in order to avoid problems or risks
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular medical check-ups are advisable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定期检查身体是明智的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is advisable to write a career objective at the start of your resume.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简历开头最好写上职业目标。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She needed someone to advise her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要有个人给她出主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Evans advised him to leave London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯劝他离开伦敦。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You are strongly advised to take out medical insurance when travelling abroad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈建议出国旅游要购买医疗保险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d advise you against saying anything to the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议你对新闻界保持沉默。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Experts advise that sunscreen be reapplied every one to two hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家建议每隔一到两个小时重抹一遍防晒霜。

GramExa.GLOSS: advise people to be careful, patient etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 建议小心/有耐心/克制等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The makers advise extreme caution when handling this material.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造商建议处理这种材料时要极其小心。

Sense.DEF: to be employed to give advice on a subject about which you have special knowledge or skill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been asked to advise on training the new sales team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获邀为新的销售队伍的培训工作提供建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He advises us on tax matters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向我们提供税务咨询。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll advise you of any changes in the delivery dates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 递送日期若有变化﹐我们会通知你的。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Keep us advised of
continue to tell us about
any new developments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They advised him that the tour would proceed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们通知他旅游将继续。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you would be well/ill advised to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that it is wise or unwise to do something
Sense.TRAN: 建议你最好做/不做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: You would be well advised to stay in bed and rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好卧床休息。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you have more experience or knowledge than they do
Exponent.TRAN: 〔经验或知识丰富者〕劝告﹐忠告﹔建议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My lawyer advised me to plead guilty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的律师建议我认罪。

Exponent.DEF: to advise someone about questions relating to a particular subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They give advice to people about loans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向人们提供贷款咨询。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I give you some advice?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能不能给你提些忠告？

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially in order to avoid problems
Exponent.TRAN: 告诉﹔建议〔尤指为避免麻烦〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My Dad told me to talk to a teacher if I was being bullied.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸对我说﹐假如有人欺负我﹐就去告诉老师。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I told her not to worry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叫她不要担心。

Exponent.DEF: to advise someone to do something, especially after careful study of that subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors recommend eating five portions of fruit and vegetables each day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生建议每天食用五份蔬果。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone your ideas about what they should do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I suggested they should visit the cathedral while they’re here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议他们在此地逗留期间去参观一下大教堂。

Exponent.DEF: to strongly advise someone to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police have urged anyone with information about the murder to contact them.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方呼吁﹐有这宗凶杀案信息的人﹐请与他们联系。

Sense.DEF: after careful thought
Sense.TRAN: 深思熟虑地﹐经周密考虑后
Sense.EXAMPLE: He behaved like a dictator, and I use the term advisedly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的所作所为就像个独裁者﹐我用这个词是经过认真考虑的。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to give advice because they know a lot about a subject, especially in business, law, or politics
Sense.EXAMPLE: a financial adviser
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务顾问

Sense.DEF: having the purpose of giving advice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Environmental Protection Advisory Committee
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护咨询委员会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was employed in a purely advisory role.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他纯粹以顾问身份受聘。

Sense.DEF: an official warning or notice that gives information about a dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The State Department issues travel advisories about conditions overseas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国务院就海外局势发布旅游警报。

Sense.DEF: public support for a course of action or way of doing things
to publicly support a particular way of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Those who advocate for doctor-assisted suicide say the terminally ill should not have to suffer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主张可以在医生协助下结束生命的人说﹐晚期病人不应当受罪。

Sense.DEF: someone who publicly supports someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s a passionate advocate of natural childbirth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭力主张自然分娩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an advocate for the disabled
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 残障人士的支持者

Sense.DEF: a lawyer who speaks in a court of law, especially in Scotland
a sharp tool with the blade at a right angle to the handle, used to shape wood
with the protection or support of a person or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: a refugee camp operating under the aegis of the UN
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在联合国保护下的一座难民营

Sense.DEF: an extremely long period of time
to put a gas or air into a liquid or into soil
Sense.TRAN: 充气于〔液体〕﹔使〔土壤〕透气

Sense.DEF: from a plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aerial attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空袭
Sense.EXAMPLE: aerial photographs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在空中拍摄的照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aerial view of the Three Gorges Dam project
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张三峡大坝工程鸟瞰图

Sense.DEF: in or moving through the air
a piece of equipment for receiving or sending radio or television signals, usually consisting of a piece of metal or wire

a sport in which someone goes down a mountain on
ski s
and performs complicated jumps and turns in the air

someone who goes down a mountain on
ski s
and performs complicated jumps and turns in the air
Sense.TRAN: 〔自由式滑雪的〕空中技巧选手

Sense.DEF: concerning the air or aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLE:
aerodynamics
the science of movement through air
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气动力学
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aeroengine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空发动机

Sense.DEF: tricks done in a plane that involve making difficult or dangerous movements in the air
using oxygen
a type of exercise intended to strengthen the heart and lungs
Sense.EXAMPLE: running, swimming, and other forms of aerobic exercise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑步﹑游泳及其他有氧健身运动

Sense.DEF: a very active type of physical exercise done to music, usually in a class
a place that small planes fly from
an aerodynamic car, design etc uses the principles of aerodynamics to achieve high speed or low use of petrol
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车、设计等〕流线型的﹐运用空气动力学原理的

Sense.DEF: related to or involving aerodynamics
Sense.EXAMPLE: aerodynamic efficiency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气动力效率

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of how objects move through the air
the qualities needed for something to move smoothly through the air

a very light letter you send by
airmail
the science of designing and flying planes
a flying vehicle with wings and at least one engine
a small metal container with liquid inside. You press a button on the container to make the liquid come out in very small drops.
the industry that designs and builds aircraft and space vehicles
Sense.TRAN: 航空航天工业﹐宇航工业

GramExa.EXAMPLE: employment in the aerospace industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空航天工业的工作

Sense.DEF: someone who loves and understands beautiful things, such as art and music
Sense.TRAN: 审美家﹐〔美术﹑音乐等〕鉴赏家

Sense.DEF: connected with beauty and the study of beauty
Sense.EXAMPLE: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从美学角度看﹐这是个不错的设计。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a work of great aesthetic appeal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极富美之神韵的作品

Sense.DEF: the study of beauty, especially beauty in art
a set of principles about beauty or art
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new aesthetic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的美学标准

Sense.DEF:
an old spelling of
ether
the air or sky
Sense.TRAN: 苍穹﹐苍天〔ether 的旧式拼法〕

Sense.DEF: the study of what causes disease
from a long distance away
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw him from afar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我远远地看到了他。

Sense.DEF: friendly and easy to talk to
Sense.TRAN: 友善的﹔和蔼可亲的﹔容易交谈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an affable guy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个平易近人的人

Subsense.DEF: public or political events and activities
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you interested in world affairs?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交部
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Women had little role in public affairs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。
