Subsense.DEF: things connected with your personal life, your financial situation etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I am not prepared to discuss my financial affairs with the press.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不打算同新闻界谈论我的财务情况。

Subsense.DEF: an event or set of related events, especially one that is impressive or shocking
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指令人印象深刻或震惊的〕事件
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Watergate affair
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水门事件
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The whole affair was a disaster.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个事件就是一场灾难。

Subsense.DEF: used when describing an event
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The party was a very grand affair.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会场面很大。

Sense.DEF: a secret sexual relationship between two people, when at least one of them is married to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔非配偶的〕暧昧关系﹐通奸﹐私通

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

Sense.DEF: used when describing an object, machine etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer was one of those little portable affairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台电脑属于小型﹑便携的那一种。

Sense.DEF: if something is your affair, it only concerns you and you do not want anyone else to get involved in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: What I do in my free time is my affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在空余时间做什么是我自己的事。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: China is now a major player in world affairs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在中国是国际事务的重要参与者。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: important events that are happening now
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a 24-hour news and current affairs channel
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个24小时新闻时事频道

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: things that are personal and not for other people to know about
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He never discussed his private affairs in public.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从不在别人面前谈论自己的私事。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They offer advice on managing your financial affairs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提供理财建议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: events in other countries
events inside a country
events that affect the people of a country
the business of the government
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The church played no role in the affairs of state.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会不参与国事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: organize them before you go somewhere or die
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔临走或临终前〕处理好个人事务

Sense.DEF: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: the areas affected by the hurricane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受飓风影响的地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disease that affects the central nervous system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病
Sense.EXAMPLE: decisions which affect our lives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影响我们生活的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel strong emotions
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕深有感触﹔打动﹐使感动
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were all deeply affected by her death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

Sense.DEF: to pretend to have a particular feeling, way of speaking etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: As usual, Simon affected complete boredom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平时一样﹐西蒙装出无聊之极的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to affect a foreign accent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过去常假装外国口音。

Sense.DEF: a way of behaving, speaking etc that is not sincere or natural
Sense.EXAMPLE: Calling everyone ‘darling’ is just an affectation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逢人就叫“亲爱的”很做作。

Sense.DEF: not sincere or natural
Sense.EXAMPLE: an affected laugh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假笑

Sense.DEF: producing strong emotions of sadness, pity etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deeply affecting story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感人至深的故事

Sense.DEF: a feeling of liking or love and caring

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bart had a deep affection for the old man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴特对这位老人有很深的感情。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked back on those days with affection .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深情地回顾那些日子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their father never showed them much affection .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的父亲对他们从来没有表现出多少慈爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The church was held in great affection
loved and cared about a lot
by the local residents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会深受当地民众爱戴。

Sense.DEF: the feelings of love and caring that someone has
Sense.EXAMPLE: Africa has always had a special place in my affections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲在我心中始终占据着特殊的位置。

Sense.DEF: showing in a gentle way that you love someone and care about them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jo is very affectionate towards her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔对她一往情深。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an affectionate hug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲切的拥抱

Sense.DEF: relating to or having an effect on the emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: affective disorders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情感障碍

Sense.DEF: computing in which the computer measures the user’s emotional state and then uses this information in order to change the way it reacts to the user
Sense.TRAN: 情意运算﹐情感计算〔计算机测算用户的情绪状态﹐从而改变与用户的互动方式〕

Sense.DEF: a written statement that you swear is true, for use as proof in a court of law
if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Society is not affiliated with any political party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该社团不隶属任何政党。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the church’s right to affiliate to Rome
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会从属于罗马教廷的权利

Sense.DEF: to join or become connected with a larger group or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: She affiliated herself with the Impressionist school of painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她加入了印象主义画派。

Sense.DEF: a company, organization etc that is connected with or controlled by a larger one
Sense.TRAN: 支会﹔分社﹔子公司﹔附属机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: Volvo’s Japanese affiliate, Mitsubishi
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃尔沃公司在日本的联营公司三菱

Sense.DEF: an organization, club etc that is a member of a larger group or organization, or is closely connected with it
Sense.TRAN: 隶属机构/俱乐部/成员等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Association provides information on affiliated clubs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 协会提供隶属俱乐部的资料。

Sense.DEF: the connection or involvement that someone or something has with a political, religious etc organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔与政治﹑宗教等组织的〕联系﹐从属关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the newspaper’s political affiliations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报纸所属的政治派系

Sense.DEF: when a smaller group or organization joins a larger one
a strong feeling that you like and understand someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his remarkable affinity with animals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对动物的特别喜爱

Sense.DEF: a close relationship between two things because of qualities or features that they share

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the affinity between Christian and Chinese concepts of the spirit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教和中国人精神观念的相似之处

Sense.DEF:
a type of
credit card
, where an amount of money is given by the credit card company to a
charity
every time the card is used
Sense.TRAN: 慈善信用卡﹐爱心信用卡〔每次使用此卡﹐信用卡公司都会把一定数额的钱捐给一家慈善机构〕

Sense.DEF: to state publicly that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A spokesman for the company affirmed that a merger was likely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的一位发言人证实合并是可能的。

Sense.DEF: to strengthen a feeling, belief, or idea
Sense.TRAN: 坚定﹐强化〔感觉﹑信念或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claims that modern physics affirms his Christian beliefs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称现代物理学坚定了他的基督教信仰。

Sense.DEF: an affirmative answer or action means ‘yes’ or shows agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: an affirmative nod
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点头表示同意

Sense.DEF: to say ‘yes’
the practice of choosing people for a job, college etc who are usually treated unfairly because of their race, sex etc
Sense.TRAN: 积极行动﹐反歧视行动〔指聘用或录取因种族﹑性别等常受不公平对待的人〕

Sense.DEF: to fasten or stick something to something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A label must be affixed to all parcels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的包裹都必须贴上标签。

Sense.DEF: a group of letters added to the beginning or end of a word to change its meaning or use, such as ‘un-’, ‘mis-’, ‘-ness’, or ‘-ly’
to affect someone or something in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a country afflicted by famine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个饱受饥荒之苦的国家

Sense.DEF: something that causes pain or suffering, especially a medical condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: the afflictions of old age
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年的各种痛苦

Sense.DEF: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: affluent families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕的家庭

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the affluent Côte d'Azur
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕的（法国）蔚蓝海岸地区

Subsense.DEF: to have enough money to buy or pay for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can’t afford to go on vacation this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年我们没钱去度假。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t afford the rent on my own.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我单靠自己付不起房租。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How can she afford to eat out every night?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天晚上下馆子她怎么能负担得起？

Subsense.DEF: to have enough time to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dad can’t afford any more time off work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸没有办法再请假了。

Subsense.DEF: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们再也不能等下去了﹐否则会赶不上飞机的。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Afford can be followed by an infinitive with to , but not an ‘-ing’ form. afford之后可以接带to的不定式﹐但是不能接-ing形式: I can’t afford to buy (NOT 不说 can’t afford buying) a car. 我买不起汽车。

Sense.DEF: to provide something or allow something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It afforded her the opportunity to improve her tennis skills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这给了她提高网球水平的机会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The new law will afford protection to employees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

Sense.DEF: the act of planting trees in order to make a forest
a noisy fight in a public place, or when someone is involved in such a fight

a
plosive
sound such as /t/ or /d/ that is immediately followed by a
fricative
sound made in the same part of the mouth, such as /
s
/ or /
ʒ
/. The word ‘church’, for example, contains the affricate /
tʃ
/.
to offend or insult someone, especially by not showing respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stepped back, affronted by the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得这个问题语带冒犯﹐退后了几步。

Sense.DEF: a remark or action that offends or insults someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The comments were an affront to his pride.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些话伤害了他的自尊。

Sense.DEF: relating to Afghanistan or its people
someone from Afghanistan
a tall thin dog with a pointed nose and very long silky hair
someone who is very interested in a particular activity or subject and knows a lot about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an aficionado of fine food
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美食家

Sense.DEF: far away, especially from home
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were exporting as far afield as Alexandria.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出口货物远至亚历山德里亚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: students who come from further afield
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远方来的学生

Sense.DEF: burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the boats had been set afire .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中有一艘船遭人纵火。

Sense.DEF: burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the city was aflame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市大部分地方都被大火吞没。

Sense.DEF: very bright with colour or light

GramExa.EXAMPLE: trees aflame with autumn leaves
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋叶似火的树木

Sense.DEF: filled with strong emotions or excitement

PronCodes.PRON: ˌeɪ ef ˌel ˌsiː aɪ ˈəʊ

Sense.FULLFORM: the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations
Sense.DEF:
an organization of American
trade union s
Sense.TRAN: 劳联－产联〔美国劳工联合会暨产业联合会﹐是美国的一个工会组织〕

Sense.DEF: having enough money to operate or stay out of debt
Sense.TRAN: 经济上周转得开的﹔不欠债的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Treasury borrowed £40 billion, just to stay afloat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政部借了400亿英镑﹐才勉强维持下去。

Sense.DEF: floating on water

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somehow we kept the ship afloat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们总算没有让船沉下去。

Sense.DEF: being planned or happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were plans afoot for a second attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在策划第二次进攻。

Sense.DEF: mentioned before in an earlier part of a document, article, book etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The property belongs to the aforementioned Mr Jones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项财产属于前面提到的琼斯先生。

Sense.DEF: to do something that is not allowed or legal, or that is against people’s beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 和某人有冲突﹔和某事物相抵触

Sense.DEF: frightened because you think that you may get hurt or that something bad may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to be afraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要害怕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: kids who are afraid of the dark
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 怕黑的孩子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was afraid of being caught by the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怕被警察抓住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Zoe was half afraid
a little afraid
to go back in the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佐伊有点害怕回到那幢房子里。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say scared rather than afraid
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说scared﹐而不说afraid
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’m scared of heights.

Sense.DEF: worried about what might happen, or that something bad will happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was afraid that the other kids would laugh at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他担心其他孩子会嘲笑他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t tell her because I was afraid of upsetting her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有告诉她﹐因为怕她不高兴。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government was afraid of a public outcry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府担心民众强烈抗议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be afraid to ask for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要怕寻求帮助。

Sense.DEF: worried that something bad may happen to a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father looked ill and she was suddenly afraid for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲似乎不舒服﹐她一下子为他担心起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of us were afraid for our jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们许多人为自己的工作担心。

Sense.DEF: used to politely tell someone something that may annoy, upset, or disappoint them
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s the most we can offer you, I’m afraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我们最多只能给你这些了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid you’ve come to the wrong address.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你找错地址了。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
‘Is she very ill?’ ‘ I’m afraid so
yes
.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她病得很厉害吗？”“恐怕是的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE:
‘Did you see him?’ ‘ I’m afraid not
no
.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你见到他了吗？”“很遗憾﹐没有。”

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Afraid to do something means 'unwilling to do something, because you are frightened or worried'
F2NBox.TRAN: afraid to do something的意思是害怕做某事
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They are afraid to express their political views.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不敢表达自己的政治观点。
F2NBox.EXPL: Afraid of doing something can also mean this
F2NBox.TRAN: afraid of doing something也有此含义
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: When I was a child, I was afraid of going to sleep.
F2NBox.EXPL: However, it more often means 'frightened or worried that something might happen as a result of your action'
F2NBox.TRAN: 但它更多的时候是“担心会发生某事”的意思
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They were afraid of damaging their careers.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们担心会毁掉自己的事业。

Sense.DEF: if you do something afresh, you do it again from the beginning
Sense.EXAMPLE: He moved to America to start afresh .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他移居美国﹐重新开始生活。

Sense.DEF: relating to Africa or its people
someone from Africa
an American with dark skin, whose family originally came from the part of Africa south of the Sahara Desert
Sense.TRAN: 非洲裔美国人﹐美国黑人

Sense.DEF: a language of South Africa that is similar to Dutch
a white South African whose first language is Afrikaans and who is usually related to the Dutch people who settled in South Africa in the 1600s
Sense.TRAN: 南非白人﹐阿非利坎人〔母语为南非荷兰语﹐通常为17世纪荷兰移民的后裔〕

Sense.DEF: a hairstyle popular with black people in the 1970s in which the hair is cut into a large round shape
Sense.TRAN: 〔20世纪70年代在黑人中流行的〕非洲式（圆形蓬松）发型

Sense.DEF: African and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Afro-American
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个非洲裔美国人[美国黑人]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Afro-Caribbean children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加勒比黑人小孩

Sense.DEF:
a style of African popular music that is a mixture of American
funk
and African
percussion
and singing styles
Sense.TRAN: 〔融美国乡土爵士乐﹑非洲打击乐和歌唱风格为一体的〕非洲流行音乐

Sense.DEF: in or towards the back part of a boat or aircraft
Sense.TRAN: 在船[机]尾（的）﹔向船[机]尾（的）

Sense.DEF: when a particular event or time has happened, or when someone has done something
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war many soldiers stayed in France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐许多士兵留在法国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I go swimming every day after work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天下班后都去游泳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you believe in life after death?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first attack started just after midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚过午夜﹐第一波进攻开始了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
David went to bed straight after
immediately after
supper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维一吃完晚饭就去睡觉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After you’d called the police, what did you do?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报警之后﹐你做了些什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Zimmerman changed his name after he left Germany.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 齐默尔曼离开德国后改了名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
People still remember the 1958 revolution and what came after
happened after it
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们依然记得1958年的那场革命和之后发生的事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After leaving school, Mackay worked in a restaurant for a year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中学毕业后﹐麦凯在一家餐厅工作了一年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ten years after he bought the painting, Carswell discovered that it was a fake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡斯韦尔买下那幅画十年后发现它是赝品。

GramExa.GLOSS: the next day, week etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: （某事）发生后的第二天/周/年等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His car was outside your house the morning after Bob’s engagement party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃订婚宴会的第二天早上﹐他的车停在你家门外。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you again tomorrow or the day after.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天或后天我会再来看你。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She retired from politics the year after she received the Nobel Prize.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得诺贝尔奖的第二年退出了政坛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Not long after the wedding, his wife became ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚后不久﹐他的妻子就病了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family moved to Hardingham in June 1983, and Sarah’s first child was born soon after.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1983年6月﹐全家人移居哈丁厄姆﹐不久萨拉的第一个孩子出生了。

Sense.DEF: when a particular amount of time has passed
Sense.EXAMPLE: After ten minutes remove the cake from the oven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分钟后﹐把蛋糕从烤炉中取出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll get used to it after a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过一阵子你就会习惯的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After months of negotiation, an agreement was finally reached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过数月谈判﹐终于达成了一项协议。

Sense.DEF: following someone or something else in a list or a piece of writing, or in order of importance
Sense.TRAN: 〔在清单或一段文字中﹐或指主次顺序〕在…之后
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whose name is after yours on the list?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名单上谁的名字排在你后面？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The date should be written after the address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日期应写在地址之后。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After football, tennis is my favourite sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了足球﹐网球是我最喜爱的体育活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UK is the world’s third largest arms producer, after the USA and Russia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国是世界第三大武器生产国﹐位列美国和俄罗斯之后。

Sense.DEF: used when telling the time to say how many minutes have passed since a particular hour
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The movie starts at a quarter
fifteen minutes
after seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影七点一刻开始放映。

Sense.LEXUNIT: day after day/year after year etc
Sense.DEF: continuously for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s worked in that same office week after week, year after year, since he was 18.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 18岁开始﹐他就日复一日﹑年复一年地一直在那同一个办公室工作。

Subsense.DEF: following someone in order to stop or speak to them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Go after him and apologize.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 追上去向他道歉。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I heard someone running after me, and a voice called my name.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见有人追上来﹐一个声音在叫我的名字。

Subsense.DEF: in the direction of someone who has just left
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Good luck,’ she called after me as I left.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “祝你好运。”我走的时候她朝我喊道。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Harry stood in the doorway gazing after her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里站在门口注视着她的背影。

Sense.DEF: when someone has left a place or has finished doing something
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某人离开某地或做完某事〕后
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember to close the door after you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请记住随手关门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spend all day cleaning up after the kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整天跟在孩子们后面收拾。

Sense.DEF: because of something that happened earlier
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not surprised he walked out, after the way she treated him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那样对待他﹐所以他离开我并不感到吃惊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After your letter, I didn’t think I’d ever see you again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于你的这封信﹐我想我再也不会见你了。

Sense.DEF: in spite of something that was done in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can you treat me like this after all I’ve done for you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为你做了那么多﹐你怎么能这样对我？

Sense.DEF: when you have passed a particular place or travelled a certain distance along a road
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn left after the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了那家酒店后往左转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a mile you will come to a crossroads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走一英里后你会来到一个十字路口。

Subsense.DEF: to be looking for someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That boy’s always in trouble – the police are after him again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男孩子老是惹麻烦——警察又在找他了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Were you after anything in particular?’ ‘No, we’re just looking.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “有什么特别想要的吗？”“不﹐我们只是随便看看。”

Subsense.DEF: to want to have something that belongs to someone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think Chris is after my job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得克里斯要抢我的饭碗。

Sense.LEXUNIT: one after another/one after the other
Sense.DEF: if a series of events or actions happen one after another, each one happens soon after the previous one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ever since we moved here it’s been one problem after another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从我们搬到这里之后﹐问题一个接着一个。

Subsense.DEF: in spite of what you thought was true or expected to happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He wrote to say they couldn’t give me a job after all.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写信说他们还是不能给我一份工作。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Union leaders announced that they would, after all, take part in the national conference.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会领导人宣布﹐他们还是要参加这次全国会议。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something should be remembered or considered, because it helps to explain what you have just said
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Prisoners should be treated with respect – they are human beings after all.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯应该得到尊重——毕竟他们也是人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know why you’re so concerned – it isn’t your problem after all.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白你为什么这样担心﹐这毕竟不是你的问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say who or what first had the name that someone or something has been given
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name is Alessandro, after his grandfather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叫亚历山德罗﹐取的是他祖父的名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was named Waterloo Bridge, after the famous battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它叫滑铁卢桥﹐以那场著名的战役命名。

Sense.DEF: in the same style as a particular painter, musician etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a painting after Rembrandt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿伦勃朗风格的画

Subsense.DEF: used to say politely that someone else can use or do something before you do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you need the copier?’ ‘After you.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要用复印机吗？”“你先用吧。”

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone if you can have or use something after they have finished
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After you with that knife, please.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用完刀子后请给我。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: a man/woman after my own heart

Exponent.DEF: after something happens, or after a period of time has passed. After is used especially when taking about the past
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We went for a walk after lunch.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们吃完午饭去散步了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After an hour, we got tired of waiting and went home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小时后﹐我们等得不耐烦就回家了。

Exponent.DEF: after a particular period of time. In is used especially when talking about the future, especially the next few minutes, hours, days etc
Exponent.TRAN: 在〔某段时间〕之后〔尤用于谈论将来﹐尤指接下来的几分钟﹑几小时﹑几天等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The concert’s due to start in a few minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会几分钟后就要开始。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll come back in an hour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一小时以后回来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In a few years’ time, this place will look completely different.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年以后这地方会完全变样。

Exponent.DEF: after less than a month, two weeks etc has passed – used especially when the time seems surprisingly short
Exponent.TRAN: 一个月/两星期等之内〔尤用于表示时间出奇地短〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Within two days of arriving she had managed to upset everyone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到了没两天就把大家都得罪了。

Exponent.DEF: at a time 24 hours, a year etc after now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A week from now we’ll be in Paris.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一星期后我们就在巴黎了。

Exponent.DEF: after an event or time you have mentioned
Exponent.TRAN: 〔上文提到的事或时间〕之后﹔随后
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He moved to Belgium, and soon afterwards he met Angela.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他移居比利时﹐之后不久就认识了安杰拉。

Exponent.DEF: some time after now or after the time you are talking about
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll tell you about it later when I’m less busy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚些时候等我空闲一点再告诉你。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: James went off, and came back ten minutes later with some food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯走了﹐十分钟以后带了些食物回来。

Exponent.DEF: after something had happened in the past
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book was published in 1954 and was subsequently translated into fifteen languages.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书于1954年出版﹐后来被译成15种语言。

Sense.DEF: in the years after the time that has been mentioned
in the back part of a boat or an aircraft
coming or happening afterwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: an after-dinner speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐后演说
Sense.EXAMPLE: after-school activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课外活动

Sense.DEF: the substance that comes out of female humans or animals just after they have had a baby
care or treatment given to someone after they leave hospital, prison etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔病人出院后的〕护理﹔〔犯人出狱后的〕安置
Sense.EXAMPLE: the aftercare of ex-offenders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对刑满出狱者的安置

Sense.DEF: a bad effect that continues for a long time after the thing that caused it
Sense.TRAN: 后效﹐后作用﹔副作用﹔后遗效应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the after-effects of his illness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他患病留下的后遗症

Sense.DEF: a pleasant feeling that remains after a good experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔欢乐后的〕余味﹐愉快的回忆﹔余韵

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the afterglow of victory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜利的回味

Sense.DEF: the light that remains in the sky after the sun goes down
the life that some people believe people have after death
Sense.TRAN: 死后（灵魂）的生活﹔来世﹐来生

Sense.DEF: the period of time after something such as a war, storm, or accident when people are still dealing with the results
Sense.TRAN: 〔战争﹑风暴﹑事故等的〕后果﹐余殃﹐余波

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the danger of disease in the aftermath of the earthquake
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震后引发疫病的危险

Sense.DEF: the part of the day after the morning and before the evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a meeting on Thursday afternoon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期四下午有个会议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was very hot in the afternoon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午很热。
Sense.EXAMPLE: See you tomorrow afternoon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天下午见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you going into town this afternoon ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午你进城去吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We met in the early afternoon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午较早的时候我们见了面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By late afternoon , Micky had changed his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了傍晚﹐米基已改变了主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was having his afternoon nap .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在睡午觉。

Sense.DEF: during the afternoon every day
Sense.EXAMPLE: She only works afternoons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只在下午工作。

Sense.DEF: used to greet someone when you meet them in the afternoon
the part of a meal that comes after the main dish

a place, usually at a school, where young children in Britain can go after the normal school day has finished, and take part in organized activities until their parents can collect them after finishing work
Sense.TRAN: 课外俱乐部〔一般在校内﹐英国的幼童放学后可以去那里参加各种有组织的活动﹐直到父母下班来接走他们〕

Sense.DEF: a liquid with a nice smell that a man puts on his face after he has shaved

a small
earthquake
that happens after a larger one
the effects of a shocking event
Sense.EXAMPLE: the war and its aftershocks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次战争及其余波

Sense.DEF: a taste that stays in your mouth after you have eaten or drunk something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine leaves a strong aftertaste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种葡萄酒饮后会留下浓烈的余味。

Sense.DEF: something that you mention or add later because you did not think of it or plan it before
Sense.EXAMPLE: He added as an afterthought, ‘Bring Melanie too.'
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想了想又说道: “把梅拉妮也带来。”

Sense.DEF: after an event or time that has already been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles arrived shortly afterwards .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了不多久﹐查尔斯来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The experience haunted me for years afterwards .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此后多年﹐这经历一直困扰着我。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She died not long afterwards .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久以后她去世了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Afterwards, I was asked to write a book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来﹐有人要我写一本书。

Sense.DEF: one more time – used when something has happened or been done before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you say that again? I didn’t hear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能再说一遍吗？ 我没听见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll never go there again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再也不会去那儿了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Khan’s busy. Can you try again later?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡恩先生正忙着。 你能不能过一会儿再打来？

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that something has happened several or many times before

Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1997, the family moved house yet again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1997年﹐全家人再一次搬家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once again, Drew was under arrest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德鲁再一次被拘捕。

Sense.DEF: back to the same state or situation that you were in before
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stayed and nursed him back to health again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她留下来﹐照料他恢复健康。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s great to have you home again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你又回家了﹐真是太好了。

Sense.DEF: if you do something all over again, you repeat it from the beginning
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to write the essay all over again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得从头再写一遍这篇文章。

Sense.DEF: the same amount or number as you have just had, said etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a fantastic lunch. I could eat the same again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好棒的午餐呀！ 再来一份我也吃得下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nearly as many again died from pneumonia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎又有那么多人死于肺炎。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The amount of crime is about half as much again
the same in addition to half that amount
as it was in 1973.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪数量差不多比1973年多出一半。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
‘Another drink?’ ‘Yes, same again
the same drink again
, please.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “再来一杯吗？”“好的﹐请来一杯同样的。”

Sense.DEF: used to give a fact or opinion that explains or adds to something you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: And again, these workshops will benefit the community widely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再说﹐这些工作坊会令社区很多人受惠。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce an idea or fact that is different from something you have just said, or makes it seem less likely to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: She says she’s thirty-five. But then again she might be lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说自己35岁﹐不过她有可能在撒谎。

Sense.LEXUNIT: again and again/time and (time) again/over and over again
Sense.DEF: very often – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve told you again and again, don’t do that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一再告诉你﹐别干那种事！

Sense.DEF: used when you want someone to repeat information that they have already given you
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did you say your name was again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请再说一遍你叫什么名字好吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone opposes or disagrees with something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Every council member voted against the proposal.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每位市政会委员都对该提案投了反对票。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: those who are campaigning against the new road
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓动反对修筑新公路的人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He advised me against travelling.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他建议我不要去旅行。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mr Howard has declared that he is against all forms of racism.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍华德先生表明反对任何形式的种族主义。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the fight against terrorism
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反恐怖主义的斗争

Subsense.DEF: used to say that an action is not wanted or approved of by someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
They got married against her parents’ wishes
although they knew her parents did not want them to
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是违背她父母的意愿结婚的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
She has been kept in the house against her will
she does not want to stay in the house
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被人强行关在屋子里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
The use of certain drugs is against the law
illegal
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施用某些药物是违法的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
It’s against my principles to borrow money
I do not believe it is right
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向人借钱违背我的原则。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is not allowed by a law or rule
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There ought to be a law against it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该有条法律来禁止这种事。

Sense.DEF: used to say who someone is competing with or trying to defeat in a game, battle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gambotti was injured in last Saturday’s game against the Lions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甘博蒂在上周六与雄狮队的比赛中受了伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be competing against the best companies in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要和欧洲一些顶级的公司竞争。

Sense.DEF: used to say who is harmed, threatened, or given a disadvantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: violence against elderly people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对老年人的暴力行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: crimes against humanity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危害人类的罪行
Sense.EXAMPLE: discrimination against women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对妇女的歧视
Sense.EXAMPLE: There had been death threats against prison staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人对监狱管理人员发出了死亡威胁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your lack of experience could count against you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏经验可能对你不利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The regulations tend to work against smaller companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些法规往往对较小的公司不利。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something touches, hits, or rubs a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sound of the rain drumming against my window
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨点敲打我的窗户的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car skidded and we could hear the crunch of metal against metal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车打滑了﹐我们听到了金属相碰的哐当声。

Sense.DEF: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一把梯子靠在墙边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The younger policeman was leaning against the bureau with his arms folded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位较年轻的警官两臂交叉﹐倚靠在办公桌旁。

Sense.DEF: in the opposite direction to the movement or flow of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: sailing against the wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逆风航行
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dived down and swam out strongly against the current.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跳下水﹐逆流奋力游出去。

Sense.DEF: seen with something else behind or as a background
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could see a line of figures silhouetted against the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看到在天空的映衬下有一排人影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important to know what colours look good against your skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道哪些颜色衬自己的皮肤很重要。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are considering particular events in relation to other events that are happening at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reforms were introduced against a background of social unrest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革是在社会动荡的背景下开始的。

Sense.DEF: used to say what you are comparing something with
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pound has fallen 10% against the dollar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑对美元下跌了10%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She checked the contents of the box against the list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对照清单检查箱子里的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of the proposed research needs to be balanced against its benefits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于计划中的研究﹐需要权衡其费用和得益。

Sense.DEF: used to say who or what you are trying to protect someone or something from
Sense.EXAMPLE: insurance against accident and sickness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意外事故和疾病保险
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cream to protect against sunburn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种防止晒伤的乳霜
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vaccine which is effective against pneumonia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种有效预防肺炎的疫苗

Sense.DEF: used to say who is said or shown to have done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has always emphatically denied the allegations against him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直断然否认对他的指控。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence against you is overwhelming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对你不利的证据无可辩驳。

Sense.DEF: to have to deal with a difficult opponent or problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: You see, this is what we’re up against – the suppliers just aren’t reliable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你瞧﹐这就是我们必须面对的难题﹐供应商就是靠不住。

Sense.DEF: to dislike or disapprove of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 不喜欢[不赞成]某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have anything against babies. I just don’t feel very comfortable with them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不是不喜欢婴儿﹐只是跟他们在一起觉得不太自在。

Sense.DEF: with your mouth wide open, especially because you are surprised or shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vince watched, his mouth agape in horror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文斯注视着﹐吓得张大了嘴。

Sense.DEF: a hard stone with bands of different colours, used in jewellery
the number of years someone has lived or something has existed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Francis is the same age as me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西斯和我同年岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Experts disagree over the age of the drawings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家对这些画作的年代意见不统一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad retired at the age of 56.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸是在56岁时退休的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In Britain, schooling starts at age 5.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国入学年龄是5岁。

GramExa.GLOSS: 4, 15 etc years old
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was just over 16 years of age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚过16岁。

GramExa.GLOSS: when you are as old as me etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At my age, it’s quite difficult getting up the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到我这年纪﹐上楼梯就很费劲了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people over the age of 65
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 65岁以上的人

GramExa.GLOSS: compared with other people of the same age
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对于他/她等这个年纪来说
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s tall for her age, isn’t she?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以她的年龄来说﹐她算高的﹐是不是？

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use the expression how old …? rather than using the noun age
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般用短语how old …?而不用名词age
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ They asked me how old I was.

Sense.DEF: the age when you are legally old enough to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the minimum age for getting a driver’s license?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 取得驾驶执照的最小年龄是多少？
Sense.EXAMPLE:
You’re not allowed to buy alcohol. You’re under age
too young by law
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你年纪太小﹐不可以买酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The normal retirement age is 65.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正常的退休年龄是65岁。

Sense.DEF: one of the particular periods of someone’s life
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you get to old age, everything seems to take longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人到老年﹐好像做什么事都慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The early teens are often a difficult age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十三四岁往往是个麻烦的年龄。

Sense.DEF: the state of being old

GramExa.EXAMPLE: High blood pressure increases with age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着年龄增长﹐高血压会更厉害。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the furniture was showing signs of age .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些家具已显陈旧。

Sense.DEF: a particular period of history
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are living in the age of technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生活在科技时代。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Molecular biology is pushing medicine into a new age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分子生物学正在将医学推向一个新时代。

Sense.DEF: a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon! I haven’t seen you for ages .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙﹐我已经好久没有见到你了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: That recipe takes ages .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那道菜忙半天才能做出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s ages since we’ve played that game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经好久没有玩过那种游戏了。

Subsense.DEF: to reach the age when you are legally considered to be a responsible adult
if something comes of age, it reaches a stage of development at which people accept it as being important, valuable etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: During this period the movies really came of age as an art form.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个时期﹐电影真正发展成为一种艺术形式。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meanings 义项 1, 2 & 3

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the time when you are old
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the problems of old age
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年的问题

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: between about 40 and 60
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was in late middle age.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年近60。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very old age
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My aunt died at a great age.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姨妈活到高龄才去世。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used mainly about the time when people are teenagers
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 麻烦的年龄〔主要指青少年时期〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’d been playing the piano from a very early age.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自幼就弹钢琴。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Kids can start learning a second language at a young age.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子很小就可以开始学习第二语言。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He needs to find people his own age.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他需要去找同龄人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at the age when a woman can have children
when you are legally allowed to marry or have sex
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 法定结婚年龄﹐〔可发生性关系的〕合法年龄

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Men in the 50–65 age group are most at risk from heart disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 50至65岁年龄段的男性最容易患心脏病。

Collocate.COLLOC: get to/reach/live to a particular age
Collocate.EXAMPLE: One in three children die before they reach the age of 5.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 三分之一的儿童不到五岁就死亡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at which something can be done
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The voting age was lowered from 21 to 18.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票年龄由21岁降至18岁。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look or feel as old as you really are
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 容貌与年龄相当/感到自己上年纪

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: behave in the way that a person of your age should behave
ask or say how old you are
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 问人年龄/说自己的年龄

Sense.DEF: to start looking older or to make someone or something look older
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was worried to see how much she’d aged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到她苍老了许多﹐他很担心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The experience had aged him in advance of his years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次经历使他提早衰老了。

Sense.DEF: to become older
Sense.EXAMPLE: The buildings are ageing, and some are unsafe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建筑已很陈旧﹐有些还不安全。

Sense.DEF: to improve and develop in taste over a period of time, or to allow food or alcohol to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cheddar cheese ages well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切达干酪熟化得很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whisky is aged for at least ten years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种威士忌至少陈化十年。

Sense.DEF: the people between two particular ages, considered as a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔介于两个年龄之间的〕年龄段﹐年龄组

GramExa.EXAMPLE: single people in the 40–50 age bracket
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 40至50岁年龄段的单身人士

Sense.DEF: 5 etc years old

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police are looking for a man aged between 30 and 35.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察正在寻找一名年龄介于30至35岁之间的男子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The course is open to children aged 12 and over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本课程为12岁及以上的儿童而设。

Sense.DEF: very old
Sense.EXAMPLE: my aged parents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我年迈的父母

Sense.DEF: old people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the care of children and the aged
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对儿童和老人的照顾

Sense.DEF: unfair treatment of people because they are old
the people between two particular ages, considered as a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔介于两个年龄之间的〕年龄组﹐年龄群

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a book for children in the 12–14 age group
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为12至14岁年龄组的儿童写的书

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of
aging
unfair treatment of people because they are old
treating older people unfairly because of a belief that they are less important than younger people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article seemed somewhat insensitive and ageist to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐这篇文章有点冷漠并且歧视老年人。

Sense.DEF: never looking old or old-fashioned
Sense.TRAN: 永不显老的﹔永不过时的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face seemed ageless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸似乎永不显老。

Sense.DEF: having existed for a very long time and continuing forever
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ageless charm of a country kitchen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村厨房的永恒魅力

Sense.DEF: the oldest or youngest age at which you are allowed to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The upper age limit for entrants was set at 25.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参赛者的年龄上限定为25岁。

Sense.DEF: a business that provides a particular service for people or organizations
Sense.TRAN: 代办处﹐代理处﹐经销处﹐中介处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a local housing agency
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家当地房屋中介

Sense.DEF: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job
Sense.TRAN: 机构﹔〔尤指政府内的〕局﹐部﹐处
Sense.EXAMPLE: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Environmental Protection Agency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保局

Sense.DEF: being done as the result of someone’s help
a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府﹑机构等的〕待办事项﹐日程表

GramExa.PROPFORM: be high on the agenda/be top of the agenda
GramExa.GLOSS: be one of the most important problems to deal with
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Measures to combat terrorism will be high on the agenda.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 采取行动打击恐怖主义是当务之急。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government set an agenda for constitutional reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府为宪法改革定下了日程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our Centre has limited its research agenda to four areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本中心将研究项目限定在四个领域。

Sense.DEF: the ideas that a political party thinks are important and the things that party aims to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

Sense.DEF: a list of the subjects to be discussed at a meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE:
the next item
subject
on the agenda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议程表的下一项

Sense.DEF: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our agent in Rio deals with all our Brazilian business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在里约热内卢的业务代表处理我们在巴西的全部业务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re acting as agents for Mr Watson.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是沃森先生的代理人。

Sense.DEF:
someone who finds work for actors, musicians etc, or who finds someone to
publish
a writer’s work
Sense.TRAN: 〔演员﹑音乐家﹑作家等的〕经理人﹐经纪人
Sense.EXAMPLE: My agent has a new script for me to look at.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的经纪人有一个新剧本要我看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a literary agent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出版代理人

Sense.DEF: someone who works for a government or police department, especially in order to get secret information about another country or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intelligence agent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情报特工
Sense.EXAMPLE: an FBI agent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦调查局探员
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an undercover
secret
agent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密探

Sense.DEF: a chemical or substance that is used for a particular purpose or that has a particular effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soap is a cleansing agent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肥皂是一种清洁剂。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that affects or changes a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Technological advances are the chief agents of change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术进步是变革的主要推动力。

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed to encourage people who are working against a government to do something illegal so that they are caught
Sense.TRAN: 〔受雇怂恿反对政府的人做违法的事﹐以便将他们逮捕的〕卧底﹐密探﹐坐探

Sense.DEF: the age when someone can legally get married or have a sexual relationship
Sense.TRAN: 婚姻合法年龄﹔〔可以发生性关系的〕同意年龄﹐合法年龄

Sense.DEF: having existed for a very long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: age-old customs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老习俗

Sense.EXAMPLE: the age-old problem of sexual discrimination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性别歧视这个由来已久的问题

Sense.DEF: the people between two particular ages, considered as a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔介于两个年龄之间的〕年龄段

GramExa.EXAMPLE: young people in the 15–18 age range
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 15至18岁年龄段的年轻人

Sense.EXAMPLE: This affects people across a wide age range.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这影响年龄跨度很大的一群人。

Sense.DEF: a general increase in the price of food
Sense.EXAMPLE: A major cause of agflation is the growing use of crops for fuel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品通货膨胀的主因是人们越来越多地利用农作物来制造燃料。

Sense.DEF:
a type of rock formed from pieces of material from a
volcano
that have melted together
a large collection of things that do not seem to belong together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: buildings in an agglomeration of styles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风格芜杂的建筑

Sense.DEF: the state of being stuck together
the process of making new words by combining two or more words, such as combining ‘ship’ and ‘yard’ to make ‘shipyard’
Sense.TRAN: 黏着法〔构词法﹐如ship和yard合成shipyard〕

Sense.DEF: when a person or country tries to increase their power or importance – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔个人或国家权力或重要性的〕扩大﹐提高〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the misuse of authority for personal aggrandizement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为扩大个人权势而滥用职权

Sense.DEF: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于利率上调﹐他们的财务问题更加严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

Sense.DEF: to make someone angry or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: What really aggravates me is the way she won’t listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我大为生气的是她不听。

Sense.DEF: an aggravated offence is one in which a criminal does something that makes their original crime more serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was charged with aggravated assault .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因严重的人身侵犯而被起诉。

Sense.DEF: the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The smaller minorities got an aggregate of 1,327 votes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 较小的少数党总共获得1,327张选票。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
In the aggregate
as a group or in total
, women outlive men by 7 or more years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总体来看﹐女性比男性多活七年或以上。

GramExa.GLOSS: when the points from two football games are added together
GramExa.TRAN: 〔两场足球比赛的〕总分﹐合计比分
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Manchester United won 2–1 on aggregate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联队以2比1的总比分获胜。

Sense.DEF:
sand or small stones that are used in making
concrete
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于制成混凝土的〕粒料﹐骨料

Sense.DEF: being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increase in the aggregate production
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总产量的增长

Sense.DEF: to be a particular amount when added together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to put different amounts, pieces of information etc together to form a group or a total

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A wife’s income is no longer aggregated with that of her husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子的收入不再与丈夫的合并计算。

Sense.DEF: angry or threatening behaviour or feelings that often result in fighting
Sense.TRAN: 攻击性行为﹔敌对行为[心理]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Television violence can encourage aggression in children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视暴力会助长儿童的攻击性行为。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our dogs have never shown aggression towards other dogs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的狗从不向其他狗挑衅。

Sense.DEF: the act of attacking a country, especially when that country has not attacked first
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unprovoked act of aggression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无端的侵犯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Athenian aggression against Persia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雅典对波斯的侵略

Sense.DEF: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

Sense.DEF: very determined to succeed or get what you want
Sense.TRAN: 有进取心的﹐有冲劲的﹔汲汲于成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aggressive marketing campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 志在必得的营销活动

Sense.DEF: an aggressive disease spreads quickly in the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aggressive form of breast cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种侵袭性乳腺癌

Sense.DEF: a person or country that begins a fight or war with another person or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: measures taken to deter potential aggressors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻止潜在侵略者的措施

Sense.DEF: angry and sad because you think you have been unfairly treated
Sense.TRAN: 愤愤不平的﹔感到委屈的﹔愤恨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aggrieved tone of voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委屈的口吻

Sense.DEF: having suffered as a result of the illegal actions of someone else
Sense.TRAN: 受到损害的﹐受到侵害的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
the aggrieved party
the person who has suffered
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害方

Sense.DEF: angry behaviour or fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope he doesn’t cause any aggro .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他不要惹事。

Sense.DEF: problems or difficulties that annoy you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t cope with all this aggro.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一堆烦心事﹐我应付不过来。

Sense.DEF: feeling or looking shocked by something you have seen or just found out

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone was aghast at the verdict.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都对这个判决感到震惊。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hank looked at her aghast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉克惊恐地望着她。

Sense.DEF: able to move quickly and easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dogs are surprisingly agile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗出奇地敏捷。

Sense.DEF: someone who has an agile mind is able to think very quickly and intelligently
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was physically strong and mentally agile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体健壮﹑思维敏捷。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: With surprising agility, Karl darted across the road.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔冲过马路﹐动作出奇地敏捷。

Sense.DEF: becoming old
Sense.EXAMPLE: aging movie stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日益年迈的电影明星
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Europe’s ageing population
with more old people than before
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲渐渐老龄化的人口

Sense.DEF: the process of getting old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Memory loss is often a part of ageing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记忆力衰退往往是衰老的一种表现。

Sense.DEF:
an American spelling of
ageism
to argue strongly in public for something you want, especially a political or social change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: unions agitating for higher pay
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会强烈要求增加工资

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His family are agitating to get him freed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的家人在多方游说将他释放。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel anxious, upset, and nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must warn you that any mention of Clare agitates your grandmother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须提醒你﹐一提到克莱尔你奶奶就会不安。

Sense.DEF: to shake or mix a liquid quickly
so nervous or upset that you are unable to keep still or think calmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amanda was getting visibly agitated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看得出来﹐阿曼达紧张不安。

Sense.DEF: when you are so anxious, nervous, or upset that you cannot think calmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in a state of considerable agitation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她处于相当焦虑的状态。

Sense.DEF: public argument or action for social or political change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: mass agitation for political reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求政治改革的大骚动

Sense.DEF: the act of shaking or mixing a liquid
someone who encourages people to work towards changing something in society – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political agitator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治煽动者

Sense.DEF: music, literature, or art that tries to persuade people to follow a particular set of political ideas
having a soft light, or a strong warm colour
Sense.TRAN: 光线柔和的﹔色调强烈的﹔暖色调的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evening sky was still aglow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傍晚的天空依旧火红一片。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s face is aglow, they seem happy and excited
Sense.TRAN: 容光焕发的﹐〔兴奋得〕面色发红的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Linda’s face was aglow with happiness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳达脸上洋溢着幸福。

Sense.DEF: a meeting held once a year by a club, business, or organization for the members to discuss the previous year’s business, elect officials etc
someone who believes that people cannot know whether God exists or not
used to show how far back in the past something happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her husband died 14 years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的丈夫14年前去世了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He should have finished at university long ago, but he kept taking extra courses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大学早就该毕业了﹐但是他不停地选修额外课程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The little girl you saw a moment ago was my niece.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你刚才看到的那个小女孩是我侄女。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom got a letter from him just a little while ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆刚在不久之前收到他的一封来信。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
They moved to a new house some time ago
a fairly long time ago
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们搬进新居已有些日子了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had our bicentenary celebrations not that long ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久前﹐我们举行了200周年庆典活动。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法:ago, before, previously
F2NBox.EXPL: Use ago to say how much time has passed from the time something happened to the present time
F2NBox.TRAN: 用ago表示从事情发生到现在时间过去了多久
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We went to Madrid two years ago.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们两年前去了马德里。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use before to say how much time passed from the time something happened to a time in the past
F2NBox.TRAN: 用before表示从事情发生到过去某个时间是多久
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Her husband had died many years before.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时她丈夫已去世多年。
F2NBox.EXPL: Previously is used in the same way, but is more formal
F2NBox.TRAN: previously的用法相同﹐但更加正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The meeting was a follow-up to one that had been held four days previously.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议是四天前那次会议的后续。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use the past tense, not the present perfect, with ago
F2NBox.TRAN: ago和过去时连用﹐不和现在完成时连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I started (NOT 不说 I've started) a new job a few weeks ago.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 几星期前我开始了新工作。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use a preposition ('at', 'in', 'on' etc) before a phrase with ago
F2NBox.TRAN: 带ago的短语之前不用at﹐in﹐on等介词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They first met fifteen years ago (NOT 不说 at/in fifteen years ago).
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use 'since' or 'before' with ago
F2NBox.TRAN: ago不和since或before连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I came to the US two months ago (NOT 不说 since/before two months ago).

Sense.DEF: very excited about something and wanting to find out more
Sense.TRAN: 兴奋地期待的﹔急切的﹐渴望的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been agog all afternoon, waiting for the next part of your story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个下午我都在兴奋地期待着﹐等你讲下一段故事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul was agog with curiosity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗满心好奇﹐兴奋地期待着。

Sense.DEF: to think about a difficult decision very carefully and with a lot of effort

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the way home she agonized about what she should do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家一路上﹐她都在发愁该怎么办。

Sense.DEF: expressing very severe pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: an agonized scream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛苦的尖叫声
Sense.EXAMPLE: From some place close by she heard agonized sobbing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听见附近有人在很伤心地哭泣。

Sense.DEF: extremely painful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain was agonizing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛难忍。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant to experience, especially because of involving a difficult choice or a long wait
Sense.EXAMPLE: an agonizing decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛苦的决定

Sense.DEF: very severe pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: the agony of arthritis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关节炎的剧烈疼痛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was in agony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我极度痛苦。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He groaned in agony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他痛苦地呻吟着。

Sense.DEF: a very sad, difficult, or unpleasant experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was agony not knowing if she would live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生死难料﹐令人揪心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was in agonies of remorse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后悔不已。

Sense.DEF: someone who writes an agony column
Sense.TRAN: 知心阿姨〔“为读者解忧”专栏的撰稿人〕

Sense.DEF: a part of a newspaper or magazine in which someone gives advice to readers about their personal problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔报刊上的〕“为读者解忧”专栏﹐知心专栏

Sense.DEF: fear of crowds and open spaces
someone who suffers from agoraphobia
relating to farming or farmers
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an agrarian economy
based on farming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业经济

Sense.DEF: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If she felt he was right, she would agree with him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她觉得他是对的﹐就会同意他的看法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people nowadays would agree that a good pub is one of our best traditions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今大多数人都认为﹐一家好的小酒馆就是我们最好的传统之一。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t agree on everything, of course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐我们并不是对所有事情都有一致的看法。

GramExa.PROPFORM: I quite agree/I couldn’t agree more
GramExa.GLOSS: I agree completely
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘We have to talk.’ ‘Absolutely,’ Meredith replied. ‘I couldn’t agree more.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们得谈谈。”“没错﹐”梅雷迪斯回答说﹐“我完全同意。”

Sense.DEF: to say yes to an idea, plan, suggestion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suggested we go somewhere for the weekend and she agreed at once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提议我们去某个地方度周末﹐她立即表示赞同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one really knows why he agreed to do the film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人真的知道他为什么同意拍那部电影。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My sister won’t agree to our mother going into a nursing home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姐姐不会同意我母亲进养老院的。

Sense.DEF: to make a decision with someone after a discussion with them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We agreed to meet again the following Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们商定下周一再开会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They managed to agree on a date for the wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们总算商定了婚期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was agreed that elections would be held in May.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举定于5月份举行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We agreed a new four-year contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们商定了一份新的四年期合同。

Sense.DEF: if two pieces of information agree with each other, they match or are the same

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your story doesn’t agree with what the police have told us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的叙述和警察告诉我们的不一样。

Sense.DEF: if two people agree to differ, they accept that they have different opinions about something and stop arguing about it
Sense.TRAN: 同意各自保留不同意见

Exponent.DEF: to say that you think that someone’s plan or suggestion is a good idea and you think it should happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Charles suggested going for a picnic, and we all agreed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯提议去野餐﹐我们都赞同。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Council of Ministers would never agree to such a plan.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长理事会决不会赞成这样一个计划。

Exponent.DEF: to agree to do what someone has asked
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They asked if I would give a talk, and I stupidly said yes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们问我愿不愿意发言﹐我就傻乎乎地同意了。

Exponent.DEF: to officially agree to a plan or proposal
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Congress approved the plan by a large majority.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会以大多数赞成票批准了这项计划。

Exponent.DEF: to say that you agree to something that will affect you, your family, or your property, when you have the legal right to say ‘no’
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her parents have given their consent to the marriage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母答应了这桩婚事。

Exponent.DEF: to agree with someone else’s plan or suggestion even though you are not sure if it is the right thing to do
Exponent.TRAN: 同意﹐支持〔尽管不完全赞成〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t very happy with the idea, but he decided to go along with it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这个办法不太满意﹐但他还是决定表示支持。

Exponent.DEF: to have the same opinion as someone, or to think that a statement is correct
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I totally agree with what you’ve just said.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你刚才说的我完全同意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most experts agree that dieting needs to be accompanied by regular exercise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数专家都认为﹐节食的同时要定期锻炼。

Exponent.DEF: if people are in agreement, they agree with each other, especially after discussing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The world’s scientists are in agreement that global warming is a problem that needs to be addressed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 全世界的科学家一致认为全球变暖是应该设法解决的问题。

Exponent.EXP: share sb’s view/be of the same opinion
Exponent.DEF: to have the same opinion as someone, especially about an important issue
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在重要问题上〕同意某人的看法/看法相同
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A lot of people share his view that tourism will have a negative impact on the island.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人认同他的观点 — 旅游业会对该岛产生不利影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Professor Dawkins is of the same opinion as Dr Jones.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 道金斯教授和琼斯博士观点相同。

Exponent.DEF: to agree with someone or about something – a very formal word which is used especially in official contexts
Exponent.TRAN: 意见一致﹐同意 〔非常正式的用词﹐尤用于公务场合〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The committee concurred with this view.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会同意这个观点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She asked her colleague, and she concurred.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去问同事﹐同事表示同意。

Exponent.DEF: to agree with someone about something – used especially in negative sentences
Exponent.TRAN: 看法一致〔尤用于否定句〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We don’t always see eye to eye, but we do respect each other’s opinions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们并不是任何时候都意见一致﹐但是我们非常尊重彼此的看法。

Exponent.DEF: to partly agree with someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I agree with you up to a point, but surely the situation is more complex than that?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在某种程度上同意你的看法﹐不过情况当然比这要复杂吧？

Sense.DEF: to believe that a decision, action, or suggestion is correct or right
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t agree with hitting children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不赞成打孩子。

Sense.DEF: if a type of food does not agree with you, it makes you feel ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种食物〕不对某人胃口﹐某人吃了不舒服
Sense.EXAMPLE: Green peppers don’t agree with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃青椒会不舒服。

Sense.DEF: if an adjective, verb etc agrees with a word, it matches that word by being plural if the word is plural etc
pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an agreeable young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个讨人喜欢的年轻人

Sense.DEF: to be willing to do something or willing to allow something to be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

Sense.DEF: acceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main objective is to find a solution that is agreeable to the company in terms of cost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要目标是找出一个从成本来说对公司合算的解决方案。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I think you’ll be agreeably surprised by what I’m going to say.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我下面说的话会给你一个惊喜。

Sense.DEF: an agreed plan, price, arrangement etc is one that people have discussed and accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The important thing is to have agreed objectives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要的是要有一致的目标。

Sense.DEF: if people are agreed, they have discussed something and agree about what to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All parties are now agreed on the plan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有党派现在都一致同意这个计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re all agreed that we cannot spend what we have not earned.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家意见一致﹐我们不能今天花明天的钱。

Sense.DEF: used to check if someone agrees, or to show that you agree
Sense.TRAN: 好吗？〔用于核实某人是否同意〕﹔好的〔用于表示同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Let’s just forget it ever happened. Agreed?’ ‘Agreed.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们把这一切都忘了吧﹐好吗？”“好的。”

Sense.DEF: an arrangement or promise to do something, made by two or more people, companies, organizations etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had made an agreement that they would share the profits equally.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们达成协议﹐平分利润。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Haydon came to an agreement with his creditors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海登与债主达成了一项协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an agreement on arms reduction
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 削减武器的协定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under the agreement, most agricultural prices will remain at the same level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据协议﹐大部分农产品的价格将维持原有水平。

Sense.DEF: when people have the same opinion as each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is general agreement that copyright is a good idea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家普遍同意取得版权是个好主意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is widespread agreement on the need for prison reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍认为需要进行监狱改革。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A decision will not be made until everyone is in agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都达成一致才能作决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is easier for two parties to reach agreement than for three.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两方达成一致比三方达成一致容易。

Sense.DEF: when someone says yes to an idea, plan, suggestion etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would their discussion result in his agreement to visit his stepmother?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们商量后﹐他会不会同意去看望继母？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such arrangements cannot be altered without the agreement of the bank.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种约定没有银行同意是无法更改的。

Sense.DEF: an official document that people sign to show that they have agreed to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please read the agreement and sign it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请阅读协议书并签字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hire purchase agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分期付款协议

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We made an agreement not to tell anyone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们约定不告诉任何人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The two countries have signed an agreement on military co-operation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国已签订一项军事合作协议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have an agreement that all workers should be union members.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间有协议﹐所有雇员都须是工会会员。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took the two sides several weeks to reach an agreement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方历时数周才达成协议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The UN accused the country's leaders of breaking international agreements.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国谴责该国领导人违反国际协定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what you have agreed
not do what you agreed to do
have to obey the conditions of an official agreement
discuss particular things in order to reach an agreement
write the conditions of an agreement, which may be changed
arrange an agreement between two or more opposing groups
make an official agreement, which has legal responsibilities
agree the last part
it stops working

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is usually a written agreement between the borrower and the bank.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 借款人和银行之间通常有一份书面协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agreed in words, but not written down
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The doctor needs to have a verbal agreement from the patient.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生需要得到病人的口头同意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The administration has signed a multi-billion dollar trade agreement with Colombia.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府和哥伦比亚签订了一份几十亿美元的贸易协定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The golf club is also offering to enter into a legal agreement with local residents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家高尔夫俱乐部还提出和当地居民订立一个有法律效力的协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an official agreement that must be obeyed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Lawyers are in the process of drafting a legally binding agreement between both parties
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师正在起草一份对双方均有法律约束力的协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a permanent agreement to stop fighting
a temporary agreement to stop fighting
involving several countries or groups
between two countries or groups
one that is not yet in its finished form
an agreement that is not written down, and is based only on trust
the conditions that people agree on
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Under the terms of the agreement, the debt would be repaid over a 20-year period.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据协议条款﹐债务将在20年内还清。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an act of breaking an agreement
have almost reached an agreement

Sense.DEF: the production and sale of farm products, or a company involved in this
Sense.TRAN: 农业综合经营﹔农业综合企业

Sense.DEF: the practice or science of farming
Sense.EXAMPLE: More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

Sense.DEF: holidays in which visitors stay in country areas on farms or near farms
relating to farming
Sense.EXAMPLE: agrobiology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业生物学

Sense.DEF: the study of the growing of crops
if a ship runs aground, it becomes stuck in a place where the water is not deep enough
a fever that makes you shake and feel cold
used to show surprise, happiness, agreement etc
Sense.TRAN: 啊〔表示惊奇﹑喜悦﹑同意等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ah! There you are!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊！ 你在这里呀！

Sense.DEF: used to show that you understand or realize something
Sense.TRAN: 啊哈〔表示明白或意识到某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aha! So you planned all this, did you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊哈！ 原来这一切都是你策划的﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: a short distance in front of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kept his gaze fixed on the car ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的目光一直盯着前面的那辆汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A hill loomed ahead of them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座小山赫然耸现在他们面前。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We could see the lights of Las Vegas up ahead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能看到前方拉斯维加斯的灯光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The clinic was now in sight, some way ahead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在可以看见诊所了﹐就在前面不远处。

GramExa.GLOSS: straight in front
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The river is eight miles away dead ahead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河就在正前方八英里处。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Henry hurried on ahead
went in front of the others
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利赶紧跑到前面。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something looks or moves ahead, they look or move forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared straight ahead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他直视前方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship forged ahead through the thin ice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船冲破薄冰前行。

Sense.DEF: before someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were four people ahead of me at the doctor’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诊所里有四个人排在我前面。

Sense.DEF: in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have a long trip ahead of you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你前面还有很长一段路要走。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Problems may lie ahead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将来也许会遇到问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We do not foresee any major changes in the years ahead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预料今后几年不会有重大改变。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Unless we plan ahead
plan for the future
we are going to be in a mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非我们事先安排好﹐否则会一团糟的。

Sense.DEF: before an event happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: I cook rice two or three hours ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提前两三个小时煮好米饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you tell me ahead of time if you’re coming?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你要来﹐能不能事先告诉我？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s giving a series of concerts in London ahead of his international tour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际巡回演出之前他会在伦敦举办一系列的音乐会。

Sense.DEF: earlier than planned or arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: I arrived at Jack’s suite half an hour ahead of schedule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我比原计划提前半小时来到杰克的套房。

Sense.DEF: making progress and being successful in your job, education etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Getting ahead at work is the most important thing to her at the moment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为目前最重要的是事业有成。

Sense.DEF: ideas, achievements etc that are ahead of others have made more progress or are more developed
Sense.EXAMPLE:
This design is light years ahead
much more advanced
in performance and comfort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一设计在性能和舒适度方面遥遥领先。

GramExa.GLOSS: very advanced or new, and not understood or accepted
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 领先于你的/它的时代〔因而不被理解或接受〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Coleridge was in many ways far ahead of his time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 柯勒律治在许多方面都远远超越他那个时代。

Sense.DEF: winning in a competition or election
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two shots from Gardner put the Giants 80–75 ahead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘉德纳的两个进球使巨人队以80比75领先。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are 10 points ahead in the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在民意测验中领先十点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At this stage, Smith appeared to be ahead of his rivals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个阶段﹐史密斯似乎领先于对手。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone they can do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I have the sports section?’ ‘Yeah, go ahead, I’ve read it.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我可以看看体育版吗？”“好﹐拿去吧﹐我已经看过了。”

Subsense.DEF: to do something that was planned, especially in spite of a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Frank’ll be late but we’ll go ahead with the meeting anyway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克会晚些时候到﹐我们先开会。

Subsense.DEF: to take place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tests of anti-cancer drugs are to go ahead this year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗癌药物的试验将在今年进行。

Sense.DEF: in a position where you are more advanced or more successful than your competitors
Sense.TRAN: 成功﹔领先﹐超越〔竞争对手〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Belmont city leaders have never been ahead of the curve in environmental matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尔蒙特市的领导在环境事务上从来都是落后的。

PronCodes.STRONG: spelling pronunciation 根据拼写读作

Sense.DEF: a sound like a cough that you make to attract someone’s attention, or when you are saying something embarrassing
Sense.TRAN: 啊哼〔用于引起注意或说令人难堪的话时发出的声音〕

Sense.DEF: someone who cannot stop doing something or using something
Sense.TRAN: 对…痴迷的人﹐沉湎于…的人

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who never stops working
someone who loves chocolate

Sense.DEF: used by sailors to get someone’s attention or greet them
Sense.TRAN: 啊嗨〔船员吸引注意或打招呼的喊声〕
the abbreviation of 缩写= artificial intelligence 人工智能

Sense.DEF: help, such as money or food, given by an organization or government to a country or to people who are in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foreign aid from many countries poured into the famine area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自许多国家的救援物资纷纷送到饥荒地区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: convoys delivering humanitarian aid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运载人道主义援助的车队
Sense.EXAMPLE: a substantial aid programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的援助计划
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He has been granted legal aid
free legal services
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得了法律援助。

Sense.DEF: help that you need to do a particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Father Poole walked painfully, with the aid of a stick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 普尔神父拄着一根拐杖艰难地行走。

Sense.DEF:
in order to help a
charity
Sense.TRAN: 为了帮助〔某一慈善事业〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re collecting money in aid of cancer research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在筹集资金以资助癌症研究。

Sense.DEF: help or advice that is given to someone who needs it

GramExa.GLOSS: help someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t speak any French, but a nice man came to my aid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点都不会说法语﹐不过一个好心人帮了我的忙。

Sense.DEF: something such as a machine or tool that helps someone do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A video is a useful aid in the classroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像是课堂教学的有用教具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hearing aid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 助听器

Sense.DEF: used to ask what something is used for or why someone is doing something
Sense.TRAN: 这有什么用途？ 这样做是什么用意？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s this meeting tomorrow in aid of, then?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐明天的这个会议是为了什么？

Sense.DEF:
an American spelling of
aide
to help someone do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an index to aid the reader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方便读者的索引

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Coxen was aided in looking after the children by her niece.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考克森太太有她侄女帮忙一起照看小孩。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen more quickly or easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Welfare spending aids economic development in three ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福利开支在三个方面促进经济发展。

Sense.DEF: to help someone do something illegal
someone whose job is to help someone who has an important job, especially a politician
Sense.EXAMPLE: a presidential aide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位总统助理

Sense.DEF: a military officer whose job is to help an officer of a higher rank
a very serious disease that stops your body from defending itself against infections, and usually causes death
Sense.TRAN: 艾滋病﹐获得性免疫缺陷综合征
Sense.EXAMPLE: the AIDS virus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾滋病病毒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aids sufferers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾滋病患者

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: AIDS at its most advanced stage

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全型艾滋病

Sense.DEF: someone who works for an organization that brings food and other supplies to people in danger from wars, floods etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: UN aid workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国救援人员

Sense.DEF: the thing or things that are causing difficulties for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This initiative is not the answer to what ails our educational system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一新方案并不能解决我们教育体制的弊病。

Sense.DEF: to be ill, or to make someone feel ill or unhappy

an ailing company, organization, or
economy
is having a lot of problems and is not successful
Sense.TRAN: 不景气的﹐状况不佳的﹐处境困难的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ailing car industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不景气的汽车工业

Sense.DEF: ill and not likely to get better
an illness that is not very serious
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小恙

Sense.DEF: something you hope to achieve by doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The aim of the research is to find new food sources.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此项研究的目的是寻找新的食物来源。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The main aim of the course is to improve your writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一课程的主要目的是提高写作能力。

GramExa.PROPFORM: with the aim of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a campaign with the aim of helping victims of crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在帮助罪案受害者的运动

Sense.EXAMPLE: Teamwork is required in order to achieve these aims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完成这些目标需要团队合作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a policy which sets out the school’s aims and objectives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清楚阐明该校各项目标的政策

Sense.DEF: to point a gun or weapon at someone or something you want to shoot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alan took aim at the target.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦瞄准了目标。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 向某人/某事开火﹐批评某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Critics took aim at the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 评论员向总统开火。

Sense.DEF: someone’s ability to hit what they are aiming at when they throw or shoot something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Val’s aim was very good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦尔很有准头。

Exponent.DEF: something you hope to achieve by doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The main aim of the plan was to provide employment for local people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划的主要目的是为当地人提供就业岗位。

Exponent.DEF: something important that you hope to achieve in the future, even though it may take a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔意义重大﹐也许会花费很长时间才能实现的〕目标﹐目的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The country can still achieve its goal of reducing poverty by a third.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国仍然可以实现减少三分之一贫困人口的目标。

Exponent.DEF: a particular amount or total that you want to achieve
Exponent.TRAN: 〔想要在总数量上达到的〕目标﹐指标
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company is on track to meet its target of increasing profits by 10%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司有可能达到其利润增长10%的目标。

Exponent.DEF: the specific thing that you are trying to achieve – used especially about things that have been officially discussed and agreed upon in business, politics etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指商业或政治方面的〕目的﹐目标
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their main objective is to halt the flow of drugs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的主要目标是阻止毒品流通。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We met to set the business objectives for the coming year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开会确定来年的经营目标。

Exponent.DEF: something that you very much want to achieve in your future career
