Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her ambition was to go to law school and become an attorney.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的理想是上法学院﹐当律师。

Sense.DEF: to try or intend to achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We aim to finish by Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力争星期五之前完成。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an initiative aimed at reducing road accidents
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在减少道路事故的新计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re aiming for a big improvement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力求取得重大进步。

Sense.DEF: to say or do something that is intended for a particular person or group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a program that’s aimed at teenagers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对象为青少年的节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: The criticism wasn’t aimed at you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评不是针对你的。

Sense.DEF: to choose the place, person etc that you want to hit or reach and point a weapon or another object towards them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Denver aimed his gun but did not shoot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹佛举枪瞄准﹐但是没有射击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pilot was aiming for the runway but came down in a nearby field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员的目标是跑道﹐却降落在附近的农田里。

Sense.DEF: not having a clear purpose or reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young man drifting through life in an aimless way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个浑浑噩噩度日的年轻人

Sense.DEF: a short form of ‘am not’, ‘is not’, ‘are not’, ‘has not’, or ‘have not’, that many people think is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 不〔一种许多人认为不规范的否定缩写形式〕

Sense.DEF:
a
racecourse
in northwest England where a famous horse race, the Grand National, takes place each year
Sense.TRAN: 安特里赛马场〔位于英格兰西北部﹐英国一年一度的全国越野障碍赛马大赛在此举行〕

Sense.DEF: the mixture of gases around the Earth, that we breathe
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go outside and get some fresh air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出去呼吸些新鲜空气吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to put some air in the tyres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得给轮胎充气了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a strong smell of burning in the air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气中有一股浓烈的焦味。

Sense.DEF: the space above the ground or around things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flames leapt into the air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火苗蹿向天空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fell 2,000 metres through the air without a parachute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没用降落伞在空中下落了2,000米。

Subsense.DEF: travelling by, or using, a plane
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d prefer to travel by air.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢坐飞机出行。

Subsense.DEF: relating to or involving planes
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the victims of Britain’s worst air disaster
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国最大空难的死难者
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Air travel was growing rapidly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空旅行在迅速增长。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: air traffic congestion
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空中交通阻塞
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His brother died in an air crash .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的兄弟死于一场空难。

Subsense.DEF: if a feeling is in the air, a lot of people feel it at the same time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There was a sense of excitement in the air.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到处洋溢着一种激动的气氛。

Subsense.DEF: to be going to happen very soon
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Change is in the air.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变革即将到来。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone has an air of confidence, mystery etc, they seem confident, mysterious etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had an air of quiet confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她气定神闲。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at him with a determined air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看着他﹐神情坚毅。

Sense.DEF: if something is up in the air, no decision has been made about it yet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our trip is still very much up in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的旅行计划有许多事情尚未决定。

Sense.DEF: to be broadcasting on the radio or television at the present moment, or to stop broadcasting
Sense.TRAN: 正在广播[播放]/停止广播[播放]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be on air in three minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三分钟后我们开始广播。

Sense.DEF:
a simple tune, often used in the title of a piece of
classical
music
Sense.TRAN: 曲调﹐旋律〔常用于古典乐曲名中〕

Sense.DEF: a way of behaving that shows someone thinks they are more important than they really are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trudy is always putting on airs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特鲁迪老是摆架子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an actor with no airs and graces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无架子的演员

Sense.DEF: to feel very happy

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She opened the window to let in some fresh air.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打开窗户放进一些新鲜空气来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: London’s air is cleaner than it has been at any time since 1585.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦的空气比1585年以来的任何时候都要干净。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Warm air rises and is replaced by cooler and denser air.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖空气上升﹐取而代之的是较为凉爽﹑密度较大的空气。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The air had turned a little cooler.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气变凉了一些。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pleasantly cool
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the crisp autumn air
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天凉爽的空气

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not fresh and often full of smoke
there is less oxygen because you are in a high place
air in which there is no wind

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most air pollution is caused by cars.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气污染主要是由汽车引起的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The air quality is very poor on hot days.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高温天气时的空气质量非常差。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I went outside for a breath of air.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到外面去透透气。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She breathed in the cool mountain air.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她呼吸着山上凉爽的空气。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try to breathe with difficulty
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He clutched his throat as he fought for air.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓着喉部急促地喘气。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: let fresh air into a room
fill a tyre, balloon etc with air

Sense.DEF: to express your opinions publicly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Staff will get a chance to ask questions and air their views.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工将有机会提问并发表意见。

Sense.DEF: to broadcast a programme on television or radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: KPBS airs such popular children’s programs as ‘Barney’ and ‘Sesame Street’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: KPBS电视台播出《小博士邦尼》﹑《芝麻街》等受欢迎的儿童节目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The program is due to air next month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目将于下月播出。

Sense.DEF: to let fresh air into a room, especially one that has been closed for a long time
to put a piece of clothing in a place that is warm or has a lot of air, so that it smells clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve left my sweater outside to air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把毛衣放在外面透透风。

Sense.DEF: a special aircraft used for taking people to hospital
a bag in a car that fills with air to protect the driver or passenger in an accident
a place where military aircraft begin and end their flights, and where members of an air force live
something that you fill with air and use as a bed
a plane that is airborne is in the air
airborne soldiers are trained to fight in areas that they get to by jumping out of a plane
carried through the air

Sense.DEF:
brake s
that work using air pressure

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that uses air to put paint onto a surface
to use an airbrush to make a picture or photograph look better

Sense.DEF: to remove someone or something from a picture or photograph using an airbrush
a large plane that carries a lot of people for short distances
a high rank in the British air force, or someone who has this rank
a high rank in the British air force, or someone who has this rank
a machine that makes the air in a room or building cooler and drier
a system that makes the air in a room or building cooler and drier
a plane or other vehicle that can fly
a type of ship that planes can fly from and land on
a low rank in the British air force, or someone who has this rank
the pilot and the people who are responsible for flying a plane
the action of delivering supplies to people by dropping them from a plane
the price of a journey by plane
a place where planes can fly from, especially one used by military planes
the movement of air through or around something
the part of a country’s military organization that uses planes to fight
the name of the plane that the US president uses

Sense.DEF: a substance or object used to make a room smell pleasant

if someone plays air guitar, they pretend to play an imaginary
guitar
, usually while listening to
rock
music

Sense.DEF: a gun that uses air pressure to fire a small round bullet
someone who behaves in a stupid way
a woman who serves food and drink to passengers on a plane

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you are not worried about something or do not think it is serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t really care,’ he replied airily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不是很在意。”他漫不经心地回答。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when an opinion, idea etc is discussed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an issue that wasn’t given an airing during the campaign
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场运动中没有公开讨论的一个问题

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a programme is broadcast on television or radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: the program’s first airing in 2000
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2000年该节目的首次播出

Sense.DEF: an occasion when something is shown to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car which had its first airing at the Paris Motor Show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎车展上首次亮相的汽车

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you let fresh air move around something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put your houseplants outside to give them an airing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把室内盆栽植物搬出去透透气。

Sense.DEF: a warm cupboard in a house where you keep sheets
a way of greeting someone with a kiss that is near the side of their face, but that does not touch them
Sense.TRAN: 空吻﹐嘬唇示吻〔一种问候方式﹐嘴唇接近对方面颊但不接触〕

Sense.DEF: airless places or conditions are unpleasant because there is not enough fresh air

Sense.EXAMPLE: an airless room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不通风的房间

Sense.DEF: an occasion when people or supplies are taken to a place by plane, especially during a war or dangerous situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指战时或危险情况下人员或物资的〕空运

Sense.DEF: a company that takes passengers and goods to different places by plane

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司飞行员

Sense.DEF: a large plane for passengers
a small room used for moving between two places that do not have the same air pressure, for example in a spacecraft

Sense.DEF: a small amount of air in a pipe that stops liquid flowing through it
letters and packages that are sent somewhere using a plane, or the system of doing this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send the letter by airmail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信用航空邮寄。

Sense.DEF: someone who is a member of their country’s air force

another name for a
sky marshal
a system in which people collect points when they buy things from certain companies. These points can be exchanged for free flights.
Sense.TRAN: 航空里程〔指以购物积分兑换免费航程〕

Sense.DEF: a vehicle that flies through the air and has one or more engines
the number of times that a particular song is played on the radio

Sense.DEF: a current of air that makes a plane suddenly move down
Sense.TRAN: 〔使飞机突然下降的〕气穴﹐气阱

Sense.DEF: a small area that becomes filled with air
a place where planes take off and land, with buildings for passengers to wait in
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane landed at Heathrow Airport.

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her family went to see her off at the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的家人去机场送她。

Sense.DEF: books that are not very serious, and that people buy at airports to read when they are on a plane journey
Sense.TRAN: 机场小说〔在机场购买以便飞行途中阅读的消遣小说〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to put air into something

a movement that someone makes in the air with their fingers to show that what they are saying should be in
quotation mark s
, and that it should not be taken as their real opinion or their usual way of speaking
Sense.TRAN: 手势引号〔表示所说的话不是表达真正的想法或不是一贯的说话方式〕

Sense.DEF: violence and angry behaviour by a passenger on a plane towards other passengers or the people who work on it
Sense.TRAN: 空中暴怒﹐空中闹事〔飞机乘客之间﹐或乘客针对机组人员的暴力或愤怒行为〕

Sense.DEF: an attack in which bombs are dropped on a place by planes
a gun that uses air pressure to fire a small bullet
a large aircraft with no wings, that has an engine and is filled with gas to make it float
an event at which people watch planes fly and do very complicated movements in the sky
feeling sick because of the movement of a plane
the sky above a particular country, that is legally controlled by that country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Canadian airspace

Sense.DEF: the speed at which a plane travels
an attack in which military aircraft drop bombs
a long narrow piece of land that planes can fly from or land on

Sense.DEF: a large building at an airport where passengers wait to get on planes
not allowing air to get in or out

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密封容器

Sense.DEF: planned or done so carefully that there is no chance of any problems or mistakes
Sense.TRAN: 万无一失的﹔无懈可击的

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无懈可击的不在犯罪现场的证据

Sense.DEF: the amount of time that a radio or television station gives to a particular subject, advertisement etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播或电视给予某一话题﹑广告等的〕播放时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Advertisers have bought airtime on all the major TV networks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告商在各大电视网购买了播放时间。

Sense.DEF:
the amount of time that has been paid for when using a
mobile phone

a company that provides the service that allows you to make and receive calls on a
mobile phone
shot from one plane to another while both planes are flying
Sense.EXAMPLE: an air-to-air missile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空对空导弹

Sense.DEF: the process or job of giving instructions to pilots by radio
the people whose job is to do this
someone at an airport whose job is to give instructions to pilots by radio
a high rank in the British air force, or someone who has this rank
radio and television broadcasts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a subject that’s been debated on the airwaves
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 广播和电视中辩论过的一个话题

Sense.DEF: the passage in your throat that you breathe through
an area of the sky that is regularly used by planes
a plane that is airworthy is safe to fly
an airy room or building has plenty of fresh air because it is large or has a lot of windows
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the hotel’s bedrooms are light and airy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店的所有客房都明亮通风。

Sense.DEF: done in a happy and confident way, even when you should be serious or worried
Sense.TRAN: 快活的﹐无忧无虑的﹔漫不经心的

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他漫不经心地挥一下手﹐对她的忧虑不屑一顾。

Sense.DEF: not sensible or practical
Sense.EXAMPLE: airy fairy ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不切实际的想法

Sense.DEF: a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theatre etc, or between rows of shelves in a shop

Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat
seat next to the aisle
?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您想要靠窗的座位还是靠过道的座位？

Sense.DEF: to get married
the letter H when written as a word not a letter

GramExa.GLOSS: not pronounce the letter H at the beginning of words
GramExa.EXAMPLE: People with Cockney accents tend to drop their aitches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 带伦敦东区口音的人往往不发词首的H音。

Sense.DEF: a door that is ajar is slightly open
used when giving someone or something’s real name together with a different name they are known by
Sense.EXAMPLE: John Phillips, aka The Mississippi Mauler
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰·菲力普斯﹐人称“密西西比铁拳”

Sense.DEF:
with your hands on your
hip s
so that your elbows point away from your body
with your legs wide apart
very similar to something
Sense.TRAN: 与某物相似的﹐与某物类似的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something akin to panic overwhelmed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种近似惊恐的感觉使他不知所措。

Sense.DEF: in the same style as someone or something else

Sense.DEF:
a white stone, used for making
statue s
or other objects for decoration
made of alabaster
white and smooth

Sense.TRAN: （每道菜）单点的[地]﹐分别计价的[地]

Sense.DEF: quickness and eagerness
Sense.EXAMPLE: She accepted with alacrity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她欣然接受了。

Sense.DEF: a place that contains a large variety of interesting, valuable, or exciting things. This expression comes from the story of Aladdin in The Arabian Nights
Sense.TRAN: 阿拉丁的山洞〔源自《一千零一夜》中阿拉丁的故事﹐指有大量珍奇事物的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her apartment is an Aladdin's Cave of antiques, old books, and fine paintings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的公寓宛如一座阿拉丁的山洞﹐珍藏着许多古董﹑旧书和精品画作。

Sense.DEF: a famous battle that took place in 1836, when the US and Mexico were fighting each other for the control of Texas. The Americans were eventually all killed, but their brave action encouraged others, and Texas later became part of the US. The phrase ‘Remember the Alamo!’ is used to encourage people to continue doing something very difficult.
Sense.TRAN: 阿拉莫战役〔1836年美国和墨西哥为争夺得克萨斯控制权而进行的战役﹔短语Remember the Alamo!用于鼓励人们在困境中坚持不懈〕

Sense.DEF: fashionable

served with
ice cream
Sense.EXAMPLE: apple pie à la mode
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果派配冰激凌

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sophisticated alarm system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精密的警报系统

Sense.DEF: a feeling of fear or worry because something bad or dangerous might happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is growing alarm at the increase in crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于罪案数量的上升﹐人们越来越恐慌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked up in alarm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊慌地抬头看。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists have said there is no cause for alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家说了不必惊慌。

Sense.DEF: an alarm clock
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve set the alarm for 7 o'clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把闹钟设在7点钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was still asleep when the alarm went off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闹钟响的时候我还在睡。

Sense.DEF: to warn people that something bad is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neighbours raised the alarm when they smelled smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居闻到烟味便发出了警报。

Sense.DEF: if alarm bells ring, you feel worried that something bad may be happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alarm bells started to ring when he failed to return home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有回家﹐大家担心起来。

PIC.HEADING: ALARM 警报器﹔闹钟
PIC.PICCONTENT: smoke alarm 烟雾报警器；alarm clock 闹钟

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Neighbours heard the burglar alarm and called the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居听见防盗警报器响起便报了警。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A fire alarm went off and the building had to be evacuated.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 防火警报器响了﹐大楼里的人员不得不撤离。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for when someone tries to steal a car
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was woken by a car alarm in the middle of the night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 半夜﹐我被汽车警报器惊醒。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for when a baby wakes up and cries
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Is the baby alarm switched on?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿警报器开着吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that you carry with you in case you are attacked

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He hit the alarm button under the desk.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他按了桌子底下的警报器按钮。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it start ringing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A window blew open, setting off the alarm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一扇窗户突然吹开﹐触响了警报器。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it ready to operate
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you set the burglar alarm?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打开防盗警报器了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The thieves fled when an alarm went off.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警报器响了﹐小偷就逃跑了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel worried or frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to alarm you, but I can’t find the key.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想吓你﹐但我找不到钥匙了。

Sense.DEF: a clock that makes a noise at a particular time to wake you up
worried or frightened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists are alarmed by the increase in pollution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断加重的污染引起环保人士的担忧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was alarmed to discover that his car was gone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他惊慌地发现自己的车不见了。

Sense.DEF: protected by an alarm
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole building is alarmed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整幢大楼都装有警报系统。

Sense.DEF: making you feel worried or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 令人担忧的﹔令人恐慌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alarming increase in violent crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪事件的惊人增长
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rainforest is disappearing at an alarming rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带雨林在以惊人的速度消失。

Sense.DEF: making people feel worried about dangers that do not really exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: alarmist reports of health risks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关健康风险的危言耸听的报告

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning a fact that you wish was not true
Sense.TRAN: 不幸地〔表示但愿并非事实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donald, alas, died last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐纳德去年不幸去世了。

Sense.DEF: used to express sadness, shame, or fear
Sense.TRAN: 唉﹐哎呀〔表示悲伤﹑羞愧或恐惧〕

Sense.DEF: a very large white sea bird
Sense.TRAN: 信天翁〔一种白色的大海鸟〕

Sense.DEF: something that causes problems for you and prevents you from succeeding
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue has become a political albatross for the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事成了政府的政治包袱。

Sense.DEF: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accepted the job, albeit with some hesitation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管有些犹豫﹐他还是接受了那份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris went with her, albeit reluctantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管勉强﹐克里斯还是同她一起去了。

Sense.DEF:
a person or animal with a
genetic
condition that makes their skin and hair very white and their eyes pink

a group of songs or pieces of music on a
CD
, tape etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band plan to release their new album next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该乐队计划下周发行他们的新专辑。

Sense.DEF: a book that you put photographs, stamps etc in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a photograph album
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相册

Sense.DEF: the colourless part inside an egg

a prison on a rocky island in San Francisco Bay, in California. It was known for being almost impossible to escape from, and for having very strict rules for its prisoners. When people are describing a place that is very difficult to escape from, they often compare it to Alcatraz.
Sense.TRAN: 阿尔卡特拉斯岛监狱〔旧时一监狱﹐位于美国加州的旧金山湾﹐常喻指守卫森严的地方〕

Sense.DEF: a science studied in the Middle Ages, that involved trying to change ordinary metals into gold
magic
drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不再喝酒了。
酗酒
Sense.EXAMPLE:
people with alcohol problems
people who drink too much
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有酗酒问题的人

Sense.DEF: the chemical substance in alcoholic drinks that can make you drunk, which is also used in other types of products
Sense.EXAMPLE: low alcohol drinks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低度酒

Sense.DEF: relating to alcohol or containing alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: alcoholic drinks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精饮料

Sense.DEF: caused by drinking alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alcoholic stupor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酩酊大醉

Sense.DEF: someone who regularly drinks too much alcohol and has difficulty stopping
the medical condition of being an alcoholic

a sweet
fizzy
drink that contains alcohol
a place in the wall of a room that is built further back than the rest of the wall

food, especially
pasta
that is al dente is still pleasantly firm after it has been cooked
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物﹐尤指面食〕咬劲适中的﹐有弹性的

Sense.DEF: an elected member of a town or city council in the US
an important member of a town council in Britain in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时英国市﹑镇的〕参事﹔高级市政官

Sense.DEF:
a type of beer made from
malt 1
beer
a place where people drank beer in the past
giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记笔记是听课时集中注意力的最佳方法之一。

Sense.DEF: able to think quickly and clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack was as mentally alert as a man half his age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克的头脑和年龄小他一半的人一样灵活。

Sense.DEF: to know about or understand something, especially a possible danger or problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authorities should have been alert to the possibility of invasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局早就应该对入侵的可能性有所警觉了。

Sense.DEF: to officially warn someone about a problem or danger so that they are ready to deal with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school immediately alerted the police .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校立即报了警。

Sense.DEF: to make someone realize something important or dangerous

GramExa.EXAMPLE: campaigns to alert the public to the dangers of HIV
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让公众意识到艾滋病病毒危险的宣传活动

Sense.DEF: a warning to be ready for possible danger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a full-scale flood alert
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高级别的防洪警报

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bomb alert was raised soon after midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚过子夜﹐防空警报就拉响了。

Sense.DEF: ready to notice and deal with a situation or problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be on the alert for anyone acting suspiciously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警惕举止可疑的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Troops in the vicinity were put on alert .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近地区的军队受命进入戒备状态。

GramExa.GLOSS: completely ready to deal with a dangerous situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All our border points are on full alert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有的边防站都处于全面戒备状态。

Sense.DEF: an examination that students in England and Wales take, usually when they are 18
Sense.TRAN: 〔英格兰和威尔士中学生通常在18岁参加的〕高级程度考试

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She decided to stay on at school and do her A levels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定留在学校里继续学习﹐参加高级程度考试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I took maths, physics, and chemistry at A level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我参加了数学﹑物理﹑化学三门科目的高级程度考试。

Sense.DEF: a special way of sitting, standing, and moving, which some people believe helps to improve general health, cure back problems etc
Sense.TRAN: 亚历山大技巧﹐正姿舒压法〔指一种特殊的坐立行姿势﹐有些人认为它有利于增进健康﹑治愈背部疾患等〕

Sense.DEF: a plant grown especially in the US to feed farm animals
if you eat alfresco, you eat in the open air
Sense.EXAMPLE: We dined alfresco , on a balcony overlooking the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在一个可以眺望大海的露天阳台上用餐。

Sense.DEF: a very simple plant without stems or leaves that grows in or near water
a type of mathematics that uses letters and other signs to represent numbers and values
a set of instructions that are followed in a fixed order and used for solving a mathematical problem, making a computer program etc
used when giving someone’s real name, especially an actor’s or a criminal’s name, together with another name they use
Sense.TRAN: 又名﹐化名〔尤指演员或罪犯〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Friends’ star Jennifer Aniston, alias Rachel Green
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《六人行》的主角珍妮佛·安尼斯顿﹐即瑞秋·格林

Sense.DEF: a false name, usually used by a criminal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spy operating under the alias Barsad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个化名巴萨德进行活动的间谍

Sense.DEF: something that proves that someone was not where a crime happened and therefore could not have done it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had a perfect alibi and the police let him go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有不在犯罪现场的确凿证明﹐警方便放了他。

Sense.DEF: an excuse for something you have failed to do or have done wrong

a book by Lewis Carroll about a girl called Alice who has many strange adventures. People sometimes describe something as being ‘Alice-in-Wonderland’, when they mean it is the opposite of what is normal or what you expect
Sense.TRAN: 《艾丽丝漫游奇境记》〔路易斯·卡罗尔的著作﹐人们有时用 Alice-in-Wonderland 来表示“不平常”之意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is a good introduction to the strange, Alice-in-Wonderland world of theoretical physics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书是一本很好的入门读物﹐引导你进入理论物理学的奇幻世界。

Sense.DEF: very different from what you are used to, especially in a way that is difficult to understand or accept
Sense.EXAMPLE: the alien environment of the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城里陌生的环境

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a way of life that is totally alien to us
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完全陌生的生活方式

Sense.DEF: belonging to another country or race
Sense.EXAMPLE: alien cultures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异域文化
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alien multiracial society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个多种族的异国社会

Sense.DEF: relating to creatures from another world
Sense.EXAMPLE: alien beings from another planet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自另一个行星的外星生物

Sense.DEF: someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in
Sense.EXAMPLE: illegal aliens entering the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法入境的外国人

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Alien is used in official contexts. In everyday English, foreigner is used, but can sound disapproving or unfriendly. To avoid this, people often use the expression people from other countries instead
F2NBox.TRAN: Alien用于正式语境。 在日常英语中﹐用foreigner一词﹐但是这个词带有贬义色彩或显得不友好。 为了避免这一点﹐人们常用短语people from other countries
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: In those days people from other countries rarely came to Japan.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐很少有外国人到日本来。

Sense.DEF: in stories, a creature from another world
to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

Sense.DEF: to make it difficult for someone to belong to a particular group or to feel comfortable with a particular person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt that his experiences had alienated him from society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到自己的经历令他与社会格格不入。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Gina had become alienated from her family.

Sense.DEF: the feeling of not being part of society or a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unemployment may provoke a sense of alienation from society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业可能会引起不容于社会的感觉。

Sense.DEF: when someone becomes less friendly, understanding, or willing to give support as the result of something that happens or is done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the alienation of voters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民的疏远

Sense.DEF: burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was set alight and pushed over a hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆汽车被点燃后就被推下山去。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Alight is mostly used in journalism or in literature. In everyday English, people usually say on fire
F2NBox.TRAN: alight大多用于新闻报道或文学作品中。 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说on fire
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The car had been deliberately set on fire .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车被人蓄意纵火焚烧。

Sense.DEF: someone whose face or eyes are alight looks excited, happy, etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔兴奋得〕神采飞扬的﹔眉开眼笑的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jed’s face was alight with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰德神采奕奕。

Sense.DEF: bright with light or colour
if a bird or insect alights on something, it stops flying and stands on it
to step out of a vehicle after a journey

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She alighted from the train at 74th Street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在第74大街下了火车。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly think of or notice something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mind alighted on several possible answers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一下子想到了几个可能的答案。

Sense.DEF: to publicly support a political group, country, or person that you agree with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Church leaders have aligned themselves with the opposition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会领袖和反对派站在同一阵线上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a country closely aligned with the West
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与西方亲近的一个国家

Sense.DEF: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure that all the holes align.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

Sense.DEF: to organize or change something so that it has the right relationship to something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This policy is closely aligned with the goals of the organization.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一政策与该机构的目标非常一致。

Sense.DEF: the state of being arranged in a line with something or parallel to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the geometrical alignment of the Sun, Moon, and Earth at the eclipse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日蚀或月蚀发生时太阳﹑月亮和地球成几何直线的排列

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wheels were out of alignment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车轮偏位，不在一条直线上。

Sense.DEF: support given by one country or group to another in politics, defence etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: their military alignment with the US
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们与美国的军事结盟

Sense.DEF: very similar
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

Sense.DEF: in a similar way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The twins were dressed alike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对双胞胎穿着相似。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 同样都〔用于强调刚提及的两者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I learned a lot from teachers and students alike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从老师和学生身上都获益良多。

Sense.DEF:
the tube in your body that takes food through your body from your mouth to your
anus
money that a court orders someone to pay regularly to their former wife or husband after their marriage has ended
Sense.TRAN: 〔法院判定离婚一方须向另一方定期支付的〕赡养费

Sense.DEF: all the most popular or famous film stars, musicians etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Hollywood A-list
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞的一线明星
Sense.EXAMPLE: A-list celebrities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一线名人

Sense.DEF: a very famous film star, musician etc – used especially in newspapers and magazines
Sense.TRAN: 一线明星〔指个体﹐尤用于报纸和杂志〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several A-listers are expected to be at the movie premiere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计会有几位一线明星出席该电影的首映式。

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
alight
still living and not dead
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a bad accident – they’re lucky to be alive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一宗严重事故——他们能活着实属幸运。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandparents are still alive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖父母和外祖父母都还健在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stayed alive by eating berries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们靠吃浆果活命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was kept alive on a life-support machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他靠生命维持装置活着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apparently he’s alive and well and living in Brazil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来他还健在﹐住在巴西。

Sense.DEF: continuing to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ancient traditions are very much alive in rural areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的传统在农村根深蒂固。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christianity is alive and well in Asia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教在亚洲依然盛行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sport is still very much alive and kicking in this country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项体育运动在该国依然很流行。

Sense.DEF: full of energy, happiness, activity etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the kind of morning when you wake up and feel really alive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个醒来时觉得充满活力的早晨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her face was alive with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她兴奋得眉飞色舞。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole house was alive with activity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整幢房子里都很热闹。

Subsense.DEF: if a subject or event comes alive, it becomes interesting and seems real
Subsense.TRAN: 变得兴味盎然﹔生动起来
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hopefully, we can make history come alive for the children.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望我们可以让孩子感到历史是生动的。

Subsense.DEF: if someone comes alive, they suddenly become happy and interested in what is happening
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She only came alive when she sat down at the piano.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一坐在钢琴旁就精神起来。

Subsense.DEF: if a town, city etc comes alive, it becomes busy
Subsense.EXAMPLE: seaside resorts that come alive in the summer
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季变得热闹的海滨度假胜地

Sense.LEXUNIT: be alive to a fact/possibility/danger etc
Sense.DEF: to know that a particular fact etc exists and that it is important
Sense.TRAN: 了解某事实/注意到可能性/意识到危险等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is alive to the threat posed by foreign imports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司了解国外进口商品所造成的威胁。

Sense.DEF: to be full of living things that are moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pond was alive with fish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 池塘里满是游来游去的鱼。

Sense.DEF: to make something interesting and real
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way he describes his characters really brings them alive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的描写手法使笔下人物栩栩如生。

Sense.DEF: a substance that forms a chemical salt when combined with an acid
containing an alkali
the whole of an amount, thing, or type of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you done all your homework?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你作业都做完了吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: all your life/all day/all year etc
GramExa.GLOSS: during the whole of your life, a day, a year etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一辈子/一整天/一整年等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had worked all his life in the mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在矿场工作了一辈子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boys played video games all day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们整天玩电子游戏。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
They were quarrelling all the time
very often or continuously
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们老是在吵架。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Hannah didn’t say a single word all the way back home
during the whole of the journey
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家时汉娜一路上没说一句话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Almost all of the music was from Italian operas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎所有的音乐都选自意大利歌剧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard it all before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前全都听过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d given up all hope of having a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全放弃了生孩子的希望。

Sense.DEF: every one of a number of people or things, or every thing or person of a particular type
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s taken all my books!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁把我的书都拿走了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will all the girls please stand over here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姑娘们都请站到这边来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All children should be taught to swim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个孩子都应该学会游泳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: 16 per cent of all new cars sold in Western Europe these days are diesel-engined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐在西欧销售的所有新车中有16%配备柴油发动机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all speak excellent English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都会说一口漂亮的英语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: important changes that will affect all of us
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将影响我们每个人的重大变革

Sense.DEF: the only thing or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: All you need is a hammer and some nails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只需要一把锤子和一些钉子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All I’m asking for is a little respect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要的不过是一点点尊重而已。

Sense.DEF: everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m doing all I can to help her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在尽全力帮她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope all is well with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你一切顺利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All was dark and silent down by the harbour wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 港口堤岸一片漆黑﹐万籁俱寂。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you mean the greatest possible amount of the quality you are mentioning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can any of us say in all honesty that we did everything we could?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们之中有谁真的能说自己尽力了？

Sense.DEF: used in negative statements and questions to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve done nothing at all to try and put the problem right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们根本没有采取任何行动去解决这个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not looking at all well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的气色一点都不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you mind if I stay a little longer?’ ‘No, not at all.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你介不介意我再待一会儿？”“当然不介意。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has the situation improved at all?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 局势有任何进展吗？

Sense.DEF: many different kinds of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Social workers have to deal with all kinds of problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会工作者必须处理各种问题。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that your statement is true of one particular person, thing, or place more than any other
Sense.TRAN: 在所有的人/事物/地方之中等唯独
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t have done it. You of all people should know that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该那样做﹐这一点你是最应该知道的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did not want to quarrel with Maria today, of all days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏偏今天她不想与玛丽亚争吵。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are considering every part of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: All in all, it had been one of the most miserable days of Henry’s life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的说来﹐这是亨利一生中最痛苦的日子之一。

Sense.DEF: in spite of a particular fact
Sense.EXAMPLE: For all his faults, he’s a kind-hearted old soul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管他有种种缺点﹐但他还是位善良的老人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For all my love of landscape, nothing could persuade me to spend another day in the Highlands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我很喜欢看风景﹐但是没什么能说服我在苏格兰高地再多留一天。

Sense.DEF: including every thing or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: In all, there were 215 candidates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总共有215位候选人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We received £1,550 in cash and promises of another £650, making £2,200 in all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到1,550英镑现金﹐加上对方承诺会另付650英镑﹐总计2,200英镑。

Subsense.DEF: including the thing or things just mentioned
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They ate the whole fish – head, bones, tail, and all.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把整条鱼都吃掉了﹐鱼头﹑鱼骨﹑鱼尾通通进了肚子。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize a remark that you have just added
Subsense.EXAMPLE: And you can take that smelly old coat out of here, and all!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还可以把那件发臭的旧大衣也拿走！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how large or small an amount actually is
Sense.TRAN: 足足[仅仅]花了50便士/20分钟等〔强调数量之大或小〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game lasted all of 58 seconds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场比赛一共就进行了58秒钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The repairs are going to cost all of £15,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理要花费足足15,000英镑。

Sense.DEF: used to say that unless something is done completely, it is not acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Half-heartedness won’t do – it’s got to be all or nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三心二意是不行的——要么全力以赴﹐要么什么都不干。

Sense.DEF: to make the greatest possible effort in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coach expects every player to give their all in every game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练希望每一名队员在每一场比赛中都全力以赴。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it was all I could do to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you only just succeeded in doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all I could do to stop them hitting each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好不容易才让他们停止了互殴。

Sense.DEF: used to remind someone about an important point that needs to be considered
Sense.TRAN: 毕竟﹐终究〔用以提醒某人需要考虑的重要一点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When all’s said and done, he’s only a kid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到底﹐他还是个孩子。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular verb after all when you are using an uncountable or singular noun
F2NBox.TRAN: all与不可数名词或单数名词连用时﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All the food is prepared in advance.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的食物都是事先准备好的。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a plural verb when you are using a plural noun
F2NBox.TRAN: 与复数名词连用时﹐动词也要用复数
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All the windows have locks.
F2NBox.EXPL: If you are referring to a specific group or thing, use all (of) before 'the', 'my', 'these' etc
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某一特定的群体或事物时﹐all (of)要置于the﹑my﹑these等词之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All the money (NOT 不说 The all money) had been spent.
All of my friends were girls.
F2NBox.EXPL: If you are referring to a type of person or thing, use all directly before an uncountable noun or plural noun
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果指的是某一类人或物﹐all要直接置于不可数名词或复数名词之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All reptiles have scaly skin.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有爬行动物的皮肤上都长有鳞甲。
F2NBox.EXPL: If you are saying that something happened continuously, use all directly before 'day', 'week' etc
F2NBox.TRAN: 如表示某种状况持续不断﹐all要直接置于day﹑week等词之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It rained all day yesterday.
F2NBox.EXPL: When all follows a pronoun or noun referring to a group, it should come after the first auxiliary if there is one
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果all出现在表示群体的代词或名词之后﹐且句中有助动词﹐则all应置于第一个助动词之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This is something in which we can all be involved (NOT 不说 we all can be involved).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事可能与我们大家都有关系。
F2NBox.EXPL: It comes after a simple tense of 'be'
F2NBox.TRAN: all应置于be动词的一般式之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They are all lawyers.
F2NBox.HEADING: all, whole
F2NBox.EXPL: With a singular noun, it is possible to use whole instead of all
F2NBox.TRAN: whole有时可以代替all和单数名词连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a war that could destroy the whole planet
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能毁灭整个地球的一场战争

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t be sitting here by yourself, all alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该一个人孤零零地坐在这儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strange woman, dressed all in black
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一袭黑衣的奇怪女子
Sense.EXAMPLE:
If people want more freedom of choice, then I’m all for it
I strongly support it
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果民众想要更多选择的自由﹐我完全支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
‘It was a dreadful experience.’ ‘Never mind, it’s all over
completely finished
now.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “真是一段可怕的经历。”“没关系﹐现在都过去了。”

Subsense.DEF: everywhere on an object or surface
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were bits of paper all over the floor.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板上到处都是碎纸屑。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He has cuts all over his legs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的双腿到处是伤口。
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
She ached all over
her whole body ached
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她浑身疼。

Subsense.DEF: everywhere in a place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Antique clocks from all over the world are on display.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在展出的有来自世界各地的古玩钟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: People came from all over the country.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国各地的人都来了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They’re putting up new offices all over the place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们到处设立新的办事处。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how much better, easier etc something is than it would be in a different situation
Sense.TRAN: 好得多/简单得多/多得多等〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clayton’s achievement is all the more remarkable when you consider his poor performance last season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相比于上一赛季的糟糕表现﹐克莱顿现时的成绩出色多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job was made all the easier by having the proper tools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了合适的工具﹐这工作就容易多了。

Sense.DEF: almost completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s coal industry has all but disappeared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的煤炭工业几乎已经绝迹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His left arm was all but useless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的左臂差不多残废了。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘very’ when talking about a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 非常﹐甚〔用于表示不好的情形〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All too often it’s the mother who gets blamed for her children’s behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子的行为问题往往都归罪于母亲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In these conditions it was all too easy to make mistakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这些情况下很容易犯错。

Sense.DEF: all the time from the beginning while something was happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chapman had known all along that the plan wouldn’t work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查普曼从一开始就知道﹐这计划成不了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to admit that Dad had been right all along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不得不承认﹐爸爸一直是对的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you are describing the general quality or effect of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All round it’s not a bad car.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐这辆车不错。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was a nasty business all round.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐这事情令人很苦恼。

Subsense.DEF: from everyone, for everyone, or involving everyone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were smiles all round.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都面带微笑。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He paid for drinks all round.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给每个人都买了饮料。

Sense.DEF: used when giving the score of a game in which both players or teams have scored the same number of points
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game ended one-all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛以一比一平结束。

Sense.DEF: including everything or everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a project costing £10,000, all told
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合计耗资10,000英镑的工程

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s success or happiness has ended
Sense.EXAMPLE: If someone tells the police, then it’ll be all up with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有人报警﹐我就全完了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not all there seems stupid or slightly crazy
to be showing a lot of a particular quality or type of behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mayor and mayoress were all smiles and kisses during the grand ceremony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大典时﹐市长夫妇满面笑容﹐频频送吻。

Sense.DEF: to be trying to kiss someone and touch them, especially in a sexual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before I could speak, he was all over me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没来得及开口﹐他就上来对我动手动脚。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re getting me all confused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把我弄得一头雾水。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular way of behaving is typical of someone
Sense.TRAN: 某人就是这样﹐那是典型的某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was late of course, but that’s Tim all over!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然他又迟到了﹐不过这就是蒂姆的风格嘛！

Sense.DEF: to be very tired
used to report what someone said or did, when telling a story
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drove me home, and he was all, ‘I love this car ... it’s like a rocket.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开车送我回家﹐路上一个劲地说: “我太喜欢这辆车了…它就像火箭一样。”

Sense.DEF: not very
Sense.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t sound all that good, does it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这听起来不太好﹐是吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think it matters all that much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这关系不大。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is not very attractive or desirable
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物不太漂亮[理想]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know why you keep chasing her around. She’s not all that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白你为什么一直在追求她﹐她并不怎么样嘛。

Sense.DEF: consisting of or made of only one kind of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-male club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯男性俱乐部
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-wool coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯羊毛外套

Sense.DEF: continuing for the whole day or night
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-day seminar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一整天的讨论会
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-night café
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通宵营业的咖啡馆

Sense.DEF: the Muslim name for God
Sense.TRAN: 真主﹐安拉〔穆斯林对所信奉之神的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: having qualities that are considered to be typically American and that American people admire, such as being healthy and working hard
Sense.TRAN: 富有美国传统美德的﹔典型美国人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-American family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个典型的美国家庭

Sense.DEF: belonging to a group of players who have been chosen as the best in their sport at American universities
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-American football player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入选全美最佳阵容的橄榄球运动员

Sense.DEF: good at doing many different things, especially sports
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指运动员〕全能的﹐多才多艺的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-around athlete
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全能运动员

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less afraid, worried etc
Sense.TRAN: 减轻（某人的）恐惧/担忧/疑虑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president made a statement to allay public anxiety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统发表了一项声明以缓解公众的忧虑。

Subsense.DEF: official permission to begin doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve got the all clear for the new project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新项目我们已经得到批准。

Subsense.DEF: a signal such as a loud whistle that tells you that a dangerous situation has ended

Sense.DEF: everyone who wants to take part in something, especially a competition
Sense.TRAN: 所有参与者﹐所有参赛者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The marathon is open to all comers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马拉松比赛谁都可以报名参加。

Sense.DEF: a statement that someone has done something wrong or illegal, but that has not been proved

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Singh has strongly denied the allegations of sexual harassment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛格先生强烈否认性骚扰的指控。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an allegation that senior government figures were involved
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府高官涉案的说法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher made serious allegations against a colleague.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位老师对一位同事提出严重指控。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A committee will investigate allegations of racial discrimination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个委员会将着手调查有关种族歧视的指控。

Sense.DEF: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved
Sense.TRAN: 〔在未经证实下〕断言﹐宣称﹐声称﹔指控

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was alleged that the policeman had accepted bribes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人声称这名警察收受贿赂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prosecution alleged that the man had been responsible for an act of terrorism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 控方指控那名男子发起了一次恐怖主义行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The water is alleged to be polluted with mercury.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据称这片水域受到汞污染。

Sense.DEF: an alleged crime, fact etc is one that someone says has happened or is true, although it has not been proved

GramExa.EXAMPLE: their alleged involvement in international terrorism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们涉嫌参与国际恐怖主义活动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The alleged victim made the complaint at a police station in York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位自称是受害者的人在约克一家警察局报了案。

Sense.DEF: used when reporting something that people say is true, although it has not been proved
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sports car, allegedly stolen in Manchester
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说是在曼彻斯特被偷的一辆跑车

Sense.DEF: loyalty to a leader, country, belief etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对领袖﹑国家﹑信念等的〕忠诚﹐效忠

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
You owe allegiance
have a duty to give allegiance
to your king.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须效忠国王。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向美国国旗宣誓效忠。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an oath of allegiance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 效忠宣誓

GramExa.GLOSS: start to support a different person, group etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: The people here have strong political allegiances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的民众政治忠诚度很高。

Sense.DEF: a story, painting etc in which the events and characters represent ideas or teach a moral lesson
a piece of music played or sung quickly

another spelling of
hallelujah
including everyone or everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-embracing vision of society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对社会的全面看法

Sense.DEF: a tool used to turn an Allen screw
a type of screw with a hole that has six sides
a tool used to turn an Allen screw
a substance that causes an allergy
having an allergy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m allergic to penicillin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对青霉素过敏。

Sense.DEF: caused by an allergy
Sense.EXAMPLE: an allergic reaction to nuts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对坚果的过敏性反应
Sense.EXAMPLE: an allergic rash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过敏性皮疹

Sense.DEF: if you are allergic to something, you do not like it and try to avoid it – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 不喜欢某事﹐对某事反感〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most men are allergic to housework!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数男人都对做家务过敏！

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which you become ill or in which your skin becomes red and painful because you have eaten or touched a particular substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have an allergy to cats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对猫过敏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a food allergy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物过敏

Sense.DEF: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new medicine to alleviate the symptoms of flu
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种减轻流感症状的新药

Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to alleviate poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扶贫措施

Sense.DEF: a narrow street between or behind buildings, not usually used by cars
Sense.EXAMPLE: The alley led to the railway bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小巷通往铁路桥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found the side alley where the stage door was located.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找到了剧场后门所在的小巷。

Sense.DEF: very suitable for someone
Sense.TRAN: 正合某人的胃口﹔非常适合某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job sounds right up your alley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作听上去正合你的胃口。

Sense.DEF: a cat that lives on the streets and does not belong to anyone

an
alley
completely – used when describing a quality that you think is extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he weren’t so all-fired sure of himself, I’d like him better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他不是那么过于自信﹐我会更喜欢他。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation is very busy and full of activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all go from 8.00 until we finished at 5.00.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从8点开始一直到5点结束﹐我们忙个不停。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement in which two or more countries, groups etc agree to work together to try to change or achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain’s military alliance with her NATO partners
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国与其北约伙伴的军事联盟

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the possibility of a political alliance between the two parties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两党政治联盟的可能性

GramExa.GLOSS: agree to work together
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The companies have formed an alliance to market the product.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家公司联手将该产品推向市场。

Sense.DEF: a group of two or more countries, groups etc who work together to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: independent organizations and alliances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独立组织和联盟

Sense.DEF: if two groups, countries etc are in alliance, they work together to achieve something or protect each another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relief workers in alliance with local charities are trying to help the victims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救济人员与当地慈善机构联合起来﹐设法帮助灾民。

Sense.DEF: a close relationship, especially a marriage, between people
Sense.TRAN: 〔人与人之间的〕紧密关系﹔〔尤指〕联姻

Sense.DEF: belonging or relating to the countries that fought with Britain, the US etc in the First or Second World War
Sense.TRAN: 〔第一次世界大战〕协约国的﹔〔第二次世界大战〕同盟国的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Allied bombing raid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盟军空袭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allied forces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盟军

Sense.DEF: to be related to something or to be very similar
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anthropology is closely allied to the field of psychology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类学与心理学领域紧密关联。

Sense.DEF: connected with each other because of being similar to or dependent on each other
Sense.TRAN: 相关的工业/组织/行业等
Sense.EXAMPLE: agriculture and allied industries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业及相关产业

Sense.DEF: joined by the same political, military, or economic aims
Sense.EXAMPLE: loosely allied guerilla groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松散结盟的游击队组织

Sense.DEF: a large animal with a long mouth and tail and sharp teeth that lives in the hot wet parts of the US and China
the skin of this animal used as leather
Sense.EXAMPLE: alligator shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短吻鳄皮皮鞋

Sense.DEF: extremely important
Sense.EXAMPLE: the all-important question in everyone’s minds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人心里都认为最重要的那个问题

Sense.DEF: used to describe the total cost of something, or the total amount of money charged for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: all-in deals to Australia and New Zealand
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用全包的澳大利亚和新西兰游

Sense.EXAMPLE: The hourly rate is £20 all in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时收费总计20英镑。

Sense.DEF: including the cost of everything in the price charged

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an all-inclusive vacation cruise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 包括一切费用的游轮度假旅行

Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-in-one TV and video
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视﹑录像一体机

Sense.DEF: the use of several words together that begin with the same sound or letter in order to make a special effect, especially in poetry
Sense.TRAN: 头韵（法）〔连续使用开头读音或字母相同的单词﹐以制造特别效果﹐尤用于诗歌〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you spend the whole night studying or doing written work at university
to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the importance of allocating resources to local communities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将资源分配给地方社区的重要性
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should allocate the same amount of time to each question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应当给每个问题分配相同的时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One million dollars was allocated for disaster relief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拨出100万美元用于救灾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several patients were waiting to be allocated a bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几位病人在等着分配床位。

Sense.DEF: the amount or share of something that has been allocated for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Twelve hours a week seemed a generous allocation of your time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周12个小时﹐这好像占用了你很多时间。

Sense.DEF: the decision to allocate something, or the act of allocating it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the allocation of funds to universities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 分配资金给各大学

Sense.DEF: to use a particular amount of time for something, or give a particular share of money, space etc to someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try and allot two or three hours a day to revision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天设法抽出两三个小时复习。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each school will be allotted twenty seats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个学校将分配到20个座位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone who works for the company has been allotted ten shares.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的每位员工都分到十股股票。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The department has already spent more than its allotted budget.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个部门的开支已经超出了分配的预算。

Sense.DEF: an amount or share of something such as money or time that is given to someone or something, or the process of doing this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The budget allotment for each county is below what is needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分配给每个县的预算低于所需。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the allotment of shares in the company
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司内部的股票分配

Sense.DEF: a small area of land that people can rent for growing vegetables
done in a very determined way, and involving a lot of energy or anger
Sense.TRAN: 全力以赴的﹐竭尽全力的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 全面的战争/进攻/攻击等

Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-out effort to win
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竭尽全力争取胜利

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Canada will have to go all out on the ice if they want to win.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果加拿大队想赢﹐就必须在冰场上全力以赴。

Sense.DEF: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents wouldn’t allow me to go to the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母不许我去参加聚会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women are not allowed to enter the mosque.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性不准进入清真寺。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t allow your problems to dominate your life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让碰到的问题支配你的生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Passengers are allowed one item of hand luggage each.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每位乘客允许携带一件手提行李。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much time are we allowed?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以有多少时间？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t allow the cat in the bedroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不允许猫进入卧室。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The audience is not allowed backstage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众不允许进入后台。

GramExa.GLOSS: something is or is not officially permitted
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are dictionaries allowed in the exam?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试时可以查词典吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泳池内禁止跳水。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for something to happen or for someone to do something, especially something helpful or useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: This adjustment of the figures allows a fairer comparison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给数据做这样的调整可以使对比更加公正。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our new system will allow for more efficient use of resources.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的新系统将使资源得到更有效的利用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A 24-hour ceasefire allowed the two armies to reach an agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 24小时的停火让两军达成了一项协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a seat belt that allows the driver greater freedom of movement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让司机活动更自如的安全带

Sense.DEF: to be sure that you have enough time, money, food etc available for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 留出﹐给予〔足够的时间﹑金钱﹑食物等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Allow yourselves plenty of time to get to the airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 留出足够的时间去机场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve allowed half a bottle of wine for each person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给每个人准备了半瓶酒。

Sense.DEF: to accept that something is correct or true, or that something is acceptable according to the rules or law

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I allow that there may have been a mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我承认其中可能有个错误。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge allowed the evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官接受了这项证据。

Sense.DEF: used as a polite way of offering to help someone do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Allow me,’ the waiter said, opening the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “让我来。”服务员边说边打开门。

Exponent.DEF: to say that someone can do something – used about parents, teachers, or people in authority
Exponent.TRAN: 〔家长﹑老师﹑有权力的人等〕允许﹐准许
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They don’t allow students to chew gum in the classroom.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不允许学生在课堂上嚼口香糖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m not allowed to stay out after ten o'clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不可以在外面待到10点以后。

Exponent.DEF: to allow someone to do something. Let is not used in the passive, and is much more commonly used in everyday English than allow
Exponent.TRAN: 让﹐允许〔let不用被动态﹐在日常英语中比allow要常用得多〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Will your Mum let you come to the party?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你妈会让你来参加聚会吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll borrow John’s bicycle, if he’ll let me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会借用约翰的自行车﹐如果他肯的话。

Exponent.DEF: if something is permitted, it is allowed according to the rules - used especially on written notices and announcements
Exponent.TRAN: 〔根据规则〕允许﹐许可〔尤用于书面通知和声明〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Smoking is not permitted anywhere in the building.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼内全面禁止吸烟。

Exponent.DEF: used when someone in an important official position decides to allow someone to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was given special permission to leave school early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获特批可以提前离开学校。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Home Office has given him permission to stay in Britain indefinitely.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 内政部批准他在英国无限期居留。

Exponent.DEF: to say that you will allow someone to do something that will affect you personally, or a member of your family, when you have a legal right to say ‘no’
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her parents have given their consent to the marriage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母同意了这桩婚事。

Exponent.DEF: to officially allow a planned project or activity to happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government finally gave the go-ahead for a new terminal at Heathrow airport.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府最终批准在希思罗机场建造一座新航站楼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A new nuclear plant has been given the go-ahead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座新核电站已获准建造。

Exponent.DEF: to officially or legally allow someone to do something - used about laws or people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The UN resolution would authorize the use of force.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国决议会批准动用武力。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I never authorized them to give information about me to other banks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未授权他们向其他银行透露我的资料。

Exponent.DEF: to give someone the right to do or have something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pass entitles you to travel on any bus, at any time, in Norwich.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭这张乘车证你可以在诺威奇随时乘坐任何公共汽车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If the goods are faulty, the customer is entitled to a refund.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 商品如有瑕疵﹐顾客可以要求退款。

Exponent.DEF: to give official approval and support for something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Truman administration refused to sanction a military attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜鲁门政府拒绝批准发动军事进攻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The advertisements were sanctioned by the candidate himself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些广告是经由候选人本人认可的。

Sense.DEF: to consider the possible facts, problems, costs etc involved in something when making a plan, calculation, or judgment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allowing for inflation, the cost of the project will be $2 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考虑到通货膨胀因素﹐这个项目将花费200万美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should always allow for the possibility that it might rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要考虑到下雨的可能性。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for something to happen or be accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The facts allow of only one interpretation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事实只可能有一种解释。

Sense.DEF: acceptable according to the rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: The maximum allowable dosage is two tablets a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最大允许剂量是每天两片。

Sense.DEF: allowable costs are costs that you do not pay tax on
Sense.EXAMPLE: allowable deductions such as alimony and business expenses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免税扣除额﹐如赡养费和业务开销

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔定期或出于特殊原因而给予的〕一笔钱﹔津贴﹐补助

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His father gives him a monthly allowance of £200.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲每月给他200英镑的生活费。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you get an allowance for clothes?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有服装补贴吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales staff get a generous mileage allowance or a company car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售人员有优厚的里程补贴或者公司提供的专用汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you are entitled to sickness allowance, you must claim it from your employer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果有资格领取疾病津贴﹐必须向雇主申请索要。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that is acceptable or safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: the recommended daily allowance of Vitamin C
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维生素C的每日建议摄入量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Passengers’ baggage allowance is 75 pounds per person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客行李限重是每人75磅。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you can earn without paying tax on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new tax allowance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的免税额度

Sense.DEF: a small amount of money that a parent regularly gives to a child
Sense.TRAN: 〔父母给小孩的〕零用钱﹐零花钱

Sense.DEF: something that you consider when deciding what is likely to happen, what you should expect etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is always an allowance in insurance premiums for whether someone smokes or not.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保费总是要考虑到被保险人是否吸烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The budget makes allowances for extra staff when needed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预算考虑到必要时增聘员工的开支。

Sense.DEF: to let someone behave in a way you do not normally approve of, because you know there are special reasons for their behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad’s under pressure – you have to make allowances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸压力大——你得体谅。

Sense.DEF: a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄铜是铜和锌的合金。

Sense.DEF: to mix one metal with another
having complete power or control
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-powerful dictator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 权力无限的独裁者

Sense.DEF: able to be used in any situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-purpose cleaner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万能清洁剂

Sense.DEF: satisfactory, but not excellent
Sense.TRAN: 还算可以（的）﹐ 比较满意的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s the food like?’ ‘It’s all right, but the place on campus is better.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “饭菜怎么样？” “还可以﹐但是校园里那家更好些。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s school going, Steve?’ ‘Oh, all right, I guess.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “史蒂夫﹐学习怎么样？”“噢﹐我想还不错吧。”

Sense.DEF: not ill, hurt, or upset or not having any problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate looks really unhappy – I’d better make sure she’s all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特看上去很不高兴﹐我最好去看看她是不是有事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you feeling all right ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你感觉还好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids seem to be getting on all right at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在学校里好像表现不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Tony was worried about the meeting but it went all right
happened with no problems
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼本来挺担心这次会议﹐但是会开得很顺利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, it’ll turn out all right .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐会好的。

Sense.DEF: to be successful in your job, life etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s doing all right – she’s got a job with Microsoft.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她干得不错﹐在微软公司工作。

Sense.DEF: used to say whether something is suitable or convenient

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is Thursday morning all right with you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期四早上你行吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll eat at eight. Does that sound all right to you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们8点钟吃饭﹐你看行吗？

Sense.DEF: used to make someone feel less afraid or worried
Sense.TRAN: 别怕﹐没事〔用于安慰对方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s all right, Mommy’s here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没事﹐妈妈在这儿呢。

Sense.DEF: used to reply to someone who thanks you or says they are sorry about something
Sense.TRAN: 别客气﹔不要紧〔用于回答对方的感谢或道歉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Thanks for all your help!’ ‘That’s quite all right .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “谢谢你帮了我那么多！”“不必客气。”

Sense.DEF: used to ask or give permission for something
Sense.TRAN: 可以﹐好﹐行〔用于征求或给予许可〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would it be all right if I left early?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早点走可以吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: be all right to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is it all right to bring my dog?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我带狗来行吗？

Sense.DEF: used to agree with someone’s suggestion, although you may be slightly unwilling
Sense.TRAN: 好吧〔用于同意某人的建议﹐尽管也许有一丝不情愿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why not come along?’ ‘Oh, all right.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “为什么不一起去呢？”“嗯﹐好吧。”

Sense.DEF: used to check that someone understands what you have said, or to show that you understand
Sense.TRAN: 好吗﹔好的〔用于确定对方是否明白﹐或表示你明白了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll leave a key with the neighbours, all right?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会在邻居家里留一把钥匙﹐好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The train leaves at 5.30.’ ‘All right, I’m coming!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “火车5点半开。”“好的﹐我就来！”

Sense.DEF: used when asking in a threatening or angry way what someone’s intentions are
Sense.TRAN: 好啊〔用于威吓或愤怒时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All right, you two. What are you doing in my room?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啊﹐你们两个。 你们在我房间里干什么？

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a new subject or to end a conversation
Sense.TRAN: 好了〔用于引入新话题或结束对话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All right, now I’d like to introduce our first speaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐现在我来介绍第一位演讲者。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone else does not have the problems that you have, or that you are jealous because someone else is luckier than you
Sense.TRAN: 某人是没有问题啦﹔某人就是幸运
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I get eight weeks’ holiday a year.‘ ’Well, it’s all right for some .'
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我一年有八周休假。”“唉﹐有些人就是运气好。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are certain about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sure it was Bill?’ ‘Oh, yes, it was him all right.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你肯定是比尔？”“噢﹐是的﹐肯定是他。”

Sense.DEF: used to say you are happy about something you have just been told
Sense.TRAN: 好啊〔用于表示对刚听说的事感到高兴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You passed? All right!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你通过了？好啊！

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone you like or approve of
Sense.TRAN: 挺好的〔用于描述喜欢或赞许的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The new boss isn’t too bad, is she?’ ‘No, she’s all right.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “新老板还行﹐是不是？”“是啊﹐她挺好的。”

Sense.DEF: used as a greeting when you meet someone you know well, or reply to a greeting
Sense.TRAN: 好吗﹔挺好〔用于同熟人打招呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How are you, John?’ ‘Oh, all right – can’t complain.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “约翰﹐你好吗？”“啊﹐挺好的﹐还不错。”

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone’s attitude when they do not care about other people as long as they themselves are happy, comfortable etc
Sense.TRAN: 我过得好就行〔用于描述只顾自己开心﹑舒服﹐不管别人怎样的态度〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’ll be all right on the night
Sense.DEF: used to say that something will be successful, even though there have been lots of problems
Sense.TRAN: 船到桥头自然直﹐车到山前必有路
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workmen have yet to finish the new complex, but the organisers are confident it will be all right on the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们还没建成新的综合大楼﹐但组织者相信船到桥头自然直。

Sense.DEF: good at doing many different things
Sense.TRAN: 有多方面才能的﹐全面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-round athlete
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全能运动员

Sense.DEF: someone with many different skills
Sense.EXAMPLE: a good all-rounder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多面手

Sense.DEF:
an all-seater football ground,
stadium
etc is one where everyone has a seat
an all-singing, all-dancing machine or system can do many things because it is so technically advanced – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器或系统〕无所不能的﹐多功能的〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the dried fruit of a tropical American tree, crushed and used in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 多香果〔碾碎后用于烹饪的香料〕

Sense.DEF: including many famous actors, sports players etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-star cast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全明星阵容

Sense.DEF: all-terrain vehicles are very strong with thick tyres and are suitable for use in many different conditions
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-terrain bike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全地形自行车

Sense.DEF: used when you compare things to say that one of them is the best, worst etc that there has ever been

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The price of wheat had reached an all-time low.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小麦的价格降到了前所未有的低点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They reached an all-time record score.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们取得了创记录的高分。

Sense.DEF: to mention something or someone indirectly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rick didn’t want to discuss his past, though he alluded darkly to ‘some bad things that happened.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克不想谈论自己的过去﹐不过他曾伤感地暗示“发生过一些不幸的事情”。

Sense.DEF: a mysterious, exciting, or desirable quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the allure of foreign travel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出国旅行的诱惑

Sense.EXAMPLE: At 50, she had lost none of her sexual allure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 50岁的她魅力丝毫未减。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: harmonies that never fail to allure the listener
the alluring magic of Hong Kong

Sense.DEF: something said or written that mentions a subject, person etc indirectly
Sense.TRAN: 暗示﹐暗指﹐间接提到﹔典故

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee made no allusion to the former President in its report.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会在报告中没有影射前总统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eliot’s poetry is full of biblical allusions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾略特的诗作中圣经典故比比皆是。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In his poetry we find many allusions to the human body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的诗中﹐人体的隐喻俯拾皆是。

Sense.DEF: made of soil left by rivers, lakes, floods etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: alluvial flood plains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冲积泛滥平原

Sense.DEF: soil left by rivers, lakes, floods etc
a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meeting of the European allies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲盟国会议

Sense.DEF: the group of countries including Britain and the US that fought together in the First and Second World Wars
Sense.TRAN: 〔第一次世界大战的〕协约国﹔〔第二次世界大战的〕同盟国

Sense.DEF: someone who helps and supports you when other people are trying to oppose you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ridley was one of the Queen’s closest allies .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里德利是女王最亲密的盟友之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a staunch ally
very close ally
of President Soares
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏亚雷斯总统的一位坚定支持者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a network of political allies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治盟友网
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew she had found an ally in Ted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道泰德已经是她的盟友了。

Sense.DEF: something that helps you succeed in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise is an important ally in your campaign to lose weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼在减肥计划中是重要的辅助手段。

Sense.DEF: to help and support other people or countries, especially in a war or disagreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the northern cities allied themselves with the emperor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 北方一些城市与皇帝结盟。

Sense.DEF: the school, college etc that someone used to attend
the song of a particular school, college etc
a book produced each year containing information about a particular subject, especially a sport, or important dates, times etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a football almanac
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球年鉴
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nautical almanac
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航海年鉴

Sense.DEF: expressions used to talk about God that emphasize His power
Sense.TRAN: 全能者/全能的上帝/全能的天父

Sense.DEF: an expression used when you are angry or upset. Some people consider this use offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 天啊〔用于表示愤怒或不高兴﹐有些人认为这种用法具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a very loud noise, argument etc
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的喧闹声/碰撞声/争吵声等
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an almighty bang and the car came to a halt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砰的一声巨响﹐汽车停了下来。

Sense.DEF: a flat pale nut with brown skin that tastes sweet, or the tree that produces these nuts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stir in the ground almonds and egg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拌入碾碎的扁桃仁和鸡蛋。

Sense.DEF: nearly, but not completely or not quite
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you almost finished?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你差不多完成了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supper’s almost ready.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭就要做好了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was almost midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午夜将至。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Almost nothing was done to improve the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有采取什么措施来改善这个情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story is almost certainly true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这故事几乎肯定是真实的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s almost as old as I am.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他差不多跟我一样大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marsha visits her son almost every day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎几乎每天都去看望儿子。

Exponent.DEF: not completely or not quite
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve almost finished my essay.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的论文就快写完了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It's almost lunchtime.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 就要到午饭时间了。

Exponent.DEF: almost. Nearly is more commonly used in British English than American English
Exponent.TRAN: 几乎﹐差不多〔nearly在英国英语中比在美国英语中更常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been a teacher for nearly 10 years now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当老师差不多十年了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s very nearly time to go home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 差不多是时候回家了。

Exponent.DEF: almost, but not yet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Is he 60?’ ‘Not quite!’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “他有60岁了吗？”“还没呢！”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s not quite time to go yet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 还没到走的时候。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m not quite ready yet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有完全准备好。

Exponent.DEF: very nearly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The room was practically empty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里几乎空无一物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The frost killed practically every plant in the garden.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒霜几乎冻死了花园里的所有植物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Virtually everyone had gone home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎人人都已回家。

Exponent.DEF: very nearly – use this when saying that the difference is not important
Exponent.TRAN: 几乎﹐差不多〔表示差异并不重要〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the rooms are more or less the same size.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的房间都差不多大。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His jacket was pretty much the same colour as his trousers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的夹克和裤子几乎是一个颜色。

Exponent.DEF: almost a particular time, age, or period of time – used especially when you are not sure of the exact time, age etc
Exponent.TRAN: 快到〔尤用于表示对确切时间﹑年龄等不确定〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s getting on for 10 years since we last saw each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都快十年没见面了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How old’s Diane?’ ‘She must be getting on toward 50.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “黛安娜多大年纪了？”“肯定都快50岁了。”

Exponent.DEF: almost a particular number, amount, or time – used especially when the number or amount is surprisingly large or the time is very late
Exponent.TRAN: 接近〔某一数字﹑数量或时间﹐尤指数字或数量非常大或时间非常晚〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was close to midnight by the time we arrived.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到时已将近午夜。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’ve spent close to $1.3 billion on the project.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在这个项目上已投入将近13亿美元。

Exponent.DEF: almost – used when a number or amount is still increasing or a time is getting nearer
Exponent.TRAN: 接近〔用于表示数字或数量仍在增加或时间迫近〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The unemployment rate was nearing 20%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率接近20%。

Exponent.EXP: be on the verge of (doing) sth
Exponent.DEF: to be very close to doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE:
She was on the verge of tears
almost crying
.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她差点儿就要哭出来了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was on the verge of giving up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我几乎就要放弃了。

Exponent.EXP: be on the brink of sth
Exponent.DEF: to be very close to an extremely bad situation
Exponent.TRAN: 处于…的边缘〔指非常糟糕的情况〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two countries are on the brink of war.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国处于战争的边缘。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company was on the brink of bankruptcy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司濒临破产。

Sense.DEF: money, food etc given to poor people in the past
in Britain in the past, a house where a poor person was allowed to live without paying rent

a tropical plant with thick leaves that are filled with a liquid which is used to make medicine,
cosmetic s
etc
high up in the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He emerged, holding a baby aloft.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他高举着一个小宝宝出现了。

Sense.DEF: if you are alone in a place, there is no one with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives alone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一个人生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t leave a child alone in the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该把小孩独自留在家里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wife and I like to spend time alone together away from the kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和妻子喜欢没有孩子打扰﹐过二人世界。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say by yourself or on your own rather than alone
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说by yourself或on your own﹐而不说alone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She lives by herself/on her own .

Sense.DEF: without any friends or people you know
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was scary being all alone in a strange city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孤身一人在陌生的城市中很可怕。
