Sense.EXAMPLE:
She was all alone in the world
she had no family or friends to help her or look after her
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在这世界上孑然一身。

Sense.DEF: feeling unhappy and lonely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I cried like a child because I felt so alone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到很孤独，像个孩子似的哭了起来。

Sense.DEF: without any help from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was left to raise their two children alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只留下他独力抚养他们的两个孩子。

Sense.DEF: without including anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case will cost thousands of pounds in legal fees alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个案子仅律师费一项就要数千英镑。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that there is only one person who knows, can do something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie alone knew the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有朱莉一个人知道真相。

Sense.DEF: to start working or living on your own, especially after working or living with other people
Sense.TRAN: 单独行动﹐独自干﹔独立出去生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: After years of working for a big company I decided to go it alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一家大公司工作多年后﹐我决定自己单干。

Sense.DEF: to stop annoying or interrupting someone
Sense.TRAN: 不打扰某人﹐不去烦某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Leave me alone!’ she screamed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别烦我！”她尖叫道。

Sense.DEF: to stop touching an object or changing something
Sense.TRAN: 不要碰某物﹔不改变某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave those cakes alone. They’re for the guests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别动那些蛋糕﹐那是给客人吃的。

GramExa.GLOSS: not change something that is satisfactory
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In economic matters, they should leave well alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经济问题上﹐他们一动不如一静。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something belongs to someone
Sense.TRAN: 是你/她/他等一个人的〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The responsibility is yours and yours alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 责任全是你一个人的。

Sense.DEF: to not be the only person to do something
Sense.TRAN: 并不只是…一个人做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re not alone in feeling upset, believe me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相信我﹐并不只是你一个人感到生气。

Subsense.DEF: to be strong and independent
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the courage to stand alone
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚强独立的勇气

Subsense.DEF: to be at a distance from other objects or buildings
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The house stood alone at the end of the road.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢房子孤零零地矗立在路的尽头。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of alone, on your own and by yourself in spoken and written English. 在英语口语和书面语中﹐alone, on your own和by yourself的使用频率。

In spoken English it is more usual to say on your own or by yourself rather than alone. In written or more formal English alone is more common.英语口语中更常用的说法是on your own或by yourself﹐而不是alone。在书面语或较正式的英语里则是alone更常用。

Sense.DEF: going forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was driving along, thinking about Chris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一边开车﹐一边想着克里斯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of children walking along in a line
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排着队向前走的一群孩子

Sense.DEF: to go or come to a place where something is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re welcome to come along if you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你愿意的话可以一起去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll go along and watch the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想一起去看比赛。

Sense.DEF: to take someone or something with you to a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mandy brought some of her friends along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼迪带了她的几个朋友来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you take your guitar along?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不把吉他带上呢？

Sense.DEF: to arrive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another bus should be along in a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一辆公共汽车应该一会儿就到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every so often, a band comes along that changes music history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔会出现一支能改写音乐史的乐队。

Sense.DEF: to improve, develop, or make progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a five-hour operation, Wendy is coming along just fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过五个小时的手术﹐温迪恢复得很不错。

Sense.DEF: together with someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dunne was murdered, along with three guards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邓恩与三名卫兵一起被谋杀。

Sense.DEF: all the time from the beginning, while something was happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: They should have known all along that she was lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该从一开始就知道她在撒谎。

Sense.DEF: from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were driving along Follyfoot Road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿着福莱福特路行驶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She glanced anxiously along the line of faces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她焦急地扫视着这一排面孔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slid his hand along her arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手顺着她的臂膀滑下。

Sense.DEF: forming a line beside something long
Sense.EXAMPLE: The palm trees along the shore swayed in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿岸的棕榈树在风中摇曳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the toolbar along the top of your screen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屏幕最上方的工具栏
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were cheering crowds all along Pennsylvania Avenue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾夕法尼亚大道一路上都是欢呼的人群。

Sense.DEF: a particular distance away, on or beside something long such as a line, road, edge etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hugo’s house was about two hundred yards away along the main street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨果的家在沿大街过去约两百码的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The bathroom is just along
a short distance along
the corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴室就在走廊边上。

Sense.DEF: during a process or experience, or during someone’s life
Sense.TRAN: 在…过程[经历]中﹔在生活道路上
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been lucky, but I’ve had my share of heartbreak along the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很幸运﹐但这一路走来也有过心碎的经历。

Sense.DEF: next to the side of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A car drew up alongside .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆车在旁边停了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children’s prices are shown alongside adult prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童票价标在成人票价旁边。

Sense.DEF: used to say that people or things do something or exist together at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles spent a week working alongside the miners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯花了一周时间与矿工一起干活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organized crime continued to flourish alongside the mainstream economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着主流经济的发展﹐集团犯罪越来越猖獗。

Sense.DEF: in comparison with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His achievement may seem small alongside the great triumphs of 20th-century technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与20世纪科技的伟大成就相比﹐他的成绩或许会显得渺小。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Athletics should rank alongside
be equal to
soccer and cricket as a major sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田径运动应该和足球﹑板球一样﹐被列为主要体育项目。

Sense.DEF: unfriendly and deliberately not talking to other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They worked hard, but tended to stay aloof from the local inhabitants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们工作努力﹐但是一般不和当地居民来往。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had always kept herself aloof from the boys in class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对班上的男生一直很冷漠。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Beneath that aloof exterior, Gayle is a warm, sympathetic person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在冷漠的外表下﹐盖尔是个有同情心的热心人。

Sense.DEF: deliberately not becoming involved in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Initially, the President remained aloof from the campaign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最初﹐总统没有参与这次运动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doctor held himself somewhat aloof from the rest of the ship’s crew.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位医生不大搭理其余的船员。

Sense.DEF: if you read, laugh, say something etc aloud, you read etc so that people can hear you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joanne, would you read the poem aloud?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔安妮﹐你来朗诵这首诗好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pain made him cry aloud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他痛得叫起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could have laughed aloud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她差一点笑出声来。

GramExa.GLOSS: say the things you are thinking
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 自言自语﹐边想边说出声
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘What did you say?’ ‘ Sorry, I was just thinking aloud.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你说什么？”“对不起﹐我只是在自言自语。”

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use aloud to mean ‘in a loud voice’. Use loudly . 表示“大声地”不要用aloud﹐而要用loudly: You need to speak quite loudly for the people at the back. 你得说得很大声﹐好让后面的人听见。

Sense.DEF:
an animal from South America with long hair that looks like a
llama
cloth made from the wool of an alpaca
the first letter of the Greek alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 阿尔法〔希腊字母表的第一个字母﹐即A﹐α〕

Sense.DEF: the start and finish of something, and therefore the whole of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Collective bargaining was viewed as the alpha and omega of trade unionism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 集体谈判被视为工会主义的全部法宝。

Sense.DEF: a set of letters, arranged in a particular order, and used in writing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the international phonetic alphabet
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际音标

Sense.DEF: relating to the alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 字母表的﹔按照字母顺序的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The files are arranged in alphabetical order .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件按字母顺序排列。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些记录是以字母顺序归档的吗？

Sense.DEF: to arrange things in order according to the letters of the alphabet

a teenage girl who is the most important and powerful member of a group of girls who regularly spend time together. Alpha girls are typically confident, attractive, and determined to be successful. Often used humorously.
Sense.TRAN: 阿尔法女孩〔一群女孩子中最有魅力和威信的女孩﹔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
the male with the highest rank in a group of animals such as
chimpanzee s
Sense.TRAN: 雄性头领〔黑猩猩等动物群体中地位最高的雄性动物〕

Sense.DEF: the man who has the most power and influence and the highest social position in a particular group – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 阿尔法男性〔某一群体中最有权势和影响力的男子﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: using letters and numbers
Sense.TRAN: 字母数字（混合）的﹔文数（式）的
Sense.EXAMPLE: alphanumeric codes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 字母数字（混合）代码

Sense.DEF:
an
atomic particle
consisting of two
proton s
and two
neutron s
that is sent out by some
radioactive
substances
Sense.TRAN: α粒子﹐阿尔法粒子〔包含两个质子和两个中子﹐由某些放射性物质释放〕

Sense.DEF: a test of software to see if it works properly, done by the company that is writing the software
Sense.TRAN: 〔软件公司对所编写软件进行的〕内测﹐阿尔法测试﹐第一阶段测试

Sense.DEF: software that is being tested by the company that is writing it, to see if it works properly

relating to the Alps
a mountain range in central Europe
or to mountains in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: breathtaking alpine scenery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人叹为观止的阿尔卑斯山风景
Sense.EXAMPLE: alpine flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高山花卉
Sense.EXAMPLE: alpine skiing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高山滑雪

Sense.DEF: before now, or before a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 已经〔表示在此之前或某个特定时间之前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The design of the new house is similar to those that have already been built.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新房的设计与那些已建好的房子相似。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The performance had already started when we arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到达时表演已经开始了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has been done before and does not need doing again
Sense.TRAN: 已经〔表示已做过某事﹐不必再做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You already told me that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经告诉过我那件事了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Fancy a coffee?’ ‘No thanks, I already have one.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “想来杯咖啡吗？”“不了﹐谢谢﹐我已经有一杯了。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has happened too soon or before the expected time
Sense.TRAN: 已经〔表示太早发生或比预期快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you eaten all that food already?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经把所有的食物都吃完了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it 5 o'clock already?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经5点了？

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation exists and it might get worse, greater etc
Sense.TRAN: 已经〔表示某种情况存在﹐而且可能进一步恶化﹑严重等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurry up, we’re already late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐我们已经迟到了。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
all right
that some people think is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: all right的另一种拼法〔有些人认为是错的〕

Sense.DEF: a large dog, often used by the police or to guard places
Sense.TRAN: 阿尔萨斯狼狗﹐德国牧羊犬（常用作警犬或用于守卫）

Sense.DEF: in addition to something else that you have mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Information is also available on women’s health care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还可以获得有关女性保健方面的资料。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sings beautifully and also plays the flute and piano.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她歌唱得好﹐而且还会吹长笛和弹钢琴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system was not only complicated but also ineffective.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套系统不仅复杂而且效率低。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, avoid starting a sentence with also . Use furthermore or moreover instead, or put also before the main verb
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐句子不要用also开头﹐而要用furthermore或moreover﹐或者把also放在主要动词之前

Sense.DEF: used to say that the same thing is true about another person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: My girlfriend was also called Helen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的女朋友也叫海伦。

Sense.DEF: someone who fails to win a competition, election etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛﹑选举等的〕失败者﹐落选者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten months ago he was just an also-ran for the Democratic nomination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十个月前他只是个竞选民主党候选人提名的落败者。

Sense.DEF: a holy table or surface used in religious ceremonies
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a crucifix above the high altar
the main altar in a church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主圣坛上方的耶稣受难像
Sense.EXAMPLE: The victim was tied to a sacrificial altar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牺牲被绑在祭坛上。

Sense.DEF: the area furthest from the entrance of a church, where the priest or minister stands
a boy who helps a Catholic priest during a church service
Sense.TRAN: 〔天主教神父的〕辅祭男童﹐祭坛侍者

Sense.DEF:
a painting or
sculpture
behind an altar
Sense.TRAN: 〔圣坛背壁的〕圣坛装饰画﹐圣坛雕刻

Sense.DEF: to change, or to make someone or something change
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了这么多年﹐她的容貌并没有多大改变。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The city centre has altered beyond recognition
changed very much
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心变得都认不出来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有责任帮助难民﹐这一事实无法改变。

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of clothing longer, wider etc so that it fits

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had the dress altered for the wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让人把礼服改一下婚礼上穿。

Sense.DEF: a small change that makes someone or something slightly different, or the process of this change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you make alterations to the Windows setup, save the new settings before closing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果更改了视窗操作系统的设置﹐关闭前要保存新的设置。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you noticed any alteration in the patient’s behaviour?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有注意到病人的行为有什么改变？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The King’s Arms pub is to undergo extensive alterations .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王纹章酒馆将要大变样了。

Sense.DEF: a short noisy argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: They became involved in an altercation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们争辩了起来。

Sense.DEF: an invented person that you use to represent part of your character that is very different from your usual one
Sense.TRAN: 某人的第二自我﹐某人个性的另一面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gissing used his fictional alter ego to attack Victorian morals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉辛用小说中的第二自我抨击维多利亚时代的道德观。

Sense.DEF: someone you trust and who has similar opinions, attitudes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Reagan was widely regarded as the President’s alter ego.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里根夫人被普遍认为是里根总统的知己。

Sense.DEF: if something happens on alternate days, weeks etc, it happens on one day etc and not the next, and continues in this pattern

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The service runs on alternate days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个服务机构隔天开放一次。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, instead of alternate days/Fridays/weeks etc, people usually use the phrase every other day/Friday/week etc
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般用every other day/Friday/week等短语﹐而不用alternate days/Fridays/weeks等
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每隔一个星期的周六见面。

Sense.DEF: two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: alternate blue and red stripes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝红相间的条纹
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arrange the leeks and noodles in alternate layers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一层韭葱﹑一层面条地交替放置。

Sense.DEF: used to replace another thing of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: the appointment of an alternate director
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位候补董事的任命

Sense.DEF: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She alternated between outrage and sympathy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她时而义愤填膺﹐时而同情感伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Periods of depression alternate with excited behavior.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沮丧与兴奋交替出现。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Twist your body, alternating right and left stretches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 扭动身体﹐向左向右交替伸展。

Sense.DEF: a flow of electricity that changes direction regularly and quickly
an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead
Sense.TRAN: 可替代的﹔另外的﹔两者择一的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: alternative approaches to learning
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他的学习方法
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you any alternative suggestions ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有别的建议？

Sense.EXAMPLE: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

Sense.DEF: deliberately different from what is usual, expected, or traditional

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tucson’s alternative radio station
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图森的非传统广播电台

Sense.EXAMPLE:
sources of alternative energy
energy produced by the sun, wind etc rather than by gas, coal etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 替代能源
Sense.EXAMPLE: tolerance of alternative lifestyles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对另类生活方式的包容

GramExa.GLOSS: medical treatment that is not based on the usual western methods
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Acupuncture is widely used by practitioners of alternative medicine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 针灸疗法被非西方传统医学从业者广泛利用。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: You can relax on the beach or alternatively try the bustling town centre.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在沙滩上休息﹐或者也可以逛逛热闹的镇中心。

Sense.DEF: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there a viable alternative to the present system?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有切实可行的制度能够替代现行体制？

Sense.EXAMPLE: If payment is not received legal action will be our only alternative .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果收不到付款﹐我们只能采取法律行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no alternative but to report him to the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了向警方举报他﹐我别无选择。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quickly assessed what alternatives were open to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迅速估计了一下还有哪些办法可以采用。

Sense.DEF: the way that someone lives their life, when this is not the usual way that other people live
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people say schools need to teach tolerance of alternative lifestyles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人说﹐学校要教育学生学会包容非传统的生活方式。

Sense.DEF:
an object that produces an
alternating current
, especially in a car
used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管身体不好﹐她仍继续执行任务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金﹐但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气﹐却并不赞成他的方法。

Sense.DEF: used to add a statement that balances or reduces the effect of what you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can copy down my answers, although I’m not sure they’re right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以抄我的答案﹐但是我不敢肯定我答得是否正确。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, this is my responsibility, although I appreciate your offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用了﹐这是我的责任﹐不过谢谢你的好意。

Sense.DEF: an instrument in an aircraft that tells you how high you are
the height of an object or place above the sea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re flying at an altitude of 40,000 feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的飞行高度为四万英尺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At high altitudes it is difficult to get enough oxygen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在海拔高的地方很难呼吸到足够的氧气。

Sense.DEF:
an alto instrument or voice produces notes at the second highest level, below a
soprano
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alto sax
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中音萨克斯管

Sense.DEF:
a singing voice that is lower than a
soprano
, or a singer with a voice like this
the part of a musical work that is written for an alto voice or instrument
used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely
Sense.TRAN: 完全﹐全部〔用于强调完成或结束〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old custom that has vanished altogether
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个彻底消亡的古老习俗
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress could ban the procession altogether.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会可以完全禁止这次游行。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the way you describe something is completely true
Sense.TRAN: 十分﹐全然〔用于强调对某事物的描述属实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Canada, the situation is altogether different.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在加拿大﹐情况完全不一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This latest problem is altogether more serious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一最新问题实在是严重多了。

GramExa.GLOSS: not completely
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t altogether happy about Mike staying over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对迈克在这里过夜并不十分高兴。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The results were not altogether surprising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果并不完全出人意料。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are referring to the total amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were five people altogether.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总共有五个人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much do I owe you altogether?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总共欠你多少钱？

Sense.DEF: used to make a final statement about several things you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lots of sunshine, wonderful food, and amazing nightlife – altogether a great vacation!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充沛的阳光﹐可口的食物﹐美妙的夜生活——总而言之﹐这是个完美的假期！

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several of the men were parading around in the altogether.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中有几个男人正一丝不挂地在走来走去。

Sense.DEF: when you care about or help other people, even though this brings no advantage to yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many choose to work in developing countries out of altruism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人无私地选择在发展中国家工作。

Sense.DEF: altruistic behaviour shows that you care about and will help other people, even though this brings no advantage for yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Were his motives entirely altruistic?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的动机是完全无私的吗？

Sense.DEF: a former student of a school, college etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Crawford High alum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克劳福德高中的一位校友

Sense.DEF:
a silver-white metal that is very light and is used to make cans, cooking pans, window frames etc. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Al
Sense.TRAN: 铝〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Al〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: recycled aluminium cans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再生铝罐

Sense.DEF: a woman who is a former student of a school, college etc
the former students of a school, college etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the University alumni association
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学校友会

Sense.DEF: a former student of a school, college etc

a
consonant
sound such as /
t
/ or /
d
/ that you make by putting the end of your tongue behind your upper front teeth
all the time, at all times, or every time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always lock your bicycle to something secure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次都要把自行车锁在牢固的物体上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d always assumed that Gabriel was a girl’s name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直认为加布里埃尔是个女孩名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hadn’t always been a butler.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他并不是一直当管家。

Sense.DEF: for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always wanted to go to Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直都想去巴黎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s always been keen on music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰一直喜爱音乐。

Sense.DEF: for ever
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll always remember that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会永远记住那一天。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is always doing something, they do it often, especially in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: That woman next door’s always complaining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁的那个女人老是抱怨个不停。

Sense.DEF: used to say that one important fact has to be accepted as true for something else to happen, be true etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll leave on Tuesday – always assuming the car’s repaired by then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期二出发——当然前提是那时车子已经修好。

Sense.DEF: as is usual or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truth, as always, is more complicated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同料想的一样﹐真相更为复杂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As always, Deborah was the last to arrive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同往常一样﹐德博拉又是最后一个到。

Sense.DEF: used to make a polite suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 总还能做某事﹐总还有某物〔用于礼貌地建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could always try ringing again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你再打个电话试试总是可以的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can’t get it locally, there’s always the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你在当地买不到﹐总还有因特网呢。

Sense.DEF: used to say you are not surprised by what someone has done because it is typical of them
Sense.TRAN: 某人一贯幸运/衣冠不整等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You always were a stubborn creature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这家伙一贯顽固。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a troublemaker! Always was and always will be!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是个惹祸精！以前一向如此﹐以后也改不了！

Exponent.DEF: all the time, at all times, or every time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I will always love you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会永远爱你。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He always carries his medicine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是药不离身。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People will always need houses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们永远都会有住房需求。

Exponent.DEF: if something lasts or continues forever, it remains or continues for all future time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nothing lasts forever.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么是永世长存的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He seemed to think he would live forever.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像认为自己会长生不老。

Exponent.DEF: always, or for a very long time – used about changes that you expect to last forever. Permanently can be used with a verb or with an adjective
Exponent.TRAN: 永久地﹐长久地〔可与动词或形容词连用﹐以形容改变〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His eyesight may be permanently damaged.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的视力可能永久受损。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They decided to move to Portugal permanently.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定去葡萄牙永久定居。

Exponent.DEF: for the rest of your life
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Marriage is supposed to be for life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻应该是一辈子的事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was sent to jail for life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判终身监禁。

Exponent.DEF: forever – used to talk about a permanent change
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This time, he’s coming back for good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这次回来再也不走了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Once a species dies out, it is gone for good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个物种一旦灭绝就永远消失了。

Exponent.DEF: forever – used when saying that something will last or be remembered forever because it is very good or special
Exponent.TRAN: 永远〔表示某事物因非常好或特殊而将永远存在或被人永远记住〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their deeds will be remembered for all time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的事迹将被永远铭记。

Exponent.DEF: for the rest of your life – used when something has affected you very deeply
Exponent.TRAN: 至死﹐终身〔表示受到某事物的极大影响〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll remember what he said to my dying day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我至死都不会忘记他说的话。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Always usually comes before the verb, unless the verb is a simple tense of ‘be’, or after the first auxiliary
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果动词不是be的一般式﹐always一般位于动词之前﹐或第一个助动词之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I always wanted to be an engineer.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前一直想当工程师。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He is always cheerful.
The British education system has always been considered one of the best in the world.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的教育体制一向被认为是世界上最好的教育体制之一。
F2NBox.HEADING: always, still
F2NBox.EXPL: Use still , not always, to say that a previous situation has not changed, and is continuing at the time of speaking
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示先前的状况没有改变﹐而且在说话的这一刻仍在继续﹐要用still﹐而不用always
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He still lives (NOT always lives) with his parents.

Sense.DEF: a disease that affects the brain, especially of old people, and that gradually makes it difficult to move, talk, or remember things
Sense.TRAN: 阿尔茨海默病﹐早老性痴呆病

Sense.DEF:
the first person singular of the present tense of the verb
be
Sense.TRAN: 〔动词be的第一人称单数现在式〕

Sense.DEF:
used to talk about times that are after
midnight
but before
midday
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work starts at 9 am.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上午 9 点开始上班。

Sense.DEF: a system used for broadcasting radio programmes

an organization in the US for doctors and people who do medical
research
. There is a similar organization in the UK called the BMA (British Medical Association).
Sense.TRAN: 美国医学会〔美国医生和医学研究工作者的组织。 英国也有类似机构称为BMA〕

Sense.DEF: a mixture of different things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an amalgam of different styles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同风格的混合体

Sense.DEF: if two organizations amalgamate, or if one amalgamates with another, they join and make one big organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The agency is expected to amalgamate with the National Rivers Authority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机构预计会与国家河流管理局合并。

Sense.DEF: to combine two or more things together to make one thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stir until the ingredients are amalgamated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搅拌至配料完全混合。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The editors will amalgamate all the information into one article.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 编辑将把所有的资料汇编成一篇文章。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to write down what someone else says
if you amass money, knowledge, information etc, you gradually collect a large amount of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: For 25 years, Darwin amassed evidence to support his theories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 25年间﹐达尔文收集了大量证据来支持自己的理论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He amassed a fortune after the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐他积累了大量财富。

Sense.DEF: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gifted amateur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有天赋的业余爱好者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

Sense.DEF: someone who you think is not very skilled at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You English are a bunch of amateurs when it comes to romance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈情说爱你们英国人就外行了。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: producing or acting in plays as an interest

Sense.DEF: not skilfully done or made
Sense.EXAMPLE: His paintings are rather amateurish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的画作水平相当业余。

Sense.DEF: expressing sexual or romantic love
to surprise someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave amazed his friends by suddenly getting married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫突然结婚﹐令朋友们非常吃惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It still amazes me how much she has improved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她进步很大﹐至今仍让我惊讶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It never ceased to amaze him that women were attracted to Sam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直很惊讶﹐竟然有女人喜欢萨姆。

Sense.DEF: very surprised

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m amazed you’ve never heard of the Rolling Stones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很惊讶﹐你居然从未听说过滚石乐队。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’d be amazed how much money you can save.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会很惊讶自己竟然能省这么多钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were absolutely amazed at his rapid recovery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这么快就康复真让我们惊讶不已。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Visitors are often amazed to discover how little the town has changed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客常常惊奇地发现这个小城几乎没有什么变化。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great surprise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ralph gasped in amazement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫吃惊得倒抽了一口气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To everyone’s amazement, the goal was disallowed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令大家吃惊的是﹐进球被判无效。

Sense.DEF: very good, especially in an unexpected way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an amazing player to watch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看他比赛那才叫精彩呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an amazing bargain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人惊喜的便宜货

Sense.DEF: so surprising you can hardly believe it
Sense.TRAN: 令人惊诧的﹐让人难以相信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s amazing how often you see drivers using mobile phones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常常看到司机在打手机﹐真让人难以置信。

Sense.DEF: a strong tall woman
an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the US ambassador to Spain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国驻西班牙大使

Sense.DEF: someone who represents a particular sport, business etc because they behave in a way that people admire
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育项目﹑行业等的〕代表人物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has made some good films and he is a good ambassador for the industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍摄过一些好电影﹐是这个行业的杰出代表。

Sense.DEF: a yellowish brown colour
a hard yellowish brown substance used to make jewellery
Sense.EXAMPLE: an amber necklace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琥珀项链

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
ambience
able to use either hand equally well
the qualities and character of a particular place and the way these make you feel

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The restaurant’s new owners have created a welcoming ambience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐厅的新主人营造出一种舒适的气氛。

Sense.DEF: the temperature etc of the surrounding area
a type of modern music or sound that is slow, peaceful, and does not have a formal structure

advertising that is present on objects that are not usually expected to have advertising, for example on a train ticket or a
receipt
Sense.TRAN: 周边广告﹐非主流广告〔例如印在火车票或收据上的广告〕

Sense.DEF: the state of being unclear, confusing, or not certain, or things that produce this effect
Sense.TRAN: 模棱两可﹔不明确（的事物）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an element of ambiguity in the president’s reply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的回答有点模棱两可。

Sense.EXAMPLE: legal ambiguities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律上含混不清的地方

Sense.DEF: something that is ambiguous is unclear, confusing, or not certain, especially because it can be understood in more than one way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The legislation had been ambiguously worded .

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people also use the phrase you can take sth two ways instead of saying it is ambiguous
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们也会用短语you can take sth two ways来代替ambiguous
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ You can take what she says two ways .

Sense.DEF: the range or limit of someone’s authority, influence etc

GramExa.PROPFORM: fall within the ambit of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: areas falling within the ambit of our research
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 属于我们研究范围的领域

Sense.DEF: a strong desire to achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had always had an ambition to be a pilot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直渴望当飞行员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An injury ended his ambitions of becoming a professional footballer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次受伤使得他当职业足球员的理想落空了。

Sense.DEF: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was young and full of ambition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻﹐而且雄心勃勃。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have no ambition to do sth
Sense.DEF: used when saying that you definitely do not want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no ambition to go back there again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我压根儿不想再回那里。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.COLLOC: sb’s ambition is to be/do sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My ambition was to be a journalist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的理想是当新闻记者。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had an ambition to be a top cello player.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他曾立志成为最优秀的大提琴演奏家。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what you wanted to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took her ten years to achieve her ambition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她花了十年时间实现自己的理想。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many of the students lack ambition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生都胸无大志。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have it for a long time, especially secretly
prevent someone from achieving them

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s your main ambition in life?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一生中最大的理想是什么？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He didn’t achieve his greatest ambition – to be Wimbledon Champion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有实现自己的伟大理想——成为温布尔登锦标赛冠军。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you have had all your life
a very strong ambition

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He told her all about his dreams and ambitions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把自己的理想和抱负全部向她倾诉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was frustrated by their apparent lack of ambition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们明显胸无大志﹐这让我很懊丧。

Sense.DEF: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc
Sense.TRAN: 有抱负的﹐有雄心的﹔野心勃勃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃﹐一心想着发财。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
mothers who are highly ambitious for their children
who want their children to be successful
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 望子成龙的母亲

Sense.DEF: an ambitious plan, idea etc shows a desire to do something good but difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ambitious engineering project
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宏伟的工程项目
Sense.EXAMPLE: an over-ambitious health reform program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒进的医疗改革计划

Sense.DEF: not sure whether you want or like something or not

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are both somewhat ambivalent about having a child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们两人对于生孩子这件事心情都有点矛盾。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: O'Neill had a genuine ambivalence toward US involvement in the war.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于美国参战﹐奥尼尔内心很矛盾。

Sense.DEF: to walk slowly in a relaxed way
Sense.EXAMPLE: An old man came out and ambled over for a chat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个老人出来﹐缓步走过去聊天。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a pleasant amble by the river

Sense.DEF: food or drink that tastes very good
a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ambulance service

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ambulance crew removed him from the wreckage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护车上的人员将他从残骸中移出来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the ambulance service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护车服务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike had to be taken by ambulance to hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得不用救护车把迈克送往医院。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Do you think we need to call an ambulance
phone to ask an ambulance to come
?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

Sense.DEF:
a lawyer who uses a lot of pressure to persuade someone who has been hurt in an accident to
sue
other people or companies in court, so that the lawyer will get part of the money if they win – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 怂恿事故受害者诉讼的律师﹐靠交通事故赚钱的律师〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a sudden attack on someone by people who have been hiding and waiting for them, or the place where this happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were killed in an ambush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些士兵遭伏击身亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In winter the danger of ambush is much reduced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天﹐遭伏击的危险大大减少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Armed police lay in ambush behind the hedge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装警察埋伏在树篱后面。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Everybody thought our train would be ambushed, but we got out safely.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都认为我们的火车会遭伏击﹐但是我们安全地出来了。

Sense.DEF:
an American spelling of
amoeba
to make a bad situation better or less harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is not clear what can be done to ameliorate the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以采取什么办法来改善局面并不明确。

Sense.DEF: a word used to end a prayer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blessed be the Lord, Amen!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞美主﹐阿门！
Sense.EXAMPLE: McAllister murmured a fervent amen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦卡利斯特充满热情地低声说了句“阿门”。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree with a suggestion or remark
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think we can close the meeting now.’ ‘Amen to that.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我认为我们现在可以散会了。”“同意。”

Sense.DEF: willing to accept what someone says or does without arguing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was always a very amenable child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一向是个很听话的孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young people are more amenable than older citizens to the idea of immigration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人较年老公民更易接受移民的想法。

Sense.DEF: suitable for a particular type of treatment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such conditions may be amenable to medical intervention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些疾病也许可以采取药物干预。

Sense.DEF: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law was amended to include women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该法律经修改把女性也包括在内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The defendant later amended his evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告后来修改了证词。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Steve stole it – or rather borrowed it,’ he amended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “史蒂夫偷的——应该说是借的。”他改口道。

Sense.DEF: a small change, improvement, or addition that is made to a law or document, or the process of doing this
Sense.EXAMPLE: constitutional amendments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宪法修正案

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an amendment to the resolution
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对决议的修订

Sense.DEF: to do something to show you are sorry for hurting or upsetting someone, especially something that makes it better for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seized the chance to make amends for his behavior.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓住机会补救他的行为。

Sense.DEF: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该酒店位于市中心﹐紧邻商店和当地的便利设施。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
houses that lack basic amenities
basic things that people need, such as heat and running water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏基本生活设施的房屋

Sense.DEF: someone from Asia who has one American parent and one Asian parent
relating to the US or its people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother is American.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妈妈是美国人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a famous American writer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位著名的美国作家

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is as American as apple pie
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very typically American
someone from the US

objects that are considered to be typical of the US, especially when they are in a
collection
Sense.TRAN: 典型美国物品〔尤指收藏品〕﹔美国文物
Sense.EXAMPLE: 1940s Americana
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪40年代的美国文物

Sense.DEF:
the idea that the US is a place where everyone has the chance of becoming rich and successful. Many
immigrant s
to the US in the early 20th century believed in the American Dream.
Sense.TRAN: 美国梦〔认为在美国人人都有成功机会的观点〕

Sense.DEF:
a game played in the US by two teams of eleven players, who carry, throw, or kick an
oval
ball

PIC.HEADING: AMERICAN FOOTBALL 美式橄榄球运动
PIC.PICCONTENT: a punt 碰踢；a tackle 擒抱；a fumble 丢球；goalpost 球门柱；quarterback 四分卫；goal line 球门线；end zone 球门区；a place kick 定踢；receive 接球；a pass 传球

Sense.DEF:
another name for a
Native American
someone who belongs to one of the races that lived in North America before Europeans arrived
a word or phrase that is typically used in American English
to change a society, language, system etc so that it becomes more American in character

one of two groups of professional baseball teams that make up the highest level of baseball in the US and Canada. Every year, the team that wins in this
league
plays against the winning team of the National League in the World Series.
Sense.TRAN: 美国棒球联盟〔美国和加拿大的两个职业棒球联盟之一﹐其年度冠军与国家联盟的胜者之间举行世界职业棒球锦标赛〕

Sense.DEF: a set of beliefs or values that many Americans hold but which are not laws or written down in any form
Sense.TRAN: 美国方式〔指许多美国人持有的一套信念和价值观〕

Sense.DEF: a sailing competition held every three or four years, in which teams from the US, Australia, and other nations compete. It is the most important yacht race in the world.
Sense.TRAN: 美国杯〔世界上最重要的帆船比赛﹐每三到四年举办一次〕

Sense.DEF:
a
patriotic
song which most people in the US learn when they are children
Sense.TRAN: 《美丽的阿美利加》〔美国的一首爱国歌曲〕

Sense.DEF: a valuable purple stone used in jewellery
a light purple colour
friendly and easy to like
Sense.TRAN: 和蔼可亲的﹐友善的﹐亲切的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver was an amiable young man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机是位友善的年轻人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in an amiable mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心情很好。

Sense.DEF: an amicable agreement, relationship etc is one in which people feel friendly towards each other and do not want to quarrel
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their relationship hasn’t always been amicable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的关系不是一直都很和睦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two parties have reached an amicable settlement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方已达成和解。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: In the end, the matter was resolved amicably.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐这件事心平气和地解决了。

Sense.DEF: while noisy, busy, or confused events are happening – used in writing or news reports
Sense.TRAN: 在〔嘈杂﹑纷乱的事件〕中〔用于书面语或新闻报道中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dollar has fallen in value amid rumors of weakness in the US economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一片美国经济疲软的传言中﹐美元贬值了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demonstrators ripped up the national flag amid shouts of ‘Death to the tyrants!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威者在“处死暴君！”的叫喊声中将国旗撕得粉碎。

Sense.DEF: among or surrounded by things
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat amid the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在树丛中。

Sense.DEF: in the middle part of a ship
amid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a light that shines amidst the darkness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑暗之中闪现的一道亮光

Sense.DEF:
one of the substances that combine to form
protein s

Sense.TRAN: 阿曼门诺派〔美国宾夕法尼亚及俄亥俄州的基督教团体﹐他们恪守传统生活方式﹐摒绝电话﹑汽车等现代发明〕

Sense.DEF: if something is amiss, there is a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elsa continued as if nothing was amiss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔莎若无其事地继续下去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s something amiss in their relationship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的关系有点不对劲。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something would be suitable or useful in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cup of tea wouldn’t go amiss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来杯茶准没错。

Sense.DEF: to feel upset or offended about something that someone has said or done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t take it amiss – I was just teasing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别见怪﹐我只是逗你玩呢。

Sense.DEF: friendship, especially between countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spirit of perfect amity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲善无间的精神

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to measure the strength of an electric current
ammunition
a clear liquid with a strong bad smell that is used for cleaning or in cleaning products

a poisonous gas with a strong bad smell that is used in making many chemicals,
fertilizer s
etc

an
extinct
sea creature with a
spiral
shell that can be found as a
fossil
Sense.TRAN: 菊石〔已灭绝的海洋生物﹐现只有化石〕

Sense.DEF: information that you can use to criticize someone or win an argument against them
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于批评或辩论中攻击他人的〕把柄﹐弹药﹐证据

GramExa.PROPFORM: give sb ammunition/provide sb with ammunition
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His mistakes provided political opponents with even more ammunition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的过失授给政敌更多的把柄。

Sense.DEF: the medical condition of not being able to remember anything
an official order by a government that allows a particular group of prisoners to go free

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government granted an amnesty for all former terrorists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政府大赦了所有前恐怖分子。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when you can admit to doing something illegal without being punished
Sense.TRAN: 赦免期〔在此期间交代罪行可以免受处罚〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an amnesty on illegal handguns
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交出非法持有手枪的赦免期

Sense.DEF:
a test to see if an unborn baby has a disease or other problem, done by taking liquid from the mother’s
womb
Sense.TRAN: 羊膜腔穿刺术〔抽取孕妇子宫羊水以检查胎儿是否患病等〕

Sense.DEF: the liquid that surrounds and protects a baby when it is growing inside its mother's body
a very small creature that has only one cell
Sense.TRAN: 变形虫﹐阿米巴〔极小的单细胞生物〕

Subsense.DEF: to suddenly behave in a very violent and uncontrolled way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Drunken troops ran amok in the town.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝醉酒的士兵在镇上撒野。

Subsense.DEF: to get out of control and cause a lot of problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an age in which global capitalism has run amok
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球资本主义大行其道的时代

Sense.DEF: in or through the middle of a group of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl quickly disappeared among the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩转眼消失在人群中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear voices coming from somewhere among the bushes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能听到灌木丛中某个地方传来说话的声音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked among the chestnut woods on the mountain slopes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走在山坡上的栗树林中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She began rummaging among the books on her desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始在桌子上的一堆书中乱翻起来。

Sense.DEF: with a particular group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim relaxed, knowing he was among friends .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆知道周围都是朋友﹐放松了下来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that many people in a group have the same feeling or opinion, or that something affects many people in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem is causing widespread concern among scientists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该问题在科学家中引起广泛关注。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general opinion among police officers was that the law should be tightened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察普遍认为这条法律应该制定得更加严厉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The changes will mean 7,000 job losses among railway workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变革意味着铁路工人中将有7,000人失业。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular person, thing, or group as belonging to a larger group
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the eldest among them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是他们当中年纪最大的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Innocent civilians were among the casualties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死伤者中有无辜平民。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandfather had among his possessions a portrait by Matisse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖父有一幅马蒂斯画的肖像画。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Representatives were chosen by the students from among themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表由学生内部选举产生。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are only mentioning one or two people or things out of a much larger group
Sense.TRAN: 除了其他东西/地方/因素等
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the meeting they discussed, among other things, recent events in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会上除其他议题外﹐他们还讨论了日本近来发生的事件。

Sense.DEF: if something is divided or shared among a group of people, each person is given a part of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A father’s property was divided among his heirs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲的财产在继承人之间分配。

Sense.DEF: with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The allies found it hard to agree among themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盟友发现他们内部很难达成一致意见。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法:among, between
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are talking about position, use among if there are more than two people or things around someone or something, and between if there is just one person or thing on each side
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示所处的位置时﹐如果某人或某物周围有两个以上的人或物﹐要用among﹔如果每边只有一个人或物﹐要用between
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They hid among the reeds.
I put my bag on the ground between my feet.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把包放在地上﹐夹在双脚之间。
F2NBox.EXPL: Among is not commonly used after words such as 'relationship' and 'difference', even when more than two people or things are involved. Use between
F2NBox.TRAN: 即使有两个以上的人或物﹐在relationship﹐difference等词之后通常也不用among﹐而用between
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the relationship between these three sectors of the economy
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这三个经济领域之间的关系

Sense.DEF: having no moral standards at all
Sense.TRAN: 毫无道德观念的﹐没有道德的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a completely amoral person
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无道德观念的人

Sense.DEF: showing or concerning sexual love
Sense.EXAMPLE: She resisted his amorous advances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝了他的挑逗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was always boasting about his amorous adventures .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是吹嘘自己的风流韵事。

Sense.DEF: having no definite shape or features
Sense.TRAN: 无固定形状的﹐不定形的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an amorphous mass of twisted metal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆扭曲变形的金属

Sense.DEF: to pay a debt by making regular payments
a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They spend equal amounts of time in California and New York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在加利福尼亚和纽约待的时间同样长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a considerable amount of money
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大笔钱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tiny amount of dirt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点点灰尘

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Please pay the full amount
of money
by the end of the month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请在月底前全额付清。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about how much there is of a feeling or quality

GramExa.PROPFORM: a large/considerable etc amount of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her case has attracted an enormous amount of public sympathy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的情况得到了无数民众的同情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dina encountered a fair amount of envy among her colleagues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪娜遭到不少同事的嫉妒。

Sense.LEXUNIT: no amount of sth can/will etc do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that something has no effect
Sense.TRAN: 即使再多[再大]…也毫无结果[毫无影响]
Sense.EXAMPLE: No amount of persuasion could make her change her mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么劝也无法让她改变主意。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is plenty of something, and no more is needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school has any amount of resources and equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校拥有充足的资源和设备。

Exponent.DEF: how much of something there is
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Try to reduce the amount of fat in your diet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量减少饮食中的脂肪摄入量。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tiny amount of poison
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 微量毒药

Exponent.DEF: a particular amount of food, liquid, or another substance that can be measured – used especially in written descriptions and instructions
Exponent.TRAN: 数量〔指食物﹑液体等﹐尤用于书面介绍和用法说明〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Make sure that you add the right quantity of milk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要加入适量的牛奶。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They buy the wood in large quantities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们大批购买这种木材。

Exponent.DEF: the amount of something such as business activity or traffic, especially when this is large or increasing
Exponent.TRAN: 量〔指商业活动﹑交通等﹐尤表示量很大或持续增加〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The volume of traffic on our roads has risen sharply.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的道路交通量已急剧增加。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the huge volume of trade with China
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 和中国之间的巨大贸易量

Exponent.DEF: the exact amount of something at one time, which can go up or down at other times
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They measured the level of alcohol in his blood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们检测了他血液中的酒精含量。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is a high level of unemployment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率很高。

Exponent.DEF: the amount of something, compared with the whole amount that exists
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the proportion of road accidents caused by drunk drivers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒后驾车导致的交通事故的比例
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A high proportion of the students were from poor families.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分学生来自贫困家庭。

Exponent.DEF: a maximum amount of something that can be produced, sold, brought into a country etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: import quotas on Japanese cars
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本汽车的进口配额

Exponent.DEF: the amount of something that is produced, especially crops
Exponent.EXAMPLE: this year’s cotton yield
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的棉花产量

Sense.DEF: if figures, sums etc amount to a particular total, they equal that total when they are added together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time lost through illness amounted to 1,357 working days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因疾病而损失的时间总计为1,357个工作日。

Sense.DEF: if an attitude, remark, situation etc amounts to something, it has the same effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court’s decision amounts to a not guilty verdict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭的裁决等于是宣判无罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ultimately, their ideas amount to the same thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 归根结底﹐他们的想法都是一回事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not amount to much/anything/a great deal etc
Sense.DEF: to not be important, valuable, or successful
Sense.TRAN: 没多少意义[价值﹐成就等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her academic achievements don’t amount to much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的学习成绩不怎么样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim’s never going to amount to much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆永远不会有多大出息。

Sense.DEF: a sexual relationship, especially a secret one
a unit for measuring electric current
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 3 amp fuse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三安培的保险丝

Sense.DEF:
an
amplifier
the sign ‘&’ that means ‘and’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mills & Boon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米尔斯和布恩〔出版公司名〕

Sense.DEF: a drug that gives you a feeling of excitement and a lot of energy
Sense.TRAN: 苯丙胺﹐安非他明〔一种兴奋剂〕

Sense.DEF:
an animal such as a
frog
that can live both on land and in water
able to live both on land and in water
Sense.EXAMPLE: amphibious creatures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两栖生物

Sense.DEF: a vehicle that is able to move both on land and in water
an amphibious operation etc involves both sea and land vehicles
a large circular building without a roof and with many rows of seats
a tall clay container for oil or wine, used in ancient times
more than enough

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll have ample time for questions later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍后你们会有充裕的时间来提问。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is ample evidence that climate patterns are changing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有足够的证据表明气候模式正在改变。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She found ample room for her things in the wardrobe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现衣柜里有足够的空间摆放自己的东西。

Sense.DEF: large in a way that is attractive or pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ample bosom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰满的胸部

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Recent US history has amply demonstrated the risks of foreign intervention.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国近代历史已经充分证明了对外干预的危险。

Sense.DEF: a piece of electrical equipment that makes sound louder
to make sound louder, especially musical sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: an amplified guitar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

Sense.DEF: to increase the effects or strength of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: These stories only amplified her fears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些故事徒增了她的恐惧感。

Sense.DEF: to explain something that you have said by giving more information about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you care to amplify that remark?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把那句话解释一下好吗？

Sense.DEF:
the distance between the middle and the top or bottom of a
wave
such as a
sound wave
a small container for medicine that will be put into someone with a special needle
to cut off someone’s arm, leg, finger etc during a medical operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of her toes were amputated because of frostbite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的两个脚趾因为冻伤被截掉了。

Sense.DEF: someone who has had an arm or a leg amputated
a small piece of jewellery worn to protect against bad luck, disease etc
Sense.TRAN: 护身符﹐驱邪物〔为驱邪﹑防病等佩戴的小件珠宝〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone laugh or smile
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question seemed to amuse him in some way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题似乎不知怎么把他给逗乐了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it amuses sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It amused me to think back to my life in London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回想起在伦敦的生活﹐我不禁笑了起来。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say they think something is funny rather than say that it amuses them
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说they think something is funny﹐而不说it amuses them
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ They thought the joke was really funny .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们觉得那笑话真是好笑。

Sense.DEF: to make time pass in an enjoyable way, so that you do not get bored
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

Sense.DEF: if you are amused by something, you think it is funny and you smile or laugh

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ellen seemed amused by the whole situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦似乎对整个情况感到好笑。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
I could see she was highly amused
very amused
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出她开心极了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man looked a little amused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男子看上去有点被逗乐了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He won’t be very amused
he will be annoyed
when he finds out what’s happened to his garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当他发现自己花园遭的殃﹐他会很生气。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 愉悦的微笑/神情/表情等

Sense.DEF: to entertain or interest someone for a long time so that they do not get bored
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were puzzles and games to keep the children amused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有拼图玩具和其他游戏供小孩子玩乐。

Sense.DEF: the feeling you have when you think something is funny

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her eyes sparkled with amusement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛里闪烁着笑意。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked at him in amusement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她乐呵呵地看着他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve couldn’t hide his amusement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫忍俊不禁。

GramExa.GLOSS: in a way that makes someone laugh or smile
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were dancing and singing in the car, much to the amusement of passers-by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在车里又唱又跳﹐让路人感到十分有趣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The cats are a constant source of amusement to us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些猫给我们带来无穷的乐趣。

Subsense.DEF: things that entertain you and make time pass in an enjoyable way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: childhood amusements
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿时的游戏

Subsense.DEF:
special machines or games that are intended to entertain people, for example at a
fair
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The kids can ride on the amusements.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们可以乘坐这些游乐设施。

Sense.DEF: the process of getting or providing pleasure and enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you do for amusement in this town?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们镇上有什么消遣？

Sense.DEF: a place where you play games on machines by putting coins into them

a large park with many special machines that you can ride on, such as
roller coaster s
and
merry-go-round s

PIC.HEADING: AMUSEMENT PARK 游乐场
PIC.PICCONTENT: roller coaster 过山车；big wheel BrE【英】/ferris wheel AmE【美】摩天轮

Sense.DEF: funny and entertaining
Sense.TRAN: 逗人发笑的﹐好笑的﹐有趣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t find his jokes at all amusing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的笑话一点都不好笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a highly amusing
very amusing
film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常有趣的电影

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is full of amusing stories about his childhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书里全是一些他童年的趣事。

GramExa.GLOSS: a little amusing, but not very
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mildly amusing spectacle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有点好笑的场面

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say funny rather than amusing
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说funny﹐而不说amusing
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Someone told me a really funny joke.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人给我讲了个非常好笑的笑话。

Sense.DEF: used when the following word begins with a vowel sound
Sense.TRAN: 一（个）〔用于以元音开头的单词前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an orange
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个橘子
Sense.EXAMPLE: an X-ray
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次X光检查

Sense.DEF:
the form used for
a
before a vowel sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于以元音开头的单词前﹐相当于a-〕

Sense.DEF: not
Sense.EXAMPLE:
anarchy
without government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无政府状态
Sense.EXAMPLE:
anoxia
a condition caused by lack of oxygen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺氧

Sense.DEF: someone or something of, from, or connected with a particular thing, place, or person
Sense.TRAN: 与…有关的﹔与…有关的人[物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: suburban
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 郊区的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jamesian
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯的

Sense.DEF: someone skilled in or studying a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a historian
someone who studies history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史学家

Sense.DEF:
another form of the suffix
-iana
Sense.EXAMPLE: Americana
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国文物

Sense.DEF: a drug that makes muscles grow quickly, sometimes used illegally by people in sport
Sense.TRAN: 蛋白同化甾类﹐促蛋白合成类固醇〔有时被运动员违禁使用〕

Sense.DEF: someone or something that seems to belong to the past, not the present
Sense.TRAN: 过时的人[事物]﹐不合时宜的人[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The monarchy is something of an anachronism these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今君主制是一种过时的体制。

Sense.DEF: something in a play, film etc that seems wrong because it did not exist in the period of history in which the play etc is set
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑电影等中的〕年代误植﹐弄错年代
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is full of anachronisms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片年代错误百出。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His painting style was seen as outdated and anachronistic.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的绘画风格被认为过时落伍。

Sense.DEF: a very large South American snake
Sense.TRAN: 水蟒﹐森蚺〔产于南美洲的一种大蟒蛇〕

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which there are too few red cells in your blood
suffering from anaemia
Sense.EXAMPLE: his anaemic-looking face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那毫无血色的脸

Sense.DEF: seeming weak and uninteresting
Sense.TRAN: 没有活力的﹐无精打采的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anaemic first novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味的第一部小说

Sense.DEF: not needing oxygen in order to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: anaerobic bacteria
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厌氧菌

Sense.DEF: without oxygen, or happening without oxygen
Sense.EXAMPLE: anaerobic fermentation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无氧发酵

Sense.DEF: the use of anaesthetics in medicine
the state of being unable to feel pain
a drug that stops you feeling pain

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
The operation will have to be done under anaesthetic
using anaesthetic
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术得在麻醉状态下进行。
GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Eye surgery is often performed using a local anaesthetic
one that only affects a particular area of your body
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼科手术常在局部麻醉下进行。
GramExa.EXAMPLE:
You will need to have a general anaesthetic
one that makes you completely unconscious
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得接受全身麻醉。

Sense.DEF: a doctor or nurse who has been specially trained to give people anaesthetics
to give someone an anaesthetic so that they do not feel pain
a word or phrase that is made by changing the order of the letters in another word or phrase
Sense.TRAN: 变位词（组）〔改变某个词或短语的字母顺序后构成的新词或短语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Silent’ is an anagram of ‘listen’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: silent是listen的变位词。

Sense.DEF:
connected with the
anus
showing too much concern with small details, especially in a way that annoys other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so anal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要这么吹毛求疵。

Sense.DEF: the condition of being unable to feel pain while conscious
a drug that reduces pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aspirin is a popular analgesic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿司匹林是一种广泛使用的镇痛药。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: drugs that have an analgesic effect on ulcers
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于溃疡有镇痛作用的药物

Sense.DEF: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report’s findings are analogous with our own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇报告的发现与我们的类似。

Sense.DEF:
a clock or watch that uses
pointer s
, not changing numbers

analogue technology uses changing physical quantities such as
voltage
to store data
something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: analogies between human and animal behaviour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

GramExa.GLOSS: make a comparison
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Dr Wood explained the movement of light by analogy with
using the analogy of
the movement of water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伍德博士用水的运动作类比﹐解释光的运动。

Sense.DEF: to examine or think about something carefully, in order to understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She still needs to analyse the data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍需要分析这些数据。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to sit down and analyse why you feel so upset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得坐下来想一想自己为什么会那么生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe had never tried to analyze their relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔从未试图去理清他们的关系。

Sense.DEF: to examine a substance to see what it is made of
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cell samples are analyzed by a lab.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些细胞样本由一家实验室进行分析。

Sense.DEF:
to examine someone’s mental or emotional problems by using
psychoanalysis

Subsense.DEF: a careful examination of something in order to understand it better

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a detailed analysis of the week’s news
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周新闻的详细分析

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Further analysis of the data is needed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据需要做进一步分析。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were doing some type of statistical analysis .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在进行某种统计分析。

Subsense.DEF: the way in which someone describes a situation or problem, and says what causes it to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you agree with Marx’s analysis of the failure of free-market capitalism?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是否同意马克思对于自由市场资本主义终将失败的分析？

Subsense.DEF: a careful examination of a substance to see what it is made of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: analysis of genetic material
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对遗传物质的分析

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blood samples were sent for analysis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血液样本已送去分析。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ll get the results when the analysis is complete.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析完成后你就会拿到一份结果报告。

Sense.DEF: a process in which a doctor makes someone talk about their past experiences, relationships etc in order to help them with mental or emotional problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been in analysis for three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她接受精神分析治疗已经三年了。

Sense.DEF: used when giving the most basic or important facts about a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the final analysis, profit is the motive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 归根结底﹐利润就是动力。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to think about something carefully in order to understand it, and often to advise other people about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Political analysts expect the Conservatives to win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治分析家预计保守党获胜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cleary has been working as a computer analyst in Winchester.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克利里在温彻斯特当计算机分析员。

Sense.DEF: a doctor who helps people who have mental or emotional problems by making them talk about their experiences and relationships
Sense.TRAN: 精神分析专家﹐心理（分析）医生

Sense.DEF: thinking about things in a detailed and intelligent way, so that you can examine and understand things
Sense.TRAN: 头脑周密的﹐条分缕析的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got an analytical mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她思维缜密。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: During the course, students will develop their analytical skills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这门课上﹐学生的分析能力将得到提高。

Sense.DEF: using scientific analysis to examine something
Sense.EXAMPLE: analytical chemistry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析化学

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
analyse

a very sudden serious physical reaction that is caused by an
allergy
to something such as nuts, eggs, or the
sting
of some insects. The reaction causes shock, breathing difficulties, and sometimes death.
Sense.TRAN: 过敏性休克〔这种过敏反应导致休克﹑呼吸困难﹐有时会致死〕

Sense.DEF: lacking any rules or order, or not following the moral rules of society
Sense.TRAN: 无政府的﹔无秩序的﹐混乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lawless, anarchic city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个没有法纪的混乱城市
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anarchic sense of humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肆无忌惮的幽默感

Sense.DEF: the political belief that there should be no government and ordinary people should work together to improve society
someone who believes that governments, laws etc are not necessary
a situation in which there is no effective government in a country or no order in an organization or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prison is close to anarchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所监狱几乎一片混乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The classroom was in a constant state of anarchy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教室里永远是一片混乱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The nation is in danger of falling into anarchy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个国家面临陷入无政府状态的危险。

Sense.DEF: something that is completely the opposite of what you believe in
Sense.TRAN: 因立场相左而讨厌的事物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His political views were anathema to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他的政治观点全然反感。

Sense.DEF: relating to the structure of human or animal bodies
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anatomical examination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解剖检查

Sense.DEF: a scientist who studies anatomy
the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies
Sense.EXAMPLE: a professor of anatomy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解剖学教授

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Knowledge of human anatomy is essential to figure drawing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体解剖学知识对于人体素描是极其重要的。

Sense.DEF: the structure of a body, or of a part of a body

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the anatomy of the nervous system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经系统的解剖构造

Sense.DEF: your body – often used in a humorous way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could see a part of his anatomy that I’d rather not mention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你都能看到他的某个身体部位﹐是什么部位我就不想说了。

Subsense.DEF: a study or examination of an organization, process etc in order to understand and explain how it works
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Elkind’s book is an anatomy of one man’s discussion with his son about life.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔金德的书分析了一个男人与儿子关于人生问题的讨论。

Subsense.DEF: the structure of an organization, process etc or the way it works
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For the first time, we have the chance to examine the anatomy of a secret government operation.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们第一次有机会研究一个秘密政府行动的运作过程。

Sense.DEF: the action, state, or quality of doing something or of being something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
his sudden appearance
he appeared suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的突然出现
Sense.EXAMPLE:
her brilliance
she is
brilliant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的聪明才智

Sense.DEF: a member of your family who lived a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: My ancestors were French.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖先是法国人。

Sense.DEF: an animal that lived in the past, that modern animals have developed from
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Lions and house cats evolved from a common ancestor
the same ancestor
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狮子和家猫从共同的原种进化而来。

Sense.DEF: the form in which a modern machine, vehicle etc first existed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Babbage’s invention was the ancestor of the modern computer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴比奇的发明是现代计算机的原型。

Sense.DEF: the members of your family who lived a long time ago

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Her mother is of German ancestry
has German ancestors
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲祖籍德国。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helen’s family can trace their ancestry back to the 1700s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦家的世系可追溯至18世纪。

Sense.DEF: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship was at anchor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船停锚了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We dropped anchor a few yards offshore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在离岸几码远的地方抛锚停航。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The next morning, they weighed anchor
lifted the anchor
and began to move south again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早上他们起锚﹐又开始向南航行。

Sense.DEF: someone who reads the news on TV and introduces news reports
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan Rather, anchor of the CBC Evening News
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哥伦比亚广播公司《晚间新闻》主持人丹·拉瑟

Sense.DEF: someone or something that provides a feeling of support and safety
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad was the anchor of the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸是家里的顶梁柱。

Sense.DEF: to lower the anchor on a ship or boat to hold it in one place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three tankers were anchored in the harbor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三艘油轮停泊在港口。

Sense.DEF: to fasten something firmly so that it cannot move
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shelves should be securely anchored to the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搁板应牢牢固定在墙上。

Sense.DEF: to be strongly connected with a particular system, way of life etc
Sense.TRAN: 扎根于〔某种体系﹑生活方式等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s outlook has always been anchored in the political mainstream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰的观点一直植根于主流政治思想。

Sense.DEF: to provide a feeling of support, safety, or help for someone or an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve anchors the team’s defense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫是该队的防守中坚力量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her life was anchored by her religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的生活依靠宗教信仰支撑。

Sense.DEF: to be the person who reads the news and introduces reports on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: Collins anchors the 6 o'clock news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林斯主持6点钟的新闻节目。

Sense.DEF: a place where ships can anchor
a place where something can be firmly fastened
someone who reads the news on TV and introduces reports

a large, well-known, and popular store in a
shopping mall
place containing a lot of shops
, that attracts a lot of customers to the mall and to the other shops. An anchor store is usually part of a successful chain that has stores in many cities.
Sense.TRAN: 锚店﹐主力商店﹐旗舰名店〔商场内的知名大商店〕

Sense.DEF: a very small fish that tastes strongly of salt
belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ancient civilizations of Asia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚洲的古代文明

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the religion of ancient Egypt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古埃及宗教

Sense.DEF: having existed for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ancient walled city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有城墙的古城
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ancient forest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片古森林
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ancient art of calligraphy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的书法艺术

Sense.DEF: very old – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 老的﹐老掉牙的〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That photo makes me look ancient!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张照片显得我很老！

Subsense.DEF: the history of ancient societies, such as Greece or Rome
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a professor of ancient history
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位古代史教授

Subsense.DEF: if you say that something is ancient history, you mean that it happened a long time ago and is not important now
Subsense.TRAN: 很久以前的事﹐陈年往事〔指很久以前发生﹑现在已不重要的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s all ancient history and I’m not upset any more.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这都是陈年往事了﹐我不再生气了。

Sense.DEF: people who lived long ago, especially the Greeks and Romans
Sense.TRAN: 古人〔尤指古希腊人和古罗马人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ancients believed that the Sun and Moon were planets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古人认为太阳和月亮都是行星。

Sense.DEF: workers who provide additional help and services for the people who do the main work in hospitals, schools etc
connected with or supporting something else, but less important than it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Agreement was reached on several ancillary matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就一些相关问题达成了协议。

Sense.DEF: the state or quality of doing something or of being something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
expectancy
state of expecting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 期待﹐期望
Sense.EXAMPLE: hesitancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犹豫
Sense.EXAMPLE:
complacency
being complacent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自满﹐自鸣得意

Sense.DEF: used to join two words, phrases etc referring to things that are related in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s gone to get some fish and chips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去买炸鱼薯条了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film starred Jack Lemmon and Shirley Maclaine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影由杰克·莱蒙和雪莉·麦克莱恩主演。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve dealt with items one, two, and eleven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经处理了第一项﹑第二项和第十一项。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was tall, dark, and handsome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身材高大﹑皮肤黝黑﹐相貌英俊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays the guitar and sings folk songs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他弹吉他唱民歌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t speak to anyone and nobody spoke to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不跟别人说话﹐也没人跟她说话。

Sense.DEF: used to say that one action or event follows another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit down and tell me all about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐下来把整件事说给我听。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She picked up the kitten and put it in the box.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抱起小猫放在盒子里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knocked on the door and went in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他敲敲门走了进去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to wait and see what happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只能等着看接下去会发生什么事情。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is caused by something else
Sense.TRAN: 那么﹐因此〔用于表示结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I missed supper and I’m starving!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没吃晚饭﹐现在饿极了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell downstairs and broke her leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从楼梯上摔下来﹐把腿摔断了。

Sense.DEF: used when adding numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Six and four is ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六加四等于十。

Sense.DEF: used after verbs such as ‘go’, ‘come’, and ‘try’ to show what your intention is
Sense.TRAN: 为了〔用于go, come和try等之后表示目的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall we go and have a cup of coffee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去喝杯咖啡好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see if I can try and persuade her to come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看看能不能说服她来。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a statement, remark, question etc
Sense.TRAN: 那么﹐于是〔用于引出一个话题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: And now I’d like to introduce our next speaker, Mrs Thompson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我想介绍下一位演讲者汤普森夫人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s getting married in June.’ ‘And who’s the lucky man?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她6月份结婚。”“那么那个幸运的男人是谁？”

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, avoid starting a sentence with and
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐句首要避免用and
F2NBox.BADEXA: And now we come onto the issue of homelessness.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ We now come onto the issue of homelessness.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我们来谈谈无家可归这个问题。

Sense.DEF: used between repeated words to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 越来越…﹐接连﹐又〔用于连接重复的词以示强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: More and more people are losing their jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人失业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We waited for hours and hours!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等了一个又一个小时！
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was years and years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是多少年以前的事了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ran and ran.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们跑啊跑。

Subsense.DEF: used before saying the part of a large number which is less than 100
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于百位数和十[个]位数之间〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a hundred and four
five hundred and seventy-six
by the year two thousand and ten

Subsense.DEF:
used when saying a number which consists of a whole number followed by a
fraction
Subsense.TRAN: 又〔用于整数和分数之间〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: three and three-quarters
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三又四分之三
Subsense.EXAMPLE: in about two and a half hours’ time
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大约两个半小时后
Subsense.EXAMPLE: five and a quarter per cent
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 百分之五点二五

Sense.DEF: used between repeated plural nouns to say that some things of a particular kind are much better than others
Sense.TRAN: 各有不同〔用于重复的复数名词之间﹐表示有优劣之分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They said this guy was an expert.’ ‘Yes, but there are experts and experts.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们说这家伙是专家。”“是啊﹐可是专家和专家也不一样。”

Sense.DEF: used when you want someone to add something to what they have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sorry.’ ‘And?’ ‘And I promise it won’t happen again.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “对不起。”“还有呢？”“我保证这样的事再也不会发生了。”

Sense.DEF: played or sung at a speed that is neither very fast or very slow
a piece of music played or sung at a speed that is neither very fast nor very slow
having both male and female parts
Sense.TRAN: 雌雄同体的﹔雌雄同株的

Sense.DEF: someone who is androgynous looks both female and male
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bowie had a kind of androgynous sex appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍伊有一种中性魅力。

Sense.DEF:
a
robot
that looks completely human

the period in a man’s life when the amount of
testosterone
in his body begins to reduce, after about age 50
information which is presented as if it is the result of serious research, but which is actually based on what someone thinks but cannot prove
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this is just anecdata, when what we need now is some hard evidence of what UK firms are doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些都是想当然﹐而我们现在需要的是能够说明英国公司正在从事什么活动的确凿证据。

Sense.DEF: consisting of short stories based on someone’s personal experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: His findings are based on anecdotal evidence rather than serious research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的发现依据的是传闻轶事﹐而不是认真的调查研究。

Sense.DEF: a short story based on your personal experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

Sense.DEF:
the usual American spelling of
anaemia

the usual American spelling of
anaemic
a plant with red, white, or blue flowers

the usual American spelling of
anaesthesia

a doctor who gives
anaesthetic s
to a patient

the usual American spelling of
anaesthetic

the usual American spelling of
anaesthetist

the usual American spelling of
anaesthetize

a small place on the surface of a
blood vessel
that is swollen and full of blood, and that can kill you if it breaks open
to begin a different job, start to live in a different place etc, especially after a difficult period in your life
Sense.TRAN: 重新开始〔尤指在经历过困难后开始新的工作﹑在新的地方生活等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was ready to leave everything behind and start anew in California.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备好舍弃一切﹐在加利福尼亚开始新的生活。

Sense.DEF: if you do something anew, you start doing it again
