Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee is going to examine the whole situation anew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会将重新调查整个情况。

Sense.DEF:
a
spirit
who is God’s servant in heaven, and who is often shown as a person dressed in white with wings
Sense.EXAMPLE: the angel Gabriel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天使加百列

Sense.DEF: someone who is very kind, very good, or very beautiful
Sense.TRAN: 安琪儿﹐天使〔指仁慈﹑善良或美丽的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That little girl of theirs is an angel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的小女儿是个小天使。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Sam is no angel
often behaves badly
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆绝不是善良之辈。

Sense.DEF: used when asking someone to help you or when thanking someone for helping you
Sense.TRAN: 大好人〔用于请人帮忙或表示感谢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks for mailing those letters, you’re an angel .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你帮我寄了那些信﹐你真是个大好人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be an angel and get me my glasses, will you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行行好﹐帮我把眼镜拿来好吗？

Sense.DEF: someone who gives new businesses money, often in exchange for a share of the company
Sense.TRAN: 天使投资者﹐投资天使〔指向初创企业投资的人﹐往往以持有公司股份作为交换条件〕

Sense.DEF: looking good, kind, and gentle or behaving in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had an angelic smile, but a dreadful temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她笑起来像个天使﹐但脾气很可怕。

Sense.DEF: connected with angels
Sense.EXAMPLE: the angelic hosts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天使群﹐众天使

Sense.DEF: a plant that smells sweet and is used in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 白芷〔一种带香味的植物﹐用于烹调〕

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of wanting to hurt or criticize someone because they have done something bad to you or been unkind to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is growing anger among the people against the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众对政府越来越不满。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She struggled to control her anger at her son’s disobedience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子不听话﹐对此她强压怒火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s a lie!’ he shouted in anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “撒谎！”他怒吼道。

Sense.DEF: to do or use something for the first time, or in a real situation
Sense.TRAN: 第一次做某事/真的用某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He joined the club last month, but has yet to kick a ball in anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上月加入该俱乐部﹐但是还未真正上场踢过球。

Collocate.COLLOC: be filled with anger/be full of anger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His face was suddenly filled with anger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然间他一脸愤怒。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My aunt was shaking with anger as she left the room.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我阿姨离开房间时气得浑身发抖。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be extremely angry
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Seething with anger and frustration, Polly pushed back her chair and stood up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 波莉怒火中烧﹐沮丧至极﹐把椅子往后一推站了起来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show your anger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Demonstrators expressed their anger by burning American flags.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威者焚烧美国国旗来泄愤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make people angry
make people even more angry
it stops

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is deep anger against the occupying forces.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对占领军感到强烈不满。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is growing anger among drivers over the rise in fuel prices.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机对油价上涨越来越不满。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: among many people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The decision to build the airport has provoked widespread anger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 建造机场的决定引起了广泛不满。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that you have tried not to show
anger felt when you think something should not be allowed to happen
an occasion when someone suddenly becomes angry
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His occasional outbursts of anger shocked those around him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他偶尔会突然发怒﹐让身边的人很震惊。

Sense.DEF: to make someone angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: What angered me most was his total lack of remorse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最让我生气的是他居然毫无悔意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmental groups were disappointed and angered by the president’s decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保组织对总统的决定感到失望和愤怒。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say something makes them angry rather than say that it angers them
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说something makes somebody angry﹐而不说it angers somebody
F2NBox.BADEXA: I didn’t want to anger him.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ I didn’t want to make him angry .

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which you have bad pains in your chest because your heart is weak
the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an angle of 45°
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 45度角

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the angles of a triangle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三角形的三个角

Sense.EXAMPLE: You didn’t measure the angle accurately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有量准角度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the angle between walls and ceiling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙与天花板的夹角

Sense.DEF: a way of considering a problem or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔看待问题或形势的〕角度﹐立场
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re approaching the issue from many different angles .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从许多不同的角度来考虑这个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look at every angle of the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要从方方面面来看待局势。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s another angle to this question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 还可从另一个角度来看这个问题。

Sense.DEF: a position from which you look at something or photograph it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This drawing of the monastery was done from an unusual angle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画是从一个独特的视角来描绘那座寺院的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the pictures have strange camera angles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些照片拍摄的角度很奇特。

Sense.DEF: leaning to one side and not straight or upright
Sense.EXAMPLE: The portrait was hanging at an angle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画像挂歪了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sign leaned over at a slight angle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那块招牌有点倾斜。

Sense.DEF: the shape formed when two lines or surfaces join
Sense.TRAN: 〔两条线或两个平面相交的〕边角

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My head struck the angle of the shelf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的头撞到了书架的角上。

PIC.HEADING: ANGLES 角
PIC.PICCONTENT: right angle:90° 直角90°；obtuse angle:between 90° and 180° 钝角:大于90°小于180°；acute angle:less than 90° 锐角:小于90°；reflex angle:between 180° and 360° 优角:大于180°小于360°；adjacent angles 邻角；opposite angles 对顶角；alternate angles 错角；corresponding angles 同位角

Sense.DEF: to move or place something so that it is not straight or upright
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mirror angled to reflect light from a window
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为反射窗外的光线而斜放的一面镜子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Philip angled his chair towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普转过椅子对着门口。

Sense.DEF: to present information from a particular point of view or for a specific group of people
Sense.TRAN: 从〔某个角度〕报道﹔以〔某一群体〕提供信息
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is angled towards a business audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的目标读者是商界人士。

Sense.DEF: to try to get something you want without asking directly for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was obviously angling for an invitation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她显然是在拐弯抹角地要请柬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want him to think I was just angling for sympathy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让他认为我只是在博取同情。

Sense.DEF:
a pair of
bracket s
( ) used for enclosing information
someone who catches fish as a sport
a Christian who is a member of the Church of England or related churches
to make something or someone more English
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leszek anglicized his name to ‘Lester’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: Leszek把他的名字改成了英语名字Lester。

Sense.DEF: the sport of catching fish with a fishing rod
relating to England or Britain
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an anglophile
someone who loves Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲英者﹐崇英者

Sense.DEF: English or British and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Anglo-Scottish family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兼具英格兰和苏格兰血统的家庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: an improvement in Anglo-American relations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英美关系的改善

Sense.DEF: a Christian who is a member of the part of the Church of England that is similar to the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.TRAN: 〔与天主教相近的〕英国国教高教会派教徒

Sense.DEF: someone whose family is partly British and partly Indian
someone who is not English but likes England and anything English
someone who dislikes anything English
someone who speaks English as their first language

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the US and other anglophone countries
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和其他讲英语的国家

Sense.DEF: someone who belonged to the race of people who lived in England from about 600 AD
the language used by the Anglo-Saxons
a white person, especially someone whose family originally came from England
Sense.TRAN: 白人﹔〔尤指〕原籍英国的白人

Sense.DEF: a type of goat, rabbit, or cat with very long soft hair or fur
Sense.TRAN: 〔一种有柔软长毛的〕安哥拉羊﹔安哥拉兔﹔安哥拉猫

Sense.DEF: wool or thread made from the fur of an angora goat or rabbit
Sense.TRAN: 用安哥拉羊毛[兔毛]制成的织物[毛线]
Sense.EXAMPLE: soft pink angora sweaters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔软的粉红色安哥拉羊毛套头衫

Sense.DEF: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was angry because he hadn’t told me his plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很生气﹐因为他没有告诉我他的计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was beginning to get angry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始发脾气了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His comments brought an angry response from opposition politicians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话激起反对派政客愤怒的回应。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Calm down,’ she said, looking at his angry face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “冷静一下。”她看着他那张生气的脸说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Please don’t be angry with me,’ she said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “请别生我的气。”她说道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jesse laughed, which made me even angrier .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰西笑了起来﹐这令我更加恼火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate’s still so angry about the whole thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特仍对整件事愤愤不平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The workers are angry that they haven’t been paid for the week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们因没拿到这周的工钱而感到气愤。

Sense.DEF: feeling strongly that you wish you had done something or had not done something
Sense.EXAMPLE: David was angry with himself for letting the others see his true feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维恨自己让别人看出了他的真实感受。

Sense.DEF: an angry sky or cloud looks dark and stormy
Sense.TRAN: 〔天空〕昏暗的﹐狂风暴雨的﹔〔云层〕黑压压的

Sense.DEF: an angry wound etc is painful and red and looks infected

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common different grammar patterns of the adjective angry are. 本图表所示为形容词angry构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Exponent.DEF: feeling strong emotions because you think someone has behaved badly, or because a situation seems bad or unfair
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He gets really angry if people keep him waiting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有人让他一直等﹐他就会非常生气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a crowd of angry protesters
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群愤怒的抗议者

Exponent.DEF: angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dad was mad at me for damaging the car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把汽车弄坏了﹐爸爸很生气。

Exponent.DEF: rather angry – used when speaking to people you know well
Exponent.TRAN: 恼怒的〔用于和熟悉的人说话〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was cross with me for being late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因我迟到而十分生气。

Exponent.DEF: a little angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was annoyed no one had told me the class was cancelled.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 竟然没有人告诉我课取消了﹐这让我有些恼火。

Exponent.DEF: annoyed and impatient, especially by something that keeps happening or something someone keeps saying
Exponent.TRAN: 恼火的﹔急躁的〔尤指被反复发生的事情或重复的话惹恼〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was irritated by their stupid questions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的愚蠢问题让我感到恼火。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an irritated voice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恼火的声音

Exponent.DEF: becoming annoyed or angry easily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bad-tempered old man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个脾气暴躁的老人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s always bad-tempered when he doesn’t get what he wants.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得不到想要的东西就爱发脾气。

Exponent.DEF: feeling a little angry for a period of time, often for no particular reason
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指无具体原因而〕心情不好
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I woke up in a bad mood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我醒来时心情很糟。

Exponent.DEF: in an angry mood for a short time, especially because someone has just said something to offend or annoy you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指因受到别人的冒犯或烦扰而短时间地〕生气﹐气恼
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He walked off in a huff when they refused to let him join in their game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不肯让他一起玩﹐他就气呼呼地走了。

Exponent.EXP: sb has got up on the wrong side of the bed
Exponent.DEF: used when you think someone has been in an angry mood all day, for no particular reason – often used humorously
Exponent.TRAN: 某人（无缘无故地）一整天心情不好〔常为幽默用法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what’s wrong – she must have got up on the wrong side of the bed today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道是怎么了——她今天一整天都心情不好。

Exponent.DEF: extremely angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was furious when she found out he’d been lying to her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现他一直在对自己撒谎﹐感到非常生气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looked absolutely livid.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去气坏了。

Exponent.DEF: very angry and shocked by something you think is unfair or wrong
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因觉得不公平或错误而〕非常愤怒的﹐震怒的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most people were outraged by the 9/11 attacks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都对“九一一”袭击事件感到震怒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: complaints from outraged viewers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒观众的投诉

Exponent.DEF: extremely angry – used mainly in writing, for example in newspaper reports
Exponent.TRAN: 怒不可遏〔主要用于书面语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gordon Brown was reported to be incandescent with rage over the article.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说这篇文章令戈登·布朗怒不可遏。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly become very angry and start shouting at someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was the first time I’d seen her lose her temper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我第一次看见她发脾气。

Sense.DEF: a young man who strongly criticizes society and the government. The phrase was first used to describe John Osborne and other British writers in the 1950s.
Sense.TRAN: 愤怒青年〔指强烈批评社会和政府的青年人〕

Sense.DEF: strong feelings of anxiety and unhappiness because you are worried about your life, your future, or what you should do in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: love letters full of angst
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满纸忧愁的情书

Sense.DEF: mental or physical suffering caused by extreme pain or worry
Sense.EXAMPLE: the anguish of not knowing what had happened to her
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于不知道她发生了什么事而痛苦不堪

Sense.DEF: thin and not having much flesh on your bones
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall, angular young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又高又瘦的年轻男子

Sense.DEF: having sharp and definite corners
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cubist painting with angular shapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅有棱角图案的立体派绘画

Sense.DEF: a living creature such as a dog or cat, that is not an insect, plant, bird, fish, or person
Sense.TRAN: 兽﹐动物﹐牲畜〔不包括昆虫﹑植物﹑鸟类﹑鱼类或人类〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: furry little animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛茸茸的小动物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: cattle, sheep, and other domestic animals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛﹑羊及其他家畜

Sense.EXAMPLE: The cosmetics have not been tested on animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些化妆品没有进行过动物试验。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Beth is an animal lover
someone who likes animals
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝是个喜欢动物的人。

Sense.DEF: any living creature that is not a plant or a person
Sense.TRAN: 动物〔除植物或人类以外的生物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can’t stand cruelty to animals of any sort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不能容忍任何虐待动物的行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the animal welfare movement in Britain
the enormous diversity of the animal kingdom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物界的品种繁杂

Sense.DEF: any living creature, including people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Man is a highly intelligent animal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人是一种高智慧动物。

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a cruel, violent, or very rude way
Sense.TRAN: 衣冠禽兽﹐残暴的人﹐畜生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Football hooligans are just animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球流氓简直是禽兽。

Sense.DEF: something that is very different from the thing you have mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 非常不同/截然不同的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Writing email is a very different animal from all other forms of writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写电子邮件不同于其他任何形式的写作。

Sense.DEF: someone who is interested in politics, in meeting other people etc
Sense.TRAN: 热衷于政治/社交等的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is simply not a social animal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是不善社交的那种人。

Exponent.DEF: a living thing such as a dog, cow, or tiger, but not an insect, fish, or bird
Exponent.TRAN: 兽﹐动物﹐牲畜〔不包括昆虫﹑鱼类或鸟类〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: farm animals such as cows, sheep, and pigs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛﹑羊﹑猪等家畜
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People are becoming more concerned about animal welfare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们越来越关注动物的福祉。

Exponent.DEF: an animal – used especially when describing a particular animal’s characteristics or when referring to animals generally
Exponent.TRAN: 生物﹔动物〔尤用于表示某种动物的特征或泛指动物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cheetah is a magnificent creature.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 猎豹是一种威武雄壮的动物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: all the living creatures in the sea
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海洋中的所有生物

Exponent.DEF: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one
Exponent.EXAMPLE: To most people, lions are savage beasts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大多数人看来﹐狮子是凶残的野兽。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a wild beast
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 野兽

Exponent.DEF: an animal considered as one of a group of things that grow and then die, including humans and plants
Exponent.TRAN: 生物〔指有生命周期的生物﹐包括人类和植物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The only living things we saw were dogs and cats.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到的活物仅有猫和狗。

Exponent.DEF: a group of animals whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 观察到了七种猛禽。

Exponent.DEF: an animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Humans, dogs, and whales are all mammals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人﹑狗和鲸都是哺乳动物。

Exponent.DEF: a living creature that has a backbone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: viruses that affect chickens, monkeys, and most other vertebrates
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 感染鸡﹑猴子及其他许多脊椎动物的病毒

Exponent.DEF: a living creature that does not have a backbone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: earthworms and other small invertebrates
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蚯蚓及其他小型无脊椎动物

Sense.DEF: human feelings, desires etc that are connected with sex, food, and other basic needs
things that are made or come from animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diet rich in red meat and animal fats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄入大量红肉和动物脂肪的饮食

Sense.DEF: farming that involves keeping animals and producing milk, meat etc
the idea that people should treat animals well, and especially not use them in tests to develop medicines or other products
Sense.TRAN: 动物权利〔指人们应善待动物﹐尤其不把它们用作试验品来研制药物或其他产品〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill has been involved in the animal rights movement for years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔参加动物权利运动多年了。

Sense.DEF: living
Sense.EXAMPLE: animate beings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物

Sense.DEF: to give life or energy to something
Sense.TRAN: 赋予…生命﹔使有生气[活力]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laughter animated his face for a moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笑容使他的脸上一时增添了生气。

Sense.DEF: showing a lot of interest and energy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The performance was followed by an animated discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出过后进行了热烈的讨论。

Sense.DEF: a film or programme that shows pictures, clay models etc that seem to be really moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: an animated Disney film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部迪士尼动画片

Sense.DEF: the process of making animated films, television programmes, computer games etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They used computer animation in the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在影片中使用了计算机动画制作。

Sense.DEF: a film, television programme, computer game etc that has pictures, clay models etc that seem to be really moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: 3-D animations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三维动画片

Sense.DEF: liveliness and excitement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were talking with animation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们谈得兴致盎然。

Sense.DEF: someone who makes animated films
the method or process of making or using moving models that look like real animals or people in films
Sense.TRAN: 电子动画制作技术﹐电子特效

Sense.DEF:
Japanese
cartoon s
and computer
animation
pictures, films etc produced using a computer
Sense.TRAN: 日本卡通片[计算机动画]

Sense.DEF: a religion in which animals and plants are believed to have spirits
strong dislike or hatred

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no personal animosity between the party leaders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各党领导人之间并没有个人恩怨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a certain amount of animosity towards him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他怀有一点仇恨。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of strong dislike or hatred

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no animus towards Robert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对罗伯特并没有敌意。

Sense.DEF: a plant with seeds that have a strong taste
the seeds of an anise plant, which are used in alcoholic drinks and in sweets
the joint between your foot and your leg

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Janet slipped on the stairs and twisted her ankle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特在楼梯上滑倒﹐扭伤了脚踝。

Sense.EXAMPLE: slender ankles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纤细的脚踝

Sense.DEF: socks or boots that only come up to your ankle

a ring or
bracelet
worn around your ankle
in the whole history of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most unusual cases in the annals of crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪史上最不寻常的案例之一

Sense.DEF: used in the titles of official records of events or activities
Sense.TRAN: 年鉴﹐年报〔用于正式记录的标题中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Annals of the Zoological Society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《动物学学会年报》

Sense.DEF: to make metal or glass hard by heating it and then slowly letting it get cold
Sense.TRAN: 使退火〔把金属或玻璃加热后缓缓冷却使之坚硬〕

Sense.DEF: to take control of a country or area next to your own, especially by using force
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过武力〕并吞﹐兼并﹐霸占〔邻国或相邻地区〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Baltic republics were annexed by the Soviet Union in 1940.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1940年﹐波罗的海各共和国被苏联吞并。

Sense.DEF: a separate building that has been added to a larger one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of us will be sleeping in the annexe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有些人要睡在增建的屋子里。

Sense.DEF: a part that has been added to the end of a document, report etc
to destroy something or someone completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just one of these bombs could annihilate a city the size of New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种炸弹只要一颗就能彻底毁灭纽约那么大的一座城市。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone easily and completely in a game or competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔在游戏或比赛中轻易地〕彻底击败
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tyson annihilated his opponent in the first round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰森在第一个回合就轻取对手。

Sense.DEF: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack and Kim celebrated their twentieth wedding anniversary in January.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1月﹐杰克和金庆祝了他们的结婚20周年纪念日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A huge parade was held on the anniversary of the 1959 revolution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1959年革命纪念日那天举行了大规模游行活动。

Sense.DEF: to add short notes to a book or piece of writing to explain parts of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an annotated edition of ‘Othello’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《奥赛罗》的注释本

Sense.DEF: to officially tell people about something, especially about a plan or a decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: They announced their engagement in ‘The Times’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在《泰晤士报》上宣布了订婚的消息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has announced plans to create 10,000 new jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府宣布了创造一万个就业机会的方案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A government spokesman announced that the hostages had been released.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府发言人宣布人质已经被释放。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At the end of their meeting, it was announced that an agreement had been reached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议最后宣布已达成一项协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cordon announced his resignation to staff members on Wednesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期三﹐科登向员工宣布辞职。

Sense.DEF: to say something, especially something that other people will not like, in a loud and confident way
Sense.TRAN: 郑重地说﹐大声而肯定地说〔尤指别人不喜欢的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m not going to their party,’ Maggie announced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不会去参加他们的聚会。”玛吉郑重地说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stood up and announced that he was ready to go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起身来﹐郑重其事地说他要走了。

Sense.DEF:
to give information to people using a
loudspeaker
or
microphone
, especially at an airport or railway station
Sense.TRAN: 广播通知〔尤指在机场或火车站〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We arrived just as they were announcing the arrival of Flight 207 from Minneapolis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到的时候正在广播来自明尼阿波利斯的207次航班已经到达的消息。

Sense.DEF: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在接待处通报姓名后﹐詹姆斯被领上楼去。

Sense.DEF: to introduce a programme on television or radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电视台或电台〕当…的播音员[节目主持人]

Sense.DEF: an important or official statement
Sense.TRAN: 〔重要或正式的〕通告﹐公告﹐布告
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister made the announcement at a news conference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长在记者招待会上发表了这项声明。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an important announcement about tax increases
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关提高税收的重要通告

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They heard the announcement that the mayor was resigning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们听到了市长要辞职的公告。

Sense.DEF: the act of telling people that something important is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the announcement of the company’s annual results
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司年度业绩的公布

Sense.DEF: a small advertisement or statement in a newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wedding announcement in the local paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地报纸上的一则结婚通告

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The next day an announcement was issued to staff, saying the company would be closing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天向员工发表了公告﹐宣布公司要关闭。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone was shocked when they heard the announcement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到这项公告﹐人人都很震惊。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that you are pleased about it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Environmental groups welcomed the announcement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保组织对这项声明表示欢迎。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it happens
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His announcement came after two days of peace talks.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 和谈进行两天之后﹐他发表了声明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A formal announcement will be made in Parliament.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份正式通告将在议会发布。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: No official announcement is expected until next year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计明年才会发布官方通告。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 令人意外/意想不到的通告

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sudden and important

Sense.DEF: someone who reads news or information on the television or radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或电台的〕播音员﹐节目主持人

Sense.DEF:
someone who gives information to people using a
loudspeaker
or
microphone
, especially at an airport or railway station
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指机场或火车站的〕广播员

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel slightly angry and unhappy about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What annoyed him most was that he had received no apology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最令他生气的是没人向他道歉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It really annoys me when I see people dropping litter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到别人乱丢垃圾我非常生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She annoyed him with her stupid questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那些愚蠢的问题令他很恼火。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people also often use the phrase get on someone's nerves
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们还经常使用短语get on someone’s nerves
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She got on his nerves with her stupid questions.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那些愚蠢的问题令他很恼火。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of slight anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: A look of annoyance crossed her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸上掠过一丝不快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To his annoyance, he discovered they hadn’t waited.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现他们没有等他﹐感到很气恼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kelly shook her head in annoyance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯莉气得直摇头。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you slightly angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan found the constant noise of the traffic an annoyance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦觉得不绝于耳的交通噪音让人心烦。

Sense.DEF: slightly angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be annoyed if we don’t finish by eight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们8点还未完成﹐我会生气的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was annoyed with Duncan for forgetting to phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为邓肯忘了打电话而气恼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was annoyed by her apparent indifference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她明显的冷淡让他恼火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Davies was annoyed that the books were missing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯先生因为那些书不见了而生气。

Sense.DEF: making you feel slightly angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: an annoying habit of interrupting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打断他人讲话的讨厌习惯
Sense.EXAMPLE: The annoying thing is he’s usually right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人气恼的是﹐他通常都是对的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s annoying that we didn’t know about this before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人恼火的是﹐我们以前并不知道这事。

Sense.DEF: happening once a year
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school trip has become an annual event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

Sense.DEF: based on or calculated over a period of one year

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a household with an annual income of $60,000
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年收入六万美元的家庭

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The jazz festival is held annually in July.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 爵士音乐节每年7月举行。

Sense.DEF: a plant that lives for one year or season
Sense.TRAN: 一年生植物﹔一季生植物

Sense.DEF: a book, especially for children, that is produced once a year with the same title but different stories, pictures etc
Sense.TRAN: 年刊﹐年报﹐年鉴〔尤指儿童年册〕

Sense.DEF: if money or an amount is annualized, it is calculated for one year, based on amounts for shorter periods of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算钱或数量时〕年化的﹐年度化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an annualized inflation rate of 15%
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 15%的年化通货膨胀率

Sense.DEF: a fixed amount of money that is paid each year to someone, usually until they die
to officially state that a marriage or legal agreement no longer exists
Sense.TRAN: 终止﹐废止﹐取消〔婚姻关系或契约〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their marriage was annulled last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻关系去年宣告解除。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a
battery
that collects
electron s
, often a wire or piece of metal with the sign (+)
expressed in a way that is unlikely to offend anyone
Sense.TRAN: 不得罪人的﹐不冒犯他人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: anodyne topics of conversation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不冒犯人的话题

Sense.DEF: a medicine that reduces pain
an activity or thing that comforts people
to put oil or water on someone’s head or body, usually as part of a religious ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔宗教仪式中〕涂油[水]于〔某人的头或身上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the anointed king
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已受涂油礼的国王

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was anointed with sacred oil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被涂了圣油。

Sense.DEF: different from what you expected to find
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly anomalous situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其反常的形势
Sense.EXAMPLE: anomalous results
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异常的结果

Sense.DEF: something that is noticeable because it is different from what is usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days, a woman professor was still an anomaly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐女教授仍旧十分稀罕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: various anomalies in the tax system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 税制中的种种不正常现象

Sense.DEF: soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: See you anon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改日再见。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= anonymous 无名的

Sense.DEF: when other people do not know who you are or what your name is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every step will be taken to preserve your anonymity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将采取各种措施确保你的姓名保密。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
One official, who spoke on condition of anonymity
he would only speak if his name was not told
, said the White House took the threat very seriously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位不愿公开姓名的官员称﹐白宫非常重视这一威胁。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
the anonymity of city streets
you do not know anyone, and no one knows you
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市街头人人互不相识

Sense.DEF: unknown by name
Sense.EXAMPLE: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本诗集的佚名作者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the anonymous donor of a large sum of money
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔巨款的匿名捐赠者

Sense.EXAMPLE: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述﹐这家公司曾从事非法活动。

Sense.DEF: done, sent, or given by someone who does not want their name to be known
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anonymous donation of $5,000
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5,000美元的匿名捐赠

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is often unpleasant or contains threats

Sense.DEF: uninteresting in features or qualities – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: grey, anonymous housing estates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰暗而无特色的住宅区

Sense.DEF:
a short coat with a
hood
that keeps out the wind and rain
a boring person who is interested in the unimportant details of a particular subject and does not know how to behave properly in social situations
Sense.TRAN: 闷蛋﹐怪胎〔好钻研无聊琐事﹑不善交际的人〕

Sense.DEF: a mental illness that makes someone stop eating
suffering from or relating to anorexia
one more person or thing of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to have another cup of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要再喝一杯咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’ll be another bus along in a few minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几分钟后就会再来一辆公共汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buy two CDs and get another completely free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买两张激光唱片即可免费获赠一张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is this another of your schemes to make money?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这又是你的一个赚钱计划吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Not another word was spoken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有再说一个字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh look, there’s another one of those birds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐你看﹐又有一只那样的鸟。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
This misunderstanding is yet another example of bad communication
there have already been several
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次误会是又一个沟通不畅的例子。

GramExa.GLOSS: an additional amount or number
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to wait another three weeks for the results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还得再等三周才能知道结果。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s still another £100 to pay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 还需支付100英镑。

Sense.DEF: not the same thing, person etc, but a different one
Sense.EXAMPLE: They must have returned by another route.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们肯定是从另一条路线回来的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We finally moved to another apartment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最后搬到另一间公寓去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m busy right now. Could you come back another time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在很忙﹐你换个时间再来好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen resigned from her last job and has yet to find another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦辞去了上一份工作﹐还没有找到新工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gold watch was a present from another of his girlfriends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那块金表是他的另一个女朋友送的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She spends the day rushing from one meeting to another.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她成天在会场之间奔波。

Sense.DEF: used to say that two or more people or things do the same thing to each other or share a relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: They seem to love one another very much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们似乎彼此爱得很深。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The streets are all at right angles to one another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些街道都互相垂直交叉。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there are many different types of something, or many possibilities, rather than being specific
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the kids in this class have learning difficulties of one sort or another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个班上的每个孩子都有这样或那样的学习障碍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who, for one reason or another, can’t have children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因这样或那样的原因不能生孩子的人

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a series of similar things or events
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small businesses have been collapsing one after another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小型企业纷纷倒闭。

Sense.DEF: used when a series of bad or annoying things have happened and something of the same type seems to have just happened again
Sense.TRAN: 不要再…！〔用于指不好或讨厌的事物接连发生后似乎又要重演〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh no! Not another accident!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐不！别再出事故！

Sense.DEF: used to suggest that something may not be true, possible, easy etc, after mentioning something that is
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is true that his programme is original, though whether it is funny is quite another matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不错﹐他的节目很新颖﹐但好不好笑则完全是另一回事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is one thing to talk about ‘involving the students’; it is quite another thing to actually do this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说“让学生参与”是一回事﹐真正做起来又完全是另一回事。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce something additional that you want to say to someone about a different subject
Sense.TRAN: 还有一件事〔用于引出不同的话题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: And another thing. You were late for work again this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有一件事﹐你今天早上上班又迟到了。

Sense.DEF: used with the name of a well-known person, thing, event etc to mean someone or something else that is similar because they have the same good or bad qualities
Sense.TRAN: 另一个〔类似的人﹑物﹑事件等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: warnings that not enough has been done to prevent another Chernobyl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于未采取足够措施防止切尔诺贝利事件重演的警告
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’ll never be another Elvis Presley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能再出现一个埃尔维斯·普雷斯利了。

Sense.DEF: something you say when you reply to a question that someone has asked you
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t have to give them an answer now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不必现在就给他们答复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every time I ask him about it, I get a different answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每次问他此这件事﹐都得到不同的回答。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These are important questions, and we want answers to them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题很重要﹐我们希望得到答案。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s still waiting for an answer from the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还在等校方的答复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The honest answer was that I didn’t know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦白回答﹐我不知道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was never able to get a straight answer about why it happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情为什么会发生﹐他一直没有得到直接的回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer at this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我无法给你明确答复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The short answer is that it can’t be done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单的回答就是做不了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In answer to your question , yes, you can go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来回答你的问题﹐是的﹐你可以去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it’s money you want, the answer is no !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你要的是钱﹐回答是不行！

Sense.DEF: something that you write or say in reply to a question in a test or competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What was the answer to question 4?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第四题的答案是什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Score two points for each correct answer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 答对一题得两分。

Sense.DEF: a written reply to a letter, invitation, advertisement etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you ever get an answer to your letter?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有收到过回信？

Sense.DEF: a way of dealing with a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no simple answer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有简单的解决方法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police do not have an answer to rising crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方没有办法解决犯罪率上升的问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people think cars should be banned from the city, but I don’t think that’s the answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为城市里应当禁止汽车通行﹐但我觉得这不是解决办法。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be the answer to sb’s problems/worries etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he could get a job it’d be the answer to all his worries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他能找到一份工作﹐他所有的烦恼就能迎刃而解了。

Sense.DEF: if you get an answer when you call someone on the phone, they pick up the phone and talk to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried calling him all day but couldn’t get an answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试着给他打了一天电话﹐但没有人接听。

Sense.DEF: if you get an answer when you knock on a door, someone opens it and talks to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried knocking on her door, but there was no answer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试着敲了敲她的门﹐但是没人应门。

Sense.DEF: to be very sure that you know everything about a situation, especially when you do not
Sense.EXAMPLE: He acts like he has all the answers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一副无所不知的样子。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is considered to be just as good as a more famous person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 相当的人﹔不相上下的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Space Needle is Seattle’s answer to the Eiffel Tower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西雅图的太空针塔堪比艾菲尔铁塔。

Sense.DEF: to say something to someone as a reply when they have asked you a question, made a suggestion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She thought for a moment before answering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想了一会儿才回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He still hadn’t answered my question .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍然没有回答我的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why don’t you just leave?’ ‘I’d like to,’ she answered, ‘but I have nowhere else to go.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么不一走了之？”“我倒是想走﹐”她回答说﹐“但是我没有其他地方可去。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When questioned, Hughes answered that he knew nothing about the robbery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 问到休斯时﹐他回答说对这宗抢劫案一无所知。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How much was it? Come on, answer me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多少钱？ 快点告诉我吧。

Sense.DEF: to write or say the answer to a question in a test or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Answer as many questions as possible in the time provided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在所给时间内尽量多答题。

Sense.DEF: to pick up the telephone and speak when it rings or open the door when someone knocks or rings the bell
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept ringing the bell, but no one answered the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在按门铃﹐可就是没人应门。

Sense.DEF: if you answer a letter or advertisement, you write a letter to the person who has written it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon got the job by answering an advert in the paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙通过应征报纸上的一则广告找到了工作。

Sense.DEF: to explain why you did something when people are criticizing you – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 就批评/指控/谴责等作出回应〔用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you answer the criticism that your government has done nothing to help the homeless?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人批评你的政府没有采取任何行动帮助无家可归者﹐你对此有何回应？

Sense.DEF: to do something as a reaction to criticism or an attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army answered by firing into the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队向人群开火还击。

Sense.DEF: to be a way of dealing with or solving a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You can borrow my car if you like.’ ‘Well, that answers one problem.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “如果你愿意﹐可以借我的车。”“好啊﹐这下解决了一个问题。”

Sense.DEF: to provide something that is needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our transportation system is designed to answer the needs of the city’s commuters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的交通系统是为满足本市乘车上下班者的需求而设计的。

Sense.DEF: if someone answers a description, they match that description
Sense.EXAMPLE: A man answering the police’s description was seen entering the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人看到一个和警方描述相符的男人进了这座楼。

Exponent.DEF: to say something to someone when they have asked you a question or spoken to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You don’t have to answer the question if you don’t want to.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是不想回答这个问题就用不着回答。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I said hello to her, but she didn’t answer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟她打招呼﹐可是她不搭理。

Exponent.DEF: to answer someone. Used especially in written English to report what someone said
Exponent.TRAN: 回答﹐答复〔尤用于书面英语中引述别人说的话〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m so sorry,’ he replied.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “非常抱歉。”他答道。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We asked Jane to help, but she replied that she was too busy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们请简帮忙﹐可她回答说她太忙。

Exponent.DEF: to answer someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How do you respond to the allegation that you deliberately deceived your employers?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人指控你故意欺骗雇主﹐对此你如何回应？

Exponent.DEF: to answer someone by telling them what you have decided or giving them a piece of information they asked for
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He asked me to marry him, but I didn’t give him an answer straight away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向我求婚﹐但是我没有马上答复他。

Exponent.DEF: to answer someone at a later time especially by telephoning them, usually because you need to think about their question or find out more information
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s promised to get back to me as soon as she hears any more news from the hospital.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她答应一有来自医院方面的更多消息就会马上打电话告诉我。

Exponent.DEF: to answer someone angrily, especially because they have annoyed you or criticized you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re not afraid?’ Brenda asked. ‘Of course not,’ he retorted angrily.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你不怕？”布伦达问道。“当然不怕。”他气愤地反驳。

Sense.DEF: to reply in a rude way to someone that you are supposed to obey

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t answer me back young man!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人﹐别跟我顶嘴！

Sense.DEF: to explain to people in authority why you did something wrong or why something happened, and be punished if necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their coach must answer for the team’s poor performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的教练必须为球队的不佳表现负责。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a lot to answer for
Sense.DEF: to be responsible for causing a lot of trouble
used to say that you cannot make a decision for someone who is not there, or give their opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure John will help us – I can’t really answer for the others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信约翰会帮我们﹐但别人我就说不准了。

Sense.DEF: to give an explanation to someone, especially about something that you have done wrong
Sense.TRAN: 向…负责﹐对…作出解释〔尤指错事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phipps answers to me and me alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲普斯只向我一个人负责。

Sense.LEXUNIT: answer to the name of sth
Sense.DEF: to be called a particular name – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-dressed young woman answering to the name of Suzanne
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穿着讲究的年轻女子﹐芳名苏珊

Sense.DEF: to have to explain your actions to someone in authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: The agency is answerable to the governor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该机构向州长负责。

Sense.DEF: a question that is answerable can be answered
a machine that records your telephone calls when you cannot answer them
a small insect that lives in large groups
to be so excited or full of energy that you are unable to sit or stand still – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 坐立不安﹔躁动不安〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone or something that does something
Sense.TRAN: 做…的人﹔用作…的东西﹔处于…的状态
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a servant
someone who serves others
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仆人
Sense.EXAMPLE:
disinfectant
substance for killing germs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消毒剂﹐杀菌剂
Sense.EXAMPLE:
expectant
expecting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 期待的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
pleasant
pleasing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人愉快的

Sense.DEF: a substance that gets rid of the burning feeling in your stomach when you have eaten too much, drunk too much alcohol etc
hatred between people or groups of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或团体之间的〕对抗﹐对立﹐敌对

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the antagonism between the army and other military groups
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队和其他军事组织间的对立

Sense.DEF: opposition to an idea, plan etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his antagonism towards the press
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对新闻界所持的反对态度

Sense.DEF: your opponent in a competition, battle, quarrel etc
unfriendly; wanting to argue or disagree
Sense.EXAMPLE: an antagonistic attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对抗态度

Sense.DEF: opposed to an idea or group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: antagonistic to new ideas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对新观点

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone very much by doing something that they do not like
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do not antagonize your customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要惹恼顾客。

Sense.DEF: the very cold most southern part of the world
an imaginary line drawn around the world at a certain distance from the most southern point (the South Pole)
to increase your demands or try to get more things from a situation, even though this involves more risks
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve upped the ante by making a $120 million bid to buy the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们增加筹码﹐出价1.2亿美元收购该公司。

Sense.DEF: to pay an amount of money in order to be able to do or be involved in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small firms that want to expand must ante up large legal fees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小公司想要扩展就必须支付一大笔律师费。

Sense.DEF: before
Sense.EXAMPLE:
antedate
earlier than something
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早于
Sense.EXAMPLE:
antenatal
before birth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产前的

Sense.DEF: an animal that has a very long nose and eats small insects
existing before a war, especially the American Civil War
Sense.TRAN: 战前的﹔〔尤指〕美国内战前的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an antebellum plantation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国内战前的种植园

Sense.DEF: an event, organization, or thing that is similar to the one you have mentioned but existed earlier
Sense.EXAMPLE: historical antecedents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史先例

Sense.DEF: the people in your family who lived a long time ago

a word, phrase, or sentence that is represented by another word, for example a
pronoun
Sense.TRAN: 先行语〔由代词等代替的单词﹑短语或句子〕
〔通往较大房间的〕前室﹐外室﹐接待室

Sense.DEF: to come from an earlier time in history than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economic troubles antedate the current administration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些经济问题早在现任政府就职之前就已出现。

Sense.DEF: very old-fashioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: antediluvian ideas about women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于女性的陈旧观念

Sense.DEF: an animal with long horns that can run very fast and is very graceful
relating to the medical care given to women who are going to have a baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: an antenatal clinic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产前检查诊所
Sense.EXAMPLE: regular antenatal care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定期产前保健
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many young mothers do not attend antenatal classes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻的母亲不参加产前学习班。

Sense.DEF: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

a wire
rod
etc used for receiving radio and television signals
Sense.EXAMPLE: television antennas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视机天线

Sense.DEF: at or towards the front
Sense.EXAMPLE: anterior vertebrae
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前椎

Sense.DEF: happening or existing before something else
a small room that is connected to a larger room, especially where people wait to go into the larger room
Sense.TRAN: 〔通往较大房间的〕前室﹐外室﹐接待室

Sense.DEF: a formal or religious song
a song that a particular group of people consider to be very important
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个群体认为非常重要的〕经典歌曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Rolling Stones’ ‘Satisfaction’ was an anthem for a generation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚石乐队的《满足》是一代人传唱的经典歌曲。

Sense.DEF: having the qualities of an anthem
Sense.EXAMPLE: anthemic rock music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激动人心的摇滚音乐

Sense.DEF:
the part of a male flower which contains
pollen

a place where
ant s
live
a set of stories, poems, songs etc by different people collected together in one book
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anthology of American literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国文学选集

Sense.DEF: a very hard type of coal that burns slowly and produces a lot of heat
a serious disease affecting cattle and sheep, which can affect humans

like or concerning
human being s
Sense.EXAMPLE:
anthropomorphic
having human form or qualities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拟人的

Sense.DEF:
an anthropoid animal, such as an
ape
, looks like a human

the scientific study of people, their societies,
culture s
etc
the belief that animals or objects have the same feelings and qualities as humans
Sense.TRAN: 拟人论﹐拟人观〔认为动物或物体具有人类的情感和特质〕

Sense.DEF: the belief that God can appear in a human or animal form
Sense.TRAN: 神人同形论〔认为神能具有人或动物的外貌〕

Sense.DEF: opposed to
Sense.EXAMPLE:
antinuclear
opposing the use of
nuclear
weapons and power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对使用核武器[核能]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-American
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反美的

Sense.DEF: the opposite of something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
anticlimax
an unexciting ending instead of the expected exciting ending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人扫兴的结局
Sense.EXAMPLE:
antimatter
material completely opposite in kind to the ordinary material in the universe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反物质

Sense.DEF: acting to prevent something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
antifreeze
a liquid added to a car’s engine to prevent freezing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防冻剂

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: a liquid that kills harmful bacteria

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗菌剂﹐消毒剂

Sense.DEF: anti-aircraft weapons are used against enemy aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-aircraft missiles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防空导弹

Sense.DEF:
a drug that is used to kill
bacteria
and cure infections
a substance produced by your body to fight disease

against women having the right to have an
abortion
to expect that something will happen and be ready for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales are better than anticipated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销量比预期要好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The schedule isn’t final, but we don’t anticipate many changes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日程还没有最后定下来﹐但是我们预料不会有许多变化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t anticipate any problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预料不会有问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么﹑关注什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This year, we anticipate that our expenses will be 15% greater.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年﹐我们预计支出会增加15%。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is anticipated that the research will have many different practical applications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计这项研究将有许多不同的实际用途。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t anticipate having to do the cooking myself!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有料到要自己做饭！

Sense.DEF: to think about something that is going to happen, especially something pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

Sense.DEF: to do something before someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Copernicus anticipated in part the discoveries of the 17th and 18th centuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17和18世纪的发现中有一部分早为哥白尼所发现。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the anticipatory atmosphere of a big college football game
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场大学足球大战前山雨欲来的气氛

Sense.DEF: when you are expecting something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She waited in eager anticipation for Robert to arrive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她急切地期盼着罗伯特到来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taylor was excited and full of anticipation at the prospect of the trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒很兴奋﹐对这次旅行满怀期待。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth in anticipation of sth
Sense.DEF: to do something because you expect something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 因预料到某事而做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workers have called off their strike in anticipation of a pay offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们预料到资方会提供薪酬调整方案﹐便取消了罢工。

Sense.DEF: being opposed to priests having any political power or influence
a situation or event that does not seem exciting because it happens after something that was much better
Sense.TRAN: 〔精彩的事情之后的〕令人扫兴的情况[事]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Going back to work after a month travelling in China was bound to be an anticlimax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在中国旅行了一个月之后再回去工作必然很没劲。

Sense.DEF: moving in the opposite direction to the hands of a clock
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn the lid anticlockwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往逆时针方向转动盖子。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that seems strange, funny, silly, or annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re all growing tired of his childish antics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都厌倦了他那些幼稚的滑稽举动。

Sense.DEF: an area of high air pressure that causes calm weather in the place it is moving over

a drug used to treat
depression
a mental illness that makes people very unhappy
a substance that stops the effects of a poison

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no known antidote to a bite from this snake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被这种毒蛇咬伤尚无解药。

Sense.DEF: something that makes an unpleasant situation better
Sense.EXAMPLE: laughter, the antidote to stress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笑﹐舒缓压力的良药

Sense.DEF: a liquid that is put in the water in car engines to stop it from freezing
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于汽车发动机的〕防冻剂﹐抗凝剂

Sense.DEF:
anti-fungal medicines are used to cure
fungal
infections such as
athlete’s foot
,
ringworm
, and
thrush

a substance that makes the body produce
antibodies

a belief shared by various political groups that people must oppose
globalization
the process of making something such as a business operate in different countries around the world
because of bad effects it has on people, especially in developing countries, and because of the damage it does to the environment
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-globalization protests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反全球化抗议活动

Sense.DEF: a main character in a book, play, or film who is an ordinary or unpleasant person and lacks the qualities that you expect a hero to have
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑戏剧或电影中的〕非正统主角﹐〔缺乏传统英雄品格的〕反英雄

Sense.DEF:
a drug that is used to treat an
allergy
an unpleasant reaction to particular foods, substances etc
Sense.TRAN: 抗组（织）胺药〔治疗过敏症〕

Sense.DEF:
anti-inflammatory drugs reduce
inflammation
painful swelling
in part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-inflammatory painkillers for treating arthritis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗关节炎的消炎止痛药

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle easier to control when you have to stop very suddenly

a form of
matter 30
substance which the things in the universe are made of
consisting of antiparticles

a silver-white metal that breaks easily and is often combined with other metals. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Sb
Sense.TRAN: 锑〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Sb〕

Sense.DEF:
a substance in some foods that cleans the body and protects it from
cancer
a very small part of an atom that has the opposite electrical charge to the one usually found in atoms
an Italian dish consisting of cold meat or vegetables that you eat before the main part of a meal
having a very strong feeling of disliking or opposing someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s human nature to be antipathetic to change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生性不喜欢变化。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of strong dislike towards someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a growing antipathy towards the government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府日益强烈的反感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s always been a certain amount of antipathy between the two doctors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个医生之间一向有嫌隙。

Sense.DEF: an anti-personnel weapon is designed to hurt people rather than to damage buildings, vehicles etc

a substance that prevents you
sweat ing
an antiquarian bookshop sells old books
old-fashioned and not suitable for modern needs or conditions – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 过时的﹐陈旧的﹐老式的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: antiquated laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过时的法律

Sense.DEF: antique furniture, jewellery etc is old and often valuable
Sense.TRAN: 〔家具﹑珠宝等〕古时制造的﹐古董的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an antique rosewood desk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古董红木书桌

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The palace is full of priceless antiques.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宫殿里到处都是价值连城的古董。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They bought the clock at an antique shop in Bath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在巴斯一家古玩店里买了这只钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an antique dealer
someone who buys and sells antiques
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古玩商

Sense.DEF: ancient times

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The common household fork was nearly unknown in antiquity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古时﹐几乎看不到普通的家用餐叉。

Sense.DEF: the state of being very old
Sense.EXAMPLE: a building of great antiquity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常古老的建筑物

Sense.DEF: a building or object made in ancient times
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of Roman antiquities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批古罗马文物

Sense.DEF: a type of drug that is used against HIV infection
someone who hates Jewish people

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He made a few anti-Semitic remarks.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说了些仇恨犹太人的话。

Sense.DEF: hatred of Jewish people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the struggle against fascism and anti-Semitism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反抗法西斯主义和反犹太主义的斗争

Sense.DEF: a medicine that you put onto a wound to stop it from becoming infected
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在伤口上涂了些消毒剂。
薄荷是一种温和的杀菌剂。

Sense.DEF: helping to prevent infection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗感染药膏
一些药草有抗菌性。

Sense.DEF: antisocial behaviour is violent or harmful to other people, or shows that you do not care about other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕反社会的﹔危害社会的﹔不考虑他人利益的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was finding it hard to cope with her son’s increasingly antisocial behaviour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得难以应付儿子日益加剧的反社会行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is an antisocial habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟是一种无视他人利益的行为习惯。

Sense.DEF: someone who is antisocial does not enjoy meeting or being with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I don’t go tonight, everyone will accuse me of being antisocial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我今晚不去﹐所有人都会指责我不合群。

Sense.DEF: an activity or job that is antisocial does not give you the chance to meet other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got fed up with the low pay and antisocial hours .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资微薄﹐还要在本该用于社交的时间上班﹐这让我受够了。

Sense.DEF:
an anti-tank weapon is designed to destroy enemy
tank s
the complete opposite of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is not democratic. It is the antithesis of democracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不民主﹐而是民主的对立面。

Sense.DEF: exactly opposite to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This violence is completely antithetical to the teaching of the church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种暴行与教会的教义完全背道而驰。

Sense.DEF: a medicine or substance produced by your body which stops the effects of a poison
intended to prevent companies from unfairly controlling prices
Sense.EXAMPLE: new tougher antitrust laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更严厉的新反垄断法
Sense.EXAMPLE: an antitrust investigation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反垄断调查

Sense.DEF:
a type of
software
that looks for and removes
virus es
in programs and documents on your computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to update your anti-virus software regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要定期更新杀毒软件。

Sense.DEF:
one of the two horns of a male
deer
a word that means the opposite of another word
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dictionary of synonyms and antonyms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同义词和反义词词典

Sense.DEF: nervous and unable to keep still because you are waiting for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔因等待某事发生而〕坐立不安的

Sense.DEF: the hole in your bottom through which solid waste leaves your body
a heavy iron block on which pieces of hot metal are shaped using a hammer
the feeling of being very worried about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is considerable anxiety among staff about job losses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工很担心会失业。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is growing public anxiety over levels of air pollution in our cities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众越来越担心城市中的空气污染程度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fear of unemployment can be a source of deep anxiety to people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 害怕失业会使人们产生严重的焦虑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: his feelings of anxiety
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他焦虑的心情
Sense.EXAMPLE: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂安装了摄像头﹐这引起了工人的高度不安。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of wanting to do something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I nearly fell in my anxiety to get downstairs quickly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我急匆匆地下楼﹐差点摔倒。

Sense.DEF: worried about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was a bit anxious about the safety of the machinery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有点担心机器的安全性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were anxious for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为你担心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave me an anxious look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was anxious that it might be cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心可能是癌症。

Sense.DEF: an anxious time or situation is one in which you feel nervous or worried
Sense.TRAN: 〔时间或形势〕紧张的﹐使人焦虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had an anxious couple of weeks waiting for the test results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们惴惴不安地过了几个礼拜﹐等待考试成绩出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an anxious moment when the plane suddenly dropped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机突然下坠﹐那一刻让人很紧张。

Sense.DEF: feeling strongly that you want to do something or want something to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is anxious to improve its image.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司急于改善形象。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president is anxious not to have another crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统亟欲避免另一场危机。

GramExa.PROPFORM: anxious for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why was she so anxious for me to stay?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为什么非要我留下来？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were all anxious for news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都在焦急地等待消息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both sides were anxious that the agreement should be signed as quickly as possible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都急着想尽快签署协议。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She waited anxiously by the phone.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她焦急地在电话机旁等着。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: some or even the smallest amount or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got any money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你身上有没有钱？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need any further information?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要更详细的信息吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are any of the paintings for sale?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些画有没有要卖的？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They didn’t invite any of us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有邀请我们中的任何一个。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Are there any other questions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有没有其他问题？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They haven’t shown any interest at all in my research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对我的研究没表示任何兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The universities have shown few if any signs of a willingness to change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些大学非常不情愿改革。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a person or thing of a particular type when what you are saying is true of all people or things of that type
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any child who breaks the rules will be punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡违反规定的孩子都要受罚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always check the details carefully before you sign any written agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 签署任何书面协议之前都要仔细核对细节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can see you any time on Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一我随时都能见你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I can help in any way, let me know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我能帮上忙的话﹐就告诉我一声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can choose any of the books on the list.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张单子上的书你可以随便选。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This excuse was as good as any other .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个借口和其他借口如出一辙。

Sense.DEF: as much as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re going to need any help they can get.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能得到的帮助他们都需要。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is special
Sense.TRAN: 非一般的（老）男人/女人/工作等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s not just any actress, she’s one of the best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可不是一般的演员﹐她是属于顶尖的那种。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: not in any way, shape, or form

Head.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句

Sense.DEF: used before the comparative form of an adjective to mean ‘even a small amount’
Sense.TRAN: 一点﹐丝毫〔用于形容词比较级之前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t run any faster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没法跑得更快了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you feeling any better?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你感觉好些了吗？

Sense.DEF: if something does not happen any more or any longer, it used to happen but does not happen now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah doesn’t live here any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎拉已不住在这里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was told he wasn’t wanted any longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被告知不再需要他了。

Sense.DEF: used with a verb to mean ‘at all’
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tried talking to him but that didn’t help any.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们试着跟他谈过﹐但一点用处也没有。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal could damage her reputation but the press reported it anyhow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这宗丑闻可能损害她的名声﹐不过报纸还是给登了出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been to a circus, not recently anyhow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从没看过马戏﹐至少最近没看过。

Sense.DEF: in a careless or untidy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cupboard would hardly close, with all the shoes thrown in anyhow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柜子乱塞了许多鞋﹐都快关不上了。

Sense.DEF: not any longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick doesn’t live here anymore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克不再住在这里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She told me not to phone her anymore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她叫我不要再给她打电话。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to any person, when it is not important to say exactly who
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone could win tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚任何人都可能赢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They offer help and advice to anyone interested in becoming a teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为任何有兴趣当老师的人提供帮助和咨询。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anyone sees Lisa, ask her to call me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有谁看见莉萨﹐叫她打电话给我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone else who is interested in going on the trip should see me at the end of this lesson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有谁有兴趣参加此次旅行﹐下课来找我。

Sense.DEF: used in questions to mean ‘someone’
Sense.TRAN: 有人﹐任何人〔用于疑问句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does anyone want a drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有人想喝一杯？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there anyone new coming to tonight’s meeting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上来参加会议的有没有新面孔？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know anyone else who wants a ticket?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道还有谁想要票吗？

Sense.DEF: used in negative sentences to mean no person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went to the bar but there wasn’t anyone there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去了酒吧﹐但是那里一个人都没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t spoken to anyone all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一整天都没跟任何人说过话。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular verb after anyone
F2NBox.TRAN: anyone后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Hardly anyone was paying attention to him.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use 'of' after anyone . Use any of
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要用anyone of﹐而要用any of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Do any of these people have jobs?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人当中有谁有工作吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t imagine living anyplace else now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在不能想象住在其他地方会怎么样。

Sense.DEF: any thing, event, situation etc, when it is not important to say exactly which
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can buy anything you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想要什么都可以买。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was prepared to do anything to make a bit of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要能赚一点钱﹐他什么都愿意做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anything would be better than staying at home!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做什么都比待在家里好！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can write about swimming, skiing, or anything else you enjoy doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以写游泳﹑写滑雪或者其他任何你喜欢的活动。

Sense.DEF: used in questions to mean ‘something’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there anything I can do to help?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有什么是我可以效劳的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want anything from the shops?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要我从商店带点什么回来吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like anything else to eat?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还要吃点别的东西吗？

Sense.DEF: used in negative sentences to mean no thing event etc
Sense.TRAN: 任何事物都（没有）〔用于否定句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t have anything to eat for three days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们连着三天没吃过任何东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t do anything until we get there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到那儿之前不要采取任何行动。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone or something does not have a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria is anything but stupid!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚才不笨呢！

Sense.DEF: similar in any way to someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t look anything like your mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你长得一点都不像你母亲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re anything like me, you’ll want to be where the action is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你像我一样﹐就也会想去热闹的地方。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a negative sentence
Sense.TRAN: 一点也不〔用于强调否定句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have anything like enough money to buy a new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们根本没有足够的钱买新汽车。

Sense.DEF: extremely important, clear etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was as nice as anything to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我非常好。

Sense.DEF: or something that is similar
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a drink or anything?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想来杯饮料什么的吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that anything someone says or does is acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: From what other people were wearing, it looked like anything goes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从其他人的衣着来看﹐好像穿什么都可以。

Sense.DEF: if you will not do something for anything, you will definitely not do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t go back there for anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不回那里去。

Sense.DEF: if you do something like anything, you do it a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all encouraged him like anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都拼命鼓励他。

Sense.DEF: used when you are adding something to emphasize what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 要说有什么的话（倒是…）〔用于补充内容以强调前面所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam didn’t seem too disappointed at losing. If anything, he seemed relieved that it was all over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于比赛失利﹐萨姆好像并不是太失望﹐要说有什么的话﹐比赛结束之后他看上去倒是松了一口气。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone you agree with what they suggest
Sense.TRAN: 怎么样都行﹐你说怎样就怎样
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes, of course, anything you say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是的﹐当然﹐怎么样都行。

Sense.DEF: at any time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Call me anytime. I’m always home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随时给我打电话﹐我一直在家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They should arrive anytime between noon and 3 p.m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们会在中午至下午3点期间到达。

Sense.DEF: in spite of the fact that you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Catherine wasn’t sure the book was the right one, but she bought it anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳不能确定就是这本书﹐但她还是买了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This idea probably won’t work, but let’s try it anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个办法可能行不通﹐不过我们还是试试吧。

Sense.DEF: used when adding a remark which shows that the fact just mentioned is not important
Sense.TRAN: 反正〔用于补充说明刚才提到的事实不重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They didn’t have any trainers in my size, and anyway I’d already decided I’d rather save the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们卖的运动鞋没有我的尺码﹐不过反正我也已经决定还是省点钱吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hope you haven’t told anyone.’ ‘No. Who would believe me anyway?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我希望你没告诉别人。”“没有。话又说回来﹐说了又有谁会相信我呢？”

Sense.DEF: used when adding something that corrects or slightly changes what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 至少〔用于纠正前面的话﹐或稍作修改〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s think about it for a while, for a few days anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们想一想﹐至少考虑几天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seems to have been a technical problem – anyway, that’s what they told me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好像出了技术故障﹐至少他们是这么跟我说的。

Sense.DEF: used when you are ignoring details so that you can talk immediately about the most important thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got lost and spent hours looking for the station, and anyway it was past midnight by the time he got home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迷了路﹐找车站花了几个小时﹐总之过了午夜才到家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyway, why didn’t you call the police?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总之﹐你为什么不报警？

Sense.DEF: used when you are changing the subject of a conversation or returning to a previous subject
Sense.TRAN: 对了﹐好吧〔用于转换话题或回到前一个话题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyway, let’s leave that for the moment and look at this month’s profit figures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐那个问题先搁置一边﹐我们来看看本月的利润额。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyway, how are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对了﹐你身体好吗？

Sense.DEF: used when you want to end a conversation or leave a place
Sense.TRAN: 噢﹐啊〔用于表示想结束谈话或想要离开〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyway, I must be going now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐我现在得走了。

Sense.DEF:
anyway
. Many teachers think this is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 〔同anyway﹐许多教师认为这不是正确的英语〕

Sense.DEF: in or to any place
Sense.TRAN: 任何地方﹐无论何处﹐随便哪里
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit anywhere you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你随便坐吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can buy clothes like these anywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的衣服到处都可以买到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to live in London, but I’d be happy living anywhere else .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想住在伦敦﹐但是住在其他什么地方我都很乐意。

Sense.DEF: used in questions to mean ‘somewhere’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need anywhere to stay for the night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要找个地方过夜吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you go anywhere exotic on vacation this year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今年去没去什么有异国情调的地方度假？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you been anywhere else in Spain?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到过西班牙的其他地方吗？

Sense.DEF: used in negative sentences to mean no place
Sense.TRAN: 哪儿（也没有）〔用于否定句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t find my passport anywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我哪儿也找不到我的护照。

Subsense.DEF: not at all near
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t anywhere near him when he fell.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摔倒的时候我根本不在他旁边。

Subsense.DEF: not at all
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think these figures are anywhere near accurate.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这些数据完全不准确。

Sense.LEXUNIT: anywhere between one and ten/anywhere from one to ten etc
Sense.DEF: used to mean any age, number, amount etc between the ones that you say
Sense.TRAN: 在一到十之间/从一到十等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could have been anywhere between 45 and 60 years of age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能在45到60岁之间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can accommodate anywhere between 60 and 300 people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这里可容纳60到300人。

Sense.DEF: to not be successful at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: You won’t get anywhere without qualifications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有资历﹐你会一事无成。

Sense.DEF: if something does not get you anywhere, it does not change a situation or help you to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: （对某人）不会有什么改观﹐没什么用处
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can try writing to complain, but I don’t think it will get you anywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以试试写信去投诉﹐但我认为这没什么用。

Sense.DEF: to not be achieving success in your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a nice enough lad, but he’s not going anywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个很好的小伙子﹐但没什么出息。

Sense.DEF: a soldier from Australia or New Zealand, especially in World War I
Sense.TRAN: 澳大利亚士兵﹔新西兰士兵﹔〔尤指第一次世界大战时的〕澳新军团士兵

Sense.DEF: things which are not written on the list of subjects to discuss at a meeting, but which people want to talk about after all the other subjects have been discussed
in good condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: We took the car in for a check, and it was A-OK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把汽车送去检查﹐结果一切正常。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Everything’s been going A-OK since Jack got home.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克回家以后﹐一切都很顺利。

Sense.DEF:
the largest
artery
that takes blood away from your heart

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= access point 接入点﹐入口点

Sense.DEF: happening quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Expansion of the company has continued apace .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司继续迅速扩张。

Sense.DEF: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Place the two posts 6 metres apart.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这两根桩相隔6米立好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的办事处远至印度﹑秘鲁等国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名男子打起架来﹐我们不得不将他们拉开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔尔皱着眉头﹐独自站在一边。

Sense.DEF: if something comes apart, or you take it apart, it is separated into different pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole thing comes apart so that you can clean it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个东西可以拆开﹐以便清洗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They took the engine apart to see what was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把发动机拆开检查故障。

Sense.DEF: if you keep things apart, you keep them separate from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: I try to keep my work and private life as far apart as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法把工作和私生活尽可能分开。

Sense.DEF: if things are a particular time apart, they do not happen at the same time but have that much time between them

GramExa.PROPFORM: two days/three weeks/five years etc apart
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our birthdays are exactly a month apart.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩的生日正好相差一个月。

Sense.DEF: if people are apart, they are not together in the same place, or not having a relationship with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children have never been apart before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们以前从来没有分开过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wife and I are living apart at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前我和妻子分居。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s never been apart from his mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从未离开过母亲。

Subsense.DEF: if something falls apart, it breaks into different pieces
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It just fell apart in my hands!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它好端端地就在我手里碎了！

Subsense.DEF: if something is falling apart, it is in very bad condition
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He drives around in an old car that’s falling apart.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开一辆快散架的老汽车东奔西跑。

Subsense.DEF: if something falls apart, it fails completely
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He lost his job and his marriage fell apart.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他失业了﹐婚姻也破裂了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The country’s economy is in danger of falling apart.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国经济面临崩溃。

Sense.DEF: if a marriage, family etc is torn apart, it can no longer continue because of serious difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play portrays a good marriage torn apart by external forces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏讲述了一段美好姻缘被外力摧毁的故事。

Sense.DEF: if people, beliefs, or ideas are worlds or poles apart, they are completely different from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realized we were still worlds apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我意识到我们之间仍有天壤之别。

Sense.DEF: if people drift or grow apart, their relationship slowly becomes less close
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis and his father drifted apart after he moved to New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯搬到纽约后和父亲逐渐疏远了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you want to say something seriously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joking apart, they did do quite a good job for us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说正经的﹐他们确实为我们干得很好。

Sense.DEF: except for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car industry apart, most industries are now seeing an improvement in their economic performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了汽车工业﹐目前大多数行业的经济状况都在好转。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something different from other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her unusual lifestyle set her apart as a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小时候﹐她独特的生活方式令她显得与众不同。

Sense.DEF: except for
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t see anyone all day, apart from a couple of kids on the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了海滩上的几个小孩﹐我们一整天没见到什么人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apart from the ending, it’s a really good film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了结局﹐这部电影真的不错。

Sense.DEF: as well as
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apart from his earnings as a football coach, he also owns and runs a chain of sports shops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了当足球教练的收入之外﹐他还拥有并经营一家体育用品连锁店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quite apart from the cost, we need to think about how much time the job will take.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了成本﹐我们还得考虑这个工作要花多少时间。

Sense.DEF: the former political and social system in South Africa, in which only white people had full political rights and people of other races, especially black people, were forced to go to separate schools, live in separate areas etc
a set of rooms on one floor of a large building, where someone lives
Sense.TRAN: 〔在同一楼层的〕一套住房﹐公寓套房
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives in a small apartment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她住在一套小公寓里。

Sense.DEF: a room or set of rooms used by an important person such as a president
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had never been in the prince’s private apartments before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未进过王子的私人套房。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the presidential apartments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统套房

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一居室/两居室等的公寓
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A tiny one-bedroom apartment was all she could afford.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只买得起一间小小的一居室公寓。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with just one main room, which you use for sleeping, cooking, and eating
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔睡觉﹑做饭和用餐都在一个房间的〕一室公寓﹐开间公寓
位于一楼/二楼等的公寓

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: below the level of the ground
on the top floor of a building
with or without furniture
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 有家具的/没有家具的公寓

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He lived in a small apartment on the third floor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他住在三楼的一套小公寓里。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tom rented an apartment at the top of the building.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆租下了大楼顶层的一套公寓。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a five-storey apartment block
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 五层的公寓楼

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a group of buildings containing apartments

Sense.DEF: a large building containing many apartments
