not interested in something, and not willing to make any effort to change or improve things
Sense.TRAN: 无兴趣的﹔冷淡的﹔无动于衷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt too apathetic even to move.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她毫无兴趣﹐甚至连动都不想动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can you be so apathetic about the world and its problems?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么能对这个世界以及其中存在的问题如此无动于衷？

Sense.DEF: the feeling of not being interested in something, and not willing to make any effort to change or improve things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The campaign failed because of public apathy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于公众反应冷淡﹐这次运动失败了。

Sense.DEF: an animal that is similar to a monkey but has no tail or only a very short tail
to suddenly become very angry
to copy the way someone speaks or behaves in order to make fun of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could ape his teachers perfectly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他可以把老师模仿得惟妙惟肖。

Sense.DEF: to copy someone’s way of doing something, so that what you do or produce is not good or original
Sense.EXAMPLE: cheap clothes which ape the high fashions of the day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模仿高级流行时装的廉价服饰

Sense.DEF: an alcoholic drink that people drink before a meal
a small hole or space in something
the small hole at the front of a camera, which can be made larger or smaller to let more or less light in when you take a photograph
to suddenly become very angry
the top or highest part of something pointed or curved
Sense.EXAMPLE: the apex of the roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房顶的尖端
Sense.EXAMPLE: the apex of a pyramid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金字塔塔尖

Sense.DEF: the most important position in an organization or society
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king was at the apex of society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王是社会的最高主宰。

Sense.DEF: the most successful part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was at the apex of his career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正处于事业的顶峰。

Sense.DEF: APEX tickets for planes or trains are cheaper than normal ones, and have to be bought several days before you travel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The APEX fare is £222 return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预购往返票优惠价是222英镑。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I managed to get an APEX for less than £100.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了不到100英镑买到一张预购优惠票。

Sense.DEF: a type of small insect that feeds on the juices of plants
a short phrase that contains a wise idea
a food, drink, or drug that makes you want to have sex

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a fruit that is believed to have aphrodisiac properties
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种据信有催情作用的水果

Sense.DEF: costing or having a particular amount each
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pictures are worth about £10,000 apiece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些画每幅价值约一万英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two top teams have ten points apiece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排名最高的两支球队各得十分。

Sense.DEF: in large amounts, especially more than you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was food aplenty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物很充裕。

Sense.DEF: in a confident and skilful way, especially when you have to deal with difficult problems or a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 游刃有余地﹐从容不迫地﹐泰然自若地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ms Sharpe handled their questions with great aplomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏普女士镇定自若地回答了他们的问题。

Sense.DEF: the destruction and end of the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-nuclear protesters who fear the apocalypse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 担心世界末日到来的反核示威者

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people die or suffer, and a lot of damage is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of investors now fear a stock market apocalypse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前许多投资者担心股灾降临。

Sense.DEF: warning people about terrible events that will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The novel presents us with an apocalyptic vision of the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部小说向我们描述了未来的恐怖景象。

Sense.DEF: connected with the final destruction and end of the world, or with any great destruction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before them was an apocalyptic landscape of burnt villages and bomb craters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们眼前是被焚毁的村落和一个个弹坑﹐俨然一幅世界末日的景象。

Sense.DEF: an apocryphal story is well-known but probably not true
Sense.TRAN: 广为流传但真实性可疑的

Sense.DEF: the most successful part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His political career reached its apogee in the 1960s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代﹐他的政治生涯达到了顶峰。

Sense.DEF: not interested in politics, or not connected with any political party
Sense.TRAN: 不关心政治的﹔与政党无关的﹐非政治的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of apolitical young professional people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群不问政事的年轻专业人士
Sense.EXAMPLE: an apolitical organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非政治组织

Sense.DEF: showing or saying that you are sorry that something has happened, especially because you feel guilty or embarrassed about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The manager was very apologetic about everything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理对一切深表愧疚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave me an apologetic smile .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝我歉然一笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dan came in looking very apologetic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹走了进来﹐满脸歉意。

Sense.DEF: a statement in which you defend an idea or organization that you believe in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an apologia for the Christian church
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为基督教会所作的辩护

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to explain and defend an idea, person, or political system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an apologist for socialism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会主义的辩护者

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m so sorry, I do apologize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常对不起﹐我真心道歉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you should apologize to your brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你应该给你弟弟赔个不是。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He later apologized for his behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后来为自己的行为道了歉。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I apologize for losing my temper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我道歉﹐我不该发脾气的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often use the phrases say (you are) sorry or tell someone you are sorry , rather than apologize (to sb)
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们经常用短语say (you are) sorry或tell someone you are sorry﹐而不说apologize (to sb)
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ I’ve already told him I'm sorry .

Sense.DEF: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister had to issue a formal public apology for his remarks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长不得不为他的言论作出正式的公开道歉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She finally received an apology from the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于接到了公司方面的道歉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an apology to passengers for any inconvenience caused
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为造成的不便向乘客致歉

Sense.DEF: a message that you send to a meeting to say that you will not be able to come to the meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edward can’t be here today, but he sends his apologies .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华今天来不了﹐他向大家表示歉意。

Sense.DEF: to say that you are sorry but you have to leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: I quickly made my apologies and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快便致歉离开了。

Sense.DEF: to not say that you are sorry for something, because you do not regret it and you think it is the right thing to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: We make no apology for defending our members’ interests – that is our job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们保护会员利益没有错﹐这是我们的职责。

Sense.DEF: a statement in which you defend something you believe in after it has been criticized by other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an apology for Christianity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为基督教所作的辩护

Sense.DEF: a very bad example of something
Sense.TRAN: 权充某物的东西﹔勉强代用的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: They served us up an apology for a meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们端给我们的饭菜真不像样。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I hope you are going to make an apology.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你会道歉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an official public apology
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 作出道歉〔指正式的公开道歉〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country issued an official apology for the incident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国就此事件作出了正式道歉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He received a formal apology from the company.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接到了公司方面的正式道歉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We would like to offer our sincere apologies for the delay.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要对此次延误表示诚挚的歉意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Please accept my apologies for having to cancel our meeting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议被迫取消﹐请接受我的道歉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: print it in a newspaper
say it quietly, especially because you are embarrassed
used when you feel very sorry
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Firstly, my sincere apologies for not having contacted you earlier.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐我为没有早点和你联系向你表示诚挚的歉意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The authorities published a public apology in the newspaper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局在报纸上刊登了公开道歉声明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Russia is demanding a formal apology.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯要求正式道歉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that shows that you are very sorry

Sense.DEF: so angry that your face becomes red
Sense.EXAMPLE: The colonel was apoplectic with rage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上校气愤得满脸通红。

Sense.DEF: relating to apoplexy
an illness in your brain which causes you to suddenly lose your ability to move or think
when someone suddenly stops believing in a religion or supporting a political party
someone who has stopped believing in a religion or supporting a political party
using facts that you know now to form a judgment about what must have happened before
Sense.TRAN: 后验的[地]﹐由事实[结果]推断出原因的[地]﹐归纳的[地]〕

Sense.DEF: one of the 12 people chosen by Jesus Christ to teach and spread the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 门徒﹐使徒〔耶稣基督的十二门徒之一〕

Sense.DEF: someone who believes strongly in an idea and tries to persuade other people about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a great apostle of non-violence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非暴力的大力倡导者

Sense.DEF:
connected with the Pope
leader of the Catholic church
connected with one of Christ’s 12 apostles

Subsense.DEF:
the sign (‘) that is used in writing to show that numbers or letters have been left out, as in ’don’t'
do not
and '86
1986
Subsense.TRAN: 撇号﹐省字符〔用于表示数字或字母的省略〕

Subsense.DEF: the same sign used before ‘s’ to show that something belongs to someone or something, or is connected with them, as in ‘John’s book’, or ‘Charles’ mother', or ‘Henry’s first year as a teacher’
Subsense.TRAN: 撇号﹐所有格符号〔用于s之前表示所有格〕

Subsense.DEF: the same sign used before ‘s’ to show the plural of letters and numbers as in ‘Your r’s look like v’s’.
Subsense.TRAN: 撇号﹐复数符号 〔用于s之前表示字母或数字的复数〕

Sense.DEF: someone who mixed and sold medicines in the past
the best and most perfect example of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the apotheosis of romantic art
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浪漫派艺术的典范

Sense.DEF: the best or highest point in someone’s life or job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the apotheosis of his career
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他事业的巅峰

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very shocked and upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way we kill animals appals a lot of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们屠杀动物的方式令许多人震惊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision to execute the two men has appalled many politicians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处死那两名男子的判决令许多从政者震惊。

Sense.DEF: very shocked and upset by something very bad or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 感到震惊的﹐惊骇万分的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was appalled by what I saw.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼前的一幕看得我心惊肉跳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was appalled at how dirty the place was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地方那么脏﹐他很震惊。

Sense.EXAMPLE: When I heard what had happened I was absolutely appalled .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说了发生的事﹐震惊万分。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant and shocking
Sense.TRAN: 骇人听闻的﹔令人震惊的﹔可怕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She suffered appalling injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伤势非常严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was kept in appalling conditions in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被关在环境极其恶劣的监狱中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an appalling famine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骇人听闻的饥荒

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather was absolutely appalling .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气极其恶劣。

Sense.DEF: a type of horse that is pale in colour, with dark spots
Sense.TRAN: 阿帕卢萨马〔一种皮毛色浅﹑带深色斑点的马〕

Sense.DEF: an official who works for a government or other organization and who obeys orders without thinking
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Labour party apparatchik
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个工党官僚

Sense.DEF: the set of tools and machines that you use for a particular scientific, medical, or technical purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Astronauts have special breathing apparatus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航天员有专门的呼吸装装备。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a lot of people are organized to work together to do a job or control a company or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tax will require a massive administrative apparatus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税收需要大规模的行政机构。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The state apparatus has become corrupt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家机关已经腐败。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the apparatus of government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府机构

Sense.DEF: clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked lovely, despite her strange apparel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身穿奇装异服﹐但是看上去很可爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: men wearing protective apparel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿防护服的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sell a full range of sports apparel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出售各种各样的运动装。

Sense.DEF: easy to notice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It soon became apparent that we had a major problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久就看出来﹐我们有了大麻烦。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is apparent from sth that
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is apparent from scientific studies that the drug has some fairly nasty side effects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学研究表明﹐这种药有相当严重的副作用。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is apparent to sb that
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was apparent to everyone that he was seriously ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都明白他病得很厉害。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 质量的差异显而易见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知什么原因﹐他突然离开了。

Sense.DEF: seeming to have a particular feeling or attitude, although this may not be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did well in his exams, despite his apparent lack of interest in his work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他考得很好﹐尽管表面上他对功课不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have heard that something is true, although you are not completely sure about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apparently the company is losing a lot of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说该公司目前亏损很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t there, but apparently it went well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时不在﹐但是据说事情进展顺利。

Sense.DEF: according to the way someone looks or a situation appears, although you cannot be sure
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned to face him, her anger apparently gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过身面对着他﹐好像怒气已经消退了。

Sense.DEF: something that you imagine you can see, especially the spirit of a dead person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared at the strange apparition before him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他盯着面前那个古怪的幽灵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ghostly apparition of a man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个男子的鬼影

Sense.DEF: an urgent request for something important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police have issued a new appeal for information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方再次发出呼吁﹐征求线索。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the organizations involved have sent urgent appeals to the government, asking for extra funding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关机构都向政府发出紧急呼吁﹐要求增加拨款。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

GramExa.PROPFORM: appeal to sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an appeal to the army to not use too much force
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 呼吁军队不要滥用武力

Sense.DEF: an attempt to persuade people to give money in order to help people who need something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The appeal has nearly reached its target of £100,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次募捐呼吁差不多达到了十万英镑的目标。

Sense.DEF: a formal request to a court or to someone in authority asking for a decision to be changed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sentence was reduced to three years on appeal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过上诉﹐刑期减为三年。

Sense.DEF: a quality that makes people like something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is the particular appeal of this island?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岛的迷人之处在哪里？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme has a very wide appeal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目广受欢迎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film has great appeal for young audiences.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影备受年轻观众喜爱。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
She’s definitely got sex appeal
she is sexually attractive
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她绝对性感。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Detectives are making an urgent appeal for information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探发出紧急呼吁﹐征求线索。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an appeal again
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Detectives renewed their appeal for help from the public.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探再次发出呼吁﹐请求公众协助。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fire service has made an urgent appeal for more part-time firefighters.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防部门发出紧急呼吁﹐征召更多兼职消防员。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The family made a desperate appeal to their daughter to come home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 家人急切地恳求女儿回家。
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The London-based relief agency issued a desperate appeal for aid.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家伦敦的救助机构急切呼吁给予援助。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police have issued a direct appeal to the witness to come forward with information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方直接呼吁目击者站出来提供线索。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Muslim leaders made a personal appeal for the hostage's freedom.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆斯林领袖亲自发出呼吁﹐请求释放人质。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you make again

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meaning 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My client is planning to make an appeal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的委托人正在打算提出上诉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an appeal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mr Sarhadi, who has lived here for three years, has lodged an appeal against extradition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨尔哈迪先生在此居住满三年﹐已就引渡一事提出上诉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The US Supreme Court could refuse to consider the appeal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国最高法院可能拒绝考虑上诉请求。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: listen to all the facts
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The FA will hear Chelsea's appeal against the fine next week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球协会将于下周听取切尔西就罚款提出的申诉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give permission for a decision to be changed
not give permission for a decision to be changed

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She decided to make a formal appeal through her lawyer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定通过律师正式提出上诉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: reasons for making an appeal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You need to have reasonable grounds for your appeal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 上诉要有正当理由。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: until an appeal can take place

Sense.DEF: to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Church and community leaders have appealed for calm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会和社区领袖都呼吁保持冷静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场主请求政府帮助。

GramExa.PROPFORM: appeal to sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police have appealed to anyone with information to come forward and talk to them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方呼吁知情者前来陈述情况。

Sense.DEF: to make a formal request to a court or someone in authority asking for a decision to be changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不服判决﹐打算上诉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both men intend to appeal against their convictions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子都打算对判决提出上诉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Appealing to the referee does not often result in a decision being changed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向裁判提出申诉往往并不能改变判罚。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something appeals to you, they seem attractive and interesting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The programme appeals to young children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目受小孩子喜欢。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea of working abroad really appeals to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去国外工作的这个想法对我很有吸引力。

Sense.LEXUNIT: appeal to sb’s better nature/sense of justice etc
Sense.DEF: to try to persuade someone to do something by reminding them that it is a good or fair thing to do
Sense.TRAN: 呼唤某人的良知/正义感等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could always try appealing to his better nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你总可以试着去唤醒他的良知。

Sense.DEF:
the
Court of Appeal
attractive or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city offers an appealing combination of sporting and cultural events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市集体育活动和文化活动于一身﹐颇具吸引力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It creates an atmosphere which visitors find so appealing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它创造了一种吸引游客的氛围。

Sense.DEF: a look etc that shows that someone wants help or sympathy
Sense.TRAN: 恳求的眼神/表情/声音等
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sure it’s okay?’ she said with an appealing smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你确信没问题吗？”她脸上带着恳求的笑容说道。

Sense.DEF: a court of law in some countries which deals with cases when people are not satisfied with the judgment given by a lower court
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruling by a US federal appeals court
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国联邦上诉法院的一项裁决

Sense.DEF: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police say there appear to be signs of a break-in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称似乎有破门而入的迹象。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The survey appears to contradict motor industry claims.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查结果似乎跟汽车工业宣称的相反。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It appears that all the files have been deleted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来所有文件都已被删除。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方发现了疑似人体遗骸的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图制造她自杀的假象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may be less useful than it appears at first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能没有一开始显得那么有用。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something seems likely to be true, although you are not completely sure

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something seems to have a particular quality or feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried hard to appear calm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他努力让自己显得镇静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to appear rude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想显得无礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The right colours can make a small room appear much bigger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颜色运用恰当可以使小房间显得大很多。

Sense.DEF: to start to be seen, to arrive, or to exist in a place, especially suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two faces appeared at our window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两张面孔出现在我们的窗口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A man suddenly appeared from behind a tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名男子突然从树后冒出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small cracks appeared in the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上出现了小裂缝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was nearly an hour before Sweeney appeared in the pub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了近一小时斯威尼才在小酒馆里出现。

GramExa.GLOSS: appear suddenly and unexpectedly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 突然不知从哪里冒出来
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车好像是突然间从哪里冒出来的。

Sense.DEF: to take part in a film, play, concert, television programme etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has already appeared in a number of films.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经参演过一些影片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He appeared on national television to deny the claims.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出现在全国性电视节目上﹐否认这些说法。

Sense.DEF: to be written or shown on a list, in a book or newspaper, in a document etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story appeared in all the national newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事上了所有的全国性报纸。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Some of the material used has appeared in print before
has been published
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用到的一些材料曾经发表过。

Sense.DEF: to become widely available or known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new range will be appearing in shops in the autumn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的系列将于秋季上市。
Sense.EXAMPLE: New courses are appearing every year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年都会开设新的课程。

Sense.DEF: to go to a law court or other official meeting to give information, answer questions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The three men are due to appear in court tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天这三名男子将出庭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She appeared before Colchester magistrates charged with attempted murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被控杀人未遂﹐接受科尔切斯特地方法官审讯。

GramExa.PROPFORM: appear for sb/on behalf of sb
GramExa.GLOSS: to be the legal representative for someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sir Nicholas Gammon QC appeared on behalf of the defendant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 御用大律师尼古拉斯·甘蒙爵士代表被告出庭。

Exponent.DEF: to start to be seen, especially suddenly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A few small white clouds appeared on the horizon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地平线上出现几朵小小的白云。

Exponent.DEF: to appear very suddenly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A woman’s face popped up from the other side of the fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 围栏那边突然露出一张女人的脸。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually start to be able to be seen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The shape of the baby’s head gradually became visible on the screen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿头部的形状逐渐在屏幕上清晰起来。

Exponent.DEF: if something comes into view, you start to see it as you move closer to it, or it gets closer to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The white cliffs of Dover came into view.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 多佛的白色悬崖映入眼帘。

Exponent.DEF: if the sun, moon, or the stars come out, they suddenly appear
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sun came out from behind a cloud.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳从云朵后面露了出来。

Exponent.DEF: if a large frightening object or person looms, they appear suddenly
Exponent.TRAN: 〔巨大而可怕的物体或人〕赫然耸现﹐突然出现
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dark shape of the castle loomed up out of the mist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡的黑色轮廓赫然耸现在薄雾中。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The man’s face suddenly loomed over him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男人的脸突然出现在他面前。

Exponent.DEF: to appear again after being lost or missing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The girl’s father has resurfaced after six years of no contact.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失去联系六年后﹐这个女孩的父亲再次现身。

Sense.DEF: the way someone or something looks to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve changed the appearance of the whole building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们改变了整幢建筑的外观。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表面上很镇静﹐内心却十分担忧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该以貌取人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在学校里学习很用功﹐只是表面上并不显得特别如此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从所有迹象来看﹐这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些学生看上去如天使一般﹐但外表可能是会骗人的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从各方面看﹐他都是个体面而成功的商人。

Sense.SIGNPOST: sb takes part in a public event
Sense.DEF: when a famous person takes part in a film, concert, or other public event
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was his first public appearance since the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是选举后他首次公开露面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made his last appearance for the club in the Cup Final.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在足总杯决赛中最后一次为这个俱乐部出战。

GramExa.GLOSS: money paid to a famous person to attend an event

Sense.DEF: when something new begins to exist or starts being used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新技术问世后﹐这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the appearance of buds on the trees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树上抽出新芽

Sense.DEF: the unexpected or sudden arrival of someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eileen was deep in concentration, and the sudden appearance of her daughter startled her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾琳正全神贯注﹐女儿突然出现吓了她一跳。

Sense.DEF: to dress and behave in the way in which people expect you to, especially to hide your true situation
Sense.TRAN: 保持体面﹐维持面子﹔装样子
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just wanted to keep up appearances for the kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了孩子﹐她一心要保持体面。

Sense.LEXUNIT: for appearances’ sake/for the sake of appearances
Sense.DEF: if you do something for appearances’ sake, you are trying to behave how people expect you to, especially to hide your true situation or feelings

Sense.LEXUNIT: put in an appearance/make an appearance
Sense.DEF: to go to an event for a short time, because you think you should rather than because you want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least Marc managed to put in an appearance at the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少﹐马克做到了在聚会上露了一面。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone goes to a court of law or official meeting to give information, answer questions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is due to make another court appearance on Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一﹐他将再次出庭。

Sense.DEF: to make someone less angry or stop them from attacking you by giving them what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: They attempted to appease international opposition by promising to hold talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们答应举行会谈﹐试图以此平息国际上的反对声音。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Chamberlain’s policy of appeasement towards Hitler in the 30s
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 30年代张伯伦对希特拉的绥靖政策

Sense.DEF:
a person who
appeal s
against the decision in a court of law

a court in which people
appeal
against decisions made in other courts of law
a name or title
to add something to a piece of writing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The results of the client survey are appended to this document.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 客户调查的结果附在这个文件里面。

Sense.DEF: something that is connected to a larger or more important thing
an arm, leg, or other body part
Sense.TRAN: 附肢﹐附器〔指臂﹑腿或身体其他部位〕

Sense.DEF:
a medical operation in which your
appendix
is removed

an illness in which your
appendix
swells and causes pain

a small organ near your
bowel
, which has little or no use
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Christine had to go into hospital to have her appendix out
have it removed
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里丝蒂娜不得不去医院切除阑尾。

Sense.DEF: a part at the end of a book containing additional information
Sense.EXAMPLE: See Appendix 2.6.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见附录2.6。

Sense.DEF: to belong to or concern something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A forum was set up to deal with all issues appertaining to Everton Park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已设立一个论坛﹐讨论所有关于埃弗顿公园的问题。

Sense.DEF: a desire for food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband always had a huge appetite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

Sense.DEF: a desire or liking for a particular activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has an amazing appetite for knowledge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她求知欲极强。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
People seem to have an insatiable appetite
always wanting more of something
for news of any kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们好像对任何一种新闻都有无穷的兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loss of sexual appetite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性欲减退

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Growing children should have a healthy appetite.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在发育的孩子应该有好胃口。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By the time Ron was 16 he had an enormous appetite.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗恩16岁时胃口已经很大了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A poor appetite may be a sign of illness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食欲不振可能是患病的征兆。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s lots of food – I hope you have a good appetite.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物很多——希望你胃口好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was so miserable that she completely lost her appetite.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她痛苦不堪﹐食欲全无。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The exercise and fresh air had given us an appetite.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动和新鲜空气令我们胃口大开。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make you not feel like eating a meal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t give the children any more sweets – it will spoil their appetite.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再给孩子们吃糖了——会破坏他们的食欲的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Symptoms include fever and loss of appetite.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 症状包括发烧和食欲不振。

Sense.DEF: a small dish that you eat at the beginning of a meal
food that is appetizing smells or looks very good, making you want to eat it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an appetizing aroma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人垂涎的香味
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food wasn’t particularly appetizing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些食物让人不是特别有胃口。

Sense.DEF: to hit your open hands together, to show that you have enjoyed a play, concert, speaker etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience applauded loudly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众掌声雷动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd of 300 supporters warmly applauded her speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 300名支持者为她的演讲热烈鼓掌。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say clap rather than applaud
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说clap﹐而不说applaud
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Everyone was clapping and cheering.

Sense.DEF: to express strong approval of an idea, plan etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I applaud the decision to install more security cameras.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我极力赞成安装更多监控摄像机的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She should be applauded for her honesty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的诚实应当受到赞许。

Sense.DEF: the sound of many people hitting their hands together and shouting, to show that they have enjoyed something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She got a round of applause
a short period of applause
when she finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她结束的时候获得一阵掌声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He left the stage to rapturous applause.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在热烈的喝彩声中离开舞台。

Sense.DEF: a hard round fruit that has red, light green, or yellow skin and is white inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: apple pie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果馅饼
Sense.EXAMPLE: an apple tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果树
Sense.EXAMPLE:
roast pork and apple sauce
a thick sauce made from cooked apples
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤猪肉配苹果酱汁

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the apple of sb’s eye
Sense.DEF: to be loved very much by someone
Sense.TRAN: 是某人的心肝宝贝﹐是某人的掌上明珠
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben was always the apple of his father’s eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本一直是他父亲的心肝宝贝。

Sense.DEF: to play a game in which you must use your teeth to pick up apples floating in water
Sense.TRAN: 咬苹果〔指用牙齿从水面上叼起苹果的游戏〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: be as American as apple pie
Sense.DEF: used to describe something that is typically American

Sense.LEXUNIT: the apple doesn’t fall far from the tree
Sense.DEF: used to say that children are usually similar to their parents, especially in a bad way
someone who tries to gain something, become popular etc by praising or helping someone else without being sincere
a computer program that is part of a larger program, and which performs a particular job, such as finding documents on the Internet

a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a
cooker
or
washing machine
, used in people’s homes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s plenty of space for all the usual kitchen appliances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有足够的空间摆放各种日常厨房器具。

PronCodes.PRON: əˈplɪkəb ə l, ˈæplɪkəb ə l

Sense.DEF: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The offer is only applicable to bookings for double rooms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个报价只适用于预订双人房。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ms/Miss/Mrs/Mr Please delete as applicable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女士/小姐/太太/先生 请删去不适用项。

Sense.DEF: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was one of 30 applicants for the manager’s job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是经理职位的30名申请人之一。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who is accepted or not accepted for a job etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 被录用[录取]/未被录用[录取]的申请人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Successful applicants will be expected to travel extensively.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获录用者需要经常出差。

Sense.DEF: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an application for a grant
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经费申请

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The university welcomes applications from overseas students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本大学欢迎海外学生申请入学。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We receive hundreds of job applications each year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每年收到数百封求职信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I filled in the application form and sent it off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我填完申请表后把它寄了出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to submit your application before the end of the month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月底之前必须递交申请。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve put in an application for a transfer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已递交了调动申请。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received a letter saying that his application had been rejected .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到一封信﹐告知他的申请已被拒绝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can take a long time for your visa application to be processed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办理签证申请可能需要很长时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Council is currently reviewing the way it deals with planning applications .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会目前正在审查其处理规划申请的方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for your letter of application , which we received yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的申请信昨天收悉﹐谢谢。

Sense.DEF: the practical purpose for which a machine, idea etc can be used, or a situation when this is used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the applications of genetic engineering in agriculture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基因工程在农业上的应用

Sense.EXAMPLE: The research has many practical applications .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究有许多实际用途。

Sense.DEF: a piece of computer software which does a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: We received training on a number of spreadsheet and database applications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们接受过一些电子表格和数据库应用软件方面的培训。

Sense.DEF: when you put something such as paint, liquid, medicine etc onto a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The application of fertilizer increased the size of the plants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 施肥后植株长得更高大了。

Sense.DEF: attention or effort over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Making your new business successful requires luck, patience, and application.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新公司的成功需要运气﹑耐心和努力。

Sense.DEF:
an
ASP
computer software that is designed for a particular use or user
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to ensure that the application software on both the PC and the Macintosh produces compatible files.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要确保这一应用软件在个人电脑和苹果计算机上都能制作出可以兼容的文档。

Sense.DEF: a special brush or tool used to spread a cream, liquid, medicine etc onto a surface
science etc that has a practical use
Sense.TRAN: 应用科学/物理学/语言学等

Sense.DEF: the process of sewing pieces of material onto a piece of clothing for decoration, or the pieces themselves
to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She applied for a job with the local newspaper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她申请了当地报社的一个职位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I applied to four universities and was accepted by all of them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向四所大学提出申请﹐都被录取了。

Sense.DEF: to have an effect on or to concern a particular person, group, or situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do the same rules apply to part-time workers?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些规定对兼职人员也适用吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The offer only applies to flights from London and Manchester.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个报价只适用于从伦敦和曼彻斯特起飞的航班。

Sense.DEF: to use something such as a method, idea, or law in a particular situation, activity, or process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New technology is being applied to almost every industrial process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新技术几乎应用到所有的工业流程中应用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: These ideas are often difficult to apply in practice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些想法往往很难付诸实践。

Sense.DEF: to work hard at something, especially with a lot of attention for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen would do well if only he applied himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬只要肯用心﹐就能做得很好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over the next months, he applied himself to improving the technique.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在接下来的几个月里﹐他专心致志地改进技术。

Sense.DEF: to make something such as a piece of equipment operate, usually by pushing or pressing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: apply the brakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 踩剎车

Sense.DEF: to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apply the cream evenly over the skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将乳霜均匀地涂抹在皮肤上。

Sense.DEF: to push on something
to use a particular word or name to describe something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The term ‘mat’ can be applied to any small rug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: mat一词可用于指各种小地毯。

Sense.DEF: to choose someone for a position or a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: officials appointed by the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府任命的官员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been appointed to the State Supreme Court.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他奉命到州最高法院任职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A committee was appointed to consider the plans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个委员会被委派去研究这些计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: O'Connell was appointed as chairman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥康奈尔被任命为主席。

Sense.DEF: to arrange or decide a time or place for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Everyone assembled in the hall at the appointed time
at the time that had been arranged
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都在指定时间到大厅里集合。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to make an appointment to see the doctor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想约个时间看医生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has an appointment with a client at 10.30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他10点半约了客户。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All consultations are by appointment only .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就诊必须预约。

Sense.DEF: when someone is chosen for a position or job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They congratulated him on his appointment as chairman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们祝贺他被任命为主席。

Sense.DEF: a job or position, usually involving some responsibility

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has taken up an appointment as Professor of Chemistry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接受了化学教授的职位。

Sense.DEF: a phrase that can be used by a business that sells goods or services to the Queen
Sense.TRAN: 女王指定御用〔向王室出售商品或提供服务的商家可使用的短语〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has an appointment with the dentist at 5 o'clock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她约了5点钟看牙医。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can you phone the hairdresser and make an appointment?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能给美发师打电话约个时间？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an appointment
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve scheduled your appointment for 9.30.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你把时间约在了9点半。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed in arranging one
not go to an appointment you have arranged
go to an appointment that you have arranged

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My hospital appointment lasted half an hour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在医院看医生花了半小时。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What time is your doctor’s appointment?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和医生约的是几点？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can’t talk now – I have an urgent appointment to get to.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这会儿不能聊了——有个紧急约会要去。

Sense.DEF:
a
diary

a large book divided into days and times containing the names of people you have appointments with, for example a doctor or a
hairdresser
etc
to decide how something should be shared among various people
Sense.EXAMPLE:
It’s not easy to apportion blame
say who deserves to be blamed
when a marriage breaks up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻破裂很难说是谁的错。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Court costs were equally apportioned between them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诉讼费由他们均摊。

Sense.DEF: suitable to what is happening or being discussed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His observations are, indeed, apposite to the present discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的评论的确切合当前的讨论。

Sense.DEF: in grammar, an occasion when a simple sentence contains two or more noun phrases that describe the same thing or person, appearing one after the other without a word such as ‘and’ or ‘or’ between them. For example, in the sentence ‘The defendant, a woman of thirty, denies kicking the policeman’ the two phrases ‘the defendant’ and ‘a woman of thirty’ are in apposition.
a statement or opinion judging the worth, value, or condition of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It needed a calmer appraisal of her situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的情况需要更为冷静的评判。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a critical appraisal of the existing facilities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对现存设施的审慎评估

Sense.DEF: a meeting between a manager and a worker to discuss the quality of someone’s work and how well they do their job
Sense.TRAN: 员工工作评估﹐工作表现评估

Sense.DEF: to officially judge how successful, effective, or valuable something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greenpeace has been invited to appraise the environmental costs of such an operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿色和平组织已受邀评估这样一次行动对环境的影响。

Sense.DEF: to look carefully at someone or something to make an opinion about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes appraised her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他两眼端详着她的脸庞。

Sense.DEF: large enough to be noticed or considered important
Sense.TRAN: 明显的﹐可觉察到的﹔值得重视的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no appreciable change in the patient’s condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人的状况没有明显改变。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The two plans are not appreciably different.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个计划没有明显的区别。

Sense.DEF: to understand how serious or important a situation or problem is or what someone’s feelings are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He did not fully appreciate the significance of signing the contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有完全理解签署这份合同的意义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We appreciate that caring for children is an important job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们理解﹐照顾小孩子是个重要的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to appreciate how bad the situation had become.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 形势已经恶化到什么地步﹐很难理解。

Sense.DEF: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多谢你的帮助﹐我真的很感激。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你关心﹐不过说真的﹐我很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能让我继续工作﹐我会非常感激。

Sense.DEF: to understand how good or useful someone or something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是专家﹐但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become more valuable over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most investments are expected to appreciate at a steady rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数投资都应该会平稳增值。

Sense.DEF: pleasure you feel when you realize something is good, useful, or well done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It helps children to develop an appreciation of poetry and literature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这有助于培养小孩子对诗歌和文学作品的欣赏力。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being grateful for something someone has done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman asked me to express our appreciation of all your hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席要我对大家的努力表示感谢。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was presented with a watch in appreciation of his long service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获赠一块手表﹐作为对其长期服务的感谢。

Sense.DEF: an understanding of the importance or meaning of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a realistic appreciation of the situation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对局势实事求是的理解

Sense.DEF: a rise in value, especially of land or possessions
Sense.TRAN: 增值﹐〔尤指土地或财产的〕升值
Sense.EXAMPLE: an appreciation of 50% in property values
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 50%的资产增值

Sense.DEF: feeling or showing that you enjoy something or are pleased about it
grateful for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was appreciative of Greg’s concern for her health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格关心她的健康﹐她很感激。

Sense.DEF: if the police apprehend a criminal, they catch him or her
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have failed to apprehend the culprits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方未能拘捕罪犯。

Sense.DEF: to understand something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were slow to apprehend the danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们未能迅速意识到危险。

Sense.DEF: anxiety about the future, especially about dealing with something unpleasant or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeling of apprehension
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 担忧的心情
Sense.EXAMPLE: I woke before the alarm, filled with apprehension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忧心忡忡﹐闹钟没响就醒了。

Sense.DEF: the act of apprehending a criminal
understanding
worried or nervous about something that you are going to do, or about the future
Sense.TRAN: 〔对将做的事或对未来〕忧虑的﹐担心的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’d been a little apprehensive about their visit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对他们的来访一直有些不安。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was apprehensive that something would go wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心会出错。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some had apprehensive looks on their faces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人面带愁容。

Sense.DEF: someone who works for an employer for a fixed period of time in order to learn a particular skill or job
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works in the hairdresser’s as an apprentice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在美发店当学徒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an apprentice electrician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电工学徒

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was apprenticed to a local architect.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在当地一位建筑师那里当学徒。

Sense.DEF: the job of being an apprentice, or the period of time in which you are an apprentice
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s serving an apprenticeship as a printer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在是一名印刷工学徒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-year apprenticeship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年学徒期

Sense.DEF: to tell or give someone information about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The district chairman was fully apprised of all the details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有细节都已经通知地区主席。

Sense.DEF: to move towards or nearer to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: As I approached the house, I noticed a light on upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走近那幢房子的时候注意到楼上有灯光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She heard footsteps approaching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到有脚步声走过来。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone for something, or ask them to do something, especially when you are asking them for the first time or when you are not sure if they will do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students should be able to approach teachers for advice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生应当能够找老师征求意见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The charity approached several stores about giving food aid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个慈善机构找了几家商店﹐请求他们给予食品援助。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
I have already been approached by several other companies
offered a job, work etc
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另外还有几家公司已经同我联系过。

Sense.DEF: if an event or a particular time approaches, or you approach it, it is coming nearer and will happen soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was then approaching the end of her career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时她的职业生涯就要走到头了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The time is fast approaching when we will have to make a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须作出决定的时刻很快要到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With winter approaching, many animals are storing food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季临近﹐许多动物在储存食物。

Sense.DEF: to begin to deal with a situation or problem in a particular way or with a particular attitude
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某种方式或态度〕对付﹐处理

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It might be possible to approach the problem in a different way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许可以换个方式处理这个问题。

Sense.DEF: to be almost equal to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: temperatures approaching 35° C
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接近35摄氏度的温度
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s never had anything approaching a normal life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从未有过类似正常人的生活。

Sense.DEF: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new approach to teaching languages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的语言教学法

Sense.EXAMPLE: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定采用一种不同的方法﹐通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

Sense.DEF: a request from someone, asking you to do something for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: They made a direct approach to the minister of education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们直接找到了教育部长。

Sense.DEF: the approach of a particular time or event is the fact that it is getting closer
Sense.EXAMPLE: the approach of autumn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天的来临
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a sign of the approach of middle age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是中年将至的迹象。

Sense.DEF: movement towards or near to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our approach frightened the birds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的靠近吓了那些鸟。

Sense.DEF: a road, path etc that leads to a place, and is the main way of reaching it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers were guarding the approaches to the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵把守着进城的道路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an approach road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条通路

Sense.DEF: the final part of a plane’s flight, before it lands at an airport
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was clear to land so we made our approach .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑道已清空﹐于是我们进场着陆。

Sense.DEF: friendly and easy to talk to
Sense.TRAN: 友善的﹐和蔼可亲的﹐平易近人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The head teacher is very approachable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长非常平易近人。

Sense.DEF: official praise or approval
correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: clothes appropriate for a job interview
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合求职面试穿的服装

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an education system which is more appropriate to the needs of the students
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 更切合学生需求的教育制度

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is appropriate (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would not be appropriate for me to discuss that now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我不宜讨论此事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seemed somehow appropriate that we should begin our journey here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知何故﹐我们从这里出发看来是合适的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t feel that this was an appropriate time to mention the subject of money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这个时候不适合提钱的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I thought his remark was highly appropriate, given the circumstances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考虑到当时情况﹐我认为他的话很恰当。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通告发布的时机很合适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要合适﹐我就尽量把工作分派出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

RunOn.EXAMPLE:
The painters met, appropriately enough , in an art gallery
used to emphasize that something is very appropriate
.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家们在画廊里会面﹐这是个很合适的地点。

Sense.DEF: to take something for yourself when you do not have the right to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is suspected of appropriating government funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被怀疑挪用政府资金。

Sense.DEF: to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress appropriated $5 million for International Women’s Year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会为国际妇女年拨款500万美元。

Sense.DEF: the process of saving money for a special purpose, or the money that is saved, especially by a business or government

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the appropriation of $2 million for the new hospital
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于新医院的200万美元拨款

Sense.DEF: the act of taking control of something without asking permission

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the appropriation of company property
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 侵吞公司财产

Sense.DEF: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统已经批准了这个计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法案将提交国会通过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统将任命内阁成员﹐但需经国民议会批准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。
Sense.EXAMPLE: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需经议会批准的任命

Sense.DEF: when someone likes something or someone and thinks that they are good
Sense.EXAMPLE: A murmur of approval passed through the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群纷纷低声称是。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They clapped their hands in approval.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拍手叫好。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
His ideas have won widespread public approval
many people agree with them and think they are good
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的想法获得了公众广泛的赞同。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Does the design meet with your approval
do you like it?
?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个设计你喜欢吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children are always seeking approval from their parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子总是期待父母的赞许。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked to Greg for approval .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指望格雷格同意。

Sense.DEF: if you buy something on approval, you have the right to return it to the shop if you decide you do not want it
to officially accept a plan, proposal etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conference approved a proposal for a referendum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议通过了举行全民公决的提议。

Sense.DEF: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Catherine’s parents now approve of her marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳的父母现在认可她的婚姻了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t approve of cosmetic surgery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不赞同整型手术。

Exponent.DEF: to officially accept a plan, proposal etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Medical Research Council has approved the use of a new drug for breast cancer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医学研究委员会已批准使用一种新药来治疗乳腺癌。

Exponent.DEF: to approve a law or proposal, especially by voting
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指以投票方式〕通过〔法律或提案〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many anti-smoking laws have been passed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多禁烟法令已获通过。

Exponent.DEF: to make a written agreement official by signing it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The treaty was ratified by the Senate in 1988.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 此条约由参议院于1988年批准。

Exponent.DEF: to approve something without really thinking about it – used to show disapproval
Exponent.TRAN: 不加思考就照例批准〔含贬义〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parliament merely rubber-stamped the president’s decisions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会只是例行公事般通过了总统的决定。

Sense.DEF: officially recognized as being of a particular level or standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: Funding is available for approved courses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经核准的课程可获得专款。

Sense.DEF: a special school in Britain in the past, where children who had done something illegal were sent if they were under 18
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时英国的〕少年感化院﹐少年（罪）犯教养院

Sense.DEF: showing support or agreement for something

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 赞许的点头/一瞥/微笑等

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She smiled approvingly at the child.

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= approximately 大致﹐大约﹐大概

Sense.DEF: an approximate number, amount, or time is close to the exact number, amount etc, but could be a little bit more or less than it
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is the approximate number of students in each class?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个班大致有多少学生？
Sense.EXAMPLE: These percentages are only approximate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些百分比仅仅是近似值。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say rough rather than approximate
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说rough﹐而不说approximate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a rough idea of how much it would cost?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我这大概要花多少钱吗？

Exponent.DEF: more or less than a number or amount – used especially in technical or scientific contexts
Exponent.TRAN: 大致﹐大约﹐大概〔尤用于科技文本〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company had total revenues of approximately $2 million.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的总收益约有200万美元。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The disease affects approximately 10% of the adult population.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约有10%的成年人口患有这种疾病。

Exponent.DEF: more or less than a number or amount. ‘About’ is the usual word to use in everyday English
Exponent.TRAN: 大约﹐大概〔常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It costs about $30 to get a visa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 办理签证需大约30美元。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were about 50 people at the meeting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约有50人参加了会议。

Exponent.DEF: about – used when you are trying to give someone a general idea of the size, amount, or number of something
Exponent.TRAN: 大约﹐大概〔用于说明某物的大致尺寸或数量〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two countries are roughly the same size.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国面积基本相同。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Roughly how many miles do you travel a year?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你每年的行程大约是多少英里？

Exponent.DEF: about a number or time – used when you are guessing
Exponent.TRAN: 大约〔用于估计数量﹑时间〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll be there around 5 o'clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我5点左右到那儿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The BBC broadcasts around 2,000 radio dramas every year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国广播公司每年播出约2,000部广播剧。

Exponent.DEF: about – used with very large numbers or amounts
Exponent.TRAN: 大约﹐在…左右〔用于指很大的数或量〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Last year he earned something in the region of $60 million.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年他挣了约6,000万美元。

Exponent.DEF: about – used after a period of time, a number, or an amount
Exponent.TRAN: 大约〔用于时间﹑数量之后〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The journey takes an hour or so.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上大约要花一小时。

Exponent.DEF: about – used with dates a long time ago in the past
Exponent.TRAN: 大约〔用于过去很久的日期前〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house was built circa 1530.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子大约建于1530年。

Exponent.DEF: used after a number or amount, when the total may be a lot more
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A thirty-second commercial can cost £60,000 or more.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一则30秒的广告可能要花费6万英镑﹐甚至更多。

Exponent.DEF: more than a number or amount
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The aircraft can carry upwards of 400 passengers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种飞机可承载400多名乘客。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The plane will be landing in approximately 20 minutes.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机大约在20分钟后着陆。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: How much do you think it will cost, approximately?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为这大约要花多少钱？

Sense.DEF: to be close to a particular number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This figure approximates to a quarter of the UK’s annual consumption.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个数字接近英国年消耗量的四分之一。

Sense.DEF: to be similar to but not exactly the same as something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your story only approximates to the real facts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你所说的只是接近事实真相。

Sense.DEF: a number, amount etc that is not exact, but is almost correct

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an approximation of the total
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大概的总数

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is not very exact
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you give us a rough approximation of the cost?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能给我们粗略估算一下费用有多少吗？

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 很好的/接近的/接近的/合理的估算

Sense.DEF: something that is similar to another thing, but not exactly the same

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was the nearest approximation to a crisis she’d ever experienced.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她的经历中﹐这差不多就是一场危机。

Sense.DEF: a part of something more important

the rate of
interest
that you must pay when you borrow money

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= April 四月

Sense.DEF:
activities such as eating and drinking that you do after
ski ing
Sense.TRAN: 滑雪后的活动〔如吃喝东西等〕

Sense.DEF: a small round fruit that is orange or yellow and has a single large seed
the orange-yellow colour of an apricot
the fourth month of the year, between March and May

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m going to Cuba next April.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明4月份去古巴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our new office opened in April 2001.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们新的办事处于2001年4月开业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meeting will be on April 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议定于4月6日举行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I arrived on 6th April.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是4月6日到的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jim’s birthday’s April 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆的生日是4月6日。

Sense.DEF: someone who is tricked on April Fools’ Day, or the trick that is played on them
Sense.TRAN: 愚人节受愚弄的人﹔愚人节开的玩笑

Sense.DEF: April 1st, a day when people play tricks on each other
using previous experiences or facts to decide what the likely result or effect of something will be
Sense.TRAN: 先验的[地]﹐由因及果的[地]﹐演绎的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruling made on a priori grounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由推论作出的裁决

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing that covers the front part of your clothes and is tied around your waist, worn to keep your clothes clean, especially while cooking
the relationship between a child and its mother, especially if the mother controls an adult son or daughter too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re 25 years old, and you still haven’t cut the apron strings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你都25岁了﹐还没摆脱母亲的支配。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeff is still tied to his mother’s apron strings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫还是处处听母亲的。

Sense.DEF: the hard surface in an airport on which planes are turned around, loaded, unloaded etc
the part of the stage in a theatre that is in front of the curtain
used to introduce a new subject that is related to something just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 说到某事﹐关于某事﹐就某事而言〔用于引入与刚才话题有关的新话题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had nothing to say apropos of the latest developments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至于最新的进展﹐他没有什么要说的。

GramExa.GLOSS: not relating to anything previously mentioned
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 突然地﹐无缘无故地〔改变话题〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Apropos of nothing, he suddenly asked me if I liked cats!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然没头没脑地问我是否喜欢猫！

Sense.DEF: the curved inside end of a building, especially the east end of a church
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指教堂东端的〕半圆室﹐半圆形殿

Sense.DEF: to have a natural tendency to do something
Sense.TRAN: 倾向于做某事﹐易于做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the staff are apt to arrive late on Mondays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些职员星期一往往迟到。

Sense.DEF: exactly right for a particular situation or purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Love at first sight’ is a very apt description of how he felt when he saw her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用“一见钟情”来形容他见到她时的感觉再恰当不过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The punishment should be apt for the crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罚应当其罪。

Sense.DEF: a student who is quick to learn and understand
natural ability or skill, especially in learning

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has a natural aptitude for teaching.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有教书的天赋。

Sense.DEF: a test that measures your natural skills or abilities
named, described etc in a way that seems very suitable
Sense.TRAN: 被恰当地命名/描述/称呼等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aptly named Skyline Restaurant provides spectacular views of the city below.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天际餐厅名副其实﹐可以俯瞰城市美景。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment that provides a
diver
someone who swims underwater
with air, and which they wear on their backs
Sense.TRAN: 〔供潜水者呼吸用的〕水肺﹐水中呼吸器

Sense.DEF: a greenish blue jewel, or the type of stone it comes from
a greenish blue colour
if a car aquaplanes, it slides over a wet road in an uncontrolled way
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车在潮湿的路面上〕打滑失控

Sense.DEF: to be pulled over the water on an aquaplane
Sense.TRAN: 滑水﹐站在滑水板上滑行

Sense.DEF: a thin board that you stand on while you are pulled over the water by a fast boat
a clear glass or plastic container for fish and other water animals
a building where people go to look at fish and other water animals

the 11th sign of the
zodiac
, represented by a person pouring water, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between January 21 and February 19
someone who was born between January 21 and February 19
Sense.TRAN: 属水瓶座的人〔即1月21日至2月19日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF:
aerobics
very active physical exercise done to music, usually in a class
that you do in a swimming pool
Sense.TRAN: 水中有氧操﹐水上韵律操

Sense.DEF: living or growing in water
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aquatic plant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水生植物

Sense.DEF: involving or happening in water
Sense.EXAMPLE: aquatic sports
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水上运动

Sense.DEF: a method of producing a picture using acid on a sheet of metal, or a picture printed using this method
Sense.TRAN: 凹版腐蚀制版法﹔腐蚀凹版画〔用凹版腐蚀法印制成的图画〕

Sense.DEF: a structure like a bridge, that carries water across a river or valley
Sense.TRAN: 〔跨过河流或山谷的〕高架渠﹐渡槽

Sense.DEF: containing water or similar to water

a nose with a curved shape like the beak of an
eagle
relating to something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
stellar
relating to stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星（球）的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
polar
relating to the North or South Pole
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极地的

Sense.DEF: someone who does something
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a liar
someone who lies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说谎的人

Sense.DEF: someone whose language is Arabic and whose family comes from, or originally came from, the Middle East or North Africa

a position in
ballet
, in which you stand on one foot with the other leg stretched out straight behind you
a decorative pattern of flowing lines
relating to Arabia or its people
the language or writing of the Arabs, which is the main language of North Africa and the Middle East
the sign 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9, or 0, or a combination of these signs, used as a number
relating to growing crops
Sense.EXAMPLE: arable farming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耕作农业
Sense.EXAMPLE:
arable land
land that is suitable for growing crops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可耕地

Sense.DEF:
a small creature such as a
spider
, that has eight legs and a body with two parts

someone who influences society’s opinions about what is
stylish
, socially acceptable etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔影响社会潮流﹑规范等的〕权威人士
Sense.EXAMPLE: The designer has received rave reviews from such arbiters of taste as ‘Elle’ magazine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名设计师受到《世界时装之苑》杂志等时尚权威的热情赞扬。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that settles an argument between two opposing sides
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The European Court of Justice will be the final arbiter
make the final decision
in the dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲法庭将对这宗争端作出最终裁决。

Sense.DEF:
the process of buying something such as raw materials or
currency
in one place and selling them immediately in another place in order to make a profit from the difference in prices
decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: an arbitrary decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武断的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政敌的任意逮捕

Sense.DEF: to officially judge how an argument between two opposing sides should be settled

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A committee will arbitrate between management and unions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将由一个委员会来仲裁资方和工会的争端。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tribunal arbitrates in disputes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个特别法庭仲裁纠纷。

Sense.DEF: the process of judging officially how an argument should be settled
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The dispute is going to arbitration
someone is being asked to arbitrate
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场争议将提请仲裁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides in the dispute have agreed to binding arbitration .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纠纷双方都接受了约束性仲裁。

Sense.DEF: relating to trees, or living in trees
a place where trees are grown for scientific study
Sense.TRAN: 〔供科学研究用的〕树木园﹐植物园

Sense.DEF:
a shelter in a garden made by making plants grow together on a frame shaped like an
arch
Sense.TRAN: 〔花园中长满蔓藤的〕棚架﹐藤架﹐凉棚

Sense.DEF: a curved shape or line
Sense.EXAMPLE: the arc of a rainbow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩虹的弧状

Sense.DEF: part of a curved line or a circle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Sun moves across the sky in an arc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳在天空中以弧线方式运行。

Sense.DEF: a flash of light formed by the flow of electricity between two points

a covered passage at the side of a row of buildings with
pillar s
and
arch es
supporting it on one side
a covered passage between two streets with shops on each side of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔两旁设有商店的〕拱廊式街道

Sense.DEF: a large building or part of a building where there are many shops

an
amusement arcade
Sense.EXAMPLE: arcade games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏厅的电子游戏

Sense.DEF:
a type of electronic game that was first popular in
amusement arcade s
a place where you play games by putting coins in machines
in the early 1980s, but is now usually played on a computer
Sense.TRAN: （游戏厅的）电子游戏﹐计算机游戏

Sense.DEF: an area in the country where people have a pleasant simple life. Arcadia was first used in ancient Greek and Latin poetry as the name of a beautiful area of countryside in ancient Greece.
Sense.TRAN: 阿卡迪亚〔古希腊及拉丁诗歌中的世外桃源〕

Sense.DEF: secret and known or understood by only a few people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the arcane language of the law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晦涩难懂的法律语言

Sense.DEF: a structure with a curved top and straight sides that supports the weight of a bridge or building
Sense.TRAN: 拱〔支撑桥梁或建筑物的弧形结构〕

Sense.DEF: a curved structure above a door, window etc
a curved structure of bones in the middle of your foot
something with a curved top and straight sides
to form or make something form a curved shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two rows of trees arched over the driveway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车道两旁树木交错﹐形成一个拱顶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog arched its back .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗弓起了背。

Sense.DEF: amused because you think you understand something better than other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think he’s in for a surprise,’ Ian said, in a somewhat arch tone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想他很快就会感到惊讶的。”伊恩略带调侃地说道。

Sense.DEF: belonging to the highest class or rank
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an archbishop
an important
bishop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大主教
Sense.EXAMPLE:
our archenemy
our worst enemy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的头号敌人
Sense.EXAMPLE:
the company’s arch-rivals
main competitors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的主要竞争对手

Sense.DEF:
the study of ancient societies by examining what remains of their buildings,
grave s
, tools etc
old and no longer used
Sense.EXAMPLE: archaic words
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古词

Sense.DEF: old-fashioned and needing to be replaced
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many smaller radio stations broadcast on archaic equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多较小的电台使用过时的设备播音。

Sense.DEF: from or relating to ancient times
Sense.EXAMPLE: archaic civilizations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古代文明

Sense.DEF: an old word or phrase that is no longer used

one of the most important
angel s
in the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔犹太教﹑基督教和伊斯兰教中的〕天使长﹐大天使

Sense.DEF: a priest of the highest rank, who is in charge of all the churches in a particular area
the area governed by an archbishop
the rank of archbishop

a priest of a high rank in the Anglican Church who works under a
bishop
the area that is governed by an archbishop
a prince who belonged to the royal family of Austria
Sense.TRAN: 大公〔昔日奥地利的皇子〕

Sense.DEF: the main enemy

an American spelling of
archaeology

someone who shoots
arrow s
from a
bow

the sport of shooting
arrow s
from a
bow
a perfect example of something, because it has all the most important qualities of things that belong to that type

GramExa.EXAMPLE: France is the archetype of the centralized nation-state.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国是典型的中央集权制单一民族国家。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Byron was the archetypal Romantic hero.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 拜伦是典型的浪漫主义代表人物。

Sense.DEF: a group of small islands
someone whose job is to design buildings
the person who originally thought of an important and successful idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tinoco was one of the architects of the government’s economic reforms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂诺科是政府经济改革的设计师之一。

Sense.DEF: the style and design of a building or buildings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the architecture of Venice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尼斯的建筑风格

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

Sense.DEF: the art and practice of planning and designing buildings
Sense.EXAMPLE: He studied architecture at university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

Sense.DEF: the structure of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the architecture of DNA
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: DNA（脱氧核糖核酸）的结构

Sense.DEF: the structure of a computer system and the way it works

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Architecturally, Chengdu is quite different from most of China.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 从建筑学的角度看﹐成都与中国大多数地方很不一样。

Sense.DEF: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
Sense.EXAMPLE: an archive of the writer’s unpublished work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位作家未发表作品的档案

Sense.DEF:
copies of a computer’s
file s
that are stored on a
disk
or in the computer’s memory in a way that uses less space than usual, so that the computer can keep them for a long time

RunOn.EXAMPLE: archival footage of the President’s visit in 1969
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 1969年总统来访的一组档案镜头

Sense.DEF: to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

to save a computer
file
in a way that uses less space than usual, because you do not use that file often but may need it in the future
someone who works in an archive

a passage or entrance under an
arch
or arches
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was standing in the archway outside the club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在俱乐部外的拱廊里。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular type of government
Sense.EXAMPLE:
anarchy
no government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无政府（状态）
Sense.EXAMPLE:
monarchy
having a king or queen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 君主政体

Sense.DEF: relating to the most northern part of the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Arctic island of Novaya Zemlya
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北极的新地岛

Sense.DEF: extremely cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: arctic conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极冷的环境

Sense.DEF: a method of joining two pieces of metal together by heating them with a special tool
someone who is usually or always in a particular state
Sense.TRAN: 常处于〔某种状态〕的人﹔沉湎于…的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drunkard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒鬼

Sense.DEF: showing strong positive feelings about an activity and determination to succeed at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ardent supporter of free trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由贸易的热心支持者

Sense.DEF: showing strong feelings of love
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ardent lover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感情热烈的情人

Sense.DEF: very strong admiration or excitement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sang with real ardour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们唱得很有激情。

Sense.DEF: strong feelings of love
involving a lot of strength and effort

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the arduous task of loading all the boxes into the van
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将所有箱子搬上货车的费力活儿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an arduous journey through the mountains
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越山区的艰苦旅程

Sense.DEF: the present tense and plural of ‘be’
a particular part of a country, town etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only cheeses made in this area may be labelled ‘Roquefort.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有这个地区出产的干酪才能被称作“罗克福尔干酪”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城镇地区的犯罪率要高很多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many areas of Africa have suffered severe drought this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年﹐非洲的许多地区都遭遇了严重的旱灾。

Sense.DEF: a part of a house, office, garden etc that is used for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子﹑办公室﹑花园里面等作特定用途的〕区域
Sense.EXAMPLE: a no-smoking area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无烟区
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their apartment has a large kitchen area .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的公寓有个很大的厨房。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come through into the dining area .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请进饭厅来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the reception area of the hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店的接待处
Sense.EXAMPLE: a storage area on the ground floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 底层的储物区

Sense.DEF: a particular subject, range of activities, or group of related subjects
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course covers three main subject areas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程涵盖三大学科领域。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This study has clearly identified a major problem area for the National Health Service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次调查明确指出了国民医疗服务体系中的主要问题所在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re funding research into new areas such as law enforcement technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为执法技术等新领域的研究提供资金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: reforms in the key areas of health and education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗及教育的关键领域的改革

Sense.DEF: the amount of space that a flat surface or shape covers

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an area of 2,000 square miles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2,000平方英里的面积
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a formula to calculate the area of a circle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算圆面积的公式

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in the countryside
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Schools in rural areas are often very small.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村地区的学校往往都很小。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a town or city
Collocate.EXAMPLE: 90% of the English population live in urban areas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰90%的人口居住在城镇地区。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a long way from towns and cities
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a remote area of northeast Afghanistan
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿富汗东北部的偏远地区

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He quickly made friends in the local area.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就在当地交上了朋友。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the area around a place
far from the centre of a town, village etc
a part of a town where people live
with a lot of buildings close together
where many poor people live
the central part of a city, where many poor people live
where a particular class of people live
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 中产阶级/工人阶级等居住区

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very large city
for preserving nature or old buildings
one that is shown on a map

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had just moved into the area and knew very few people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚搬到这个地区﹐认识的人很少。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police ordered people to stay away from the area.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方要求市民远离这一地区。

Collocate.COLLOC: be spread out over a wide area
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The town is spread out over a wide area.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城镇地域广阔。

Exponent.DEF: a part of a town or country, or of the world
Exponent.TRAN: 〔市镇﹑国家或世界的〕地区﹐区域
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They live in a very wealthy area.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在富人区。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: coastal areas
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿海地区

Exponent.DEF: a large area of a country or the world
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the northwest region of Russia
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯西北地区
Exponent.EXAMPLE: desert regions
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠地区

Exponent.DEF: an area that is different from other areas around it in some way
Exponent.TRAN: 〔与周围地区有所不同的〕地区﹐地带﹐区域
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a war zone
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战区
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a no-parking zone
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止停车区

Exponent.DEF: one of the areas a city or town is officially divided into, or an area of a city where a particular group live or an activity happens
Exponent.TRAN: 行政区﹔〔某一族群居住或某一活动举行的〕地区﹐区域
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Chelsea district of Manhattan
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼哈顿切尔西区
