Exponent.EXAMPLE: the financial district of London
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦金融区

Exponent.DEF: an area of a town where people live
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a friendly neighbourhood
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 友好的社区
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are lots of trees in our neighborhood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的社区有很多树木。

Exponent.DEF: an area outside the centre of a city, where people live
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a suburb of Boston
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 波士顿市郊

Exponent.DEF: an area of a town or city where people of a particular nationality live
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the French quarter of New Orleans
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新奥尔良的法裔居住区

Exponent.DEF: an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where many poor people live
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He grew up in the slums of East London.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在东伦敦的贫民窟长大。

Exponent.DEF: an area of a city where poor people of a particular race or class live
Exponent.TRAN: 〔城市中某一种族或阶级的穷人的〕聚居区﹐贫民区
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a black baby born in the ghetto
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出生于贫民窟的一个黑人婴儿

Sense.DEF: numbers you use before a phone number when you phone someone in a different area of the country
a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place
Sense.TRAN: 〔四周设有座位供比赛或表演的〕场地
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sports arena
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动场
Sense.EXAMPLE: an indoor arena
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 室内剧场

Sense.DEF: all the activities and people connected with politics, public life etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women are entering the political arena in larger numbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的女性进入政界。
Sense.EXAMPLE: American economic activity in the international arena
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国在国际舞台上的经济活动

Subsense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘are not’
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They aren’t here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不在这儿。

Subsense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘am not’, used in questions〔用于疑问句〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m in big trouble, aren’t I?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是不是遇到大麻烦了？

Sense.DEF: relating to Argentina or its people
someone from Argentina

a colourless gas that is found in very small quantities in the air and is sometimes used in electric light
bulb s
. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Ar
Sense.TRAN: 氩〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Ar〕

Sense.DEF: expressions used by a particular group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: teenage argot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年俚语

Sense.DEF: not certain, or not definitely true or correct, and therefore easy to doubt
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whether or not Webb is the best person for the job is arguable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦布是不是这个职务的最佳人选尚待商榷。

Sense.DEF: used in order to give good reasons why something might be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s arguable that the legislation has had little effect on young people’s behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以说这个立法对年轻人的行为影响不大。

Sense.DEF: used when giving your opinion to say that there are good reasons why something might be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Senna was arguably the greatest racing driver of all time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以说﹐塞纳是有史以来最伟大的赛车手。

Sense.DEF: to disagree with someone in words, often in an angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could hear the neighbours arguing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到邻居在争吵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gallacher continued to argue with the referee throughout the game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整场比赛加拉赫一直与裁判争论不休。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were arguing about how to spend the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在为这笔钱怎么花而争吵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were arguing over which TV programme to watch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在为看哪一个电视节目而争吵。

Sense.DEF: to state, giving clear reasons, that something is true, should be done etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Croft argued that a date should be set for the withdrawal of troops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克罗夫特竭力主张应该确定撤军的日期。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It could be argued that a dam might actually increase the risk of flooding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以这么说﹐修建水坝可能反而会增加洪水泛滥的危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Baker argued against cutting the military budget.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克尔据理反对削减军费预算。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She argued the case for changing the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她提出论据﹐力主修改法律。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The researchers put forward a well-argued case for banning the drug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员为禁止这种药提出了充足的论据。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
They argued the point
discussed it
for hours without reaching a conclusion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题他们讨论了几个小时﹐还是没有得出结论。

Sense.LEXUNIT: argue sb into/out of doing sth
Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do or not do something
Sense.TRAN: 说服某人做某事/不做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joyce argued me into buying a new jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔伊斯说服我买了一件新夹克衫。

Sense.DEF: to show that something clearly exists or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The statement argues a change of attitude by the management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则声明表明管理层态度的转变。

Sense.DEF: to continue to argue about a decision that has been made and cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 〔对已决定的事〕徒然反对﹐徒然争论
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no point arguing the toss after the goal had been disallowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进球被判无效﹐再争辩也没有用。

Exponent.DEF: to speak angrily to someone because you disagree with them about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Those two are always arguing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两个人老是争吵。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We rarely argue with each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很少争吵。

Exponent.DEF: to argue with someone for a period of time about a particular thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had a long argument with the man who was selling the tickets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和那个卖票的男人争吵了很长时间。

Exponent.DEF: to have an argument with someone, especially with your boyfriend, girlfriend, or a member of your family
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was upset because she’d had a fight with her boyfriend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为与男朋友吵了架而心烦意乱。

Exponent.DEF: to argue with someone, especially for a long time and about many different things
Exponent.TRAN: 争吵﹐吵架〔尤指持续较长时间并且涉及许多不同的事情〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children quarrel all the time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们老是吵架。

Exponent.DEF: to argue about unimportant things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The kids were squabbling over what to watch on TV.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在为看什么电视节目而争吵。

Exponent.DEF: to have a big argument with someone that results in you stopping having a friendly relationship with them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve fallen out with my best friend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和最好的朋友闹翻了。

Exponent.DEF: if two people are at each other’s throats, they are always arguing in a very angry way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His parents are constantly at each other’s throats.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父母老是吵得不可开交。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a big argument with her husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There have been a lot of arguments about who was responsible for the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们针对谁该为事故负责一事争论不休。

Sense.DEF: a set of reasons that show that something is true or untrue, right or wrong etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得提出有说服力的论据﹐证明为何要改变体制。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a powerful argument against smoking
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对吸烟的有力论据
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good argument can be made for comparing the IT revolution with the invention of writing itself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息技术革命完全有理由与文字的发明相提并论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the arguments in favour of banning tobacco advertising
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持禁止烟草广告的论点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the familiar argument that the costs outweigh the benefits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得不偿失这一常见的论点

Sense.DEF: when you disagree with something or question whether it is right

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ian accepted the suggestion without argument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩二话不说就接受了这个建议。

GramExa.GLOSS: in order to discuss all the possibilities
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If, for the sake of argument, you aren’t offered the job, what will you do?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比方说吧﹐如果得不到这份工作﹐你会怎么办？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I could hear my parents having an argument downstairs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到父母在楼下争吵。

Collocate.COLLOC: get into an argument/become involved in an argument
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She didn’t want to get into another argument about money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想为了钱又吵起来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was deliberately trying to start an argument.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他故意想吵架。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was anxious to avoid an argument.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一心想避免争吵。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it starts
a big argument suddenly starts

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a big argument about whether we should move to a new house.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为了要不要搬家而大吵了一架。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: involving very strong feelings

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which people speak angrily to each other because they disagree about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an argument between two drivers over who had right of way
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个司机之间关于谁有优先通行权的争吵

Exponent.DEF: a loud angry argument with someone, especially your boyfriend, girlfriend, or someone in your family. Row is also used about a serious disagreement between politicians about important public issues
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指情侣﹑家人之间的〕争吵〔row也指政界人士有关重要公共问题的严重分歧〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were always fights between my parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母老是吵架。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the continuing row over tax increases
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于增税问题的持久争论

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which people disagree with each other, but without shouting or getting angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were the occasional disagreements about money, but mostly we got on well.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有时在钱上有些分歧﹐不过总的来说相处得不错。

Exponent.DEF: an argument, especially one in which people get angry and that lasts a long time. Quarrel sounds more formal and more serious than argument or row
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指长时间的〕争吵﹐吵架〔quarrel比argument和row更为正式﹑激烈〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bitter family quarrel
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 激烈的家庭争吵

Exponent.DEF: a very bitter argument between two groups, especially families, which lasts for many years and causes people to hate each other
Exponent.TRAN: 〔两个群体﹑尤指两个家族间的〕长期争斗﹐世仇
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The feud between the Hatfields and the McCoys raged for 20 years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈特菲尔德家族和麦考伊家族之间的世仇持续了20年。

Exponent.DEF: a public or legal argument about something, especially one which continues for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指长时间的涉及公共事务或法律的〕争论﹐争端
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Morris has been involved in a long legal dispute with his publisher.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯与其出版商陷入旷日持久的法律纠纷。

Section.SECHEADING: an argument that is not very serious

Exponent.DEF: an argument about something that is not important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were the usual squabbles between brothers and sisters.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 兄弟姐妹之间总有些争争吵吵。

Exponent.DEF: an argument that is not very serious, between people who are in love
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gary had a bit of a tiff with his girlfriend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里和女朋友吵嘴了。

Exponent.DEF: a slight argument – a rather formal word which is often used humorously
Exponent.TRAN: 小争执﹐不和〔相当正式﹐常为幽默用法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a slight misunderstanding over the bill, but everything’s been sorted out now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对账单有些小小的误会﹐不过现在都解决了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is argumentative often argues or likes arguing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quickly becomes argumentative after a few drinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只要几杯酒下肚﹐马上就会和别人争论起来。

Sense.DEF: noisy arguments or quarrelling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones was sent off after a bit of argy-bargy with other players.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯与其他球员发生了一点摩擦﹐被罚下场。

Sense.DEF:
a song that is sung by only one person in an
opera
or
oratorio
someone who believes in or does a particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 信奉…的人﹔…主义者﹔做…的人
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a vegetarian
someone who does not eat meat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 素食者
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a librarian
someone who works in a library
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆管理员

Sense.DEF: for people of this type, or relating to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vegetarian restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 素菜馆

Sense.DEF:
arid land or an arid
climate
is very dry because it has very little rain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

Sense.DEF: not having any new, interesting, or exciting features or qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mind was arid, all inspiration gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才思枯竭﹐灵感尽失。

Sense.DEF:
the first sign of the
zodiac
, represented by a
ram
male sheep
, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between March 21 and April 20
someone who was born between March 21 and April 20
Sense.TRAN: 属白羊座的人〔即3月21日至4月20日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF: correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was not certain I had heard aright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能肯定没有听错。

Sense.DEF: to deal with problems or difficulties
if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交部出现了危机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that a problem or difficult situation comes up rather than arises
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说问题或困难come up﹐而不说arise
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The same problems come up every time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次都会出现同样的问题。

Sense.DEF: if something arises from or out of a situation, event etc, it is caused or started by that situation etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several important legal questions arose in the contract negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同谈判过程中出现了几个重要的法律问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can we begin by discussing matters arising from the last meeting?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是不是可以首先讨论上次会议中产生的问题？

Sense.DEF: when or if it is necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: Should the need arise for extra staff, we will contact you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有需要增加人手﹐我们会和你联系。

Sense.DEF: to get out of bed, or stand up
if a group of people arise, they fight for or demand something they want
if something arises when you are moving towards it, you are gradually able to see it as you move closer
the people in the highest social class, who traditionally have a lot of land, money, and power
Sense.EXAMPLE: dukes, earls, and other members of the aristocracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公爵﹑伯爵及其他贵族成员
Sense.EXAMPLE:
the landed aristocracy
who own a lot of land
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有大量土地的贵族

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to the highest social class
belonging to or typical of the aristocracy
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aristocratic family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贵族家庭

Sense.DEF: the science of numbers involving adding, multiplying etc
involving or related to arithmetic
Sense.EXAMPLE:
the arithmetic mean
average
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 算术平均值

Sense.DEF: a set of numbers in order of value in which a particular number is added to each to produce the next (as in 2, 4, 6, 8, ...)
a large ship
in the Bible, the large boat built by Noah to save his family and the animals from a flood that covered the earth

Crossrefto.REFLEX: sth went out with the ark

Sense.DEF: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave has a broken arm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫手臂断了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had a tattoo on his left arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他左臂上有刺青。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a pile of books in his arms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抱着一摞书。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
They walked along the beach arm in arm
with their arms bent around each other’s
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

GramExa.GLOSS: lead someone somewhere by holding their arm
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She took him by the arm and pushed him out of the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓住他的胳膊将他推出门外。

GramExa.GLOSS: gently hold someone with your arms
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gerry took Fiona in his arms and kissed her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里把菲奥娜拥在怀里亲吻她。

GramExa.GLOSS: bend your arms so that they are resting on top of each other against your body
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He folded his arms and leaned back in his chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他双臂交叉﹐仰靠在椅背上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老太太张开双臂﹐快步上前迎接他。

Sense.DEF: weapons used for fighting wars
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales of arms to the Middle East have dramatically increased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销往中东的军火数量激增。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the arms trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军火交易
Sense.EXAMPLE: an arms dealer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军火商
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is cutting arms expenditure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正在削减军备开支。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The United Nations will lift its arms embargo against the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国将取消对该国的武器禁运。

GramExa.GLOSS: get weapons and fight
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Boys as young as 13 are taking up arms to defend the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 连13岁的男孩都拿起武器保卫城市。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
He appealed for the rebels to lay down their arms
stop fighting
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吁叛乱分子放下武器。

GramExa.GLOSS: with weapons and ready to fight
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All available forces are under arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有兵种都严阵以待。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a chair,
sofa
etc that you rest your arms on
the part of a piece of clothing that covers your arm
to be very angry and ready to argue or fight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Residents are up in arms about plans for a new road along the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民强烈反对修建新的海滨公路的计划。

Sense.DEF: if you do something with open arms, you show that you are happy to see someone or eager to accept an idea, plan etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We welcomed Henry’s offer with open arms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们举双手赞成亨利的提议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My new in-laws accepted me with open arms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的新公婆欣然接受了我。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb would give their right arm to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone would be willing to do anything to get or do something because they want it very much
Sense.TRAN: 某人为了做某事而不惜任何代价
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d give my right arm to be 21 again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是让我回到21岁﹐拿什么换都行。

Sense.DEF: to hold something away from your body
Sense.TRAN: 伸直手臂拿着某物﹐以一臂之距拿着某物

Sense.DEF: to avoid developing a relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Petra keeps all men at arm’s length to avoid getting hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得拉跟所有的男人都保持距离﹐以免受到伤害。

Sense.DEF: a list or written document that is as long as your arm is very long
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a list of things to do as long as your arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一大堆事情要做。

Sense.DEF: a part of a large group that is responsible for a particular type of activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the political arm of a terrorist organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖组织的政治机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: Epson America is the US marketing arm of a Japanese company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱普生美国有限公司是一家日本公司在美国的营销机构。

Sense.DEF: a long part of an object or piece of equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: the arm of a record player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱机的唱臂
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a 15-foot arm supporting the antenna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个15英尺的臂状物支撑着天线。

Sense.DEF: if a man has a woman on his arm, she is walking beside him holding his arm

a set of pictures or patterns, usually painted on a
shield
, that is used as the special sign of a family, town, university etc

Crossrefto.REFLEX: cost an arm and a leg

Sense.DEF: to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The local farmers have armed themselves with rifles and pistols.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的农场主用步枪和手枪武装自己。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rebels armed a group of 2,000 men to attack the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子武装了2,000人来攻打那座城市。

Sense.DEF: to provide all the information, skills, or equipment you need to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Arm yourself with all the facts you need to argue your case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要准备好证明你观点所需的全部论据。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guidebook arms the reader with a mass of useful information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本指南为读者提供了大量有用的信息。

Sense.DEF: a large group of things, especially ships or boats
Sense.EXAMPLE: an armada of US naval vessels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国海军舰队

Sense.DEF: a small animal that has a shell made of hard material, and lives in parts of North and South America
Sense.TRAN: 犰狳〔产于南北美洲的小动物﹐身上有骨质硬壳〕

Sense.DEF: a terrible battle that will destroy the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear Armageddon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核大战

Sense.DEF: the weapons and military equipment used by an army
Sense.EXAMPLE: nuclear armaments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核武器

Sense.DEF: the process of preparing an army or country for war by giving it weapons

the part of a
generator
, motor etc that turns around to produce electricity, movement etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔发电机﹑电动机等的〕转子﹐电枢

Sense.DEF: a frame that you cover with clay or other soft material to make a model

a band of material that you wear around your arm to show that you have an official position, or as a sign of
mourning
Sense.TRAN: 臂章﹐袖标﹔〔服丧时戴的〕臂纱

Sense.DEF: one of two bands of plastic filled with air that you wear around your arms when you are learning to swim
Sense.TRAN: 〔学游泳用的〕充气浮臂﹐救生臂环

Sense.DEF: an attractive woman or man that someone takes with them to a public event so that people will admire them
Sense.TRAN: 漂亮同伴﹐性感同伴〔指陪同某人出席公共场合的漂亮女子或男子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had just invited me along as arm candy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他邀请我一起去只是为了给他撑面子。

Sense.DEF: a comfortable chair with sides that you can rest your arms on
someone who talks or reads about being a traveller, or watches sport on television but does not have any real experience of doing it
Sense.TRAN: 神游者/光说不练的球迷等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her books about her adventures give enjoyment and inspiration to armchair travellers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她写自己冒险经历的那些书给不能亲身旅游的人带来了享受和刺激。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Armchair fans will have to pay extra to watch the best games live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安坐家中看比赛的球迷要看最精彩的现场直播球赛必须额外付费。

Sense.DEF: carrying weapons, especially a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: armed police raided the building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装警察突击搜查了那幢大楼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Minister was kidnapped by armed men on his way to the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长在去机场的路上遭武装分子绑架。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were kept under armed guard .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯由武装警卫看守。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The suspect is armed with a shotgun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫌疑犯携有一支猎枪。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
She got ten years in prison for armed robbery
stealing using a gun
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因持枪抢劫获刑十年。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The President fears that armed conflict
a war
is possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统担心可能发生武装冲突。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
There is very little support for an armed struggle
fighting with weapons
against the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没人支持反政府武装斗争。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heavily armed battleship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重装甲战舰
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Many of the gangs are armed to the teeth
carrying a lot of weapons
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多匪徒都全副武装。

Sense.DEF: having the knowledge, skills, or equipment you need to do something
Sense.TRAN: 具备〔足够的知识﹑技术或装备〕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She came to the meeting armed with all the facts and figures to prove us wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她带着能证明我们错误的所有事实和数据来开会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went out, armed with my binoculars, to see what I could find in the fields.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我带着双筒望远镜出门去看看野外能发现什么。

Sense.DEF:
a country’s military organizations, including the army, navy, and
air force
Sense.TRAN: 〔一国的〕武装部队﹐陆海空三军

Sense.DEF: the amount of something that you can hold in one or both arms

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an armful of books
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一抱书

Sense.DEF: a hole in a shirt, dress, jacket etc that you put your arm through
an agreement to stop fighting

a way in which a
wrestler
holds an opponent’s arm so that he or she cannot move
a large piece of furniture with doors, and sometimes shelves, that you hang clothes in
metal or leather clothing that protects your body, worn by soldiers in battles in past times
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时士兵在战斗中穿的〕盔甲
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knight wearing a suit of armour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全身披挂的骑士

Sense.DEF: a strong metal layer that protects military vehicles
Sense.EXAMPLE: armour-clad warships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装甲战舰

Sense.DEF: a strong layer or shell that protects some plants and animals
armoured vehicles have an outside layer made of metal to protect them from attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: armored personnel carriers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装甲运兵车

Sense.DEF: an armoured army uses armoured vehicles
Sense.EXAMPLE: an armoured division
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装甲师

Sense.DEF: a military vehicle with a strong metal cover and usually a powerful gun
a car that has special protection from bullets etc, used especially by important people

someone who makes or repairs weapons and
armour
Sense.TRAN: 〔制造或修理武器及装甲的〕军械士

Sense.DEF: something, especially a vehicle, that is armour-plated has an outer metal layer to protect it
a place where weapons are stored
all the skills, information etc someone has available to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest rates have become powerful weapons in the government’s armoury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率已成为政府锦囊中强大的法宝。

Sense.DEF: the hollow place under your arm where it joins your body
the ugliest or worst place in a particular city or area
Sense.TRAN: 最差的地方﹐最肮脏[最差]的角落
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dale says Butte is the armpit of Montana.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴尔说比尤特是蒙大拿州最差的地方。

Sense.DEF: the attempts by powerful countries to limit the number and types of war weapons that exist
the competition between different countries to have a larger number of powerful weapons
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nuclear arms race
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核军备竞赛

Sense.DEF: an attempt to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: No amount of arm-twisting will get me to reveal who told me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么逼我也不会说出是谁告诉我的。

Sense.DEF: a competition in which two people sit facing each other with one elbow on a table, and try to force the other person's hand down onto the table

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the part of a country’s military force that is trained to fight on land in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army are helping to clear up after the floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陆军部队正协助洪灾后的清理工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an army officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陆军军官
Sense.EXAMPLE: Army units launched attacks on bases near Jounieh port.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陆军部队对朱尼耶港附近的基地发动了进攻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He joined the army when he was 17.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他17岁参加了陆军。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both my sons are in the army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的两个儿子都在陆军服役。

Sense.DEF: a large organized group of people trained to fight on land in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rebel armies have taken control of the radio station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反政府陆军部队已经控制了广播电台。

GramExa.GLOSS: collect together and organize an army to fight a battle
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Slovenians say they can raise an army of 20,000 men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯洛文尼亚人称﹐他们可以组建一支两万人的陆军部队。

Sense.DEF: a large number of people involved in the same activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The village hall is maintained by an army of volunteers .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 村礼堂由一大批志愿者维护。

Sense.DEF:
a type of road in Britain that is smaller than a
motorway
, but larger than a
B-road
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕A级公路﹐干线公路〔小于高速公路但大于B级公路〕

Sense.DEF: a strong pleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: the aroma of fresh coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新煮咖啡的香味

Sense.DEF:
a treatment that uses
massage
rubbing the body
with pleasant smelling natural oils to reduce pain and make you feel well
having a strong pleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: aromatic oils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芳香油
Sense.EXAMPLE: aromatic herbs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芳香草

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
arise
surrounding or on all sides of something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole family was sitting around the dinner table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全家人围坐在饭桌旁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Romans built a defensive wall around the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马人在城市周围筑起一道防御墙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore a beautiful silk shawl around her shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在肩上围了一条漂亮的真丝披肩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People crowded around to see what was happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们挤在四周围观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We would hear the birds singing all around us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会听见四周鸟儿在唱歌。

Sense.DEF: moving in a circle
Sense.EXAMPLE: A helicopter was circling around, looking for somewhere to land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直升机盘旋着寻找降落地点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They danced around the bonfire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们围着篝火跳舞。

Sense.DEF: in or to many places or parts of an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wandered around the streets, looking in shop windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在街上闲逛﹐看看商店橱窗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are over 40 radio stations dotted around the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有40多家广播电台分布在全国各地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I finished college, I travelled around for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学毕业以后﹐我到处旅游了一段时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since it’s your first day here, would you like me to show you around?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你第一天到这儿﹐要我带你四处转转吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We started looking around for somewhere to live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开始到处找住的地方。

Subsense.DEF: in an area near a place or person
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is there a bank around here?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这附近有银行吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When you’ve been around a person long enough, you start to know how they’ll react.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和一个人相处久了就会了解他的处事态度。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the new housing areas in and around Dublin
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都柏林及其周围的新住宅区
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Catherine was the most beautiful girl for miles around .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳是方圆几英里内最漂亮的女孩子。

Subsense.DEF: if someone or something is around, they are somewhere in the place where you are
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why is there never a policeman around when you need one?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当你需要警察的时候为什么从来一个也找不到呢？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jake went down to the bar, but there was no one around that he knew.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克去了酒吧﹐但是周围一个人都不认识。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is your dad around?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你爸爸在吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The list is somewhere around .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清单就在这里的某个地方。

Sense.DEF: on the other side of something, or to the other side of it without going through it or over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the gate’s locked, you’ll have to go around the side of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果大门锁上了﹐你们就得从房子侧面绕过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a door around the back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从后面绕过去有一扇门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran around the corner and straight into the arms of John Delaney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跑过拐角﹐和约翰·德莱尼撞了个满怀。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something turns so that they face in the opposite direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rex spun around and kicked the gun from her hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷克斯一个转身踢飞了她手中的枪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slowly he turned the boat around towards the open sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢掉转船头﹐驶向茫茫大海。

Sense.DEF: used when guessing a number, amount, time etc, without being exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must have been around 40,000 people in the stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育场里肯定有4万人左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole project will probably cost around $3 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个工程可能约耗资300万美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most guests started to make their way home around about ten o'clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数客人10点钟左右开始回家了。

Sense.DEF: existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: That joke’s been around for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个笑话有年头了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manson has a reputation as one of the most stylish designers around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼森被誉为如今最有格调的设计师之一。

Sense.DEF: if something is organized around a particular person or thing, it is organized according to their needs, wishes, ideas etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does everything have to be arranged around what Callum wants to do?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么每一件事都要迁就卡勒姆？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their whole society was built around their religious beliefs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的整个社会都建立在他们的宗教信仰基础之上。

Sense.DEF: used to show that someone spends time in a place without doing anything useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been waiting around all morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个早上我都在无聊地等待。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They could be seen hanging around street corners, watching the girls go by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以看到他们在街角闲荡﹐盯着来往的女孩。

Sense.DEF: a way around a difficult situation or problem is a way to solve it or avoid it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must find a way around these difficulties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须想办法克服这些困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is expected to get around this problem by borrowing from the banks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计公司会向银行贷款解决这个问题。

Sense.DEF: to other people or positions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Write your name on this list and pass it around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在名单上写下你的名字﹐再传给别人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s been moving the furniture around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人一直在搬挪家具。

Variant.LEXVAR: have been around the block a few times

Subsense.DEF: to have had experience of many different situations so that you can deal with new situations confidently
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You could tell this guy had been around a bit by the knowing way he talked.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看他讲起来无所不知的样子﹐就知道这家伙是见过些世面的。

Subsense.DEF: to have had many sexual experiences – used humorously

Sense.DEF: used to show the length of a line surrounding something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Redwood trees can measure 30 or 40 feet around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红杉树合抱可达30或40英尺。

Sense.DEF: excitement, especially sexual excitement
to make you become interested, expect something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

Sense.DEF:
to make someone feel very unfriendly and angry, or
suspicious
Sense.TRAN: 引起敌意/怀疑/憎恨/愤怒等
Sense.EXAMPLE: A great deal of anger was aroused by Campbell’s decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎贝尔的决定引起人们强烈的愤怒。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel sexually excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt aroused by the pressure of his body so close to hers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的身体如此贴近﹐她觉得情欲被撩拨起来了。

Sense.DEF: to wake someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

Sense.DEF:
the notes of a musical
chord

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= arranged by 由…编曲﹐由…改编
Sense.EXAMPLE: music by Mozart, arr. Britten
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特作曲﹐布里顿改编

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= arrives or 或 arrival 到达

Sense.DEF: to make someone come to court to hear what their crime is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thompson was arraigned on a charge of murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤普森因被控谋杀而受到提审。

Sense.DEF: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip
Sense.EXAMPLE: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请联络当地分部安排预约。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you arranged to meet Mark this weekend?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你安排了这个周末见马克吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beth arranged a meeting with the marketing director.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝思安排了和营销总监开会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We still have to arrange how to get home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还必须安排好怎样回家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had arranged that I would go for the weekend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们商量好了﹐这个周末我去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修两点钟依约而至。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for someone to have or do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company will arrange for a taxi to meet you at the airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司会安排一辆出租车去机场接你。

GramExa.PROPFORM: arrange for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dave arranged for someone to drive him home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫安排人开车送他回家。

Sense.DEF: to put a group of things or people in a particular order or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben arranged the flowers in a vase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本把花放在花瓶里插好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The list is arranged alphabetically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名单按字母顺序排列。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were arranged in lines according to height.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们按身高排好队。

Sense.DEF: to write or change a piece of music so that it is suitable for a particular instrument

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a symphony arranged for the piano
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 改编为钢琴演奏的交响曲

Sense.DEF: a marriage in which your parents choose a husband or wife for you
plans and preparations that you must make so that something can happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you made all your travel arrangements?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的旅行都安排好了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve agreed to help with arrangements for the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我答应帮忙准备聚会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family made arrangements for his body to be flown back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家人安排用飞机运回他的遗体。

Sense.DEF: something that has been organized or agreed on

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An arrangement between the two couples ensured there was always someone to look after the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两对夫妇之间的约定确保孩子们一直有人照顾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school has an arrangement with local businesses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 校方与当地企业有协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maxine cancelled our arrangement to meet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛克辛取消了我们见面的约定。

GramExa.GLOSS: make an agreement that is acceptable to everyone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would usually cost $500, but I’m sure we can come to some kind of arrangement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常价格是500美元﹐但我相信我们可以再协商。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Pets are permitted at the resort by prior arrangement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经事先约定﹐宠物可带入度假区。

Sense.DEF: the way in which something is organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airport is currently reviewing its security arrangements .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场目前正在检查保安措施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: domestic arrangements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家务安排

Sense.DEF: a group of things that are put in a particular position, or the process of doing this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the traditional arrangement of desks in rows
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将书桌成排放置的传统做法

Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful flower arrangement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的插花样式

Sense.DEF: a piece of music that has been written or changed for a particular instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piano arrangement of an old folk song
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首传统民歌的钢琴编曲

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You are advised to make travel arrangements well in advance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 建议你要事先做好旅行准备。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We need to discuss the wedding arrangements.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得商量一下婚礼安排。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m meeting him tomorrow to finalize the arrangements.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我和他见面﹐把安排确定下来。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 变通的安排﹐可替代的安排
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If the flight is cancelled you’ll have to make alternative arrangements.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是航班取消﹐你得另作安排。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: particular preparations other than those usually made
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Please inform us if any guests have disabilities or need any special arrangements.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有客人身体不便或需要特殊安排﹐请通知我们。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was in charge of security arrangements for the President’s visit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他负责总统来访的安保工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: plans for where people will sit/sleep

Sense.DEF: someone who changes music that has been written by someone else so that it is suitable for a particular instrument or performance
someone who arranges things for other people
used to emphasize how bad something is
Sense.TRAN: 坏透的﹔彻头彻尾的﹐极端的〔用于强调某事的恶劣程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What arrant nonsense!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一派胡言！

Sense.DEF: a group of people or things, especially one that is large or impressive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dazzling array of flowers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大片绚丽多彩的鲜花

Sense.EXAMPLE: a bewildering array of options
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大堆眼花缭乱的选择

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a vast array of colours to choose from.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有各种各样的颜色可供选择。

Sense.DEF: a set of numbers or signs, or of computer memory units, arranged in lines across or down
Sense.TRAN: 〔数字﹑符号或计算机存储器的〕排列﹐数列﹐阵列﹔数组

Sense.DEF: to wear particular clothes, especially clothes of good quality
Sense.TRAN: 穿上〔尤指质量好的衣服〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She came in arrayed in all her finery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一身盛装走了进来。

Sense.DEF: to arrange something in an attractive way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

Sense.DEF: to put soldiers in position ready to fight
if someone is in arrears, or if their payments are in arrears, they are late in paying something that they should pay regularly, such as rent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people are in arrears with their rent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人拖欠房租。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be four weeks/three months etc in arrears
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rent money is two months in arrears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金已经拖欠了两个月。

GramExa.GLOSS: become late with payments

Sense.DEF: money that you owe someone because you have not made regular payments at the correct time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got 3 months' arrears to pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有3个月的欠账要付。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was ordered to pay rent arrears of £550.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被勒令支付拖欠的550英镑租金。

Sense.DEF: if your salary is paid in arrears, it is paid at the end of the period you have worked
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salary paid monthly in arrears
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月后行支付的薪金

Sense.DEF:
if the police arrest someone, the person is taken to a
police station
because the police think they have done something illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was arrested and charged with murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遭到逮捕并被指控谋杀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her father was arrested for fraud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲因诈骗被捕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I got arrested for careless driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我因鲁莽驾驶被捕。

GramExa.PROPFORM: arrest sb in connection with sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five youths were arrested in connection with the attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五名年轻人因与袭击案有关被捕。

GramExa.PROPFORM: arrest sb on charges/suspicion of (doing) sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was arrested on suspicion of supplying drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因涉嫌提供毒品被捕。

Sense.DEF: to stop something happening or to make it happen more slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: drugs used to arrest the spread of the disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于控制疾病蔓延的药物

Sense.DEF: if something arrests you or arrests your attention, you notice it because it is interesting or unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mountains are the most arresting feature of the glen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山是该峡谷最吸引人的特色。

Sense.DEF: when the police take someone away and guard them because they may have done something illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police made several arrests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方逮捕了几个人。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
A man is under arrest
the police are guarding him
following the suspicious death of his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名男子因妻子离奇死亡被警方拘捕。

GramExa.GLOSS: arrest someone

Sense.EXAMPLE:
He sued the police for wrongful arrest
when someone who is not guilty is arrested
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他起诉警方错捕。

Sense.DEF: when someone or something arrives somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only the timely arrival of the police prevented the situation from becoming worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方及时赶到才阻止了事态恶化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic problems account for one third of late arrivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到的人有三分之一是因为交通问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shortly after our arrival in London, Lisa was attacked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到伦敦不久﹐莉萨就遭遇了袭击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
A deposit is payable on arrival
when you arrive
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到达后要交付押金。

Subsense.DEF: the time when a new idea, product etc is first used or discovered
Subsense.TRAN: 〔新观念﹑新产品等〕的到来[出现]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The demand for phone numbers has increased since the arrival of mobile phones.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手机问世后﹐对电话号码的需求增加了。

Subsense.DEF: the time when an event or period of time starts to happen
Subsense.TRAN: 某事件[或一段时间]的开始
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The arrival of winter can make many people feel depressed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天来临会令许多人感到抑郁。

Sense.DEF: someone who has just arrived in a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: New arrivals were greeted with suspicion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们都抱着怀疑的态度对待新来的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Late arrivals will not be admitted to the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到者不得进入戏院。

Sense.DEF: the place at an airport where people arrive when they get off a plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: the arrivals lounge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到达大厅

Sense.DEF: a baby who has just been born
to get to the place you are going to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me a call to let me know you’ve arrived safely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打个电话给我﹐告诉我你已平安到达。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What time does the plane arrive in New York?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机几点到纽约？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He arrived late as usual.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他照例又迟到了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time the police arrived on the scene, the burglars had fled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方赶到现场时﹐窃贼已经逃跑了。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘arrive to’ a place. Say 而要说 arrive in/at a place: We arrived at the station ten minutes early. 我们提前十分钟到了车站。 | The Prime Minister arrives back in Britain tonight. 首相今晚返抵英国。

Sense.DEF: if something arrives, it is brought or delivered to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The card arrived on my birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贺卡在我生日那天寄到。

Sense.DEF: if an event or particular period of time arrives, it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: When her wedding day arrived, she was really nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了婚礼那天﹐她十分紧张。

Sense.DEF: if a new idea, method, product etc arrives, it begins to exist or starts being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since computers arrived, my job has become much easier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从有了电脑﹐我的工作变得轻松多了。

Sense.DEF: to be born
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharon’s baby arrived just after midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚过午夜﹐莎伦的宝宝就出生了。

Sense.DEF: to reach a decision, solution etc after a lot of effort
Sense.TRAN: 作出决定/找到解决方法/达成妥协等
Sense.EXAMPLE: After much consideration, we have arrived at a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再三考虑之后﹐我们作出了决定。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has become successful or famous
Sense.TRAN: 某人成功了﹔某人成名了
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he saw his name painted on the door he knew he’d arrived!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当他看到自己的名字印在门上﹐他知道自己成功了！

Exponent.DEF: to get to the place you are going to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I arrived at the party at around 7 o'clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我七点左右到达聚会地点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were due to arrive home from Spain yesterday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该昨天从西班牙回到家里。

Exponent.DEF: to arrive somewhere. Get is much more common in everyday English than arrive
Exponent.TRAN: 到达〔在日常英语中﹐get比arrive常用得多〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What time do you usually get to work?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一般几点上班？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll call you when I get home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到家后给你打电话。

Exponent.DEF: to arrive somewhere, especially after a long journey
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When we finally reached the port, we were all very tired.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 等到我们终于抵达港口时﹐大家都已疲惫不堪。

Exponent.DEF: if someone comes, they arrive at the place where you are
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She came home yesterday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她昨天回家来了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What time did the plumber say he’d come?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水管工说他几点来？

Exponent.DEF: to arrive somewhere, especially when someone is waiting for you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在别人等你的时候〕到达﹐来到
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d arranged to meet Tom, but he never turned up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我约好跟汤姆见面﹐但他一直没来。

Exponent.DEF: to arrive somewhere later than you should and not seem worried about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Rebecca usually rolls in around noon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丽贝卡一般中午才姗姗而来。

Exponent.DEF: to arrive somewhere – used especially about people arriving home, or a plane, train etc arriving at an airport, station etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I usually get in at around 6 o'clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一般六点左右到家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What time did your plane get in?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的飞机几点到的？

Exponent.DEF: if a plane, train, or ship comes in, it arrives in the place where you are
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We liked to watch the cruise ships come in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们喜欢看游轮进港。

Exponent.DEF: if a plane or the passengers on it land, they arrive on the ground
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We finally landed at 2 a.m.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨两点我们终于降落。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They watched the planes taking off and landing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们看着飞机起飞降落。

Sense.DEF: when someone behaves in a rude way because they think they are very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t believe the arrogance of the man!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不敢相信那个男人那么傲慢！

Sense.DEF: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people
Sense.TRAN: 傲慢的﹐趾高气扬的﹐目中无人的﹐妄自尊大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was unbearably arrogant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an arrogant attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傲慢的态度

Sense.DEF: to claim that you have a particular right, position etc, without having the legal right to it
Sense.TRAN: 冒称某事﹔擅取某物（为己有）

Sense.DEF:
a weapon usually made from a thin straight piece of wood with a sharp point at one end, that you shoot with a
bow
a sign in the shape of an arrow, used to show direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Follow the arrows to the X-ray department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺着箭头指示的方向去X光科。

Sense.DEF: the sharp pointed end of an arrow
a type of flour made from the root of a tropical American plant, used in cooking to make sauces thicker
the part of your body that you sit on
a stupid and annoying person
used to say that you do not believe something
used to tell someone to stop being lazy and start doing something
used to tell someone to hurry up

Sense.LEXUNIT: not know your arse from your elbow
Sense.DEF: to be stupid and confused about simple things

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be a pain in the arse

Sense.DEF: to not do something because you are feeling too lazy
to waste time behaving in a silly way instead of doing the things you should do
a stupid and annoying person. Do not use this word.

someone’s
anus
someone who is always very nice to people in authority because he or she wants to be liked by them – used to show disapproval
a large group of weapons that someone has
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s nuclear arsenal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的核武器

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an arsenal of guns
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大批枪支

Sense.DEF: a building where weapons are stored
the equipment, methods etc that someone can use to help them achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a software package that’s now part of our arsenal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现已成为我们法宝之一的一个软件包

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has a whole arsenal of cameras.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有各种各样的相机。

Sense.DEF:
a strong poison. It is a chemical
element
: symbol As
Sense.TRAN: 砷〔一种化学元素﹐符号为As〕﹐砒霜

Sense.DEF: the crime of deliberately making something burn, especially a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school was destroyed in an arson attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所学校毁于一次纵火袭击。

Sense.DEF: someone who commits the crime of arson

the use of painting, drawing,
sculpture
etc to represent things or express ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Museum of Modern Art in New York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约现代艺术博物馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: an example of early Indian art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度早期艺术的范例

Sense.DEF: objects that are produced by art, such as paintings, drawings etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an art exhibition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术作品展
Sense.EXAMPLE: an art critic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术批评家
Sense.EXAMPLE: an arts and crafts fair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工艺品展销会
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exhibition features works of art by Picasso and Matisse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次展览专题展出毕加索和马蒂斯的艺术作品。

Sense.DEF: the skill of drawing or painting
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s very good at art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很擅长绘画。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an art teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绘画教师
Sense.EXAMPLE: art college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美术学院

Sense.DEF: art, music, theatre, film, literature etc all considered together
Sense.TRAN: 艺术〔指美术﹑音乐﹑戏剧﹑电影﹑文学等的总称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Government funding for the arts has been reduced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对艺术提供的资金减少了。

Sense.DEF: subjects you can study that are not scientific, for example history, languages etc
the ability or skill involved in doing or making something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Television is ruining the art of conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视在糟蹋会话艺术。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Writing advertisements is quite an art
it is difficult to do
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撰写广告是一门大学问。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have/get sth down to a fine art
GramExa.GLOSS: do something very well
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 把某事做得很出色[精巧]
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got the early morning routine down to a fine art.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把一大早必干的事完成得很利落。

Sense.DEF: a phrase meaning ‘you are’
a style of art and decoration that uses simple shapes and was popular in Europe and America in the 1920s and 1930s
Sense.TRAN: 〔20世纪20和30年代流行于欧美的〕装饰派艺术（风格）

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to decide on how pictures, photographs etc will look in a magazine, film, advertisement etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔杂志﹑电影等的〕美术指导﹐艺术总监

Sense.DEF: an object such as a tool, weapon etc that was made in the past and is historically important
Sense.TRAN: 人工制品〔有史学价值的武器﹑工具等〕﹐手工艺品
Sense.EXAMPLE: ancient Egyptian artefacts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古埃及手工艺品

Sense.DEF: involving the arteries
Sense.EXAMPLE: arterial blood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动脉血

Sense.DEF: an arterial road is one of the main roads in a city, country etc
a disease in which your arteries become hard, which makes it difficult for the blood to flow through
one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body
a main road, railway line, river etc

a
well
from which the water is forced up out of the ground by natural pressure
a way of expressing ideas, for example in a painting, dance, piece of writing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Music is quite unlike any other art form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐与其他的艺术形式有很大差别。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make/turn sth into an art form
Sense.DEF: to do something so often that you become very good at it
Sense.TRAN: 做某事达到炉火纯青的地步
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company that’s in danger of turning mismanagement into an art form
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家管理不善到极点的公司

Sense.DEF: clever at deceiving people
Sense.EXAMPLE: artful tricks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诡计

Sense.DEF: designed or done in a clever and attractive way
Sense.EXAMPLE: artful photographs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技巧高超的照片

Sense.DEF:
a young
pickpocket
someone who steals things from people’s pockets
in the book Oliver Twist by Charles Dickens. He protests that he is a ‘victim of society’. People sometimes describe someone as an ‘artful dodger’ if they refuse to accept responsibility for their actions
Sense.TRAN: 逮不着的机灵鬼〔查尔斯·狄更斯著作《雾都孤儿》中的一个小扒手﹐有时用于形容拒绝为自己的行为承担责任的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister was regarded as the artful dodger of British politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位部长被认为是英国政界里“逮不着的机灵鬼”。

Sense.DEF: a building where paintings are shown to the public
a cinema that shows mainly foreign films, or films made by small film companies
Sense.TRAN: 〔主要放映外国影片或低成本影片的〕艺术影院
Sense.EXAMPLE: art house films
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术影片

Sense.DEF: a disease that causes the joints of your body to become swollen and very painful

a type of round green vegetable, which has
bud s
with leaves that you eat, which are like the
petal s
of a flower
a plant that has a root like a potato that you can eat
a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an article on environmental issues
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇关于环境问题的文章

Sense.EXAMPLE:
The paper’s leading article
the main article
described the government as weak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报社论称政府软弱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: newspaper articles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上的文章

Sense.DEF: a thing, especially one of a group of things
Sense.TRAN: 物品﹐物件〔尤指整套中的一件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: household articles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家居用品
Sense.EXAMPLE: She only took a few articles of clothing with her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她随身只带了几件衣服。

Sense.DEF: a part of a law or legal agreement that deals with a particular point
Sense.EXAMPLE: Article 1 of the constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宪法的第一条保障宗教信仰自由。

Sense.DEF: a word used before a noun to show whether the noun refers to a particular example of something or to a general example of something. In English, ‘the’ is called the definite article and ‘a’ and ‘an’ are called the indefinite article.
an agreement by which someone finishes their training, especially as a lawyer, by working for a company
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指律师的〕见习契约﹔师徒合约

Sense.DEF: something that you feel very strongly about so that it affects how you think or behave

someone who is articled to a company of lawyers,
accountant s
etc, is employed by that company while they are training to become a lawyer etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔与律师﹑会计师等事务所〕订有见习契约的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an articled clerk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见习文员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was articled to a firm of architects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跟一家建筑师事务所签有见习契约。

Sense.DEF: to express your ideas or feelings in words
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

Sense.DEF: to pronounce what you are saying in a clear and careful way
Sense.TRAN: 口齿清楚地讲（话）﹔清晰发（音）
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was so drunk that he could barely articulate his words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他醉得话都说不清楚了。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a bone in your body is articulated to another thing, it is joined to it in a way that allows movement
if one idea, system etc articulates with another idea, system etc, the two things are related and exist together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new course that is designed to articulate with the current degree course
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在与现有学位课程接轨的新课程

Sense.DEF: able to talk easily and effectively about things, especially difficult subjects
Sense.TRAN: 能说会道的﹐口齿伶俐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: bright, articulate 17-year-olds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聪明伶俐的17岁少年
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly articulate speaker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位能言善道的演讲者

Sense.DEF: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult
an articulated vehicle has two parts joined together to make it easier to turn
the act of making a sound or of speaking words
the expression of thoughts or feelings in words

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the articulation of ideas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想法的表达

Sense.DEF: a joint that allows movement

another spelling of
artefact
the use of clever tricks to deceive someone
a trick used to deceive someone
not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假花
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造光
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial fertilizers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化肥

Sense.DEF: an artificial situation or quality exists because someone has made it exist, and not because it is really necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial distinctions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人为差别
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial barriers of gender and race
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性别和种族的人为障碍

Sense.DEF: artificial behaviour is not sincere – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕虚假的﹐不真挚的﹐矫揉造作的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an artificial smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假笑

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Food prices are being kept artificially low.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品价格正被人为地控制在低水平。

Exponent.DEF: not real or natural, but made to look or work like something real or natural
Exponent.TRAN: 人造的﹔人工的〔尤指模拟自然的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: artificial flowers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假花
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was given an artificial heart.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被植入了人造心脏。

Exponent.DEF: made using chemical processes rather than by natural processes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: synthetic fabrics
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 合成纤维
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a synthetic version of the drug
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 合成药物

Exponent.DEF: made by people – used especially about geographical features and materials
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指地貌或材料〕人造的﹐人工的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a man-made lake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人工湖
Exponent.EXAMPLE: man-made fibres
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造纤维

Exponent.DEF: made to look or seem like something else, especially in order to deceive people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fake passport
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假护照
Exponent.EXAMPLE: fake fur
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造毛皮

Exponent.DEF: made to look like something, but not real – used especially about guns, jewellery, and leather
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指枪支﹑珠宝和皮革〕人造的﹐仿制的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: imitation firearms
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿真枪
Exponent.EXAMPLE: imitation pearls
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造珍珠

Exponent.DEF:
artificial – used especially about teeth,
eyelash es
, and
beard s
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指牙齿﹑睫毛和胡须〕人造的﹐人工的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a set of false teeth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副假牙

Exponent.DEF: not real, but made to look, sound, or feel real, especially by means of special computers or machines
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指由计算机或机械〕模仿的﹐模拟的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a simulated space flight
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 模拟航天飞行

Exponent.DEF: made, done, seen etc on a computer, rather than in the real world
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在计算机上〕虚拟的﹐非现实的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a virtual tour of the garden
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚拟花园游览

Sense.DEF:
the medical process of making a woman or female animal
pregnant
by using a piece of equipment, rather than by having sex
the study of how to make computers do intelligent things that people can do, such as think and make decisions
a way of making someone breathe again when they have stopped, by blowing air into their mouth
large guns, either on wheels or fixed in one place
the part of the army that uses these weapons
someone who does skilled work, making things with their hands
someone who produces art, especially paintings or drawings
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exhibition of paintings by local artists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地画家的画展

Sense.DEF: a professional performer, especially a singer, dancer, or actor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the artists in the show donated their fee to charity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加演出的许多艺人将出场费捐给了慈善事业。

Sense.DEF: someone who is extremely good at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an artist in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是位烹饪大师。

Sense.DEF: a professional singer, dancer, actor etc who performs in a show
Sense.TRAN: 职业演艺人员﹐专业艺人

Sense.DEF: relating to art or culture
Sense.EXAMPLE: artistic work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术作品
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opinion about the artistic merit of his paintings has been mixed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于他的绘画作品的艺术价值﹐人们褒贬不一。

Sense.DEF: good at painting, drawing, or producing beautiful things
Sense.TRAN: 艺术精湛的﹐有艺术才华的
Sense.EXAMPLE: John is very artistic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰很有艺术才华。

Sense.DEF: an artistic arrangement, design etc looks attractive and has been done with skill and imagination
Sense.TRAN: 有艺术技巧的﹔有创意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: food presented in an artistic way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布置得很有艺术感的食品

Sense.DEF: skill in a particular artistic activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the artistry of dance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞蹈的艺术技巧

Sense.DEF: natural, honest, and sincere
Sense.TRAN: 天真自然的﹐纯朴的﹔不造作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: artless sincerity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天真烂漫

Sense.DEF: made or done without any skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: an artless copy of European art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对欧洲艺术的拙劣模仿

Sense.DEF: a style of art that used plants and flowers in paintings and in the design of objects and buildings, popular in Europe and America at the end of the 19th century
Sense.TRAN: 新艺术（派）〔19世纪末流行于欧美的一种装饰艺术风格〕

Sense.DEF: a cinema that shows mainly foreign films or films made by small film companies
Sense.TRAN: 〔主要放映国外影片或低成本影片的〕艺术影院

Sense.DEF: drawings and photographs that are specially prepared to be in a book, magazine, or advertisement
paintings and other objects produced by artists
someone who is arty knows a lot about art, film, theatre etc – often used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was one of those arty types.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是那种所谓的艺术专家。

Sense.DEF: intended for, or used by people who are interested in art, film, theatre etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an arty film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paris’s arty Marais district
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎艺术气息浓厚的马莱区

Sense.DEF: trying too hard to show that you are interested in art – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 装腔作势表示喜爱艺术的﹐附庸风雅的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
someone from Northern Europe, especially someone with
blond
hair and blue eyes
used when you are comparing two people, things, situations etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom’s not as old as you, is he?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆年纪没有你大﹐是吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old woman with hair as white as snow
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位白发如雪的老太太
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the doctors are paid almost twice as much as the nurses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些医生的薪水几乎是护士的两倍。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We work as hard as any other team in England.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们同其他英格兰球队一样努力。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Please let me know your decision as soon as possible
as soon as you can
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请尽快告诉我你的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
His last album sold half a million copies and we hope this one will be just as
equally
popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上一张专辑售出50万张﹐我们希望这张同样畅销。

Sense.DEF: used to say what job, duty, use, or appearance someone or something has
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a parent, I feel that more should be done to protect our children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为家长﹐我觉得应采取更多措施来保护我们的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A flat stone was used as a table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块扁平的石头被用作桌子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad dressed up as Santa Claus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸打扮成圣诞老人。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone thinks or says a person or thing is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem is regarded as serious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题被认为很严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The result of last week’s election will be seen as a victory for the right-wing government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周选举的结果将被视为右翼政府的胜利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s described as being in his late teens, tall, and of slim build.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据描述﹐他十八九岁的样子﹐瘦高个儿。

Sense.DEF: when someone was in a particular age group
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a young man, Eliot had studied art in Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻时﹐艾略特在巴黎学画画。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll take you to all the places I loved as a girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会带你去我小时候爱去的每一个地方。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法:as, like, as if/though
F2NBox.EXPL: Use as in comparisons in the expression as ... as , with an adjective or adverb in between
F2NBox.TRAN: as用于表示比较的短语as ... as﹐中间是形容词或副词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Basketball is as popular as football here.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这里﹐篮球与足球一样流行。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He can’t sing as well as his brother.
F2NBox.EXPL: As is also used after be the same (age/colour etc)
F2NBox.TRAN: as 还用于be the same (age/colour等)之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He is the same age as me.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use as on its own before a noun or pronoun in comparisons. Use like
F2NBox.TRAN: 比较形式中的名词﹑代词前不要用单独的as﹐要用like
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: A movie is not like a book (NOT not as a book).
Like other people (NOT as other people), he values his privacy.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 同其他人一样﹐他也看重自己的隐私。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use as if/as though followed by a clause to compare a real situation to an imaginary situation
F2NBox.TRAN: as if/as though之后接从句﹐用于把真实的情形比作虚设的情形
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He talked to them as if they were children.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他同他们说话的口气就像他们是孩子。
F2NBox.EXPL: Some people use like in this sort of comparison
F2NBox.TRAN: 在这种比较中﹐有些人用like
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They act like they own the place.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们表现得像是这地方的主人。
F2NBox.EXPL: However, some people think this is incorrect.
F2NBox.TRAN: 然而有些人认为这种用法不正确。
F2NBox.EXPL: as if/as though cannot be followed directly by a noun
F2NBox.TRAN: as if/as though后面不能直接跟名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You treat them as if they were your parents (NOT 不说 as if your parents).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对待他们如同自己的父母。

Sense.DEF: used in comparisons

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They want peace as much as we do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们同我们一样希望和平。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helen comes to visit me as often as she can.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦有空就来看我。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t run as fast as I used to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不如以前跑得快了。

Sense.DEF: in the way that someone says or that something happens, or in the condition something is in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do as I say!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按我说的去做！
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better leave things as they are until the police arrive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在警察到来以前﹐我们最好什么也别动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money was repaid, as promised.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱按承诺还了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not need to keep moving house, as his father had.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不用像他父亲那样不停地搬家了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Roberta was late as usual
in the way that she usually was
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯塔和往常一样迟到了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that what you are saying is already known or has been stated before
Sense.TRAN: 正如〔用于所说的话已为人所知或已经说过〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: David, as you know, has not been well lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道的﹐戴维近来身体不大好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As I explained on the phone, your request will be considered at the next meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如我在电话里解释的那样﹐下次开会将考虑你的请求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As Napoleon once said, attack is the best method of defence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿破仑曾经说过﹐进攻是最好的防御。

Sense.DEF: while or when
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Peter as I was getting off the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我下公共汽车的时候看见了彼得。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As time passed, things seemed to get worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着时间的推移﹐情况似乎变得更加糟糕了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just as the two men were leaving, a message arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两个男子刚要离开﹐消息就传来了。

Sense.DEF: used to state why a particular situation exists or why someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: As it was getting late, I turned around to start for home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天越来越晚﹐于是我掉头回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We asked Philip to come with us, as he knew the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们叫菲利浦一起去﹐因为他认识路。

Sense.DEF: though
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unlikely as it might seem, I’m tired too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然看起来不像﹐但确实我也累了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try as she might, Sue couldn’t get the door open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论休怎样努力﹐她就是打不开门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As popular as he is, the President hasn’t always managed to have his own way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管总统很受拥戴﹐但也并非总能随心所欲。

Sense.DEF: used when you are starting to talk about someone or something new that is connected with what you were talking about before
Sense.TRAN: 至于某人/某物﹐就某人/某物而言
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kitty’s got so thin. And as for Carl, he always seems to be ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姬蒂变得很瘦﹐至于卡尔﹐他似乎一直病恹恹的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can ask the others, but as for myself, I’ll be busy in the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以去问问别人﹐至于我嘛﹐就会在办公室里忙着。

Sense.DEF: until and including the present time – used to say that something has not happened although it may happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had no word from Colin as yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到现在为止也没得到来自科林的任何消息。

Subsense.DEF: in a way that makes it seem that something is true or that something is happening
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It sounds as though she’s been really ill.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听起来她病得很重。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Gary was behaving as though nothing had happened.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里表现得好像什么也没发生过。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Crump looked as if she was going to explode.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克伦普太太看起来好像要大发雷霆。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Beckworth shook his head as if to say ‘Don’t trust her’.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克沃思摇摇头﹐好像在说“别相信她”。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is not true or will not happen
Subsense.TRAN: 仿佛﹐好像〔用于强调某事不是真的或不会发生〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
She said she’d never speak to me again. As if I cared
I do not care at all
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她再也不会跟我说话了﹐好像我会在乎似的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t try any funny business, now.’ ‘As if I would.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “好了﹐别耍什么花样。”“我才不会呢。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
He asked if I’d go out with him. As if
it is extremely unlikely that I would go out with him
!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他问我是否愿意跟他出去﹐我才不愿意呢！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something cannot be the explanation for a situation or someone’s behaviour because it is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do they never go on holiday? I mean it’s not as if they’re poor is it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为什么从不去度假呢？ 我的意思是他们并不穷﹐对吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know why you’re so frightened of her, it’s not as if she’s got any power over you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白你为什么这样怕她﹐她又没权管你。

Subsense.DEF: because of the situation that actually exists – used when that situation is different from what you expected or needed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They hoped to finish the kitchen by Friday, but as it is they’ll probably have to come back next week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望星期五厨房完工﹐但事实上﹐他们很可能下周还得来。

Subsense.DEF: already
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just keep quiet – you’re in enough trouble as it is.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静点﹐你的麻烦已经够多了。

Sense.DEF: starting from a particular time or date and continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: As from today, you are in charge of the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从今天起﹐你来负责这个办公室。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As of now, there will be no more paid overtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在起不再有加班费。

Sense.DEF: in comparison with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Profits this year are $2.5 million as against $4 million last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的利润是250万美元﹐而去年的利润是400万美元。

Subsense.DEF: concerning
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Frank was very uncertain as to whether it was the right job for him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克实在拿不准这工作是不是适合他。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: advice as to which suppliers to approach
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关与哪些供应商接洽的建议
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He kept his rivals guessing as to his real intentions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直让对手捉摸不透他的真实意图。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are starting to talk about something new that is connected with what you were talking about before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As to our future plans, I think I need only say that the company intends to expand at a steady rate.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至于我们未来的计划﹐我想我只需要说﹐公司打算稳步扩展。

Sense.DEF: used when describing someone or something in a way that is not quite exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim Radcliffe became our idol, as it were, the man we all wanted to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆·拉德克利夫可以说是我们的偶像﹐我们都想成为他那样的人。

Sense.DEF: used to add that what you have said is also true of someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eve’s very tall, as was her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊芙个子很高﹐她母亲也这样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I voted Labour, as did my wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我投了工党的票﹐我妻子也是。

Sense.DEF: in the way that people usually do something or how they normally behave – often used humorously by people after they have mentioned doing something strange or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 就像大家一样〔幽默用法﹐常指不寻常之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We talked, exchanged email addresses and phone numbers, as you do on planes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们聊天﹐交换了电子邮件地址和电话号码﹐在飞机上大家都这样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was driving a Ferrari through town yesterday – as you do – when I saw an old school friend outside the cinema.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天我像大家一样开着法拉利穿过商业区﹐在影院外看见了一位老同学。

Sense.DEF: a British organization that controls the advertising industry in the UK. If people think that an advertisement is offensive or untrue, they can complain to this organization, which can stop the advertisement being used.

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= as soon as possible 尽快

Sense.DEF: a grey mineral that does not burn easily, that was used in the past as a building material or in protective clothing

an official order in Britain which tells someone not to go to particular places or not to see particular people. The order is given by a court to someone who has been found guilty of
anti-social
behaviour such as
vandalism
deliberately damaging things, especially public property
or violence towards other people. If they do not obey the order, they are given a stronger punishment, such as being sent to prison.
Sense.TRAN: 反社会行为令〔英国法院对于反社会行为的判决指令﹐禁止当事人去某些地方或见某些人。 若当事人不遵守﹐则加重处罚〕

Sense.DEF: to move up through the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane ascended rapidly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机迅速爬升。

Sense.DEF: to climb something or move to a higher position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without a word, he began to ascend the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没说一句话就上楼梯了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Ascend is used mostly in literary or technical contexts. In everyday English, people usually say climb or go up
F2NBox.TRAN: ascend主要用于文学作品和科技文章。 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说climb或go up
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We started to climb the mountain.
She slowly went up the stairs.

Sense.DEF: to lead up to a higher position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road ascends steeply from the harbour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路从港湾那里陡直而上。

Sense.DEF: to move to a more important or powerful job
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of women decreases as you ascend the professional hierarchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专业级别越高﹐女性人数越少。

Sense.DEF: to become king or queen
if a group of things are arranged in ascending order, each thing is higher, or greater in amount, than the one before it
a position of power, influence, or control
Sense.EXAMPLE: moral ascendancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德力量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ascendancy of nationalist forces
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民族主义势力的优势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Butler established ascendancy over his critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴特勒压倒了他的批评者。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He slowly gained ascendancy in the group.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他渐渐控制了这个群体。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a teaching method that is currently in the ascendancy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前占主导地位的教学法

Sense.DEF: to be or become powerful or popular
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political party that’s in the ascendant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个正在发展壮大的政党

Sense.DEF: becoming more powerful or popular
Sense.TRAN: 影响力渐大的﹔越来越受欢迎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politically ascendant country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个政治影响力越来越大的国家

Sense.DEF: in the Christian religion, when Jesus Christ left the earth and went to heaven
when someone moves to a more important or higher position or job
Sense.EXAMPLE: his ascension to the ranks of senior management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的级别升至高级管理层

Sense.DEF: the act of climbing something or moving upwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first ascent of Qomolangma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首次攀登珠穆朗玛峰

Sense.DEF: a path or way up to the top of something, for example a mountain
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rugged and steep ascent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 崎岖陡峭的上坡路

Sense.DEF: the process of becoming more important, powerful, or successful than before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the President’s ascent to power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的上台

Sense.DEF: to find out something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A postmortem was ordered to try to ascertain the cause of death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下令验尸以查明死因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tests were conducted to ascertain whether pollution levels have dropped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进行了检测以确定污染程度是否已经下降。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police had ascertained that the dead man knew his killer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方确定死者认识凶手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should ascertain the level of insurance cover from the car rental company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该向汽车租赁公司打听清楚保险的范围。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Ascertain is used mainly in formal or technical contexts. In everyday English, people usually say find out
F2NBox.TRAN: ascertain主要用于正式或科技语境中。 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说find out
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We need to find out exactly what happened before we jump to any conclusions.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要弄清到底发生了什么事﹐不要贸然下结论。

Sense.DEF: living without any physical pleasures or comforts, especially for religious reasons
Sense.TRAN: 苦行的﹐〔尤指因宗教原因〕禁欲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ascetic life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清苦的生活

Sense.FULLFORM: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
Sense.DEF: a system used for exchanging information between computers by allowing them to recognize letters, numbers etc in the same way
Sense.TRAN: 美国信息交换标准代码〔用于计算机之间交换信息〕

Sense.DEF: a wide piece of material that a man wears loosely folded around his neck and inside his collar
to claim that something is caused by a particular person, situation etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report ascribes the rise in childhood asthma to the increase in pollution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告认为儿童哮喘发病率上升是因为污染加剧。

Sense.DEF: to claim that something has been written, said, made etc by a particular person
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quotation that’s often been ascribed to Marilyn Monroe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常被认为是玛丽莲·梦露说的一句话

Sense.DEF: to believe that something or someone has a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people ascribe healing properties to this fruit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人认为这种水果具有药用特性。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Most of the accidents were ascribable to the bad weather.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数事故是由恶劣天气引起的。

Sense.DEF: not having sexual organs or not involving sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: asexual reproduction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无性繁殖

Subsense.DEF: not having any sexual qualities
not interested in sex
Subsense.TRAN: 无性欲的﹐对性不感兴趣的

Sense.DEF: the soft grey powder that remains after something has been burned
Sense.EXAMPLE: cigarette ash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟灰
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house burnt to ashes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子烧成了灰烬。

Subsense.DEF: the ash that remains when a dead person’s body is burned
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His ashes were scattered at sea.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的骨灰被撒向大海。

Subsense.DEF: a situation in which something is completely destroyed
Subsense.TRAN: 废墟﹐灰烬〔指完全被毁的局面〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The organization has risen from the ashes to become very successful.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该机构浴火重生﹐现在已经非常成功。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All her hopes and dreams had turned to ashes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她所有的希望和梦想都化为了泡影。

Sense.DEF: a tree that is common in Britain and North America, or the wood from this tree

the first day of
lent
Sense.TRAN: 圣灰星期三〔大斋期[四旬期]的第一天〕

Sense.DEF: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done
Sense.TRAN: 〔因自己所做的事而〕羞耻的﹔内疚的﹔惭愧的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt ashamed of the things I’d said to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为对他所说的话感到羞愧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m ashamed to admit that I’ve never read any of his books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不好意思承认﹐我从来没读过他的书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt ashamed that she had missed her sister’s wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没能参加姐姐的婚礼﹐觉得很内疚。
