offence
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He assaulted a flight attendant who refused to serve him more drinks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他殴打了一名空中乘务员﹐因后者拒绝向他提供更多饮料。

Exponent.DEF: to be attacked by a group of people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He died outside his home after being set upon by a gang of youths.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被一帮少年群殴﹐死在家门外。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly change your behaviour and attack the person you are with, when they do not expect this
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog suddenly turned on him, sinking its teeth into his arm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那狗突然向他扑来﹐死死咬住他的胳膊。

Exponent.DEF: to use weapons to try to damage or take control of a place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The village was attacked by enemy warplanes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座村庄遭到敌机的袭击。

Exponent.DEF: to enter a country and try to get control of it using force
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 2,000年前罗马人入侵不列颠。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly attack a city or building that is well defended by getting inside it and taking control
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Elite troops stormed the building and rescued the hostages.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 精锐部队突袭大楼﹐救出了人质。

Exponent.DEF: to surround a city or building with soldiers in order to stop the people inside from getting out or from receiving supplies
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In April 655, Osman’s palace was besieged by rebels.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在655年4月﹐奥斯曼的宫殿被叛军包围。

Sense.DEF: a person who deliberately uses violence to hurt someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her attacker then dragged her into the bushes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击者接着将她拖进灌木丛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sex attacker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强奸犯

Sense.DEF:
a member of a sports team whose job is to move forward and try to score
goal s
or win points
used to tell a female person or dog that she has done something well, or to encourage her
Sense.TRAN: 好姑娘﹐好样的〔对女性或母犬表示赞许或鼓励〕

Sense.DEF: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过长时间努力而〕得到﹐获得﹐赢得
Sense.EXAMPLE: More women are attaining positions of power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

Sense.DEF: to reach a particular level, age, size etc
Sense.TRAN: 达到〔某水平﹑年龄﹑尺寸等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Share prices attained a high of $3.27.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股价涨到3.27美元的高位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a year she had attained her ideal weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年后﹐她达到了理想的体重。

Sense.DEF: success in achieving something or reaching a particular level
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low level of educational attainment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育程度低

Sense.DEF: something that you have succeeded in achieving or learning, such as a skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: a society remarkable for its cultural attainments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文化成就斐然的社会

Sense.DEF: an act of trying to do something, especially something difficult
Sense.TRAN: 努力﹐尝试﹐企图〔尤指困难的事情〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All attempts to control inflation have failed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制通货膨胀的所有努力都失败了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her feeble attempts at humour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她徒劳无功的试图幽默

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She passed her driving test at the first attempt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她第一次考驾驶执照就通过了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make no attempt to do sth
Sense.DEF: to not try to do something at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made no attempt to hide his anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毫不掩饰自己的愤怒。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone tries to kill a famous or important person
Sense.TRAN: 企图谋杀某人〔尤指名人或要人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has already survived two attempts on her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已两次逃过暗杀。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She made several attempts to escape.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几次企图逃跑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They had to abandon their attempt to climb the mountain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不得不放弃登山行动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He failed in his attempt to set a new Olympic record.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想创造奥运会新记录的努力失败了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All attempts to find a cure have failed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找疗法的所有努力均告失败。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The car started at the second attempt.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次尝试时汽车发动了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that does not succeed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They worked through the night in a vain attempt to finish on schedule.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们彻夜工作﹐还是没能按时完成。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that involves a lot of effort
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Doctors made a desperate attempt to save his life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生竭尽全力挽救他的生命。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: unsuccessful
certain to fail and not worth doing
certain to fail, and causing something very bad to happen
one that you admire, but that is unsuccessful
when someone openly tries to do something bad
a final attempt to achieve something before it is too late

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Two firefighters were hurt in the rescue attempt.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名消防员在营救行动中受伤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an attempt to kill a leader
Collocate.EXAMPLE: De Gaulle survived an assassination attempt in 1961.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1961年戴高乐侥幸逃过一次暗杀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an attempt to kill yourself
an attempt to change the government, usually by force

Sense.DEF: to try to do something, especially something difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In this chapter I will attempt to explain what led up to the revolution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一章里﹐我想解释一下导致革命的原因。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

Sense.DEF: an act of trying to kill or harm someone, kill yourself etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pleaded guilty to attempted murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认杀人未遂。

Sense.DEF: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有12个人出席了会议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不能出席﹐请通知我们。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say go (to) or come (to) instead of attend
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说go (to)或come (to)﹐而不说attend
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I didn’t go to the parents’ meeting.
Please let us know if you can’t come .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你不能来请通知我们。

Sense.DEF: to go regularly to a school, church etc
Sense.TRAN: 经常去﹐定期去〔学校﹑教堂等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am the first child in my family to attend college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是家里第一个读大学的孩子。

Sense.DEF: to happen or exist at the same time as something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the peculiar atmosphere which attends such an event
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伴随这类事件的怪异气氛

Sense.DEF: to look after someone, especially because they are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of attend and go to in spoken and written English. attend和go to在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。
attend is more formal than go to. attend比go to更为正式。

Sense.DEF: to deal with business or personal matters
Sense.TRAN: 处理﹐料理〔生意或个人事务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I may be late – I have got one or two things to attend to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也许会迟到﹐我有一两件事要处理。

Sense.DEF: to help a customer in a shop or a restaurant
the number of people who attend a game, concert, meeting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have an average attendance of 4,000 fans per game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每场比赛平均有4,000名球迷来观战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year’s fair saw attendance figures of 32,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年的交易会有3.2万人参加。

Sense.DEF: when someone goes to a meeting, class etc, or an occasion when they go

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most courses involve an average of eight hours' attendance at college each week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多数课程都需要平均每个星期到学院里上八小时的课。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor will have a record of her attendances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生会记录她的出诊次数。

Sense.DEF: to be at a special or important event
Sense.TRAN: 出席﹐参加〔特别或重要的活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 2,000 people were in attendance at yesterday’s demonstration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两千多人参加了昨天的示威游行。

Sense.DEF: to look after someone or serve them
someone whose job is to look after or help customers in a public place
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car park attendant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车场的服务员

Sense.DEF: someone who looks after a very important person, for example a king or queen
relating to or caused by something
Sense.TRAN: 伴随的﹐随之而来的﹐附带的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: nuclear power, with all its attendant risks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 核动力及其附带风险

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drugs are one of the issues attendant on running a school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品是办学时出现的问题之一。

Sense.DEF: someone who is at an event such as a meeting or a course
someone who regularly goes to an event such as a meeting or a class
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daniel was a regular attender at the Baptist Church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔经常去浸礼会教堂做礼拜。

Sense.DEF: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽量注意听他说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你上课更认真些﹐也许能实实在在地学到些东西！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下﹐将注意力转向面前的文件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在同一社会里﹐我们得更加关注长者的需求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在他已经走了﹐我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游戏很有趣﹐一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They listened to the speech with close attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很认真地听演讲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上课时﹐萨拉开始走神了。

Sense.DEF: the interest that people show in someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was flattered by all the attention he was giving her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的关注让她喜不自胜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a player who quickly attracted the attention of several clubs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名很快就吸引了数家俱乐部注意的球员
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exhibition received little attention in the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览几乎没有得到媒体的关注。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her case attracted a great deal of media attention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的案件吸引了媒体的大量关注。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone stay interested and keep reading, listening, watching etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book holds the reader’s attention right to the very end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书从头到尾都吸引着读者的注意力。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Rob loves being the centre of attention
the person who everyone is interested in, listens to etc
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布喜欢成为关注的焦点。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She spent a lot of time trying to avoid the attentions
romantic interest
of her boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想方设法躲避老板的殷勤之举。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The man then turned his attentions to
became romantically interested in
her sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男人后来又开始向她妹妹献殷勤。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone notice you, especially because you want to speak to them or you need their help
Subsense.TRAN: 吸引/引起/得到某人的注意
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She waved to attract the attention of the waitress.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挥手以吸引女服务员的注意。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone notice you and be interested in what you are doing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Children often misbehave in order to get attention.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子捣蛋往往是想引起注意。

Subsense.DEF: to make people notice and be concerned or think about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The purpose of the article was to draw attention to the problems faced by single parents.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章的目的是让人们关注单身父母面临的问题。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We wanted to focus public attention on this matter.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想让公众关注这件事。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He left quietly to avoid drawing attention to himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他悄悄离开﹐避免引起别人的注意。

Subsense.DEF: to make people stop being concerned about something such as a social problem
Subsense.TRAN: 转移人们对某事的注意力
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All this talk of war is just an attempt to draw attention away from the serious economic problems that face our country.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切有关战争的讨论只是为了把人们的注意力从我们国家面临的严重经济问题上转移开去。

Subsense.DEF: to tell someone, especially someone in authority, about something such as a problem
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The matter was first brought to my attention earlier this year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年早些时候﹐这个问题第一次引起了我的注意。

Subsense.DEF: if something such as a problem comes to the attention of someone in authority, they find out about it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It came to my attention that Jenny was claiming overtime pay for hours she had not worked.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现珍妮没有加班却在申请加班费。

Subsense.DEF: if something escaped your attention, you did not notice it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This fact had not escaped the attention of the authorities.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个事实没能逃过当局的眼睛。

Sense.DEF: something you do to repair or clean something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bike’s in fairly good condition, but the gears need a bit of attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆自行车车况还不错﹐但是变速器得稍作修理。

Sense.DEF: things that you do to help or to take care of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pets need a lot of care and attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宠物需要很多的关心和照顾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone who comes into contact with these chemicals should seek urgent medical attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接触这些化学品的人应当立即就医。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your plants look like they could do with a bit of attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你种的花花草草看来需要打理了。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers stand to attention, they stand up straight in neat lines

Subsense.DEF:
used to ask people to listen to important information that is being announced, especially on a
loudspeaker
piece of equipment used to make sounds louder
Subsense.TRAN: 注意！〔尤用于扩音器播放重要通知时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Attention, please! Could Passenger Marie Thomas please proceed to Gate 25 immediately.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请注意！乘客玛丽·托马斯请立刻前往25号登机口。

Subsense.DEF: used when ordering a group of soldiers to stand up straight in neat lines

Sense.DEF: used on the front of an official letter when you want a particular person to read it or deal with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Letters should be marked ‘for the attention of Joe Benson’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信上应该写“乔·本森亲启”。

Sense.DEF:
the former name of
attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder
Sense.TRAN: 注意障碍〔attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder的旧称〕

Sense.DEF: a medical condition that especially affects children. It causes them to be too active and to be unable to pay attention or be quiet for very long.
the period of time during which you continue to be interested in something
Sense.TRAN: 注意广度﹐注意力持续时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children often have a short attention span .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子的注意力持续时间通常都很短。

Sense.DEF: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested
Sense.TRAN: 注意听的﹔关注的﹔注意的﹐专心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attentive audience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚精会神的听众

Sense.DEF: making sure someone has everything they need

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Customers want companies that are attentive to their needs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 客户需要的是对其需求考虑周到的公司。

Sense.DEF: to make something weaker or less
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attenuated form of the polio virus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脊髓灰质炎减毒病毒

Sense.DEF: to show or prove that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Luxurious furnishings attested to the wealth of the owner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华的家具陈设说明了主人的财力。

Sense.DEF: to officially state that you believe something is true, especially in a court of law
a legal statement made by someone in which they say that something is definitely true
a space or room just below the roof of a house, often used for storing things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small attic room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间小阁楼

Sense.DEF: clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: business attire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商务着装﹐正装

Sense.DEF: dressed in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He arrived suitably attired in a dark dinner suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来了时得体地穿了一套黑色无尾晚礼服。

Sense.DEF: the opinions and feelings that you usually have about something, especially when this is shown in your behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过行为表现出的对某事的一般〕看法﹐态度
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as they found out I was a doctor, their whole attitude changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一听说我是医生﹐态度就完全改变了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The people have a very positive attitude to life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人的生活态度很积极。

Sense.DEF: a style of dressing, behaving etc that shows you have the confidence to do unusual and exciting things without caring what other people think

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a coat with attitude
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显示个性的外套

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a lazy student with a bad attitude
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 个性懒惰且态度恶劣的学生

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A positive attitude is essential if you want to be successful.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 若想成功﹐积极的态度极为重要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: On Bali, there is a healthier, more relaxed attitude to life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在巴厘岛﹐人们有一种更健康﹑更轻松的生活态度。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: having a good opinion of something or someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Older people tend to have a favourable attitude to the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 年长者对警察往往抱赞许的态度。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing you disagree with or disapprove of someone or something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: People’s attitude towards US foreign policy has become increasingly critical.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对美国的外交政策持越来越多批评的态度。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not sure if you approve of something
very careless, especially about something serious or important
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔尤指对严肃或重要的事〕满不在乎的

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing that you think you are more important or intelligent than someone
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 自命不凡的/居高临下的

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing anger

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Not everyone takes a positive attitude towards modern art.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 并非所有人都对现代艺术持肯定态度。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As you get older, your attitude changes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着年岁的增长﹐为人处世的态度也会改变。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This attitude no longer exists in the church.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种态度在教会不复存在。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: they feel less sympathy and they want to be stricter or firmer
a way of thinking
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Being young is simply an attitude of mind.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻只是个心态问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone is not helpful or pleasant to be with
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of the male students have a real attitude problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些男生的态度很有问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a letter or package is for a particular person
Sense.TRAN: …收〔用于表明信件或包裹的收件人〕

Sense.DEF: a lawyer
the lawyer with the highest rank in some countries or in the US government
Sense.TRAN: 检察长﹐首席检察官﹔〔美国等政府的〕司法部长

Sense.DEF:
a unit of time that is equal to 10 to the power of
minus
18
Sense.TRAN: 【术语】阿托秒﹐微微微秒〔10 – 1 8 秒〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What attracted me most to the job was the chance to travel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作最吸引我的地方是有机会旅行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The story has attracted a lot of interest from the media.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则报道引起了媒体的广泛关注。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you like someone and want to have a sexual relationship with them
Sense.TRAN: 爱慕某人﹐为某人所吸引
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

Sense.DEF: to make someone like or admire something or feel romantically interested in someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I guess it was his eyes that attracted me first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想是他的眼睛首先迷住了我。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something move towards another thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leftover food attracts flies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剩饭剩菜招苍蝇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: low rents designed to attract new businesses to the area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在吸引新企业到这个地区来的低租金

Sense.DEF: a feeling of liking someone, especially in a sexual way
Sense.TRAN: 喜爱﹐喜欢﹔〔尤指两性间的〕爱慕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The attraction between them was almost immediate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们几乎是一见钟情。

Sense.DEF: something interesting or enjoyable to see or do
Sense.TRAN: 吸引人之物﹐有魅力之物﹐诱惑物
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The beautiful beaches are the island’s main attraction
most popular place, activity etc
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美丽的海滩是这个岛上的主要魅力所在。

GramExa.GLOSS: a place that many tourists visit

Sense.DEF: a feature or quality that makes something seem interesting or enjoyable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Being your own boss is one of the attractions of owning your own business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己当老板是自己开公司的诱惑力之一。

Sense.DEF: a force which makes things move together or stay together
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gravitational attraction between the Earth and the Moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地月引力

Sense.DEF: someone who is attractive is good looking, especially in a way that makes you sexually interested in them
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attractive young woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妩媚动人的年轻女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women seem to find him attractive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性似乎觉得他很有吸引力。

Sense.DEF: pleasant to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kitchen utensils should be attractive as well as functional.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房用具应该既美观又实用。

Sense.DEF: having qualities that make you want to accept something or be involved in it
Sense.TRAN: 有吸引力的﹐引人入胜的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a political movement that is attractive to young people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸引年轻人的政治运动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I must say, it’s a very attractive offer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得说﹐这个机会很有吸引力。

Sense.DEF: likely to have been caused by something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Death was attributable to gunshot wounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 死因可能是枪伤。

Sense.DEF: to believe or say that a situation or event is caused by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fall in the number of deaths from heart disease is generally attributed to improvements in diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病死亡人数的下降通常归因于日常饮食的改善。

Sense.DEF: if people in general attribute a particular statement, painting, piece of music etc to someone, they believe that person said it, painted it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a saying usually attributed to Confucius
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般认为是孔子说的一句格言

Sense.DEF: to believe or say that someone or something has a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: One should not attribute human motives to animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不应该认为动物也有人类的动机。

Sense.DEF: a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: What attributes should a good manager possess?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名优秀的经理应该具备哪些素质？

Sense.DEF: describing and coming before a noun. For example, in the phrase ‘big city’, ‘big’ is an attributive adjective, and in the phrase ‘school bus’, ‘school’ is a noun in an attributive position.
the process of gradually destroying your enemy or making them weak by attacking them continuously
Sense.EXAMPLE: a war of attrition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消耗战

Sense.DEF: when people leave a company or course of study and are not replaced
Sense.TRAN: 自然减员﹐〔人员的〕自然流失
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff reductions could be achieved through attrition and early retirements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少员工数量可以通过自然减员和提前退休来实现。

Sense.DEF: to be or become familiar with the way someone thinks or behaves so that you can react to them in a suitable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: British companies still aren’t really attuned to the needs of the Japanese market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国公司还没有完全熟悉日本市场的需求。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= attorney 律师

Sense.DEF: a vehicle which is designed to be ridden on rough ground where there are no roads. ATVs have one seat, no roof, and three or four large wheels.
Sense.TRAN: 全地形汽车〔单座﹐敞篷﹐有三四个大轮子〕

Sense.DEF: not typical or usual
a large dark purple vegetable
auburn hair is a reddish brown colour
a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings etc are sold to the person who offers the most money for them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was sold at auction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子被拍卖了。

GramExa.GLOSS: try to sell something at an auction
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This week 14 of his paintings were put up for auction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周他的14件画作被拍卖。

GramExa.GLOSS: a company that arranges auctions

Sense.DEF: to sell something at an auction
someone who is in charge of selling the things at an auction and who calls out how much money has already been offered for something
showing great courage or confidence in a way that is impressive or slightly shocking
Sense.EXAMPLE: the risks involved in such an audacious operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如此大胆的行动中存在的风险

Sense.DEF: the quality of having enough courage to take risks or say impolite things

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the audacity to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe he had the audacity to ask me for more money!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不敢相信﹐他竟胆敢还向我要钱！

Sense.DEF: a sound that is audible is loud enough for you to hear it
Sense.EXAMPLE:
His voice was barely audible
could only just be heard
above the roar of the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人声嘈杂﹐几乎听不见他的说话声。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who come to watch and listen to someone speaking or performing in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience began clapping and cheering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众开始鼓掌欢呼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an audience of 250 business people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 250名商界人士组成的观众

Sense.EXAMPLE: One member of the audience described the opera as ‘boring’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一名观众说这出歌剧“乏味”。

Sense.DEF: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work
Sense.TRAN: 〔某节目的〕观众﹐听众﹔〔画家﹑作家等作品的〕观赏者﹐读者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

GramExa.GLOSS: the type of people that a programme, advertisement etc is supposed to attract
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔节目﹑广告等的〕目标受众﹐目标对象

Sense.EXAMPLE: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is not intended for a purely academic audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书不是面向纯学术读者的。

Sense.DEF: a formal meeting with a very important person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was granted an audience with the Pope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获准觐见教皇。

Sense.DEF: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast
Sense.EXAMPLE: audio and video equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音频视频设备

Sense.DEF: the part of a recording that contains sounds and music but not pictures
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can save the audio for editing later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以把音频储存起来﹐以后编辑。

Sense.DEF: relating to hearing or sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: an audio-cassette
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盒式录音带

Sense.DEF:
a piece of electronic equipment that visitors to a
museum
or
art gallery
can use. They carry the audioguide with them and it gives them spoken information about objects or paintings in the museum or gallery.
Sense.TRAN: 〔博物馆﹑美术馆等处供参观者使用的〕语音导览机﹐自动讲解器

Sense.DEF:
a long thin band of
magnetic
material used to record sound
someone whose job is to type letters that have been recorded
involving the use of recorded pictures and sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: the use of audiovisual materials in the classroom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 视听教材在课堂上的使用

Sense.DEF: an official examination of a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: the annual audit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年度审计

GramExa.GLOSS: an audit carried out by a company’s own staff

Sense.DEF: a detailed examination of something in order to check if it is good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Start with an audit of existing services within the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从检查社区现有的服务开始。

Sense.DEF: to officially examine a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct

to attend a course at university without intending to take examinations in it or get a
credit
for it
a short performance by an actor, singer etc that someone watches to judge if they are good enough to act in a play, sing in a concert etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got an audition for the Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra on Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五我要去伯恩茅斯交响乐团试演。

Sense.DEF: to take part in an audition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s auditioning for Ophelia in ‘Hamlet’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在试演《哈姆雷特》中的奥菲莉娅一角。

Sense.DEF: to watch and judge someone’s performance in an audition
Sense.EXAMPLE: We auditioned more than 200 dancers before deciding on Carole Ann.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在决定录用卡罗尔·安之前我们面试了200多个舞蹈演员。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to officially examine a company’s financial records
the part of a theatre where people sit when watching a play, concert etc
a large building used for concerts or public meetings
relating to the ability to hear

accounting
records which show a series of steps leading to the present financial situation
Sense.TRAN: 审计线索﹐审计轨迹〔产生当前财务状况的每一步的账目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lack of a physical audit trail in electronic commerce increases the possibilities for tax avoidance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子商务缺少实有的审计线索﹐这增加了避税的可能性。

Sense.DEF: an electronic or paper record of how a computer is used
Sense.TRAN: 检查跟踪﹐审计跟踪〔计算机使用情况记录〕

Sense.DEF: to be familiar with a system or way of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not really au fait with the computer system yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有真正熟悉该计算机系统。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= August 八月

Sense.DEF: in ancient Greek stories, the very dirty buildings where King Augeas kept thousands of cattle, which Hercules was ordered to clean. The expression ‘to clean the Augean stables’ is sometimes used in literature to describe a very difficult and unpleasant job.
Sense.TRAN: 奥吉亚斯的牛舍〔古希腊传说中国王奥吉亚斯的牛舍﹐养了数千头牛﹐非常肮脏﹐赫丘利曾奉命将它清洗干净。 文学作品中有时用to clean the Augean stables形容非常艰难的工作〕

Sense.DEF: a tool used for making a hole in wood or in the ground
anything
to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any surplus was sold to augment their income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

Sense.DEF: to be a sign that something will be successful or unsuccessful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Today’s announcement of 300 redundancies does not augur well for the local economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天宣布裁员300人对当地经济来说不是个好兆头。

Sense.DEF: a sign of what will happen in the future
impressive and respected
Sense.EXAMPLE: an august institution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庄严的机构

Sense.DEF: the eighth month of the year, between July and September

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was there last August.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年8月我在那里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My birthday’s in August.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的生日在8月份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new store opened on August 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新商店是8月6日开业的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He arrived at Berwick on 6th August 1823.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1823年8月6日他来到伯威克。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll expect you to call August 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们8月6日等你打电话来。

Sense.DEF: a black and white seabird with short wings

a Scottish song that people sing when they celebrate the beginning of the new year at 12 o'clock
midnight
on December 31st
Sense.TRAN: 《友谊地久天长》〔苏格兰民歌﹐12月31日子夜12点钟庆祝新年时唱 〕

Sense.DEF:
not wearing any clothes, or not wearing
make-up
, hair products etc that change the way you would naturally look
Sense.TRAN: 裸体地﹔不施脂粉地﹐没化妆地﹔自然地

Sense.DEF: the sister of your father or mother, or the wife of your father’s or mother’s brother
Sense.TRAN: 姑母﹔姨母﹔婶母﹔伯母﹔舅母
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aunt Mary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽姑妈

Sense.DEF: an aunt
Sense.TRAN: 姑妈﹔姨妈﹔婶婶﹔伯母﹔舅妈
Sense.EXAMPLE: Auntie Lou
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢姨妈

Sense.DEF: used by children to address a woman who is a friend of their parents
Sense.TRAN: 阿姨〔小孩子称呼父母的女性朋友〕

Sense.DEF: a young person, usually a woman, who stays with a family in a foreign country to learn the language, and looks after their children for a small wage
Sense.TRAN: 换工互惠生﹐寄居生〔通常为女性﹐住在外国家庭里学习外语并帮助照看孩子〕

Sense.DEF: a quality or feeling that seems to surround or come from a person or a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building retains an aura of mystery .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢建筑保留着一种神秘气氛。

Sense.DEF: relating to the sense of hearing, or someone’s ability to understand sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aural stimulus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听觉刺激

Sense.DEF: a bright circle of light
goodbye
the northern lights
with the help and support of a particular organization or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: negotiations held under the auspices of the United Nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国主持下举行的谈判

Sense.DEF: showing that something is likely to be successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Saccani’s excellent recording is an auspicious start to what promises to be a distinguished musical career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨卡尼出色的录音是一个吉利的开端﹐预示着他将有一个辉煌的音乐事业。

Entry.Sense: informal someone from Australia 【非正式】 澳大利亚人awnin

Sense.DEF: plain and simple and without any decoration
Sense.EXAMPLE: the church’s austere simplicity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座教堂的朴实无华

Sense.DEF: someone who is austere is very strict and serious – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father is a very austere man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父亲很严肃。

Sense.DEF: an austere way of life is very simple and has few things to make it comfortable or enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cuthbert led an austere life of prayer and solitude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡斯伯特过着祈祷和独居的苦行生活。

Sense.DEF: bad economic conditions in which people do not have much money to spend
Sense.EXAMPLE: a time of great austerity after the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后极其艰苦的岁月
Sense.EXAMPLE: the austerities of present Eastern Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现时东欧的艰难困苦

Sense.DEF: when a government has a deliberate policy of trying to reduce the amount of money it spends

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tough new austerity programme
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 严厉的新经济紧缩计划

Sense.EXAMPLE:
IMF-backed austerity measures
reductions in government spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际货币基金组织支持的经济紧缩措施

Sense.DEF: the quality of being austere
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life of austerity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苦行的一生

Sense.DEF:
relating to Australasia
Australia and the islands that are near to it
or its people
Sense.TRAN: 澳大拉西亚〔包括澳大利亚及附近诸岛〕的

Sense.DEF: relating to Australia or its people
Sense.TRAN: 澳大利亚的﹔澳大利亚人的

Sense.DEF: someone from Australia

a game played between two teams of 18 players on an oval field with an oval ball which is passed by kicking or striking with the hand, the aim being to get points by putting the ball between a set of four posts at either end of the field. The informal name for the game is Aussie Rules.
Sense.TRAN: 澳大利亚式橄榄球（运动）﹐澳式足球

Sense.DEF: relating to Austria or its people
someone from Austria
Austrian and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Austro-Hungarian
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥匈帝国的

Sense.DEF: a policy in which a country or area does not want or need goods, food etc from any other country or area, or a country which has this policy
Sense.TRAN: 自给自足﹔闭关政策﹔自给自足的国家﹔实行闭关政策的国家

Sense.DEF:
a film
director
who has a strong influence on the style of the films that he or she makes
Sense.TRAN: 风格导演〔影片风格独特的电影导演〕

Sense.DEF: done or made in the traditional or original way
Sense.EXAMPLE: authentic French food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正宗的法国食品

Sense.DEF: a painting, document, book etc that is authentic has been proved to be by a particular person
Sense.EXAMPLE: an authentic work by Picasso
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕加索的真迹

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something is real or the real thing rather than authentic
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说real 或 the real thing﹐而不说authentic
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This is real Indian cooking.
How do you know if the picture is the real thing ?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么知道这幅画是不是真品？

Sense.DEF: based on facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: an authentic account
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真实可信的说法

Sense.DEF: used to describe a copy that is the same as, or as good as, the original
Sense.EXAMPLE: Actors dressed in authentic costumes re-enact the battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员们穿着仿真的戏装重现了那次战役。

Sense.DEF: to prove that something is true or real
Sense.TRAN: 证明〔某物〕是真的﹐鉴定〔某物〕之真实性
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting has been authenticated by experts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画专家鉴定为真迹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: passwords which can authenticate electronic documents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够验证电子文档的密码

Sense.DEF: the quality of being real or true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Archaeological evidence may help to establish the authenticity of the statue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考古证据可能有助于确定该塑像的真伪。

Sense.DEF: someone who has written a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺东是位比利时作家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was the author of two books on China.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写过两本有关中国的书。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然﹐这位作者是女性。

Sense.DEF: the person who starts a plan or idea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the author of the state reforms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州政府改革的发起者

Sense.DEF: to be the writer of a book, report etc
a woman who writes books

the activity of writing and designing
website s
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here are a few tips on authoring and site design.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一些网站制作与设计的小窍门。

Sense.DEF: strictly forcing people to obey a set of rules or laws, especially ones that are wrong or unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: an authoritarian government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独裁政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: Critics claim his management has become too authoritarian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评者称他的管理变得过于专制。

Sense.DEF: an authoritative book, account etc is respected because the person who wrote it knows a lot about the subject
Sense.TRAN: 权威性的﹐可信的﹐可靠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most authoritative work on English surnames
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关英语姓氏的最权威著作

Sense.DEF: behaving or speaking in a confident determined way that makes people respect and obey you
Sense.TRAN: 权威的﹐有威信的﹐威严的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a commanding presence and an authoritative voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仪态庄重﹐声音威严。

Sense.DEF: the power you have because of your official position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only the president has the authority to declare war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有总统才有权宣战。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several countries claim authority over the islands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几个国家声称拥有这些岛屿的主权。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
I need to speak to someone in authority
who has a position of power
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得找管事的人谈谈。

Sense.DEF: the people or organizations that are in charge of a particular country or area
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家或地区的〕当权者﹐当局﹐官方
Sense.EXAMPLE: an agreement between the US and Colombian authorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和哥伦比亚当局的一份协议

Sense.DEF: an official organization or a government department that has the power to make decisions, and has particular responsibilities
Sense.EXAMPLE: the local authority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方政府部门
Sense.EXAMPLE: East Sussex Education Authority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东萨塞克斯教育局
Sense.EXAMPLE: the San Diego Water Authority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣地亚哥供水局
Sense.EXAMPLE: Welsh health authorities face a £13m deficit this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年威尔士卫生部门面临1,300万英镑的赤字。

Sense.DEF: someone who knows a lot about a subject and whose knowledge and opinions are greatly respected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Li is a leading authority on Chinese food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 李先生是中式烹饪杰出的大师。

Sense.DEF: official permission to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The attack took place under the authority of the UN Security Council.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次进攻是在联合国安全理事会授权下进行的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one may enter without my authority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经我的许可谁都不能进入。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a position of power, especially because of their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: teenage rebellion against authority figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年对尊长的叛逆

Sense.DEF: a quality in the way you speak or behave which makes people obey you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack’s air of quiet authority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克那静默威严的气势

Sense.LEXUNIT: I have it on good authority
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are sure that something is true because you trust the person who told you about it
to be sure of what you are saying, because of your knowledge or experience

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Teachers should have the authority to discipline their students.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师应该有管教学生的权威。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use your authority
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In practice it’s very difficult for the president to exercise his authority.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际上总统很难行使自己的权力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use your authority in a bad way
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The mayor was accused of abusing his authority and taking bribes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长被指滥用权力﹑收受贿赂。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show people that you have authority
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new manager was anxious to establish her authority.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新经理急于确立她本人的威信。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone’s authority weaker
do more than you have the power or right to do
try to take the power away from someone

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The manager has full authority to make decisions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理有充分的决策权。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: complete authority over everyone – used especially about the leader of a country
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔尤指国家领导者的〕绝对权力
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In those days, the emperor had absolute authority.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候皇帝拥有绝对权力。

Collocate.COLLOC: be in a position of authority
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been in a position of authority before.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从来没有担任过一官半职。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look like you have authority, in a way that makes people obey you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The commander had an unmistakeable air of authority.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 指挥官有一种不容置疑的威严。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone, such as a parent or teacher, who has the power to tell young people what they can do

Sense.DEF: official permission to do something, or the document giving this permission
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need special authorization to park here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在此停车要有特别的许可。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children may not leave the building without the authorization of the principal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有校长的许可﹐孩子们不能离开这幢楼。

Sense.DEF: to give official permission for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an authorized biography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 授权传记

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Napoleon III authorized Haussmann to rebuild Paris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿破仑三世授权奥斯曼重建巴黎。

Sense.DEF: the fact that you have written a particular book, document etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no evidence to dispute his claim to authorship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自称原作者﹐对此没有证据可以质疑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an investigation into the authorship of the Bible
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对《圣经》作者的研究

Sense.DEF: the profession of writing books

a mental
disorder
problem
that makes people unable to communicate properly, or to form relationships
a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: imported autos
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进口汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: the auto industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车工业
Sense.EXAMPLE: auto insurance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车保险

Sense.DEF: of or by yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: an autobiography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自传

Sense.DEF: working by itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: a camera with an auto-focus lens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带自动对焦镜头的相机

Sense.DEF: a book in which someone writes about their own life, or books of this type

RunOn.EXAMPLE:
an autobiographical novel
one based on the author’s own experiences

Sense.DEF: a system of government in which one person or group has unlimited power
a country or organization that is completely controlled by one powerful person or group
someone who makes decisions and gives orders to people without asking them for their opinion
a ruler who has complete power over a country
a machine that shows the words that someone must say while they are speaking in public, especially on television
Sense.TRAN: 自动提示器﹐电子提词器〔尤用于电视〕

Sense.DEF:
a machine that
dial s
people's telephone numbers and plays a recorded advertisement
Sense.TRAN: 〔播放录音广告的〕自动拨号器

Sense.DEF: a famous person’s signature that they give to someone who admires them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have your autograph?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能请你签个名吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a player who would always sign autographs and chat with fans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总是会亲笔签名并与球迷交谈的一名球员

Sense.DEF: if a famous person autographs a book, photograph etc, they sign it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shirt autographed by the whole team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件有全体队员签名的衬衫

Sense.DEF:
the activity of driving
off-road
on rough ground rather than on the road
without a
driving licence
a condition in which substances that normally prevent illness in the body attack and harm parts of it instead
by the action of a machine, without a person making it work – used especially when you want to describe what a piece of software can do without giving a technical explanation
Sense.TRAN: 自动地〔尤用于不想用技术性解释来说明某一软件的功能时〕

Sense.DEF: a company that makes cars – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 汽车制造商〔尤用于报纸〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: US automakers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国汽车制造商

Sense.DEF: to start using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cash machines automate two basic functions of a bank – deposits and withdrawals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柜员机使银行的两个基本功能——存款和取款自动化了。

Sense.DEF: using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly automated factory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高度自动化的工厂
Sense.EXAMPLE: The production process is now fully automated .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产流程现在全部自动化了。

Sense.DEF: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
Sense.EXAMPLE: an automatic weapon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自动武器
Sense.EXAMPLE: an automatic gearbox
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自动变速箱
Sense.EXAMPLE: My camera is fully automatic .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的照相机是全自动的。

Sense.DEF: something that is automatic always happens as a result of something you have done, especially because of a rule or law
Sense.TRAN: 〔根据规定或法律〕必然发生的﹐自动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Littering results in an automatic fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱扔垃圾必然要罚款。

Sense.DEF: done without thinking, especially because you have done the same thing many times before
Sense.TRAN: 不自觉的﹐无意识的﹐不假思索的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Practise the breathing techniques until they become automatic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 练习这些呼吸技巧直到成为无意识的动作。

Sense.DEF: a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

a car with a system of
gear s
that operate themselves without the driver needing to change them
Sense.TRAN: 自动变速汽车﹐自动换挡汽车

Sense.DEF: as the result of a situation or action, and without you having to do anything more
Sense.EXAMPLE: Join now and you will automatically receive 50% off your first purchase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在加入﹐立即享受首次购物五折优惠。

Sense.DEF: without thinking about what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course I automatically said yes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐我脱口而出说是的。

Sense.DEF: by the action of a machine, without a person making it work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doors opened automatically as we approached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走近时﹐门自动开了。

Sense.DEF: a machine that flies a plane by itself without the need for a pilot
doing something without thinking about it, especially because you have done it many times before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moving on automatic pilot, she tidied the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她习惯性地整理起房间来。

Sense.DEF:
a system that operates the
gear s
of a car without the driver needing to change them
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车的〕自动变速系统﹐自动换挡系统

Sense.DEF: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job
a machine, especially one in the shape of a human, that moves without anyone controlling it
Sense.TRAN: 自动操作装置﹐〔尤指〕机器人

Sense.DEF: someone who seems unable to feel emotions or to think about what they are doing
Sense.TRAN: 没有感情的人﹔机械行事的人﹔行尸走肉

Sense.DEF: a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: the automobile industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车工业

Sense.DEF: relating to cars
Sense.EXAMPLE: automotive technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车技术

Sense.DEF: an autonomous place or organization is free to govern or control itself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Galicia is an autonomous region of Spain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利西亚是西班牙的一个自治区。

Sense.DEF: having the ability to work and make decisions by yourself without any help from anyone else
freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

Sense.DEF: the ability or opportunity to make your own decisions without being controlled by anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers are given considerable individual autonomy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师被赋予相当大的个人自主权。

Sense.DEF: an examination of a dead body to discover the cause of death
Sense.EXAMPLE: an autopsy report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 验尸报告

Sense.DEF: the season between summer and winter, when leaves change colour and the weather becomes cooler
Sense.EXAMPLE: autumn mists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天的雾霭

Sense.DEF: relating to or typical of autumn
Sense.EXAMPLE: autumnal colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天的色彩

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= auxiliary or auxiliary verb 助动词

Sense.DEF: auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers
Sense.EXAMPLE: an auxiliary nurse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 助理护士
Sense.EXAMPLE: auxiliary staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辅助员工

Sense.DEF: an auxiliary motor, piece of equipment etc is kept ready to be used if the main one stops working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: an auxiliary power supply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 备用的供电设备
Sense.EXAMPLE: auxiliary equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 备用设备

Sense.DEF: a worker who provides additional help for another group of workers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nursing auxiliary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护理辅助人员

Sense.DEF: an auxiliary verb
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modal auxiliary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情态助动词

Sense.DEF:
a verb that is used with another verb to show its tense,
person
,
mood
etc. In English the auxiliary verbs are ‘be’, ‘do’, and ‘have’ (as in ‘I am running’, ‘I didn’t go’, ‘they have gone’), and all the
modal s

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= audiovisual 视听的

Sense.DEF: if something you do is to no avail or of no avail, you do not succeed in getting what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: We searched the whole area but all to no avail. Robbie had disappeared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找遍了整个地区但毫无结果﹐罗比失踪了。

Sense.DEF: to accept an offer or use an opportunity to do something
Sense.TRAN: 利用某事物〔指提议﹑机会等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many schools avail themselves of this opportunity each year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有多少学校利用这种机会？

Sense.DEF: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tickets are available from the box office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 售票处有票出售。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Not enough data is available to scientists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家没有足够的资料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Funds are available to assist teachers who want to attend the conference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想参加大会的教师可获得资助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No figures are available for the number of goods sold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已售多少货物﹐数据无从可知。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of jobs available in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区有许多就业机会。

GramExa.GLOSS: very easy to obtain
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parking is readily available near the station entrance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站入口附近很容易找到停车位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Further building can continue when money is made available .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that a book, record etc is out rather than available
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们说书﹑唱片等上市一般用out﹐而不用available
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His new album is out now.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新专辑已经上市了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is available is not busy and has enough time to talk to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Collins was not available for comment on Thursday night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柯林斯星期四晚上没空发表评论。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is available does not have a wife,
boyfriend
etc, and therefore may want to start a new romantic relationship with someone else
Sense.TRAN: 未婚未有对象〔因而有意谈恋爱〕的﹐单身待娶[待嫁]的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Rooms are offered subject to availability.

Sense.DEF: a large mass of snow, ice, and rocks that falls down the side of a mountain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two skiers were killed in the avalanche.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名滑雪者在雪崩中丧生。

Sense.DEF: a very large number of things such as letters, messages etc that arrive suddenly at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 雪片般飞来的某物﹐突然大量到来的某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school received an avalanche of applications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校收到雪片般寄来的申请。

Sense.DEF: avant-garde music, literature etc is extremely modern and often seems strange or slightly shocking
Sense.EXAMPLE: an avant-garde play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先锋派戏剧

Sense.DEF: the group of artists, writers etc who produce avant-garde books, paintings etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a member of the avant-garde
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先锋派成员

Sense.DEF: a desire to have a lot of money that is considered to be too strong
a person or animal who is really a god in human or animal form
a person who represents an idea or quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种思想或品质的〕化身﹐体现

Sense.DEF:
a picture of a person or animal that represents you on a computer screen, for example in some
chat room s
or when you are playing games over the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些网上聊天室或网上游戏中代表个人的〕头像﹐虚拟替身﹐图标
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Avenue , used in addresses 街﹐大街〔用于地址中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: 36, Rokesly Ave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗克士利大街36号

Sense.DEF: to do something to hurt or punish someone because they have harmed or offended you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted to avenge his brother’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要为弟弟的死复仇。

Sense.DEF: used in the names of streets in a town or city
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fifth Avenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第五大街
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shaftesbury Avenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙夫茨伯里街

Sense.DEF: a possible way of achieving something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president wants to explore every avenue towards peace in the region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统想探索一切途径实现该地区的和平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are many avenues open to researchers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员有许多途径可供选择。

Sense.DEF: a road or broad path between two rows of trees, especially one leading to a big house
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tree-lined avenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林荫道

Sense.DEF: to say something firmly and strongly because you are sure that it is true
the average amount is the amount you get when you add together several quantities and divide this by the total number of quantities
Sense.EXAMPLE: The age of the candidates ranged from 29 to 49 with an average age of 37.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 候选人的年龄29岁至49岁不等﹐平均37岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average cost of making a movie has risen by 15%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制作一部影片的平均成本上升了15%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last winter was colder than average.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年冬天比平常冷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cars were being sold at an average price of $11,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些汽车的平均售价是1.1万美元。

Sense.DEF: an average amount or quantity is not unusually big or small
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have an average-size front garden and a large rear garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有一个中等大小的前院和一个大后院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was in his late twenties and of average height.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年近三十﹐中等个头。

Sense.DEF: having qualities that are typical of most people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

Sense.DEF: neither very good nor very bad
the amount calculated by adding together several quantities, and then dividing this amount by the total number of quantities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The average of 3, 8, and 10 is 7.
Each person raised an average of £60 to plant an acre of trees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均每个人筹集60英镑来种一英亩的树。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The December figures brought the annual average for 2001 up to 10.6 per cent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 12月的数据将2001年的年平均水平提升到10.6%。

Sense.DEF: based on a calculation about how many times something usually happens, how much money someone usually gets, how often people usually do something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: On average, men still earn more than women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均来看﹐男性仍比女性挣得多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nearly 80% of Swiss citizens on average turn out to vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均有近80%的瑞士公民参加投票。

Sense.DEF: the usual level or amount for most people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Streets in the town centre are wider than the average.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心的街道比一般的要宽阔。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school’s eighth-graders are above average in science.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校八年级学生的自然科学水平高于平均水平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The murder rate in the city has risen to four times the national average .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市的凶杀案发案率已升至全国平均水平的四倍。

Sense.DEF: to usually do something or usually happen a particular number of times, or to usually be a particular size or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water in the lake is not particularly deep, averaging about 12 metres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖水不是很深﹐平均约为12米。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airport averages about a thousand flights a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座机场每月平均约有1,000架次航班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation averaged just under 2.8% per year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀每年平均略低于2.8%。

Sense.DEF: to calculate the average of figures
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rate of growth was averaged over a period of three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个增长率是3年的平均值。

Sense.DEF: if something averages out at a particular figure, it has that figure as an average over a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Training costs for last year averaged out at £5,100 per trainee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年的培训费是人均5,100英镑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government’s share of the cost was intended to average out at 25%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府分担的成本计划为平均25%。

Sense.DEF: to calculate the average of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I averaged out the total increase at about 10%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我算出总增长平均为10%左右。

Sense.DEF: to quite enjoy something, especially something that is slightly wrong or bad for you
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢某事物〔尤指略微不好或对你不利的事情〕﹐并不反对某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was not averse to fighting with any boy who challenged me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不反对与向我挑战的男孩子打一架。

Sense.DEF: unwilling to do something or not liking something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jim is averse to using chemicals in the garden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆讨厌在花园里使用化学品。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Some banks are risk averse
do not like taking a risk
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些银行不喜欢冒风险。

Sense.DEF: a strong dislike of something or someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite his aversion to publicity, Arnold was persuaded to talk to the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管不喜欢宣传﹐阿诺德还是被说服接受媒体采访。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have an aversion to housework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌做家务。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something unpleasant from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tragedy could have been averted if the crew had followed safety procedures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果乘务人员按照安全规则操作﹐这场悲剧是可以避免的。

Sense.DEF: to look away from something so that you do not see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry averted his eyes as she undressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脱衣服的时候﹐亨利把目光转向别处。

Sense.DEF: an infectious disease that spreads very quickly among birds and can sometimes kill them. People can also catch the disease.

a large
cage
where birds are kept
the science or practice of flying in aircraft
the industry that makes aircraft
a pilot
doing something as much as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: an avid collector of old jazz records
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爵士乐旧唱片的热心收藏者
Sense.EXAMPLE: an avid reader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热心的读者

Sense.DEF: the electronic equipment used in aircraft and the science of developing it
Sense.TRAN: 航空电子设备﹔航空电子学

Sense.DEF: a fruit with a thick green or dark purple skin that is green inside and has a large seed in the middle
to prevent something bad from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育﹐以避免交通事故。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The refugees left to avoid getting bombed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民为躲避轰炸纷纷离去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦险出事故。

Sense.DEF: to stay away from someone or something, or not use something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone seemed to be avoiding Nick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎所有人都在躲着尼克。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She carefully avoided his eyes
did not look directly at his face
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心地避开他的目光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pregnant women should avoid certain foods such as raw eggs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕妇应当戒吃生鸡蛋之类的食物。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Why did you speak to him? You usually avoid him like the plague
try hard to avoid him
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么同他说话了？你平时像躲瘟神一样躲着他的。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately not do something, especially something wrong, dangerous, or harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are ways of legally avoiding taxes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多种方法可以合法避税。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should avoid over-spending in the first half of the year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半年你应避免超支。

Section.SECHEADING: to avoid a person or place

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately not go near a person or place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why have you been avoiding me?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么一直躲着我？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We avoided Park Street because of the traffic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为交通状况我们避开了公园街。

Exponent.DEF: to avoid a person or place, especially a dangerous one
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She walked along the path, keeping well away from the edge of the cliff.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在小道上走着﹐离崖边远远的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That man is trouble – I’d stay away from him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家伙很麻烦——我要离他远点。

Exponent.DEF: to avoid a person or place, because there could be problems if you do not
Exponent.TRAN: 避开某人/某事〔以免麻烦〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I usually steer clear of the kitchen when Alan’s cooking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦做饭时我一般都避免进厨房。

Exponent.DEF: to avoid a place by travelling around it instead of through the centre
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had to make a long detour because of the floods.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为发大水﹐我们不得不绕了很长一段路。

Exponent.DEF: to find a way of not doing something that you should do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some people will do anything to avoid work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人会千方百计逃避工作。

Exponent.DEF: to avoid doing something you should do or something you promised to do. Get out of is more common than avoid in everyday spoken English
Exponent.TRAN: 逃避某事﹐逃过某事〔在日常英语中get out of比avoid更为常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We promised we’d go – we can’t get out of it now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们答应过要去的——不能现在又食言了。

Exponent.DEF: to avoid doing something you should do by making up excuses. Used to show disapproval
Exponent.TRAN: 〔找借口〕逃脱（应做的）某事〔含贬义〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He always seems to wriggle out of helping with the kids.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像总是推三阻四﹐不肯帮着照看孩子。

Exponent.DEF: to avoid doing something that legally or morally you should do – used especially about taxes or responsibilities
Exponent.TRAN: 逃避﹐规避〔法律或道德责任〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is an offence to evade taxes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃税是违法的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The US cannot evade its responsibility for the war.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国不能逃避对这场战争应负的责任。

Sense.DEF: something bad that is avoidable can be avoided or prevented
Sense.EXAMPLE: an almost entirely avoidable cause of death
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎可以完全避免的死因
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nearly 1,000 children die each year from accidents in the home which are avoidable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有近1,000名儿童死于可避免的家庭事故。

Sense.DEF: the act of avoiding someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the avoidance of issues such as domestic violence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回避家庭暴力等问题

Sense.EXAMPLE:
a tax avoidance scheme
legal way of not paying tax
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 避税方案

Sense.DEF:
the system of weighing things that uses the standard measures of the
ounce
,
pound
, and
ton
Sense.TRAN: 常衡制﹐英制〔以盎司﹑磅﹑吨为称量标准的衡制〕

Sense.DEF: to make a public statement about something you believe in
Sense.EXAMPLE: He avowed his commitment to Marxist ideals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他宣称对马克思主义理想矢志不渝。

Sense.DEF: admitted or said publicly
Sense.EXAMPLE: an avowed atheist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公开的无神论者

Sense.DEF: behaving in a kind and nice way to someone who is younger, rather like an uncle
Sense.EXAMPLE: an avuncular pat on the shoulder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慈爱地拍拍肩膀

Sense.DEF: to wait for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several men are awaiting trial for robbery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个人因抢劫正在候审。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, event etc awaits you, it is going to happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 将发生在﹐将降临到〔某人身上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A terrible surprise awaited them at Mr Tumnus’ house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在图姆纳斯先生家﹐一件意想不到的可怕事情在等待着他们。

Sense.DEF: not sleeping
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope he’s awake now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他现在醒着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给她端去咖啡的时候﹐她还是半睡半醒的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛忧心忡忡﹐半宿都没睡着。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The noise brought him wide awake
completely awake
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那声音使他睡意全无。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
To keep themselves awake
stop themselves from going to sleep
they sat on the floor and told each other stories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了不让自己睡着﹐他们坐在地板上相互讲故事。

Sense.DEF: to understand a situation and its possible effects
Sense.TRAN: 理解某事物﹐意识到某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Too few people are awake to the dangers of noise pollution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意识到噪声污染危害性的人太少了。

Sense.DEF: to wake up, or to make someone wake up
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was midday when she awoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醒来时已是中午。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We awoke to a day of brilliant sunshine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们醒来时阳光明媚。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use wake up rather than awake
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说wake up﹐而不说awake
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I woke up at 4 o'clock this morning.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我四点钟醒的。

Sense.DEF: if something awakes an emotion, or if an emotion awakes, you suddenly begin to feel that emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gesture awoke an unexpected flood of tenderness towards her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没料到这个姿势激起了对她的无限柔情。

Sense.DEF: to begin to realize the possible effects of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Artists finally awoke to the aesthetic possibilities of photography.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术家终于意识到了摄影的美学潜质。

Sense.DEF: to wake up or to make someone wake up
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was awakened by a noise at two in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨两点﹐她被一个声音吵醒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill slept a little until he was awakened to take his turn on guard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔睡了一会儿﹐直到被叫醒去换岗。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use wake up rather than awaken
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说wake up﹐而不说awaken
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She was woken up by the phone ringing.

Sense.DEF: if something awakens an emotion, interest, memory etc it makes you suddenly begin to feel that emotion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Early involvement in music can awaken an interest that will last a lifetime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早接触音乐可以激起终生的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to make someone understand a situation and its possible effects
Sense.TRAN: 使领悟﹐使醒悟﹔使意识到
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must awaken people to the dangers for the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须让人们意识到对环境造成的危害。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you suddenly realize that you understand something or feel something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was during the period of 1943–1945 that his political awakening took place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1943年至1945年期间他的政治意识开始觉醒。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Confident that he would win, he had a rude awakening
very unpleasant surprise
on election day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直自信会赢﹐到选举那天他才猛然意识到事情不妙。

Sense.DEF: the act of waking from sleep
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie has won a number of awards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该片获得了多个奖项。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an award-winning restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖餐厅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the award for best student
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最佳学生奖

Sense.DEF: something, especially money, that is officially given to someone as a payment or after a legal decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: the teachers’ pay award
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师的薪金
Sense.EXAMPLE: an award for unfair dismissal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无理解雇的赔偿金

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Caprio won the award for best actor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡普里奥获最佳男演员奖。
Collocate.EXAMPLE: an award-winning novel
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部获奖小说

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is the youngest person ever to receive the award.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是此奖项史上最年轻的获得者。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The award is given each year to the best new artist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该奖每年授予最优秀的艺术新人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give someone an award at a formal ceremony
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She cried when she was presented with her award.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她领奖时哭了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to be chosen as one of the people, films etc that could receive an award
to get an award – used especially in news reports
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 赢取/捧走奖项〔尤用于新闻报道〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that person, film etc is chosen to receive it
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 获得本奖项的是某人/某物

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Victoria Cross is Britain’s highest military award.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚十字勋章是英国最高军事奖。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The restaurant has won several top awards.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐馆多次获得最高奖。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He received a special award for his work as a movie director.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因作为电影导演所做的贡献﹐他获得一个特别奖。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very well-respected

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 电影奖/音乐奖/诗歌奖等

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My parents wanted to be at the awards ceremony.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母想参加颁奖仪式。

Sense.DEF: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
Sense.TRAN: 授予﹐给予〔奖品或奖金〕﹔奖励
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge awarded me first prize.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 评委授予我一等奖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A Nobel Prize was awarded to Waksman in 1952.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1952年瓦克斯曼获得一项诺贝尔奖。

Sense.DEF: to officially decide that someone should receive a payment or a formal agreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government awarded a German company the contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府将合同给了一家德国公司。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: £45,000 was awarded to a typist with an injured hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手受伤的打字员获判4.5万英镑。

Sense.DEF: if you are aware that a situation exists, you realize or know that it exists
Sense.TRAN: 意识到的﹐明白的﹐知道的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children are aware of the danger of taking drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们知道吸毒的危害。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Braley has been made aware of the need for absolute secrecy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布雷利先生被告知需要绝对保密。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Were you aware that Joe had this problem with his knee?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道乔的膝盖有这种毛病吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were well aware that the company was losing money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很清楚公司在赔钱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: As you are aware, a fee will be charged annually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如你所知道的那样﹐每年都要收取一笔费用。

Sense.DEF: if you are aware of something, you notice it, especially because you can see, hear, feel, or smell it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was aware of a tall dark figure watching her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现有个高高的黑影在注视着她。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was aware of the wind in his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到风在他脸上吹拂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill became aware that he was still holding his glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔意识到他手里还握着杯子。

Sense.DEF: understanding a lot about what is happening around you and paying attention to it, especially because you realize possible dangers and problems

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the socially aware novels of Dickens
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄更斯具有社会意识的小说
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should promote environmentally aware and responsible science.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该推动有环保意识和对环境负责的科学。

Sense.LEXUNIT: so/as far as I am aware
Sense.DEF: used when you are saying something that you think is true, although you might be wrong because you do not know all the facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: As far as I am aware, they are a happily married couple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就我所知﹐他们是一对幸福的夫妻。

Sense.DEF: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Health officials have tried to raise awareness
improve people’s knowledge
about AIDS.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

Sense.DEF: the ability to notice something using your senses

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an artist’s awareness of light and color
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家对光和色彩的感悟能力

Sense.DEF: covered with water or another liquid
containing too many things or people of a particular kind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the pavements were awash with rubbish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的人行道上全是垃圾。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go away!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走开！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinah was crying as she drove slowly away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛娜一边哭一边慢慢地开车走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stay away from the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要靠近火。

Sense.DEF: towards a different direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned away and stared out of the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过头看着窗外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charley blushed and looked away, embarrassed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利脸红了﹐难为情地望向别处。

Sense.DEF: if someone is away from school, work, or home, they are not there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon is away with flu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西门得了流感﹐没来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate is away on holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特去度假了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You must bring a note from your parents if you’ve been away from school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 若缺课必须补交家长的便条。

Sense.DEF: used to say how far it is to a place or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Geneva is about 20 miles away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日内瓦离这儿大约20英里远。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s another hotel not far away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不远的地方还有一家酒店。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was sitting ten feet away from the microphone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在离话筒十英尺远的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
The beach is only five minutes away
it only takes five minutes to get there
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩离这里只有5分钟的路。

Sense.DEF: if an event is two days, three weeks etc away, it will happen after that period of time has passed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christmas is only a month away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离圣诞节只有一个月了。

Sense.DEF: used to say how close someone is to achieving something or experiencing something
Sense.TRAN: 距离〔实现某事或经历某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At one stage, they were just two points away from victory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一度离获胜只差两分。

Sense.DEF: into or in a safe or enclosed place
Sense.TRAN: 放到﹐放进〔安全或封闭的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put your money away, I’m paying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的钱收起来﹐我来付。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of archaeological treasures are being kept hidden away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数千件考古珍宝被藏了起来。

Sense.DEF: used to show that something disappears or is removed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The music died away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐声消失了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruben gave all his money away to charity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁宾把所有的钱都捐给了慈善机构。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Support for the Democrats has dropped away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党的支持率有所下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut away all the dead wood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把所有的枯木都砍掉。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that an action continues
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue was singing away to herself in the bath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休一边洗澡一边唱着歌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve been hammering away all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用锤子敲敲打打了一整天。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone spends the whole of a period of time doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can dance the night away in one of Benidorm’s many discos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在贝尼多姆众多迪斯科舞厅中找一家跳上一整夜。

Sense.DEF: if a team is playing away, it is playing a game at its opponent’s field or sports hall
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liverpool are playing away at Everton on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利物浦队星期六将做客埃弗顿。

Sense.DEF: an away game or match is played at your opponent’s field or sports hall
a feeling of great respect and liking for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt great awe for the landscape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色令他赞叹不已。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate gazed at the statue with awe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特满怀崇敬地凝视着塑像。

Sense.DEF: to admire someone and have great respect for them and sometimes a slight fear of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: All of the neighbours were a little in awe of my mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居对我母亲都有点敬畏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The villagers hold them in awe and think of them as gods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村民敬畏他们﹐认为他们是神。

Sense.DEF: if you are awed by someone or something, you feel great respect and liking for them, and are often slightly afraid of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls were awed by the splendour of the cathedral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们对大教堂的宏伟气势大为惊叹。

Sense.DEF: extremely impressive in a way that makes you feel great respect
Sense.TRAN: 令人起敬的﹐令人钦佩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a truly awe-inspiring achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 的确令人敬佩的成就

Sense.DEF: extremely impressive, serious, or difficult so that you feel great respect, worry, or fear
Sense.TRAN: 令人赞叹的﹔令人畏惧的﹐可怕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an awesome responsibility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项令人惊惧的责任
Sense.EXAMPLE: the awesome sweep of the scenery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连绵的壮丽景色

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their last concert was really awesome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们上一场音乐会真棒。

Sense.TRAN: 肃然起敬的﹐充满敬畏的﹔感到惊奇的

Sense.DEF: feeling great respect for the importance, difficulty, or seriousness of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 肃然起敬的﹐充满敬畏的﹐惊叹的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gazed awestruck at the jewels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊叹地注视着那些珠宝。

Sense.DEF: very bad or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather was awful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气很糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is a pretty awful driver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开车水平相当糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That fridge smells awful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那台冰箱气味难闻极了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last six months have been awful for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近六个月对她来说相当难过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve stopped believing most of what he says. Isn’t that awful?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说的大部分话我都不再相信了。很糟吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure Suzy is dead but the awful thing is not knowing how it happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定苏齐是死了﹐但不幸的是不知道是怎么一回事。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how much or how good, bad etc something is
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于强调〕非常的﹔极好的﹔很糟的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
An awful lot of people
a large number of people
died in the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多很多的人在这场战争中死去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made me feel an awful fool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让我感觉像个大傻瓜。

Sense.DEF: to look or feel ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s lost a lot of weight and she looks awful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她瘦了许多﹐满脸病容。

Sense.DEF: making you feel great respect or fear
very
Sense.EXAMPLE: That kid’s awful cute, with her red curls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子一头红鬈发﹐十分可爱。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s awfully cold in here. Is the heater on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿非常冷﹐取暖器开了吗？

Sense.DEF: for a short time
making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say
Sense.TRAN: 令人尴尬的﹐使人难堪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊﹐一时很尴尬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an awkward silence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人尴尬的沉默
Sense.EXAMPLE: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position
made it difficult for her to know what to do
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

Sense.DEF: not relaxed or comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: She liked to dance but felt awkward if someone was watching her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢跳舞﹐但要是有人看着﹐她就觉得不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Geoff looked uneasy and awkward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫看上去紧张不安。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the baby is not sleeping in an awkward position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保小宝宝睡姿舒服。

Sense.DEF: difficult to do, use, or deal with
Sense.TRAN: 难办的﹔难用的﹐不好操作的﹔难应付的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be awkward getting cars in and out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样汽车就不好进出了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new financial arrangements were awkward to manage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的财务安排不好操作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good carpenter can make a cupboard to fit the most awkward space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就算是再尴尬的空间﹐好木匠也能做一个合适的橱柜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was afraid he was going to ask an awkward question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心他会问出不好回答的问题。

Sense.DEF: not convenient
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry to call at such an awkward time but I won’t keep you a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我这个电话打得不是时候﹐不过我不会耽搁你很久的。

Sense.DEF: an awkward person is deliberately unhelpful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The staff wanted to go home and they were getting awkward about a meeting starting so late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工想要回家﹐而这么晚才开始开会﹐他们就很不合作。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
an awkward customer
person who is difficult and unhelpful
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难侍候的家伙

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m very sorry about your sister,’ he said awkwardly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “对于你姐姐的事我很难过。”他尴尬地说道。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He tried to smooth over the awkwardness of the situation.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图缓和尴尬的场面。

Sense.DEF: a pointed tool for making holes in leather
Sense.TRAN: 〔在皮革上钻孔用的〕钻子﹐锥子

Sense.DEF: a sheet of material outside a shop, tent etc to keep off the sun or the rain
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑帐篷等外的〕遮篷﹔遮阳篷﹔遮雨篷

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
awake

the past participle of
awake

PronCodes.PRON: ˌeɪ ˌdʌb ə ljuː əʊ ˈel, ˈeɪwɒl

Sense.DEF: absent from somewhere without permission, especially from the army
Sense.TRAN: 开小差的﹐〔尤指从军队中〕擅离职守的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two soldiers had gone AWOL the night before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前一晚上﹐有两个士兵擅离职守。

Sense.DEF: if something goes awry, it does not happen in the way that was planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: My carefully laid plans had already gone awry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我精心制订的计划已经出了岔子。

Sense.DEF: not in the correct position
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rushed out, hat awry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他歪戴着帽子冲了出去。

Sense.DEF: used in a joking way to show that you feel embarrassed or sad
Sense.TRAN: 羞死人了﹔好伤心啊〔开玩笑的用法〕

Sense.DEF: a tool with a heavy metal blade on the end of a long handle, used to cut down trees or split pieces of wood
if someone gets the axe, they are dismissed from their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: 100 workers are facing the axe in a cost-cutting exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在削减成本的运作中﹐100名工人面临解雇。

Sense.DEF: if a plan, system, or service gets the axe, someone gets rid of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: MPs know there will be cuts in public spending but do not know on which department the axe will fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议员们都知道要削减公共开支﹐但是不知道从哪个部门开刀。

Sense.DEF: to have a strong personal opinion about something which is the reason why you do something
Sense.TRAN: 别有企图﹐有个人动机﹐有私心
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need objective advice from someone with no axe to grind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要公正无私的人给我一些客观的建议。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly dismiss someone from their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are plans to axe 2,600 staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有计划要解雇2,600名员工。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of a plan, system, or service, especially in order to save money
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV’s longest running show is to be axed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连续播出时间最长的电视节目要取消了。

Sense.DEF: a rule or principle that is generally considered to be true
something that is axiomatic does not need to be proved because you can easily see that it is true
Sense.TRAN: 公理的﹔不需证明的﹐不言自明的

Sense.DEF: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球绕着南北两极之间的地轴自转。
